Episodes.Description: The Dutton family embarks westward through the last bastion of untamed America. James arrives in Texas, where he and his family prepare to make their way through The Great Plains in search of a new home and the promise of opportunity.

Episodes.Name: Behind Us, a Cliff
Episodes.Description: Thomas and Shea recruit James and some local cowboys to corral a herd of cattle. As they begin their journey, the caravan is confronted with some of the many dangers they will face along the way.

Episodes.Name: River
Episodes.Description: James butts heads with Shea and Thomas about an important decision. Tensions rise in camp when an accusation is made. Elsa begins a flirtation with a cowboy.

Episodes.Name: The Crossing
Episodes.Description: The group faces the harrowing task of crossing the river with their wagons and supplies. Thomas and Noemi grow closer.

Episodes.Name: The Fangs of Freedom
Episodes.Description: Shea and Thomas cope with the aftermath of the river crossing, but there is little time to grieve and no shortage of challenges ahead. Elsa and Ennis share a romantic moment.

Episodes.Name: Boring the Devil
Episodes.Description: Shea helps Elsa cope with her loss. The group crosses another river and prepares to enter Indian territory. Thomas buys Noemi a gift.

Episodes.Name: Lightning Yellow Hair
Episodes.Description: Elsa makes an unlikely friend; the group faces a harrowing challenge from mother nature; the camp searches for one of their own.

Episodes.Name: The Weep of Surrender
Episodes.Description: Elsa makes a big decision. Shea faces doubts as winter looms.

Episodes.Name: Racing Clouds
Episodes.Description: A misunderstanding leads to a battle with serious consequences.

Episodes.Name: This Is Not Your Heaven
Episodes.Description: James and Margaret face a heavy decision. Shea and Thomas take bold action to help one of their own.

Summary: Follows the Dutton family as they embark on a journey west.

Episodes.Description: Jacob quashes a dispute between cattle ranchers and sheep herders. Cara informs Liz of the sacrifices of marrying into the Dutton family. Another Dutton finds himself far from home.

Episodes.Name: Nature's Empty Throne
Episodes.Description: Jacob and the Yellowstone cowboys save one of their own before deciding their next move. Teonna continues to endure at the hands of Sister Mary. Cara and Emma discuss Elizabeth and Jack. Alexandra makes a bold decision.

Episodes.Name: The War Has Come Home
Episodes.Description: Jacob, Cara, and the Duttons go into town to take care of some business, and pleasure. Spencer and Alexandra decide they won't waste any time, and later find new danger. The Duttons realize the feud with the sheepherders is far from over.

Episodes.Name: War and the Turquoise Tide
Episodes.Description: In the wake of the attack, Cara and the Duttons carefully plan heir next move. Spencer and Alexandra enjoy the pleasure of Zanzibar, unaware of what has happened back home. Banner Creighton seeks a powerful ally.

Summary: The Duttons face a new set of challenges in the early 20th century, including the rise of Western expansion, Prohibition and the Great Depression.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.1
Episodes.Description: Things get creepy for historian and closet witch, Diana Bishop, when she calls up a magical manuscript. Her discovery is about to throw her back into the world of magic and into the path of Matthew Clairmont, a centuries old vampire.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.2
Episodes.Description: As Matthew fights to control his cravings, he leaves Diana to face her enemies alone. And those include powerful witch Peter Knox.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.3
Episodes.Description: There is another dark turn in store for Diana when an alarming package is slipped under her door. Meanwhile, her relationship with Matthew moves forward, but something is about to happen that will cast them both further into danger.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.4
Episodes.Description: Diana gets a chilly welcome when she seeks safety at the Clairmont family home. Back in Oxford, trouble is brewing. Juliette shows up and throws Marcus' life into danger, while Satu pays the price for her curiosity.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.5
Episodes.Description: Tensions between the creatures grow as the witches find out the vampires are studying DNA. Matthew crosses a line when he returns to Oxford. Diana discovers his dark past, before something unexpected tears them apart.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.6
Episodes.Description: Matthew and Baldwin race to save Diana from Satu's dangerous dark magic. In Oxford, Sophie shocks Agatha with a confession.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.7
Episodes.Description: Diana's aunts' home gives up all sorts of secrets when Diana and Matthew pay a visit. Danger looms as Juliette breaks free from Gerbert.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.8
Episodes.Description: With danger at every turn, Diana and Matthew are forced to run. But will they escape in time?

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.1
Episodes.Description: In Madison, Satu, Knox and Gerbert arrive at the Bishop house to find that Matthew and Diana have disappeared. The couple arrives in 1590's London and are confronted by a face from Matthew's past.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.2
Episodes.Description: As Diana continues her search for a mentor she meets a wealthy alchemist Mary Sidney. London's vampire ruler demands fealty from Matthew.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.3
Episodes.Description: In the present, Domenico makes a disturbing discovery in Oxford. Back in 1590, Matthew must beg for forgiveness from Father Hubbard.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.4
Episodes.Description: Another vicious vampire murder rocks present-day Oxford. Marcus makes a breakthrough.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.5
Episodes.Description: Matthew and Diana arrive in France on their journey to face Philippe. Elsewhere, Louisa and Kit cut a swathe through London.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.6
Episodes.Description: Philippe makes a troubling discovery, provoking a conflict with Matthew. Ysabeau, Em and Sarah start to look for a message.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.7
Episodes.Description: Matthew and Diana go to Bohemia to search for Edward Kelley and the Book of Life. There, they encounter the strange Emperor Rudolf II.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.8
Episodes.Description: In 1590, Diana is transfixed as she tries to work out what the Book is telling her. Matthew worries over the Book's power.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.9
Episodes.Description: As Diana and Matthew return to London, Diana learns news that could change everything. The Queen holds Matthew to account.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.10
Episodes.Description: Realising that she must return to the present, Diana aims to complete her training.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.1
Episodes.Description: Matthew and Diana return from Elizabethan London to find tragedy at Sept-Tours. Agatha challenges Knox in the Congregation. Diana learns she’s carrying twins.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.2
Episodes.Description: Diana is forced to make a confession to Matthew after the pair are shocked by the appearance of another familiar face - Jack Blackfriars.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.3
Episodes.Description: In New Orleans, Matthew and Marcus struggle to reconnect with Marcus's children. In London, Diana and Phoebe find a lead in their hunt for the missing pages.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.4
Episodes.Description: Struggling to pin down T.J. Weston, Diana, Phoebe, and Sarah seek help from other witches. Benjamin has a proposition for Satu. Matthew finally returns home.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.5
Episodes.Description: Benjamin's plan to bring down the de Clermonts is set into motion. Matthew and Diana return to Sept-Tours with the twins. Gerbert demands to examine the babies.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.6
Episodes.Description: After receiving Benjamin's message, Matthew leaves Sept-Tours at dawn to track him down; Diana enlists Sarah's help to finally get the Book of Life.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.7
Episodes.Description: As Benjamin tortures Matthew to near death, Diana makes plans to rescue him. Revelations from the Book of Life illuminate the long-hidden secrets of creatures.

Name: A Discovery of Witches
Summary: Diana Bishop, historian and witch, accesses Ashmole 782 and knows she must solve its mysteries. She is offered help by the enigmatic Matthew Clairmont, but he's a vampire and witches should never trust vampires.

Trailers.Title: A DISCOVERY OF WITCHES Official Trailer (HD) Teresa Palmer Fantasy
Trailers.Description: A Discovery of Witches is a television film series to be released in fall 2018 based on the novel trilogy of the same name by ...

Trailers.Title: A Discovery of Witches Season 1 Trailer | Rotten Tomatoes TV
Trailers.Description: Check out the new A Discovery of Witches Season 1 Trailer starring Teresa Palmer! Let us know what you think in the comments ...

Trailers.Title: EXCLUSIVE TRAILER: A Discovery Of Witches
Trailers.Description: It begins with #ADiscoveryOfWitches. Check out the exclusive new trailer for our brand new Sky Original Production coming to Sky ...

Episodes.Name: Pilot
Episodes.Description: S.H.I.E.L.D. puts together a special team, led by Agent Phil Coulson, to track down a mysterious man with special abilities and the young computer hacker that's encouraging him to reveal himself to the world.
While extracting a strange object out of Peru, the S.H.I.E.L.D. agents are taken hostage aboard their plane.

Episodes.Name: The Asset
Episodes.Description: Dr. Franklin Hall has been kidnapped. Coulson and his team are assigned to rescue him.

Episodes.Name: Eye Spy
Episodes.Description: The team tries to track down a former agent who is now stealing valuable information.

Episodes.Name: Girl in the Flower Dress
Episodes.Description: Centipede kidnaps another gifted man. S.H.I.E.L.D. tries to track them down. Also, secrets about Skye are revealed.

Episodes.Name: FZZT
Episodes.Description: Simmons becomes infected with an alien virus after exposing herself to a group of people that have come into contact with a Chitauri helmet.

Episodes.Name: The Hub
Episodes.Description: Ward and Fitz are sent on a classified mission in South Ossetia.

Episodes.Name: The Well
Episodes.Description: Ward becomes exposed to a piece of an Asgardian staff, which causes his worst memory to resurface.

Episodes.Name: Repairs
Episodes.Description: The agents investigate the strange occurrences of a woman who, they believe, has telekinetic powers.

Episodes.Name: The Bridge
Episodes.Description: S.H.I.E.L.D. receives assistance from Mike Peterson as they take on Centipede once again.

Episodes.Name: The Magical Place
Episodes.Description: S.H.I.E.L.D. organizes a full scale hunt for Coulson. Centipede tries to resurface the memories on what happened after Coulson died.

Episodes.Name: Seeds
Episodes.Description: While investigating a problem at S.H.I.E.L.D. Academy, Coulson and May turn up unexpected information about Skye's parents.

Episodes.Name: T.R.A.C.K.S.
Episodes.Description: The team tries to confiscate an important device on a train, but when one agent takes a very risky move that backfires, the entire team is affected.

Episodes.Name: T.A.H.I.T.I.
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team rush to Bethesda in an attempt to save Skye's life.

Episodes.Name: Yes Men
Episodes.Description: While Skye recovers, Lady Sif arrives with need of assistance in capturing an escaped Asgardian prisoner, named Lorelei.

Episodes.Name: End of the Beginning
Episodes.Description: Agent Garett and Triplett have returned to assist Coulson's team hunt down S.H.I.E.L.D.'s devious nemesis--the Clairvoyant. But will Deathlok kill them all to guard his master's identity?

Episodes.Name: Turn, Turn, Turn
Episodes.Description: S.H.I.E.L.D. has been compromised by an old enemy. The team doesn't know whom to trust.

Episodes.Name: Providence
Episodes.Description: With Colonel Glenn Talbot now on their trail, Coulson and his team seek refuge in the last place anyone would look, where they begin to uncover S.H.I.E.L.D.'S most dangerous secrets -- secrets that could destroy them all.

Episodes.Name: The Only Light in the Darkness
Episodes.Description: Agent Koenig puts the team through the ultimate lie detector test and Coulson races to protect an old flame from an old enemy.

Episodes.Name: Nothing Personal
Episodes.Description: Just when there's no one left to trust, Agent Maria Hill returns to team up with Coulson as S.H.I.E.L.D. is being destroyed around them.

Episodes.Name: Ragtag
Episodes.Description: Ward's betrayal and HYDRA's shocking secrets are revealed as Coulson's team goes undercover on a mission that leaves no one unscathed.

Episodes.Name: Beginning of the End
Episodes.Description: Dark secrets are revealed as Coulson and his team put everything on the line to stop Garrett and the forces of HYDRA.

Episodes.Name: Shadows
Episodes.Description: Carl Creel is sent after an item that was stolen from Hydra during WWII. Fitz tries to cope with his mental issues.

Episodes.Name: Heavy Is the Head
Episodes.Description: Hunter gets captured by General Talbot. May goes after Creel and the Obelisk.

Episodes.Name: Making Friends and Influencing People
Episodes.Description: Simmons is forced to help Hydra capture Donnie Gill. S.H.I.E.L.D. tries to get to him first.

Episodes.Name: Face My Enemy
Episodes.Description: When May gets kidnapped, Hydra sends out an impersonator to lure Coulson into a trap. Fitz tries to find the confidence to join the rest of the team in their social activities.

Episodes.Name: A Hen in the Wolf House
Episodes.Description: Raina threatens to expose Simmons to Hydra unless Coulson hands Skye over to her father.

Episodes.Name: A Fractured House
Episodes.Description: The world turns against S.H.I.E.L.D. when Hydra impersonates them to attack The United Nations, and an unexpected enemy leads the charge to bring about their downfall.

Episodes.Name: The Writing on the Wall
Episodes.Description: A mysterious man is killing off former S.H.I.E.L.D. agents and carving the same markings as Coulson. Coulson tries to track him down. Meanwhile, May leads a team on a manhunt for Ward.

Episodes.Name: The Things We Bury
Episodes.Description: Coulson and team find themselves in an epic face-off against Hydra to uncover an ancient secret, while Ward kidnaps his brother, Senator Christian Ward, for a violent trip down memory lane.

Episodes.Name: Ye Who Enter Here
Episodes.Description: While Coulson's team tries to find the entrance to the mysterious alien city, the rest of the agents try to rescue Raina when they find out that Hydra is after her.

Episodes.Name: What They Become
Episodes.Description: Whitehall and Coulson's forces take part in an explosive confrontation that changes everyone. Skye uncovers some truths about her past.

Episodes.Name: Aftershocks
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team are faced with the consequences of the war with Hydra. As revelations threaten to destroy them, Hydra makes a move.

Episodes.Name: Who You Really Are
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team help a confused Lady Sif, who has lost her memory after a battle with a mysterious warrior.

Episodes.Name: One of Us
Episodes.Description: Cal wants vengeance, so he rallies a team of super villains to crush S.H.I.E.L.D. Meanwhile, May turns to her ex-husband, Dr. Andrew Garner, to help with a crisis threatening the harmony of the team.

Episodes.Name: Love in the Time of Hydra
Episodes.Description: The team are bewildered by a recent shocking revelation as they face a difficult decision. Meanwhile, Bobbi and Mack declare their loyalty to Hunter; and Ward and Agent 33 take care of a private matter.

Episodes.Name: One Door Closes
Episodes.Description: War comes to Coulson's doorstep in a way he never anticipated as shocking revelations are brought to light, and Skye struggles to control her new abilities but will soon make a decision that irrevocably changes her life.

Episodes.Name: Afterlife
Episodes.Description: As Robert Gonzalez makes his move, Coulson must do whatever it takes to protect the future of S.H.I.E.L.D. Meanwhile Skye's journey to control her powers take a surprising turn when she meets the enigmatic Inhuman named Lincoln.

Episodes.Name: Melinda
Episodes.Description: The story of Melinda May's transformation into "The Cavalry" is revealed as she finds herself at a crossroads in the war between Coulson and Gonzales. As Skye learns more about her true heritage from Lincoln, the truth about Inhumans will send her in a new direction.

Episodes.Name: Frenemy of My Enemy
Episodes.Description: A dangerous new alliance is formed as Coulson and Hunter turn to the last person anyone would expect, Grant Ward! As the war between S.H.I.E.L.D. factions continues, Skye and Lincoln will find themselves drawn into this conflict.

Episodes.Name: The Dirty Half Dozen
Episodes.Description: Gonzales and Coulson must find a way to put their differences aside and work together against HYDRA, even if it means teaming up with someone they don't trust.

Episodes.Name: Scars
Episodes.Description: As tensions rise between S.H.I.E.L.D. and the Inhumans, Skye finds herself torn between the groups; Coulson reveals a secret.

Episodes.Name: S.O.S. Part 1
Episodes.Description: S.H.I.E.L.D puts everything on the line to survive a war that blurs the line between friend and foe. Coulson and his team will be forced to make shocking sacrifices that will leave their relationships and their world changed forever.

Episodes.Name: S.O.S. Part 2
Episodes.Description: The battle between SHIELD and the Inhumans reaches its peak. SHIELD must defend their own and keep Skye safe.

Episodes.Name: Laws of Nature
Episodes.Description: Director Phil Coulson and Agent Daisy Johnson leading the charge as S.H.I.E.L.D. searches the world for more powered people in the aftermath of their epic battle with Jiaying and her army of Inhumans. However, Coulson and the team soon find out that they are not the only group looking for these new Inhumans.

Episodes.Name: Purpose in the Machine
Episodes.Description: Fitz and the team enlist the aid of an Asgardian to unlock the secrets of the ancient monolith that swallowed Simmons, and Agent May is at a crossroads in her personal and professional life.

Episodes.Name: A Wanted (Inhu)Man
Episodes.Description: Mack, Daisy, and Coulson race against time to keep Lincoln safe; Hunter will do whatever it takes to get revenge.

Episodes.Name: Devils You Know
Episodes.Description: Having reluctantly agreed to share information with Rosalind and the ATCU, Coulson and the team search for the Inhuman who is killing other Inhumans; May feels that Hunter's mission to take down Ward is getting too personal.

Episodes.Name: 4,722 Hours
Episodes.Description: After her dramatic rescue from another planet, Simmons is still reeling from her ordeal and reveals how she had to fight for her life in a harsh new world.

Episodes.Name: Among Us Hide...
Episodes.Description: The stakes get higher as May and Hunter pursue Ward and Hydra; Coulson thinks the ATCU could be keeping a big secret.

Episodes.Name: Chaos Theory
Episodes.Description: As Daisy and the team try to protect Inhumans, a shocking truth is revealed about S.H.I.E.L.D.'s biggest enemy; with Fitz's help, Simmons recovers information that could get them back through the portal.

Episodes.Name: Many Heads, One Tale
Episodes.Description: Dangerous facts about the ATCU are discovered by the team; Ward's plans to take down S.H.I.E.L.D. do not go as expected.

Episodes.Name: Closure
Episodes.Description: Ward's vendetta and plan for revenge against S.H.I.E.L.D. brings the team to their knees, and Coulson proves he will be willing to do anything to settle the conflict.

Episodes.Name: Maveth
Episodes.Description: S.H.I.E.L.D battles Hydra head-to-head, which sees Coulson and Fitz take the ultimate risk while Daisy and the Inhumans try to keep Hydra at bay.

Episodes.Name: Bouncing Back
Episodes.Description: Coulson is more determined than ever to get to Gideon Malick and put to an end to Hydra once and for all in the aftermath of his trip to Maveth. Meanwhile, Daisy and the team encounter more Inhumans who have powers like they've never seen before, but will they be friends or enemies of S.H.I.E.L.D?

Episodes.Name: The Inside Man
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team investigate an international conference on the fate of the Inhumans. Back on the bus, Fitzsimmons may have found a way to stop the Inhuman gene from spreading.

Episodes.Name: Parting Shot
Episodes.Description: After tracking Malick to Russia, Bobbi and Hunter become involved in an assassination plot; the team is changed forever as they race to save lives in the balance.

Episodes.Name: Watchdogs
Episodes.Description: Agent Mack and his brother step in when a radical group called the Watchdogs plan to eliminate the Inhumans; Simmons finds a powerful chemical compound.

Episodes.Name: Spacetime
Episodes.Description: When Daisy gets a horrifying glimpse of the future, S.H.I.E.L.D. races to prove that fate is not fixed.

Episodes.Name: Paradise Lost
Episodes.Description: The team hunts for information on a new enemy; Malick's secret from his past threatens to destroy his Hydra legacy.

Episodes.Name: The Team
Episodes.Description: Agent Daisy Johnson must call upon the Secret Warriors for an inaugural mission that will leave no member unscathed, and S.H.I.E.L.D. learns more about Hive's powers, forcing them to question everyone they trust.

Episodes.Name: The Singularity
Episodes.Description: The S.H.I.E.L.D. team is left reeling and decimated as Hive continues to sway Inhumans to his side. But there is a sliver of hope as Agents Fitz and Simmons follow a lead that may be able to stop the maniacal Inhuman once and for all.

Episodes.Name: Failed Experiments
Episodes.Description: As the threat of Hive looms, loyalties are put to the test and the team must come up with a decisive resolution.

Episodes.Name: Emancipation
Episodes.Description: In the aftermath of the events of Captain America: Civil War (2016), S.H.I.E.L.D feels pressure to reveal their involvement with Inhumans. But with the stakes higher than ever and Hive growing stronger, the team is tested in ways they could never anticipate.

Episodes.Name: Absolution
Episodes.Description: It's a showdown a season in the making as S.H.I.E.L.D. takes on Hive, and when his master plan is finally revealed, the team must spring into action.

Episodes.Name: Ascension
Episodes.Description: In the conclusion to "Absolution," S.H.I.E.L.D. must spring into action to combat Hive.

Episodes.Name: The Ghost
Episodes.Description: Daisy has left S.H.I.E.L.D. and is trying to solve the mystery of a bunch of serial killings in the Los Angeles area. At the same time her old friends suspect her for the killings and are following her trail in an attempt to find her.

Episodes.Name: Meet the New Boss
Episodes.Description: Daisy goes to battle Ghost Rider at a terrible cost, and Coulson faces the new director, whose bold agenda surprises them all.

Episodes.Name: Uprising
Episodes.Description: Coulson, Mack and Fitz try to locate and neutralize a rogue group looking to stop Inhuman registration worldwide; Simmons and Dr. Radcliffe have only a short time to save May before she succumbs to her illness.

Episodes.Name: Let Me Stand Next to Your Fire
Episodes.Description: As Ghost Rider's quest for vengeance brings him into an explosive confrontation with S.H.I.E.L.D., Coulson and Mack must rely on an unlikely ally in their time of desperate need; and Daisy reunites with a familiar face to stop the Watchdogs.

Episodes.Name: Lockup
Episodes.Description: As Robbie Reyes struggles to control The Ghost Rider, S.H.I.E.L.D. infiltrates a high-security prison to unravel the secrets that haunt them all.

Episodes.Name: The Good Samaritan
Episodes.Description: The shocking origin story of Robbie's transition into Ghost Rider is revealed as the lives of Coulson and the team hang in the balance.

Episodes.Name: Deals with Our Devils
Episodes.Description: With the loss of half the team, the remaining members search for answers as the clock counts down for Ghost Rider.

Episodes.Name: The Laws of Inferno Dynamics
Episodes.Description: With the lives of everyone in Los Angeles hanging in the balance, S.H.I.E.L.D. and Ghost Rider find themselves working together.

Episodes.Name: Broken Promises
Episodes.Description: Though Coulson and May are growing closer, Coulson remains unaware of the dark secret May is hiding beneath the surface. Meanwhile, Aida is unrelenting in her search for the Darkhold.

Episodes.Name: The Patriot
Episodes.Description: Separated from their team, Coulson and Mack discover a shocking secret about Mace, leaving all of S.H.I.E.L.D. in a precarious position.

Episodes.Name: Wake Up
Episodes.Description: May works to uncover the truth about what happened to her; Aida's next move puts everyone's life at risk.

Episodes.Name: Hot Potato Soup
Episodes.Description: Dr. Radcliffe goes after the Koenig family to find the location of the Darkhold. The Superior reveals his plans to Radcliffe.

Episodes.Name: BOOM
Episodes.Description: An explosive Inhuman surfaces and the team are tasked with containing it. Elsewhere: Coulson and Mack encounter Radcliffe's inspiration for Aida.

Episodes.Name: The Man Behind the Shield
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team engage in a deadly cat-and-mouse game as they work to rescue Director Mace, who is fighting for his life.

Episodes.Name: Self Control
Episodes.Description: As Radcliffe and Aida's plan goes into action, Fitz and Simmons are trapped in the Playground unsure of which of their friends are real and which ones have been replaced by LMDs.

Episodes.Name: What If...
Episodes.Description: Daisy and Simmons uncover secrets and lies in a world gone mad. With Hydra in control, they are our only hope to save everyone.

Episodes.Name: Identity and Change
Episodes.Description: As Daisy and Simmons struggle to discover an escape route to the real world, the identity of the Inhuman leader of the Resistance is revealed.

Episodes.Name: No Regrets
Episodes.Description: The truth behind Fitz's turn threatens to bring down all of S.H.I.E.L.D.

Episodes.Name: All the Madame's Men
Episodes.Description: Daisy teams up with an unlikely partner; Aida prepares to put her endgame into effect.

Episodes.Name: Farewell, Cruel World!
Episodes.Description: The clock is ticking for Daisy and Simmons to get the team out of the Framework, but not everyone is ready and willing to leave.

Episodes.Name: The Return
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team's victory in the Framework is short-lived, as an even deadlier enemy looms against them all.

Episodes.Name: World's End
Episodes.Description: With the surprising emergence of Ghost Rider, Coulson and the team attempt to stop Aida from ending the world.

Episodes.Name: Orientation: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team find themselves trapped on a mysterious ship in outer space, and that's just the beginning of the nightmare to come.

Episodes.Name: Orientation: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team find themselves stranded on a mysterious ship in outer space, and that's just the beginning of the nightmare to come.

Episodes.Name: A Life Spent
Episodes.Description: Daisy decides she will rescue Simmons, even though she must risk everything.

Episodes.Name: A Life Earned
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team discover their captors' true intentions.

Episodes.Name: Rewind
Episodes.Description: With the help of Lance Hunter, nothing will stop Fitz from finding his lost team as his secret journey is revealed.

Episodes.Name: Fun & Games
Episodes.Description: With Daisy's life on the line, an unexpected friend attempts to rescue her.

Episodes.Name: Together or Not at All
Episodes.Description: Just as the team reunites, they become prey to an undefeated Kree warrior bent on killing them all.

Episodes.Name: The Last Day
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the team discover that the most unexpected person from S.H.I.E.L.D.'s past may hold the key to stopping Earth's destruction.

Episodes.Name: Best Laid Plans
Episodes.Description: Mack, Yo-Yo and Flint fight to keep everyone alive by starting a revolution against the Kree.

Episodes.Name: Past Life
Episodes.Description: The team has one final chance to return to their timeline, but their actions may have deadly consequences.

Episodes.Name: All the Comforts of Home
Episodes.Description: Coulson and his team are out to rewrite the fate of humanity but they are unaware how the changes will affect one S.H.I.E.L.D. agent's life.

Episodes.Name: The Real Deal
Episodes.Description: Coulson finally reveals the mysterious deal he made with Ghost Rider, which will impact everyone on the team.

Episodes.Name: Principia
Episodes.Description: The team goes in search of Gravitonium in order to save the world.

Episodes.Name: The Devil Complex
Episodes.Description: Fitz and Simmons are faced with one of their greatest fears as they search for a way to seal the rift.

Episodes.Name: Rise and Shine
Episodes.Description: Coulson uncovers General Hale's real agenda and it could be the end of the world if S.H.I.E.L.D. can't help her.

Episodes.Name: Inside Voices
Episodes.Description: Coulson is forced to team up with unlikely allies to save the world, while his team try to track him down and rescue him.

Episodes.Name: The Honeymoon
Episodes.Description: When an agents life hangs in the balance, Fitz, Simmons and Yo-Yo attempt to neutralise a weapon that could play a role in Earth's destruction.

Episodes.Name: All Roads Lead...
Episodes.Description: The team must find a way to stop Ruby before the prophesied chain reaction that can destroy the earth is put into motion.

Episodes.Name: Option Two
Episodes.Description: The team finds themselves trapped and under siege at the Lighthouse.

Episodes.Name: The One Who Will Save Us All
Episodes.Description: A newly determined Talbot takes Coulson to meet the enemy and attempts to avert Earth's destruction.

Episodes.Name: The Force of Gravity
Episodes.Description: Daisy's future as the destroyer of worlds could take a critical change.

Episodes.Name: The End
Episodes.Description: The team must choose between Coulson's life or death; the wrong decision will cause the destruction of Earth.

Episodes.Name: Missing Pieces
Episodes.Description: Scattered across the galaxy, the team works to find their footing in the wake of losing Coulson.

Episodes.Name: Window of Opportunity
Episodes.Description: While Fitz and Enoch struggle in space, Sarge and his team move forward with their mysterious mission on Earth.

Episodes.Name: Fear and Loathing on the Planet of Kitson
Episodes.Description: While Fitz and Enoch try their luck at the casino, Daisy and Simmons find themselves in a much more exciting situation.

Episodes.Name: Code Yellow
Episodes.Description: Yo-Yo and Keller take things public; parasitic aliens threaten the human race; and someone really needs boba.

Episodes.Name: The Other Thing
Episodes.Description: Sarge has May; Altarah has Daisy, Enoch and Simmons; and now, there are two planets that need saving.

Episodes.Name: Inescapable
Episodes.Description: Fitz and Simmons have fought through space, time and alternate realities to find each other, and now, closer than ever, only their own demons can stop their mission.

Episodes.Name: Toldja
Episodes.Description: After finding themselves in yet another gambling dilemma, a mysterious stranger offers Enoch and FitzSimmons a ride home.

Episodes.Name: Collision Course (Part I)
Episodes.Description: To face The Galaxy-Hopping Hate-Beast That Eats Planets, the team on Earth asks for help in all the wrong places; while back on the Lazy Comet, something weird goes on with Izel's crew.

Episodes.Name: Collision Course (Part II)
Episodes.Description: There's no time for the team to play catch-up when there's a planet to save.

Episodes.Name: Leap
Episodes.Description: The team must trust each other in order to face impending doom and an enemy that's closer than they think.

Episodes.Name: From the Ashes
Episodes.Description: Out of answers and running out of time, the agents must face the ghosts of their past to move forward.

Episodes.Name: The Sign
Episodes.Description: With time running short, the team has to go to hell to stop the end of everything.

Episodes.Name: New Life
Episodes.Description: With time running short, the team has to go to hell to stop the end of everything.

Episodes.Name: The New Deal
Episodes.Description: Coulson and the agents are thrust backwards in time and stranded in 1931 New York City; with an all-new Zephyr set to time-jump at any moment, the team must hurry to find out exactly what happened.

Episodes.Name: Know Your Onions
Episodes.Description: With the identity of the timeline-unraveling "thread" revealed, the team's mission to protect him at all costs leads each agent to question their own values.

Episodes.Name: Alien Commies from the Future!
Episodes.Description: A surprise leap forward in time strands Enoch in 1931 and lands the team in another unfamiliar decade; in order to stop the chronicoms from launching their future-dismantling plan, the agents must infiltrate one of S.H.I.E.L.D.'s most secure bases.

Episodes.Name: Out of the Past
Episodes.Description: Agent Phil Coulson comes to a realization about the importance of July 22, 1955, in the S.H.I.E.L.D. history books.

Episodes.Name: A Trout in the Milk
Episodes.Description: The team - Daniel Sousa in tow - reunites with more than one familiar face at the S.H.I.E.L.D. hangout and discovers exactly how to dismantle the Chronicoms' latest plan; the Zephyr unexpectedly leaps forward again.

Episodes.Name: Adapt or Die
Episodes.Description: After blowing its cover and damaging the Zephyr in the process, the team must scramble to rescue Mack's parents, save S.H.I.E.L.D. from a chronicom infestation and fix the ship; Daisy and Sousa are at a disadvantage against Nathaniel Malick.

Episodes.Name: The Totally Excellent Adventures of Mack and the D
Episodes.Description: After getting stranded in 1982, Mack retreats to his childhood home to deal with the death of his parents; Deke scouts a group of new agents.

Episodes.Name: After, Before
Episodes.Description: With the Zephyr's time drive malfunctioning, the team hurtle toward disaster with Yo-Yo as its only hope; Yo-Yo must enlist the help of an old adversary to regain her powers.

Episodes.Name: As I Have Always Been
Episodes.Description: A time storm ravages the Zephyr, propelling it toward destruction while simultaneously forcing Daisy and Coulson to relive their failed attempts to save the team.

Episodes.Name: Stolen
Episodes.Description: The team arrives back in 1983, where Nathaniel and Kora are hard at work building an army; Daisy is tasked with protecting Jiaying; the others learn they'll need to face another supercharged enemy to stop Malick.

Episodes.Name: Brand New Day
Episodes.Description: With help from Kora on the inside, Sibyl and Nathanial continue their fight to shape a dark new future for S.H.I.E.L.D., managing to stay one step ahead of the agents along the way.

Episodes.Name: The End Is at Hand
Episodes.Description: Sibyl attempts to get the location of Fitz from Jemma's memories. Meanwhile, the SHIELD team attempts to stop Nathaniel's plans for anarchy and the Chronicoms' attempts to rewrite history.

Episodes.Name: What We're Fighting For
Episodes.Description: The final fight against the Chronicoms begins. A familiar face returns.

Name: Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.
Summary: The missions of the Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division.

Trailers.Title: Agents of SHIELD Offical Trailer 1 (2013) - Marvel, ABC HD
Trailers.Description: Visit http://film-book.com for more Agents of SHIELD. Subscribe to MOVIE TRAILERS: http://bit.ly/ZX2koF Subscribe to TV ...

Trailers.Title: Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. - Trailer 1 (Official)
Trailers.Description: Get an even better look at "Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.," coming to ABC Tuesdays at 8:00 p.m. ET this fall! Follow "Marvel's ...

Trailers.Title: Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D.
Trailers.Description: The Avengers saga continues on ABC. Coming soon.

Episodes.Name: Kassa
Episodes.Description: Cassian Andor's reckless search for answers about his past makes him a wanted man.

Episodes.Name: That Would Be Me
Episodes.Description: Cassian attempts to lay low on Ferrix as agents of the law close in.

Episodes.Name: Reckoning
Episodes.Description: Cassian's desperation to avoid arrest leads him to a mysterious man with unknown connections.

Episodes.Name: Aldhani
Episodes.Description: Out of options, Cassian is recruited for a dangerous mission to infiltrate an Imperial garrison.

Episodes.Name: The Axe Forgets
Episodes.Description: Cassian must carefully navigate the distrust inherent in being the new member of a secret operation.

Episodes.Name: The Eye
Episodes.Description: With cover from a spectacular local festival, the Aldhani mission reaches a point of no return.

Episodes.Name: Announcement
Episodes.Description: The repercussions of the Aldhani heist reach all the way to Coruscant, while Cassian returns home.

Episodes.Name: Narkina 5
Episodes.Description: The Empire catches up to Cassian, but are as yet unaware of his identity and past.

Episodes.Name: Nobody's Listening!
Episodes.Description: Under intense scrutiny while imprisoned, Cassian makes allies plan an impossible escape.

Episodes.Name: One Way Out
Episodes.Description: A rare opportunity opens and the time for Cassian and his fellow inmates to act is now.

Episodes.Name: Daughter of Ferrix
Episodes.Description: A fugitive once more, Cassian must make his next move before it is too late.

Episodes.Name: Rix Road
Episodes.Description: Cassian returns home to Ferrix, a tinderbox that is experiencing a spark of rebellion.

Name: Andor
Summary: Prequel series to Star Wars' 'Rogue One'. In an era filled with danger, deception and intrigue, Cassian will embark on the path that is destined to turn him into a Rebel hero.

Trailers.Title: Andor | Official Trailer | Disney+
Trailers.Description: Watch the new trailer for #Andor, a Star Wars original series, streaming only on Disney+. Experience the three-episode premiere ...

Trailers.Title: Andor | Official Trailer | Disney+
Trailers.Description: All for the Rebellion. Watch the brand-new trailer for #Andor, an Original series from Star Wars, and experience the three-episode ...

Trailers.Title: Star Wars: Andor - Official First Look Trailer (2022) Diego Luna
Trailers.Description: Check out this first look at the new Disney+ series, Star Wars: Andor. The series features Diego Luna, who will reprise his role as ...

Episodes.Name: Archersaurus
Episodes.Description: Archersaurus (a C.G. dinosaur) is seen in the supposed first-take of the show, starring said Raptor as a screeching, growling, snarling Raptor on the prowl to fix his expense account by staging a "Mole Hunt" - the search for a spy in their ranks.

Episodes.Name: Mole Hunt
Episodes.Description: Archer goes to great lengths to cover up discrepancies in his ISIS expense account as he attempts to access the agency's mainframe computer. Cyril and Lana's Friday night dinner date is interrupted by work.

Episodes.Name: Training Day
Episodes.Description: Lana's residual lust for Archer prompts Malory to promote Cyril to field agent. Archer then trains his new competition as only he can, whilst Malory frets over her own past and her son's future.

Episodes.Name: Diversity Hire
Episodes.Description: The agency hires a studly agent because of his minority status, and the man makes an impressive debut, but Archer suspects he has ulterior motives.

Episodes.Name: Killing Utne
Episodes.Description: Malory holds a shindig to schmooze with United Nations bigwig Torvald Utne, just as a group of assassins closes in to kill him.

Episodes.Name: Honeypot
Episodes.Description: Malory's career is threatened when a sensitive videotape falls into the hands of a rogue (and roguish) Cuban agent, so she calls on Archer's expertise in seduction to turn the tables on her blackmailer.

Episodes.Name: Skorpio
Episodes.Description: Archer must rescue Lana from the clutches of Skorpio, the infamous arms dealer. Meanwhile, Cyril fears not only for his girlfriend's life, but her succumbing to the seductive nature of Archer's heroics.

Episodes.Name: Skytanic
Episodes.Description: When a bomb threat jeopardizes the maiden voyage of the luxury airship Excelsior, Archer and the ISIS crew must battle the clock (and each other) to avert disaster.

Episodes.Name: The Rock
Episodes.Description: After ISIS loses yet another lucrative contract to rival agency ODIN, Malory assigns Archer and Lana to embarrass ODIN by stealing a priceless diamond from their biggest client.

Episodes.Name: Job Offer
Episodes.Description: When Archer takes a higher-paying job at rival agency ODIN, Malory will stop at nothing to get him back.

Episodes.Name: Dial M for Mother
Episodes.Description: Questions about the identity of Archer's real father lead him into a perilous trap... and an explosive confrontation with Malory.

Episodes.Name: Swiss Miss
Episodes.Description: ISIS protects a German billionaire's cute daughter from terrorists. She's celebrating her 17th birthday at a Swiss ski resort. The problem is, she can't keep her hands off Sterling, landing him in trouble.

Episodes.Name: A Going Concern
Episodes.Description: After Malory is wiped out in a Ponzi scheme, she hatches a scheme of her own: selling ISIS to rival spy agency ODIN. Archer and the rest of the ISIS employees must use every trick in the book to try to stop the sale.

Episodes.Name: Blood Test
Episodes.Description: Archer is in for a huge surprise when his favorite call girl, Trinette, shows up at ISIS with a subpoena in her purse.

Episodes.Name: Pipeline Fever
Episodes.Description: While Malory tries to make ISIS a green workplace, Archer and Lana head to the Louisiana Bayou to prevent a dangerous eco-terrorist from bombing America's largest natural gas pipeline.

Episodes.Name: The Double Deuce
Episodes.Description: When members of Woodhouse's famed WWI Royal Flying Corps squadron start dying mysteriously, he naturally suspects foul play. As does Archer, who tries to help his loyal manservant track down the killer.

Episodes.Name: Tragical History
Episodes.Description: Tired of his colleagues constantly calling him a failure, Cyril agrees to help George Spelvin, a mysterious computer security expert, inject a virus into the ISIS mainframe so he can defeat the virus and be seen as a hero.

Episodes.Name: Movie Star
Episodes.Description: The normal childish squabbles, sneaky backbiting, and petty jealousies at ISIS are multiplied exponentially when a famous Hollywood actress, Rona Thorne, spends a week shadowing the agents as research for an upcoming role in a spy movie.

Episodes.Name: Stage Two
Episodes.Description: After Malory's brief scare with breast cancer, another ISIS agent decides to be tested for the disease, with a tragic result.

Episodes.Name: Placebo Effect
Episodes.Description: When Archer discovers the chemotherapy drugs he's been taking for his breast cancer are counterfeit, he sets out to destroy the criminals behind the scheme.

Episodes.Name: El Secuestro
Episodes.Description: ISIS goes into full lockdown after Pam is abducted by kidnappers. Wait, Pam? Yes, but the kidnappers were really after Cheryl/Carol. Wait, Cheryl/Carol? Yes, because Cheryl/Carol isn't quite who she appears to be.

Episodes.Name: Jeu Monegasque
Episodes.Description: The team's in Monaco during Gran Prix so Malory can buy a 4M$ disc. Unfortunately, she got the money from ISIS's employees' 401 (k). Worse, Sterling gambles 3.2M$ away. It gets worse.

Episodes.Name: White Nights
Episodes.Description: Archer's search for his father's identity by going to Russia puts him in hot water as he is held prisoner by Nikolai Jackov and Malory has to ask Barry Dillon to rescue him.

Episodes.Name: Double Trouble
Episodes.Description: Sexy KGB Katya saves Sterling's life in Russia and comes to USA with him. Is she there to spy, a job at ISIS, a green card or Sterling's love?

Episodes.Name: Heart of Archness: Part I
Episodes.Description: Malory wants her son dragged home from a South Pacific island, where he's getting over Katya's death. Rip gets him on a seaplane that crashes, thanks to Sterling.

Episodes.Name: Heart of Archness: Part II
Episodes.Description: Archer finally agrees to head back to Isis. Unfortunately as he boards Riley's plane to head back, their plane is attacked by pirates and they soon find themselves on an island run by pirates, and Archer is crowned their new pirate king.

Episodes.Name: Heart of Archness: Part III
Episodes.Description: At ISIS HQ, Malory awaits a call on her son's situation/ransom on the pirate island. Meanwhile, he goes from being pirate king to being pirate prisoner together with Rip, Lana, Ray and Noah.

Episodes.Name: The Man from Jupiter
Episodes.Description: Burt Reynolds is dating Malory. Sterling is not OK with it.

Episodes.Name: El Contador
Episodes.Description: Malory sends Sterling, Lana and (just promoted to field agent) Cyril to catch a Colombian drug lord in the jungle to score $1M for ISIS. "Ironside" is demoted. ISIS employees will be drug tested.

Episodes.Name: The Limited
Episodes.Description: ISIS transports a Canadian terrorist by train to Mounties in Canada. Will Nova Scotian terrorists free him? Will the drunk Sterling fulfill his dream of fighting on the roof of a moving train?

Episodes.Name: Drift Problem
Episodes.Description: It's Sterling's birthday and his mom gives him a super spy car. She tells him to not get it stolen. Looking for his stolen car, he crosses path with the Yakuza.

Episodes.Name: Lo Scandalo
Episodes.Description: Archer and Lana are called over to Malory's apartment on what was supposed to be an off night for the ISIS crew. There, they are shocked to discover what appears to be a dead body, some foreplay, and a few random gun shots. As they put together the pieces of the mystery, they soon discover that there's more to this story than meets the eye, and does Archer have enough spaghetti and meatballs for everybody? And what is underneath Malory's trench coat?

Episodes.Name: Bloody Ferlin
Episodes.Description: The ISIS crew travels to West Virginia to help Ray and his brother save their crop from a crooked Sheriff. Meanwhile, Archer discovers that Ray has been faking his paralysis.

Episodes.Name: Crossing Over
Episodes.Description: Stirling wakes up with a hangover, only remembering having the best sex ever - but with whom? What may be Stirling's dad defects Russia and comes to see his mom and get protection from ISIS.

Episodes.Name: Skin Game
Episodes.Description: When Archer's fiancée returns under mysterious circumstances, he immediately suspects that his arch rival Barry is behind it, and soon begins to plot against them both.

Episodes.Name: Space Race: Part I
Episodes.Description: The ISIS staff is called by ISA to stop the international space station from being taken over by space pirates. During training, Cyril proves to be a more than adequate pilot, a skill which will prove valuable when they return. While on the mission, Malory attempts to make drinks in low gravity, Cyril one again shows he has no concept of what "suppressing fire" is and Lana has an unusually weak stomach.

Episodes.Name: Space Race: Part II
Episodes.Description: Once on board the international space station, Archer and the Isis crew have very little time to save the crew on board from being taken over by space pirates, but an even sinister motive looks to make things even worse for Archer and Isis.

Episodes.Name: Fugue and Riffs
Episodes.Description: Archer is working at a burger shop, but can't remember any of the events that led to him working there. Fortunately, Malory takes the Isis crew to a luxury spa and Lana helps Archer cure his amnesia.

Episodes.Name: The Wind Cries Mary
Episodes.Description: Archer and his former best friend are holed up in the Vermont wilderness, fighting hard to come out on top.

Episodes.Name: Legs
Episodes.Description: Archer's fear of cyborgs hits home when Krieger offers to make robotic legs for Gillette.

Episodes.Name: Midnight Ron
Episodes.Description: The beginning of beautiful hatred between Archer and his new stepfather plays out as the two are chased by gangsters.

Episodes.Name: Viscous Coupling
Episodes.Description: With Barry stuck in space, Archer's former fiancée Katya, who is now living as a cyborg herself, seeks Archer's help in getting Barry returned to earth. But as manipulative as Archer is, he has other plans in mind.

Episodes.Name: Once Bitten
Episodes.Description: While accompanied by Cyril and Ray on a mission in Turkmenistan, Archer comes in contact with a venomous snake with hallucinogenic repercussions. Meanwhile back at ISIS tensions come to a head between Lana and Malory.

Episodes.Name: Live and Let Dine
Episodes.Description: After a security threat, ISIS goes undercover as staff in a restaurant to protect its clients including the Albanian ambassador. Chaos ensues.

Episodes.Name: Coyote Lovely
Episodes.Description: The Isis crew heads to the Mexican border to save a coyote, but Archer and Lana soon find themselves being smuggled over the border with an immigrant family.

Episodes.Name: The Honeymooners
Episodes.Description: Archer and Lana are on a mission as a couple staying in the honeymoon suite. Their colleagues are spying on them. The North Koreans are in NYC to buy uranium.

Episodes.Name: Un Chien Tangerine
Episodes.Description: Archer and Lana head to Morocco to save a member of Isis' canine unit, but soon get themselves in deep dog doo doo.

Episodes.Name: The Papal Chase
Episodes.Description: The Isis crew heads to the Vatican to stop an assassination attempt on the Pope. Archer attempts to use Woodhouse as a decoy, while Archer and Pam pose as a priest and a nun.

Episodes.Name: Sea Tunt: Part 1
Episodes.Description: The Isis crew heads deep into the Bermuda Triangle to save an underwater sea laboratory from its deranged leader, thanks to the help of Cheryl's dim-witted brother and his equally dim-witted fiancée, who drive Cheryl crazier than usual.

Episodes.Name: Sea Tunt: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Once on board the underwater laboratory, the Isis crew find they have very little time to rescue the lab from its deranged captain. But of course, the Isis crew's conflicts and Archer's recklessly impulsive tendencies don't exactly help things.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: White Elephant
Episodes.Description: After ISIS headquarters is raided by FBI Agents, Archer and Lana work to break out the crew while Mallory works on a deal to get them all free.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: A Kiss While Dying
Episodes.Description: Archer, Pam and Lana travel to Miami to visit some old friends. It's a fondue party!

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: A Debt of Honor
Episodes.Description: Pam gets targeted for death by the Yakuza while the group continues to dig their way out of financial trouble.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: House Call
Episodes.Description: Archer has to stage an intervention for Pam that gets derailed by an unwanted guest.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Southbound and Down
Episodes.Description: Malory buys a bus and takes everyone on a road trip. Put that hammer down and give it hell.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Baby Shower
Episodes.Description: Archer and Pam try to get Kenny Loggins to play at Lana's baby shower and wind up in a zone of danger.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Smugglers' Blues
Episodes.Description: Archer travels to Columbia on a secret mission that becomes not so secret after he gets drunk.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: The Rules of Extraction
Episodes.Description: Archer, Ray, and Cyril raft down a crocodile-filled river while Lana and Pam plan a spa day for Malory.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: On the Carpet
Episodes.Description: Archer avoids crash landing in a dangerous swamp only to come face-to-face with a shady arms dealer (Christian Slater).

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Palace Intrigue - Part I
Episodes.Description: Archer and the rest of the ISIS gang are the guests of Gustavo Calderon and his wife Juliana. Calderon is a big fan of Cherlene but Juliana is a bigger fan of Archer.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Palace Intrigue: Part II
Episodes.Description: Archer tries to keep his fling with the dictator's wife a secret while Krieger bonds with his clone-brothers.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Filibuster
Episodes.Description: Cyril becomes the new president of San Marcos, Cherlene becomes the first lady of country music, and Archer becomes a resistance fighter.

Episodes.Name: Archer Vice: Arrival/Departure
Episodes.Description: While Lana is trying to give birth to her baby, it turns out that the whole "cocaine-case" was a secret agreement between Malory and the CIA.

Episodes.Name: The Holdout
Episodes.Description: Archer must salvage a crashed plane for the CIA after he disappeared for six weeks in Thailand.

Episodes.Name: Three to Tango
Episodes.Description: An agent from the past has a hand in creating tension between Archer and Lana.

Episodes.Name: The Archer Sanction
Episodes.Description: Archer, Lana and Ray travel to the Swiss Alps to carry out an assassination, while Cyril, Pam and the rest of the gang capitalize on having a little free time.

Episodes.Name: Edie's Wedding
Episodes.Description: Pam and Archer take a trip to Wisconsin for Edie Poovey's wedding, but Barry Dillon and Other Barry might have a thing or two to say about it.

Episodes.Name: Vision Quest
Episodes.Description: Everyone is stuck in an elevator. The only thing lower than rations is patience. Oh, and their only rescue is a highly advanced rolling toaster. What could go wrong?

Episodes.Name: Sitting
Episodes.Description: Archer babysits AJ for the weekend.

Episodes.Name: Nellis
Episodes.Description: A rescue mission turns into an out-of-this-world visit to Area 51.

Episodes.Name: The Kanes
Episodes.Description: Lana introduces Archer to her parents; Archer introduces Lana's parents to high-speed chases.

Episodes.Name: Pocket Listing
Episodes.Description: Slater has the gang swindle the Durhani royal family and Gillette lends a hand.

Episodes.Name: Reignition Sequence
Episodes.Description: An office romance is interrupted by the Russians.

Episodes.Name: Achub y Morfilod
Episodes.Description: Archer and Lana travel to Wales for a romantic getaway of aiding separatists.

Episodes.Name: Drastic Voyage: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Archer and the gang prepare for their most fantastic voyage ever.

Episodes.Name: Drastic Voyage: Part 2
Episodes.Description: The fantastic voyage concludes.

Episodes.Name: The Figgis Agency
Episodes.Description: Secret agent - turned private investigator Archer and the group are working on the West Coast, and Archer's newest case involves breaking and entering a mansion in order to bring back honour to one of Hollywood's leading ladies.

Episodes.Name: The Handoff
Episodes.Description: Archer and Lana make a tricky handoff while the rest of the gang hears the best voicemail ever.

Episodes.Name: Deadly Prep
Episodes.Description: A business opportunity arises at a prep school reunion.

Episodes.Name: Motherless Child
Episodes.Description: An important member of the team is kidnapped and all leads point towards the infamous disc. Meanwhile Krieger is up to no good and Lana gets a new pet.

Episodes.Name: Bel Panto: Part I
Episodes.Description: Party crashers turn a fundraiser into no laughing matter.

Episodes.Name: Bel Panto: Part II
Episodes.Description: A hostage negotiation spirals out of control when Archer and Lana go missing.

Episodes.Name: Double Indecency
Episodes.Description: Who's sexier, Cyril or Krieger? Pam or Cheryl? Only one way to find out... Bar fight!

Episodes.Name: Liquid Lunch
Episodes.Description: The on-again, off-again relationship of Archer and Slater causes a rift in the on-again, off-again relationship of Archer and Lana.

Episodes.Name: Deadly Velvet: Part 1
Episodes.Description: The Deadly Velvet production is beset with chaos and destruction so the film's producer hires the Figgis Agency to discover what's behind the suspicious activity. The team's romances and jealousy complicates the investigation, and puts Archer in a difficult situation with Lana and Ms. Deane.

Episodes.Name: Deadly Velvet: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Things get even deadlier on the set of Deadly Velvet when someone turns up, you guessed it, dead.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: No Good Deed
Episodes.Description: Archer tries to find out who killed his partner but ends up in bed with notorious L.A. crime boss, Mother.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Berenice
Episodes.Description: A mysterious woman hires Archer to fake her death but Archer is unable to rise to the occasion.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Jane Doe
Episodes.Description: Archer tries to escape from jail with the help of a crazed heiress and a dysfunctional jazz quartet.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Ladyfingers
Episodes.Description: Archer must convince the Vander Tunts that Charlotte has been kidnapped. Krieger reveals too much about his past.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Sleepers Wake
Episodes.Description: Dutch becomes a new man while Archer's ransom exchange goes up in smoke.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Waxing Gibbous
Episodes.Description: All roads lead to Len Trexler as Archer and the gang try to avoid unfriendly ghosts.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Gramercy, Halberd!
Episodes.Description: Archer's past comes back to haunt him. Dutch proves himself a hard man to get rid of. Trexler attempts a great escape.

Episodes.Name: Archer Dreamland: Auflösung
Episodes.Description: Archer visits Dreamland and receives a big break that leads him to Woodhouse's killer.

Episodes.Name: Danger Island: Strange Pilot
Episodes.Description: Archer inserts himself into a domestic dispute and engine troubles threaten to ruin his business.

Episodes.Name: Danger Island: Disheartening Situation
Episodes.Description: Archer works to overcome his dead stick while Pam and those who bailed try to survive the local nightlife.

Episodes.Name: Danger Island: Different Modes of Preparing the Fruit
Episodes.Description: Archer and Pam look for ways to make enough money to repair the plane.

Episodes.Name: Danger Island: A Warrior in Costume
Episodes.Description: A group of German pilots show up on the island. Their leader was Archer's nemesis during the Spanish Civil War, shooting Archer down a total of five times. Archer longs for revenge.

Episodes.Name: Danger Island: Strange Doings in the Taboo Groves
Episodes.Description: But there is no joy in Mudville- mighty Pam has struck out.

Now, the Cylons have evolved into more human form, into machine-created biological beings, who seek to exterminate true biological humans. Episodes.Description: Mr. Peanutbutter throws Diane a surprise birthday party, putting tension on their relationship. Princess Carolyn and Vincent have a serious talk. Wanda tells BoJack a joke.

Episodes.Name: Chickens
Episodes.Description: Todd tries to save a chicken from the slaughter house while Bojack and Kelsey are allowed some bonding time.

Episodes.Name: Higher Love
Episodes.Description: Princess Carolyn sees an opportunity when Mr. Peanutbutter's agent dies. BoJack flips when he says the "L" word out loud to Wanda.

Episodes.Name: Hank After Dark
Episodes.Description: Diane goes off script during BoJack's book tour, jeopardizing Mr. Peanutbutter's new show. Todd gets involved in international affairs.

Episodes.Name: Let's Find Out
Episodes.Description: BoJack Horseman is a contestant on Mr. Peanutbutter's new game show, facing off against a mystery 'bigger celebrity' contestant.

Episodes.Name: The Shot
Episodes.Description: BoJack, Kelsey, Todd, Princess Carolyn, and Mr. Peanutbutter attempt to shoot a crucial scene in the Secretariat movie that was not in the script. Princess Carolyn and Diane contemplate their respective careers.

Episodes.Name: Yes And
Episodes.Description: Diane crashes at BoJack's place after quitting her job following Sebastian St. Clair, which puts a strain on BoJack and Wanda's relationship. Todd joins an improv comedy troupe which turns out to be a cult.

Episodes.Name: Escape from L.A.
Episodes.Description: Bojack runs off to New Mexico to reconnect with an old friend, only to find she's happily married with a family. After staying longer than planned, Bojack makes another life mistake.

Episodes.Name: Out to Sea
Episodes.Description: BoJack discovers the Secretariat film was finished without him. Princess Carolyn starts her own agency firm. Todd finds himself trapped in the improv comedy cult.

Episodes.Name: Start Spreading the News
Episodes.Description: Bojack goes to New York to be interviewed for his new film. Todd tags along and realizes he bit off a little more than he could chew.

Episodes.Name: The BoJack Horseman Show
Episodes.Description: It's 2007, and Princess Carolyn works tirelessly to get Bojack to stop basking in the light of the glory days and start working again. Diane and Mr. Peanutbutter meet, and Todd kisses a girl.

Episodes.Name: BoJack Kills
Episodes.Description: Bojack is framed for a murder. Meanwhile, Todd and Mr. Peanutbutter are sprayed by a skunk.

Episodes.Name: Fish Out of Water
Episodes.Description: As Bojack is forced to attend an underwater movie festival to promote his new movie, a series of events and the inability to communicate with underwater life ensures that not everything goes as planned.

Episodes.Name: Love And/Or Marriage
Episodes.Description: While Todd and Bojack crash a rehearsal dinner, Diane gets high with a client. Princess Carolyn goes on a series of blind dates.

Episodes.Name: Brrap Brrap Pew Pew
Episodes.Description: Diane's tweet lands Sextina Aquafina in hot water. Prankster and A-list actor Jurj Clooners gets under BoJack's skin.

Episodes.Name: Stop the Presses
Episodes.Description: Todd builds a giant papier-mâché Todd head. A customer service rep gives Bojack some good advice when he tries to cancel his newspaper subscription.

Episodes.Name: Old Acquaintance
Episodes.Description: Bojack is up for a part in David Pincher's latest film. Diane meets Mr. Peanutbutter's brother and Todd takes the business in a new direction.

Episodes.Name: Best Thing That Ever Happened
Episodes.Description: After Princess Carolyn's latest mistake as BoJack's agent gets worse and worse, their entire relationship comes into question.

Episodes.Name: It's You
Episodes.Description: Mr. Peanutbutter announces the Oscar nominees. Bojack surrounds himself with admirers, not realizing how much his true friendships are falling apart.

Episodes.Name: That's Too Much, Man!
Episodes.Description: Bojack gets Sarah Lynn to break her sobriety to help drown his depression, and experiences the next few months through blackouts.

Episodes.Name: That Went Well
Episodes.Description: Bojack hits rock bottom. Mr. Peanutbutter and Todd save the day. Princess Carolyn finds a new calling

Episodes.Name: See Mr. Peanutbutter Run
Episodes.Description: Mr. Peanutbutter starts his campaign for Governor of California by challenging the current governor to a ski race while BoJack is nowhere to be found.

Episodes.Name: The Old Sugarman Place
Episodes.Description: BoJack goes off the grid and winds up at his grandparents' dilapidated home in Michigan where he reflects on his family legacy and befriends another soul haunted by the past.

Episodes.Name: Hooray! Todd Episode!
Episodes.Description: Helpful to a fault, Todd is spread thin doing favors for Princess Carolyn, Mr. Peanutbutter and a visitor with a potential connection to BoJack.

Episodes.Name: Commence Fracking
Episodes.Description: The campaign takes a toll on Diane's love life. BoJack helps Hollyhock search for her mom. Princess Carolyn tries to get pregnant.

Episodes.Name: Thoughts and Prayers
Episodes.Description: A mass shooting at a mall creates a PR nightmare for Princess Carolyn. BoJack takes Hollyhock to visit his estranged mother.

Episodes.Name: Stupid Piece of Sh*t
Episodes.Description: Surrounded by family, BoJack spirals into self-loathing. Princess Carolyn and Rutabaga Rabitowitz plan Courtney and Todd's sham wedding.

Episodes.Name: Underground
Episodes.Description: Mr. Peanutbutter's posh campaign fundraiser takes a terrifying turn. As chaos swirls around them. BoJack and Diane get drunk.

Episodes.Name: The Judge
Episodes.Description: Hollyhock starts dating an intern on BoJack's new show. Princess Carolyn meets Ralph's parents. Mr. Peanutbutter throws his support behind Woodchuck.

Episodes.Name: Ruthie
Episodes.Description: On one awful day, Princess Carolyn deals with rejection, deception and loss. BoJack and Diane try to track down Hollyhock's birth certificate.

Episodes.Name: lovin that cali lifestyle!!
Episodes.Description: Diane leaks damaging information on Jessica Biel, Todd's clown dentist business hits a snag, and Princess Carolyn finds hope in an unlikely place.

Episodes.Name: Time's Arrow
Episodes.Description: In 1963, young socialite Beatrice Sugarman meets the rebellious Butterscotch Horseman at her debutante party.

Episodes.Name: What Time Is It Right Now
Episodes.Description: Princess Carolyn pitches "Philbert" to company execs. Todd gets a better business idea. BoJack comes to a realization about Hollyhock.

Episodes.Name: The Light Bulb Scene
Episodes.Description: BoJack has misgivings about his new show. Princess Carolyn visits an adoption agency. Todd interviews for a job at WhatTimeIsItRightNow.com.

Episodes.Name: The Dog Days Are Over
Episodes.Description: Diane divorces Mr. Peanutbutter and moves into a shabby studio. Feeling melancholy, she travels to Vietnam to get away from it all.

Episodes.Name: Planned Obsolescence
Episodes.Description: Todd meet's Yolanda's parents, who don't know she's asexual. Mr. Peanutbutter romances a young waitress. Gina confesses a childhood dream to BoJack.

Episodes.Name: BoJack the Feminist
Episodes.Description: When Princess Carolyn casts a disgraced celeb in "Philbert," BoJack inadvertently takes a stand. Mr. Peanutbutter tries to toughen up his image.

Episodes.Name: The Amelia Earhart Story
Episodes.Description: Painful memories come rushing back when Princess Carolyn visits her hometown and meets a pregnant teen. A stunt goes awry on the "Philbert" set.

Episodes.Name: Free Churro
Episodes.Description: BoJack delivers a eulogy at a funeral.

Episodes.Name: INT. SUB
Episodes.Description: Diane's therapist encourages her to set boundaries with BoJack. A missing string cheese ignites a dispute between Todd and Princess Carolyn.

Episodes.Name: Mr. Peanutbutter's Boos
Episodes.Description: At BoJack's 25th annual Halloween party, Pickles gets a crash course in Mr. Peanutbutter's romantic history -- and some advice from Diane.

Episodes.Name: Ancient History
Episodes.Description: A visiting Hollyhock dumps BoJack's painkillers, sending him on a desperate search for more. Todd tries to solve Emily's dating dilemma.

Episodes.Name: Head in the Clouds
Episodes.Description: At the "Philbert" premiere party, Princess Carolyn deftly negotiates a deal, Gina steps into the limelight, and Diane confronts BoJack.

Episodes.Name: The Showstopper
Episodes.Description: "Philbert" is a hit, and filming begins on Season 2. But as BoJack spirals deeper into addiction, he loses his grip on reality.

Episodes.Name: The Stopped Show
Episodes.Description: In the midst of the latest PR crisis, Princess Carolyn gets a life-changing opportunity. With Diane's help, BoJack finally faces the music.

Episodes.Name: A Horse Walks into a Rehab
Episodes.Description: BoJack checks into Pastiches, a Malibu rehab facility, where he grapples with memories of Sarah Lynn's death and his own troubled childhood.

Episodes.Name: The New Client
Episodes.Description: When her nanny quits, Princess Carolyn struggles to balance the demands of work and parenting. Mr. Peanutbutter visits BoJack in rehab.

Episodes.Name: Feel-Good Story
Episodes.Description: Girl Croosh sends Diane on the road with rugged cameraman Guy, but she balks when they ask her to produce more feel-good stories.

Episodes.Name: Surprise!
Episodes.Description: Todd organizes a surprise wedding for Pickles and Mr. Peanutbutter, but the party quickly goes off the rails when Mr. Peanutbutter makes a confession.

Episodes.Name: A Little Uneven, Is All
Episodes.Description: Dr. Champ tells BoJack it's time to leave rehab. Mr. Peanutbutter's reputation takes a hit. In Chicago, Diane wrestles with writer's block.

Episodes.Name: The Kidney Stays in the Picture
Episodes.Description: The assistants of Hollywoo go on strike. BoJack tries to help Dr. Champ. When Todd learns that his mother needs a kidney, Diane comes up with a plan.

Episodes.Name: The Face of Depression
Episodes.Description: BoJack travels around the country reconnecting with loved ones, while Mr. Peanutbutter embarks on his own national tour as the face of depression.

Episodes.Name: A Quick One, While He's Away
Episodes.Description: A reporter digs into the circumstances surrounding Sarah Lynn's death. Hollyhock goes to a party in New York City.

Episodes.Name: Intermediate Scene Study w/ BoJack Horseman
Episodes.Description: When BoJack starts teaching an acting class at Wesleyan, Hollyhock sets some boundaries in their relationship.

Episodes.Name: Good Damage
Episodes.Description: Diane's depression lifts, but she's still struggling to start writing her memoir. Reporters Paige and Max pay Penny a visit.

Episodes.Name: Sunk Cost and All That
Episodes.Description: While Paige and Max question Mr. Peanutbutter at his restaurant, a panicked BoJack tries to piece together what's happening.

Episodes.Name: Xerox of a Xerox
Episodes.Description: After the Sarah Lynn story breaks, BoJack gives a live interview on TV. Diane meets Guy's teenage son.

Episodes.Name: The Horny Unicorn
Episodes.Description: BoJack gets a new AA sponsor. Todd plans a sophisticated party to impress his parents. Diane gets to know Sonny.

Episodes.Name: Angela
Episodes.Description: Angela Diaz reaches out to BoJack. Princess Carolyn gets an offer from Lenny Turtletaub. Todd cooks up a scheme.

Episodes.Name: The View from Halfway Down
Episodes.Description: BoJack reconnects with faces from his past.

Episodes.Name: Nice While It Lasted
Episodes.Description: A celebration brings people together.

Name: BoJack Horseman
Summary: BoJack Horseman was the star of the hit television show "Horsin' Around" in the '80s and '90s, but now he's washed up, living in Hollywood, complaining about everything, and wearing colorful sweaters.

Trailers.Description: official trailer for season 2 of BoJack Horseman BoJack's back -- and this year... He's really trying to be a better Horseman.

Episodes.Name: Pilot
Episodes.Description: Welcome to New London, a utopia governed by three rules -- no privacy, family or monogamy -- where everyone belongs to everyone else.

Episodes.Name: Want & Consequence
Episodes.Description: Bernard Marx is preoccupied with recent events in New London as he and Lenina Crowne take a trip together; John struggles with a dilemma.

Episodes.Name: Everybody Happy Now!
Episodes.Description: Danger awaits Bernard and Lenina in the Savage Lands, where the world is flipped on its head; John grapples with staying true to himself as paths entwine.

Episodes.Name: Swallow
Episodes.Description: Bernard introduces John to New London while Lenina struggles with reintegration after their visit to the Savage Lands.

Episodes.Name: Firefall
Episodes.Description: Lenina tests the limits of her emotional self-regulation while Bernard seizes an opportunity; John observes New London conditioning.

Episodes.Name: In the Dirt
Episodes.Description: Lenina has an unexpected collision; John becomes the center of attention as he embraces his surroundings.

Episodes.Name: Monogamy and Futility: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Lenina juggles separate lives as fantasy and reality converge; Mustafa Mond makes a terrifying discovery.

Episodes.Name: Monogamy and Futility: Part 2
Episodes.Description: John takes integration to the next level as monogamy poses new problems; while Bernard realizes his potential, Lenina questions assumptions.

Episodes.Name: Soma Red
Episodes.Description: Bernard copes with an unexpected tragedy, while Lenina draws ire at the Hatchery; John's exile pushes New London to the brink.

Name: Brave New World
Summary: In a utopia whose perfection hinges upon control of monogamy and privacy, members of the collective begin to question the rules, putting their regimented society on a collision course with forbidden love and revolution.
