Trailers.Description: Meet Matt Murdock. Blinded as a boy but imbued with extraordinary senses, Matt fights injustice by day as a respected lawyer and ...

Trailers.Title: Marvel's Daredevil | Teaser Trailer | Netflix
Trailers.Description: Meet Matt Murdock. Blinded as a boy but imbued with extraordinary senses, Matt fights injustice by day as a respected lawyer and ...

Episodes.Name: Pilot - Part 1
Episodes.Description: Six strangers awake amnesic on a marooned and damaged spacecraft. Quickly however they discover their personal talents and from there struggle to understand who they are and what has happened to them.

Episodes.Name: Pilot - Part 2
Episodes.Description: The motley crew discover a small mining colony on a planet that happens to be the target of big corporations. Discovering their identities brings each one to question who they really are.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.3
Episodes.Description: While en route to the nearest space station, the ship suffers another mysterious malfunction -- their FTL fails in the middle of a gamma radiation storm. This makes the crew think a saboteur may be aboard.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.4
Episodes.Description: The lookalike for One goes on the attack, only to reveal a disturbing truth about his doppelganger.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.5
Episodes.Description: While recovering a damaged ship, some of its dead crew are discovered. They were slaughtered by an animalistic attack, but what happened to the attacker?

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.6
Episodes.Description: 5 builds a mind probe that reveals some of her hidden memories. She experiences some of 4's past and discovers why she's on the ship.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.7
Episodes.Description: The crew gains access to the secret room, and discovers an android and an ill woman who reveals a connection to Three.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.8
Episodes.Description: The crew stops at a space station to refuel and rest, but Six has a different agenda - revenge.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.9
Episodes.Description: Four travels to talk with his brother about their father's murder.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.10
Episodes.Description: Forced to team up with another team of mercenaries the crew are assigned to steal an unknown package from a rival corporation.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.11
Episodes.Description: Double crossed by the mercenaries the crew must save themselves and retake the ship before they are turned over to the Galactic Authorities.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.12
Episodes.Description: The team's handler sends the crew on another mission, that takes place at a scientific research facility.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.13
Episodes.Description: Crew members are targeted and paranoia mounts as they search for the perpetrator; the person responsible for the mind-wipe makes a move.

Episodes.Name: Welcome to Your New Home
Episodes.Description: The crew awakens to find themselves prisoners on the Hyperion-8 Maximum Security Galactic Detention Facility.

Episodes.Name: Kill Them All
Episodes.Description: Imprisoned in Hyperion-8, the crew must negotiate attempted assassinations, extraditions, and behind-the-scenes machinations as they plot their escape.

Episodes.Name: I've Seen the Other Side of You
Episodes.Description: A computer glitch makes the crew turn against one another.

Episodes.Name: We Were Family
Episodes.Description: Three reconnects with his former crew; the Android finds herself in unique company.

Episodes.Name: We Voted Not to Space You
Episodes.Description: The Android goes undercover to help the crew track a dangerous, yet familiar, foe.

Episodes.Name: We Should Have Seen This Coming
Episodes.Description: Nyx's plan to make some money has an ulterior motive.

Episodes.Name: She's One of Them Now
Episodes.Description: The crew goes after Alicia Reynaud looking for answers.

Episodes.Name: Stuff to Steal, People to Kill
Episodes.Description: A Blink Drive test goes awry, propelling the Raza to a parallel reality.

Episodes.Name: Going Out Fighting
Episodes.Description: The crew takes a dangerous mission inside Dwarf Star Technologies in a desperate bid to save their ailing leader.

Episodes.Name: Take the Shot
Episodes.Description: An uploaded computer virus from an unknown source wreaks havoc with the crew, the Android and the ships main computer. The crews pasts are used against them and the Android is tested.

Episodes.Name: Wish I'd Spaced You When I Had the Chance
Episodes.Description: Inspector Kierken chases the crew spotted by GA while shopping on a planetary station. Three and Five are cut off and depend on each other to survive. Six is almost back to full trust and suggests an interesting perspective for the crew.

Episodes.Name: Sometimes in Life You Don't Get to Choose
Episodes.Description: Sometimes In Life You Don't Get to Choose

Episodes.Name: But First, We Save the Galaxy
Episodes.Description: The crew of the Raza works to prevent the destruction of a space station and prevent an all out corporate war.

Episodes.Name: Being Better Is So Much Harder
Episodes.Description: The survivors of the EOS 7 bombing fight to stay alive and find the rest of their crew.

Episodes.Name: It Doesn't Have to Be Like This
Episodes.Description: Ryo Ishido is now the emperor of Zairon. Who makes an enemy of his former allies.

Episodes.Name: Welcome to the Revolution
Episodes.Description: After the crew receives a distress call from a former associate, they find themselves having to broker a peace deal during the midst of an uprising.

Episodes.Name: All the Time in the World
Episodes.Description: Unbeknownst to the rest of the crew, THREE has been trapped in a time loop, reliving the same day over and over.

Episodes.Name: Give It Up, Princess
Episodes.Description: The crew of the Raza track a data file across the galaxy in an attempt to strike a blow against Ferrous, and save the life of a young woman.

Episodes.Name: One Last Card to Play
Episodes.Description: Familiar faces from the past return, causing havoc and forcing our crew to scramble to save their already damaged reputations.

Episodes.Name: Wish I Could Believe You
Episodes.Description: An injured crew member is haunted by the life they left behind, unaware of the dangers lurking in the present.

Episodes.Name: Hot Chocolate
Episodes.Description: While providing safe transport for some allies, The Raza comes under attack from within.

Episodes.Name: Isn't That a Paradox?
Episodes.Description: The Blink Drive self activates and sends the crew of the Raza 600 years back in time to the friendly 21st century suburbia. They must try to fit in while searching for answers. Only the local kids become suspicious.

Episodes.Name: Built, Not Born
Episodes.Description: While helping the Android's friend Victor, the crew find answers about Two's past.

Episodes.Name: The Dwarf Star Conspiracy
Episodes.Description: One of the Android's newly discovered memories leads the crew to a suspicious Dwarf Star facility on Nova 17.

Episodes.Name: My Final Gift to You
Episodes.Description: Ryo invites his former crew to Zairon in a final attempt to secure the Blink Drive and his victory over Pyr.

Episodes.Name: Nowhere to Go
Episodes.Description: The Raza's crew discover the secret shipyard and attempt to unite Ferrous's enemies before the ships come online.

Name: Dark Matter
Summary: In the dystopian 27th century, six people wake up on a deserted spaceship with no memory of who they are or what they're doing there. They reluctantly team up and set off to find answers with the help of a female android.

Trailers.Title: Dark Matter - Trailer
Trailers.Description: Stargate SG-1's Joseph Mallozzi and Paul Mullie are behind Syfy's new series, debuting June 12th, based on their Dark Horse ...

Trailers.Title: Dark Matter Official Trailer #1 | SYFY
Trailers.Description: The official trailer for SYFY's Dark Matter. » Subscribe To SYFY: http://po.st/A8uSSN About: In Dark Matter, the crew of a derelict ...

Trailers.Title: Dark Matter - Official Trailer - Syfy Sci-Fi
Trailers.Description: The six-person crew of a derelict spaceship awakens from stasis in the farthest reaches of space. Their memories wiped clean, ...

Episodes.Name: Deadwood
Episodes.Description: After executing his last act of justice as a Montana marshal, Seth Bullock relocates to a gold-mining camp known as Deadwood in Dakota Territory, where he and partner Sol Star look to start a hardware business. Bullock soon crosses paths with another new arrival - legendary gunfighter Wild Bill Hickok - and clashes with the formidable boss of the Gem Saloon and occasional deal broker, Al Swearengen.

Episodes.Name: Deep Water
Episodes.Description: As suspicions arise that "road agents" may have been the true perpetrators of a massacre, Swearengen takes a special interest in the health of its sole survivor, a young girl ministered to by the unlikely team of Doc Cochran and Calamity Jane. Meanwhile, Bullock and Star attempt to buy property from Swearengen, who suspects an alliance between Wild Bill and the hardware fellows.

Episodes.Name: Reconnoitering the Rim
Episodes.Description: Competition arrives for Swearengen in the form of the Bella Union, a new gambling outfit from Chicago operated by savvy Cy Tolliver, Madame Joanie Stubbs and gaming guru Eddie Sawyer. Hickok puts up precious collateral in a poker game with McCall; Bullock and Sol strike a deal with Swearengen on a lot for their hardware store. Garret threatens Swearengen before investigating his gold claim.

Episodes.Name: Here Was a Man
Episodes.Description: Swearengen directs Farnum to buy back the Garret claim. Garret's wife, Alma, prevails on Calamity Jane and Wild Bill for help with the claim issue. Hickok's respect for Bullock grows and, as a result, he commissions Bullock to do a review of the Garret claim. An ailing colleague, Andy Cramed, rejoins the Bella Union, and Wild Bill's run of luck at poker ends abruptly.

Episodes.Name: The Trial of Jack McCall
Episodes.Description: Swearengen transforms the Gem into a courtroom as Deadwood is forced to make its own laws to try a cowardly murderer. With Calamity Jane off on a bender, Trixie is enlisted by Swearengen to help Alma with the orphaned child and to keep her pliable to his purposes. Fearing Andy's illness might threaten his business, Cy banishes him to the woods, where he is discovered by Jane.

Episodes.Name: Plague
Episodes.Description: Bullock encounters native resistance in his quest to bring a murderer to justice. Swearengen presses Farnum to keep tabs on Alma and Trixie. After an outbreak of smallpox hits Deadwood, the camp fathers pool their resources to track down the vaccine, and Doc enlists Jane as a nurse. Swearengen proudly collaborates on an article in the Deadwood Pioneer meant to minimize the threat of the outbreak.

Episodes.Name: Bullock Returns to the Camp
Episodes.Description: After tracking down a murderer, Bullock returns to Deadwood a changed man as well as a marked one. Dan and Joanie both take a special interest when teenagers Miles and Flora Anderson arrive in camp in search of their father. Calamity Jane earns her moniker in the Pest Tent, while Swearengen sees through Trixie's subterfuge. Alma remains cold to Farnum's inappropriately advanced bid on her claim.

Episodes.Name: Suffer the Little Children
Episodes.Description: Deadwood breathes easier when some riders arrive in town with the smallpox vaccine, and word of a possible treaty with the Sioux. The results of Bullock's analysis of her gold claim move Alma to reassess her plans and sets up a confrontation between Bullock and Swearengen. When Flora tries to quit, Cy teaches Joanie a deadly lesson at the expense of a couple of con artists.

Episodes.Name: No Other Sons or Daughters
Episodes.Description: With annexation of Deadwood looming, Swearengen calls a meeting to set up an informal government. Bullock and Alma compare notes on Ellsworth and each other, and Farnum gets a special-delivery letter from Hickok and a special new post. Joanie finally prepares to make a go on her own, with Cy's avowed blessings, and after a long binge, Calamity Jane decides to ride out of town.

Episodes.Name: Mister Wu
Episodes.Description: An opium theft leaves Swearengen trying to find a common language with his supplier, and navigating murky waters to deal with the mess. Meanwhile, Silas Adams, bagman for the magistrate from Yankton, arrives with bad news for Swearengen. Bullock regrets having raised his hand at the government meeting. An unwelcome and ailing Reverend Smith gravitates to the Gem and its new piano.

Episodes.Name: Jewel's Boot Is Made for Walking
Episodes.Description: Alma's father, Otis Russell, arrives from New York to "help" with her claim. Swearengen strikes a bargain with Adams to rid him of some legal baggage involving the arriving magistrate. Jewel journeys to Doc's cabin for help with her leg. Eddie resumes work at the Bella Union, while Bullock is angered by the choice of the corrupt Con Stapleton as the new sheriff.

Episodes.Name: Sold Under Sin
Episodes.Description: General Crook rolls into Deadwood with his troops, known as "Custer's avengers," and the Yankton magistrate, Clagett, prompting a parade and business solicitations from E.B. Farnum and Cy Tolliver. Al Swearengen delivers a tortured soul from suffering, and Bullock reacts decisively to Russell's intentions regarding Alma. Stapleton's new commission as sheriff proves short-lived, and Bullock and Alma have a late-night meeting.

Episodes.Name: A Lie Agreed Upon: Part I
Episodes.Description: Tensions flare as the camp faces an uncertain future. Al Swearengen taunts Seth Bullock over his relationship with Alma Garret, and the resulting confrontation between sheriff and criminal turns violent. With a new business venture on the horizon, Joanie Stubbs and Cy Tolliver await the arrival of some fancy new whores on the next stagecoach, which also bears two important reminders of Bullock's past.

Episodes.Name: A Lie Agreed Upon: Part II
Episodes.Description: Alma and an increasingly self-destructive Bullock face an abrupt decision on their future. At the Gem, while Swearengen readies for another showdown with Bullock, infighting between Silas Adams and Dan Dority yields more feed for Wu's pigs. Doc Cochran is surprised by Calamity Jane, who has returned to camp in a state of inebriated deterioration.

Episodes.Name: New Money
Episodes.Description: Francis Wolcott, chief scout for a powerful mining operation, arrives to shake up the status quo - beginning with Cy Tolliver. Swearengen's lackeys fret as he refuses visitors and medical attention. Joanie's new partner, Maddie, reveals she's also running a game as their new brothel, the Chez Ami, services its first customer.

Episodes.Name: Requiem for a Gleet
Episodes.Description: Doc contemplates a procedure that could cure Swearengen - or kill him. Bullock attempts to settle into domesticity, while Sol gets a new student bookkeeper - Trixie. Alma cuts ties with Sofia's tutor, Miss Isringhausen. Joanie and Maddie argue over the business. The County Commissioner's arrival spawns rumors about the camp's future and legal ownership of the gold claims.

Episodes.Name: Complications
Episodes.Description: Swearengen is on the mend as Alma begins to take ill - mostly in the mornings. Cy is suspicious of Joanie and Maddie's operation, and makes an unexpected discovery about George Hearst's agent, Wolcott. Bullock attempts to control an outlaw mob and protect the Commissioner, who directed Merrick to print a provocative statement regarding gold claims.

Episodes.Name: Something Very Expensive
Episodes.Description: Alma proposes opening a bank with the help of Sol Star. A new schoolteacher arrives in town, much to Merrick's delight. Much to Wu's dismay, new Chinese whores arrive. Wolcott's inner demons wreak havoc on Joanie's whorehouse, testing his alliance with Cy. Bullock attempts to keep order in the camp, and at the same time settle into family life.

Episodes.Name: E.B. Was Left Out
Episodes.Description: Joanie discovers what happened at the Chez Ami and confides in Charlie Utter. Swearengen meets with Alma regarding Miss Isringhausen's allegations...and her connection to the Pinkertons. The town leaders convene to discuss pressing issues, but neglect to invite E.B., the mayor. By way of a strange circumstance, Utter comes into possession of Wild Bill's final correspondence.

Episodes.Name: Childish Things
Episodes.Description: Wolcott offers on the claim of two ornery brothers, and reports to Hearst on their progress overall. Miss Isgringhausen strikes a deal with Swearengen, who discusses his options with a friend in a small box. Alma receives very different proposals from both Mrs. Bullock and Ellsworth. A Russian telegraph operator arrives in camp, and Joanie befriends a reluctant Jane.

Episodes.Name: Amalgamation and Capital
Episodes.Description: Bullock makes a connection with his son. Swearengen, who has entrusted E.B. to spy on the new telegraph operator, stokes rumors of an annexation of the camp and amends his agreement with Miss Isgringhausen. Cy aims to unburden a troubled man of his bloodstained money. Alma and Martha come to an agreement, and a tragic accident befalls the camp.

Episodes.Name: Advances, None Miraculous
Episodes.Description: When Doc delivers a dire prognosis, one family suffers and the entire camp stands vigil. Merrick avails some private information to Swearengen, who enlists Star and Adams to help con the newly returned Commissioner Jarry. Andy, a former Deadwood pariah, offers himself as the camp's new minister. Trixie pressures a distraught Alma to accept a beneficial proposal.

Episodes.Name: The Whores Can Come
Episodes.Description: Death in the camp spooks the superstitious, and the impending funeral causes much sorrow. Cy is convinced that Andy - who will officiate at the service - is back in town to run a game. Wu asks Swearengen to back him against the "San Francisco cocksucker". Bullock encourages his wife to stay in Deadwood.

Episodes.Name: Boy-the-Earth-Talks-To
Episodes.Description: A marriage occurs against a backdrop of murder and negotiations for elections and the camp.

Episodes.Name: Tell Your God to Ready for Blood
Episodes.Description: Elections are just days away, and Bullock lets his temper get away from him. Alma's pregnancy is not progressing as expected, and Swearengen baits Hearst.

Episodes.Name: I Am Not the Fine Man You Take Me For
Episodes.Description: Campaign speeches are rescheduled, Sol makes an investment, Alma's condition worsens, and Hearst starts a deadly game with Swearengen.

Episodes.Name: True Colors
Episodes.Description: A dandy arrives by stage coach and immediately begins exploring how to bring culture to the camp, Alma and Hearst negotiate business, and Hearst's Aunt Lou comes to camp.

Episodes.Name: Full Faith and Credit
Episodes.Description: Alma opens the doors to the new Bank of Deadwood and business is brisk. Hostetler return to Deadwood with the horse that killed Bullock's son. The Sheriff accepts that his son's death was due to an accident and blames no one. He finds himself acting as a go-between Hostetler and Steve, who has been taking care of the livery in Hostetler's absence and now feels he's being pushed out. Langrische makes an offer to buy Joanie's house with a view to opening a theater but Joanie imposes certain conditions before she sells. Hearst asks Cy Tolliver and Al Swearengen to a ...

Episodes.Name: A Two-Headed Beast
Episodes.Description: Tolliver looks for a representative, the Captain calls Dan out, Swearengen continues to be perplexed by Hearst's moves, and Alma and Ellsworth's relationship takes a turn.

Episodes.Name: A Rich Find
Episodes.Description: Hearst's feathers are ruffled, Aunt Lou's son comes to town, and Bullock and Swearengen make a decision.

Episodes.Name: Unauthorized Cinnamon
Episodes.Description: A meeting of the elders occurs with surprising results, Doc's absence is noted by Swearengen, Alma battles her addiction, and Sol offers Trixie something she never expected.

Episodes.Name: Leviathan Smiles
Episodes.Description: The letter is published, Wyatt Earp hits town, delays continue with the theater, and Hearst makes a move.

Episodes.Name: Amateur Night
Episodes.Description: An Amateur Night is organized by the new theater troupe, Pinkertons hit town, the students move to their new school, and Hearst makes another move regarding the elections.

Episodes.Name: A Constant Throb
Episodes.Description: Swearengen is spurred to action when a prominent camp member is attacked, Langrishe makes arrangements for his theater, and Jane has an epiphany.

Episodes.Name: The Catbird Seat
Episodes.Description: Another attack is made at Hearst's behest, Harry and Bullock travel to Sturgis for campaigning, and there's unrest in Langrishe's troupe.

Episodes.Name: Tell Him Something Pretty
Episodes.Description: Election day arrives, Hearst has his revenge, Sol and Trixie have it out, and Tolliver releases rage at his impotence.

Name: Deadwood
Summary: A show set in the late 1800s, revolving around the characters of Deadwood, South Dakota; a town of deep corruption and crime.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.1
Episodes.Description: When her boyfriend Sergei vanishes after starting a new job at the secretive Devs division of tech company Amaya, software engineer Lily begins to suspect that his disappearance may not be as clear-cut as it seems.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.2
Episodes.Description: Lily enlists ex-boyfriend Jamie's help to investigate Sergei's disappearance. She begins to question what she really knew about Sergei.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.3
Episodes.Description: Lily returns to work at Amaya and explains her suspicions to Jen and Anya. Forest is visited by Laine, a powerful senator asking questions about the Devs project.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.4
Episodes.Description: After Lily's behavior at Amaya, Kenton forces her to see a psychiatrist. Meanwhile, the Devs team disagree over the ethics of their invention, and Forest asserts his commitment to the project.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.5
Episodes.Description: Kenton pays Jamie a visit to guarantee his silence, while Katie covertly exploits the Devs system for her own ends.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.6
Episodes.Description: Lily and Jamie visit Forest looking for answers, and Katie reveals to Lily the true nature of the Devs system.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.7
Episodes.Description: The Devs team perfect the system, and Forest and Katie wait for the completion of the Devs project. Lily and Jamie try to avoid its threat, but a visit from Kenton leaves Lily with no choice.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.8
Episodes.Description: The question is answered: is the Universe deterministic, a multi-verse, or something else?

Summary: A computer engineer investigates the secretive development division in her company, which she believes is behind the disappearance of her boyfriend.

Episodes.Name: Lion Grasslands
Episodes.Description: After dark on Kenya's Maasai Mara grasslands, a lioness won't rest until she finds the young cubs she's lost.

Episodes.Name: Tarsier Forest
Episodes.Description: As darkness falls, a family of tiny primates in Sulawesi ventures into the jungle to find food while protecting their babies.

Episodes.Name: Jaguar Jungle
Episodes.Description: A jaguar fights to keep his river home in Brazil as the night brings both challenges and opportunities to hunt.

Episodes.Name: Bear Woodlands
Episodes.Description: In the boreal forests of Europe, a young brown bear clashes with wolves-and tries to find a mate beneath the stars.

Episodes.Name: Wild Cities
Episodes.Description: When Los Angeles, Chicago, and Toronto light up at nightfall, they create worlds of opportunities for the cleverest animals willing to take the risk.

Episodes.Name: Cheetah Plains
Episodes.Description: In Kenya's Maasai Mara, two cheetah brothers attempt a high-speed night hunt with a gang of powerful hyenas on their trail.

Episodes.Name: Elephant Plains
Episodes.Description: A family of African elephants leverage the cool night to journey in search of water-but the darkness leaves them unexpectedly vulnerable.

Episodes.Name: Puma Mountain
Episodes.Description: A young puma coming of age in the Patagonian mountains must learn to survive on her own after her mother leaves to start a new family.

Episodes.Name: Kangaroo Valley
Episodes.Description: Trying to survive the Australian night, a family of kangaroos evade a pack of hungry dingoes hunting them in the darkness.

Episodes.Name: Coral Reef
Episodes.Description: As night descends, the coral reef world transforms. A dazzling realm of hidden hunters and natural wonders emerge from the dark.

Episodes.Name: Seal Coast
Episodes.Description: On Namibia's Skeleton Coast, a seal pup left home alone must outwit jackals and hyena ambushes to survive the night.

Episodes.Name: Polar Bear Winter
Episodes.Description: A mother polar bear must lead her cubs through one of the year's coldest, longest nights at the onset of arctic winter.

Name: Earth at Night in Color
Summary: The moonlit dramas of animals at night, revealing new insights and never before seen behaviors.

Trailers.Title: Earth At Night In Color — Official Trailer | Apple TV+

Trailers.Description: Narrated by Tom Hiddleston and filmed across six continents, this docuseries uses cutting-edge camera technology to capture ...

Episodes.Name: Broken Bow: Part 1
Episodes.Description: In the mid-22nd century, the Earth ship Enterprise is launched under the command of Captain Jonathan Archer. When the crew rescues an alien from a crashed spaceship, Earth gets its first look at the alien's race - the Klingons. Archer and his crew must walk a fine line as they attempt to communicate with the Klingon pilot, whose language is completely unknown, and whose homeworld wants him back. Is this the beginning of friendship...or interstellar war?

Episodes.Name: Broken Bow: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Captain Jonathan Archer, T'Pol and Trip meet Sarin and she explains that Klaang is a courier, bringing an important message from her to the leaders of the Klingons in Kronos about rebels Suliban that intend to promote the Temporal Cold War among the Klingons. Archer feels the need of rescuing Klaang and travels to the Suliban mother-ship with Trip to bring the Klingon back to Enterprise. T'Pol seems to understand that loyalty is an emotion that cannot be avoided by humans.

Episodes.Name: Fight or Flight
Episodes.Description: Captain Archer wants to convert curiosity into deeds and decides to enter a ship floating in space. Hoshi has trouble adjusting to life on Enterprise.

Episodes.Name: Strange New World
Episodes.Description: Archer sends an away team to a habitable, luscious planet for observation. But when a storm occurs, the team begins to experience paranoid delusions.

Episodes.Name: Unexpected
Episodes.Description: After helping to repair the warp drive on board of a Xyrillian ship, Trip notices a strange bulging on his arm.

Episodes.Name: Terra Nova
Episodes.Description: Enterprise tries to find out what happened on Terra Nova, the first colonization attempt outside Earth's solar system.

Episodes.Name: The Andorian Incident
Episodes.Description: Archer, Trip and T'Pol are captured by the Andorians at a Vulcan monastery on P'Jem. They believe that the monastery is being used to spy on Andoria.

Episodes.Name: Breaking the Ice
Episodes.Description: Enterprise discovers a comet which contains the very rare element eisilium. Then unexpectedly a Vulcan ship arrives. Captain Vanik tells they're interested in human behavior.

Episodes.Name: Civilization
Episodes.Description: T'Pol finds unusual neutrino readings on a planet with a preindustrial society.

Episodes.Name: Fortunate Son
Episodes.Description: Enterprise is sent to help the freighter Fortunate after an attack. However, its first officer, Ryan, is hiding something.

Episodes.Name: Cold Front
Episodes.Description: Enterprise has a group of aliens watching a stellar phenomenon on board. When the ship is miraculously saved from blowing up, crewman Daniels has an important message for Archer.

Episodes.Name: Silent Enemy
Episodes.Description: After an attack by a mysterious ship, Archers orders Enterprise's return to Jupiter to install phase cannons; Hoshi makes plans for Malcolm's birthday.

Episodes.Name: Dear Doctor
Episodes.Description: Phlox is asked to save the Valakians from annihilation by disease. However, he discovers something unusual about the Menk, another humanoid race on the planet.

Episodes.Name: Sleeping Dogs
Episodes.Description: Enterprise tries to rescue a Klingon ship from sinking into a gas giant.

Episodes.Name: Shadows of P'Jem
Episodes.Description: T'Pol is being recalled because of Enterprise's involvement in the destruction of the P'Jem sanctuary. She and Captain Archer are later kidnapped while visiting the planet Coridan.

Episodes.Name: Shuttlepod One
Episodes.Description: While returning to Enterprise in Shuttlepod One, Trip and Reed see apparent evidence that the ship has been destroyed. With only days of oxygen left, they must find a way to survive long enough for rescue.

Episodes.Name: Fusion
Episodes.Description: When Enterprise encounters a ship of Vulcan pilgrims, T'Pol is convinced by one of them to perform a Vulcan mind meld.

Episodes.Name: Rogue Planet
Episodes.Description: Lieutenant Reed discovers a rogue planet, which has broken out of orbit and therefore is devoid of any light. Life is still possible in some places because heat is bubbling up from under the surface, but T'Pol doesn't detect any humanoid life. Further scans however give a strange energy reading which seems to be coming from a ship on the surface. After the crew has landed, they encounter the Eska. The Eska come from another planet and they say they are hunting for the drayjin, an animal considered a delicacy. When captain Jonathan Archer tries to sleep on the planet, ...

Episodes.Name: Acquisition
Episodes.Description: Almost the entire crew is left unconscious when four Ferengi pirates raid Enterprise. A still conscious Trip is the only one who can get rid of them.

Episodes.Name: Oasis
Episodes.Description: The crew of Enterprise searches for a seemingly abandoned ship on a desert planet.

Episodes.Name: Detained
Episodes.Description: Archer and Mayweather are captured by the Tandarans and placed in a Suliban internment camp.

Episodes.Name: Vox Sola
Episodes.Description: A fibrous, web-like alien creature comes aboard the ship and several of the crew becomes entangled in it including Archer and Trip, and it seems Hoshi is the only one who can try to communicate with the creature.

Episodes.Name: Fallen Hero
Episodes.Description: Enterprise is planning a trip to the relaxation planet Risa, when it gets an urgent request from the Vulcan High Command. They must pick up ambassador V'Lar who has fallen in disgrace. Apparently she misused her position during negotiations on the planet Mazar and has been evicted. After Enterprise picked up V'Lar and is on its way for a meeting with the Vulcan warship Sh'Ran, suddenly a Mazarite ship appears. They want V'Lar for further interrogating. When captain Archer wants to discuss it first with Starfleet Command, they open fire.

Episodes.Name: Desert Crossing
Episodes.Description: Enterprise is for the second time on its way to Risa when yet again another urgent matter comes up: a distress call. It comes from a small vessel. The owner, Zobral, is extremely happy with the help from Enterprise and invites Captain Archer to his home world for a good meal and a game of Geskana. When Archer and Trip have landed on the desert planet, Enterprise gets a message from the Torothan Chancellor Trelit. He says Zobral isn't as nice a man as captain Archer thinks.

Episodes.Name: Two Days and Two Nights
Episodes.Description: The members of the Enterprise crew are faced with various misadventures and challenges while taking a two day break from their duties on the planet of Risa.

Episodes.Name: Shockwave, Part I
Episodes.Description: Enterprise discovers a mining colony of the Paraagans. The crew gets an invitation for a meeting on the surface and a shuttle pod tries to break through the atmosphere. All of a sudden just under the shuttle a giant explosion begins and scorches the earth beneath. All 3600 colonists are reported dead. After examination, Enterprise finds out plasma leaking from the pod's vents ignited tetrazine in the atmosphere. Lieutenant Reed, however, ensures he closed the plasma vents before the shuttle went of. After conversations with admiral Forrest of Starfleet Command, ...

Episodes.Name: Shockwave, Part II
Episodes.Description: Captain Archer and temporal agent Daniels have been stranded in the 31st century. In a library they investigate the damage to the time line and try to find way a to get Archer back in his own century. Meanwhile Silik the Suliban leader is trying his utmost to find the whereabouts of Archer and he is willing to go far for the answer. But the crew of Enterprise has plans of their own. Trip finds a way to use the com system and is able to speak with Reed. Together they try to contact other crew members and make plans to purge Enterprise of the Sulibans.

Episodes.Name: Carbon Creek
Episodes.Description: On the first anniversary of her assignment to Enterprise, T'Pol tells Archer and Trip about the first contact between humans and Vulcans, which involves three Vulcans becoming stranded in the town of Carbon Creek, Pennsylvania in 1957.

Episodes.Name: Minefield
Episodes.Description: The safety of Enterprise rests on Reed's shoulders when the ship becomes trapped in a Romulan minefield and Romulan ships are closing in on them.

Episodes.Name: Dead Stop
Episodes.Description: Enterprise seeks repairs from their encounters with the Romulans, where they stop at a desolate but idyllic repair station. But all is not what it seems when Mayweather is suddenly found dead.

Episodes.Name: A Night in Sickbay
Episodes.Description: After previously offending the Kreetassans, Enterprise attempts to make a better second impression, only to upset the alien race once again. A frustrated Captain Archer returns from the planet only to be further upset to find that his dog Porthos, has been affected by a pathogen native to the world. While Phlox works around the clock treating Porthos, Archer stands vigil in sickbay, experiencing first-hand the quirky everyday life of his Denobulan Doctor.

Episodes.Name: Marauders
Episodes.Description: Enterprise visits a colony with a deuterium trading post. But the people seem to be pretty unwilling to trade. Are they hiding something?

Episodes.Name: The Seventh
Episodes.Description: T'Pol asks Captain Archer to join her on a mission to capture a Vulcan fugitive that escaped her years ago.

Episodes.Name: The Communicator
Episodes.Description: Upon returning from covertly observing a pre-warp culture, Lieutenant Reed realizes he lost his communicator somewhere on the planet. Archer and Reed return to recover the lost technology, only to find the natives found it first. Captured and interrogated, the crewmen find themselves doing even more damage to the culture, who have scanned the prisoners and know them to be of another race. Meanwhile, Tucker and Mayweather try to figure out how to activate the cloak on the Suliban cell ship so they can mount a discreet rescue.

Episodes.Name: Singularity
Episodes.Description: T'Pol must save the ship after the crew becomes obsessed with trivialities during the approach to a black hole.

Episodes.Name: Vanishing Point
Episodes.Description: After Hoshi uses the transporter to avoid running into a storm, she starts to feel very strange.

Episodes.Name: Precious Cargo
Episodes.Description: While Trip is repairing a stasis pod at a Retellian cargo ship and the woman inside, heir apparent to the throne of Krios, wakes up, the ship makes a hasty departure. Trip must make a plan to escape.

Episodes.Name: The Catwalk
Episodes.Description: After receiving a warning about a radioactive storm approaching Enterprise, the crew is forced to take shelter in the ship's catwalk.

Episodes.Name: Dawn
Episodes.Description: Trip's shuttlepod is shot down by a hostile race and is forced to land on a deserted moon. There he must team up with the alien who shot him down in order to find a way back to Enterprise.

Episodes.Name: Stigma
Episodes.Description: T'Pol is diagnosed with a possibly fatal neurological disease as a result of a mind meld. Meanwhile, one of Phlox's wives visits Enterprise and becomes very interested in Trip.

Episodes.Name: Cease Fire
Episodes.Description: Captain Archer is asked to negotiate between the Andorians and Vulcans who are fighting over a small planet.

Episodes.Name: Future Tense
Episodes.Description: Enterprise discovers a pod with the body of a human that seems to be wanted by both Sulibans and Tholians.

Episodes.Name: Canamar
Episodes.Description: Archer and Trip are accused of smuggling and sent to the penal colony Canamar. While Enterprise manages to negotiate their release, a mutiny breaks out on the prison ship.

Episodes.Name: The Crossing
Episodes.Description: Enterprise is held captive by non-corporeal beings who claim to be explorers.

Episodes.Name: Judgment
Episodes.Description: After Enterprise lends aid to a group of accused rebels, Captain Archer faces a tribunal and charges of conspiring against the Klingon Empire.

Episodes.Name: Horizon
Episodes.Description: Mayweather temporarily leaves Enterprise to visit the cargo ship Horizon, where he was born and raised. Meanwhile, the Enterprise crew observes an unusual planetary event.

Episodes.Name: The Breach
Episodes.Description: At Dr. Phlox's request, Enterprise attempts to retrieve 3 Denobulan scientists from the planet Xantoras, where the Goverment has ordered all off-worlders to evacuate within 3 days. Tucker, Reed, and Mayweather navigate a series of labyrinthine underground caves in search of the scientists. Meanwhile, Enterprise lends assistance to a damaged ship fleeing the planet. Doctor Phlox faces an ethical dilemma when one of the refugees of the ship refuses life-saving treatment. The patient, an Antaran, holds a grudge against Phlox stemming from a war between their races that ...

Episodes.Name: Cogenitor
Episodes.Description: Enterprise encounters a hyper-giant star. While there, they make first contact with the Vissians, a technologically sophisticated race with three genders. While making quick friends, and eagerly learning about the advanced technology, Trip gets curious about the Vissians third gender, known as the Cogenitor, who is crucial in the Vissian reproductive process. Against the wishes of the Vissians, Trip befriends the Cogenitor and encourages it to defy its cultural boundaries, which the Vissians are made aware of, and are angered by.

Episodes.Name: Regeneration
Episodes.Description: An Arctic research team makes a startling find: cybernetic creatures - Borg - buried in the ice. When the revived aliens seize control of a spacecraft, it's up to Archer to keep them from contacting the Collective and threatening Earth.

Episodes.Name: First Flight
Episodes.Description: After his close friend and colleague A.G. Robinson is killed in a mountain climbing accident, Captain Archer tells T'Pol about the Warp 2 test flight almost ten years earlier.

Episodes.Name: Bounty
Episodes.Description: After exploring an uninhabited planet, Captain Archer is taken prisoner by a Tellarite bounty hunter who was hired by the Klingons to return Archer to Qo'noS.

Episodes.Name: The Expanse
Episodes.Description: An unknown probe fires on Earth from space, cutting a swath from Florida to Venezuela. Everything in the path of the attack was destroyed, resulting in the deaths of seven million humans including Tucker's younger sister Elizabeth. Enterprise is recalled to Earth for upgrades to the ship and to take on military crewmen. Silik gives Archer a message from the future about Earth's latest enemy. The Klingon Empire gives Duras another chance to capture Archer. Enterprise heads for infamous and dangerous Delphic Expanse.

Episodes.Name: The Xindi
Episodes.Description: Enterprise has been in the Delphic Expanse for six weeks and have yet to get any intel about the Xindi. Strange anomalies affect the ship, sending cargo flying violently through the bays, pockets of atmosphere losing gravity and other incidents defying the known laws of physics. T'Pol helps Trip's insomnia with an intimate Vulcan therapy. Archer and Trip find another race of Xindi imprisoned in a mine.

Episodes.Name: Anomaly
Episodes.Description: After an attack by Osaarian pirates, Enterprise follows them to a mysterious sphere.

Episodes.Name: Extinction
Episodes.Description: Archer, Reed and Sato are transformed into aliens while visiting a planet.

Episodes.Name: Rajiin
Episodes.Description: Enterprise helps an alien woman, Rajiin, seeking to escape her life as a sex slave. Once on board she uses her alien abilities to gather biometric data about humans and is recaptured by her employers, the Xindi council.

Episodes.Name: Impulse
Episodes.Description: Enterprise answers a distress signal from a stranded Vulcan ship, only when arriving they find the ship completely desolate, wrecked - and filled with Vulcan zombies.

Episodes.Name: Exile
Episodes.Description: Hoshi Sato is contacted by a 400-year-old telepathic alien exiled on planet in the Expanse, shunned by his society because of his abilities. The alien offers to use his powers to help Enterprise find the Xindi and the weapon they are building, but only if Hoshi will stay with him while he works. She agrees to stay behind, while Enterprise confirms the Expanse has a second Sphere and is on its way to investigate.

Episodes.Name: The Shipment
Episodes.Description: Enterprise follows a lead and discovers a Xindi lab that refines Kemocite, the key ingredient in the weapon being built to destroy Earth. An away team of Archer, Reed and Hayes confront the lead researcher, Gralik Durr, who was employed by Degra to refine the Kemocite but was never told what it would be used for. When Gralik realizes it was his research that contributed to the 7 million deaths on Earth, he agrees to help Archer prevent further loss of life. Meanwhile, on Enterprise, Phlox and Tucker study the weapon they seized from the Xindi and find an organic ...

Episodes.Name: Twilight
Episodes.Description: His memory crippled, Archer awakens years in the future, after the Xindi have reduced Earth to a cinder and the remnants of humanity have settled on a distant planet. Now, Archer learns that he may be the key to undoing this tragedy.

Episodes.Name: North Star
Episodes.Description: Enterprise investigates a previously unknown colony of humans who are living in the fashion of the American Old West. They are oppressing an alien race called the Skagarans.

Episodes.Name: Similitude
Episodes.Description: Archer decides to make a fast-growing clone of Trip to help save his life while Enterprise is stranded in a dangerous field with nucleonic particles.

Episodes.Name: Carpenter Street
Episodes.Description: Archer and T'Pol travel back in time to Detroit in 2004 to stop three Xindi-Reptilians from constructing a bioweapon.

Episodes.Name: Chosen Realm
Episodes.Description: Enterprise is taken over by religious zealots who want to use the ship in a war against heretics.

Episodes.Name: Proving Ground
Episodes.Description: Enterprise has found the location of the testing site of the Xindi weapon and gets some rather unexpected help.

Episodes.Name: Stratagem
Episodes.Description: Archer and the Xindi Degra are in a shuttle. With Degra suffering from memory loss, Archer tells him they escaped together from a prison and that the Insectoids took power after destroying Earth.

Episodes.Name: Harbinger
Episodes.Description: With Reed and Hayes fighting over a training program and Trip seemingly making T'Pol jealous, Enterprise discovers a dying alien in a pod with technology similar to the Spheres.

Episodes.Name: Doctor's Orders
Episodes.Description: While in command of Enterprise because the entire crew is in a coma, Dr. Phlox starts hearing some strange sounds.

Episodes.Name: Hatchery
Episodes.Description: Captain Archer orders the crew of Enterprise to save a Xindi-Insectoid hatchery.

Episodes.Name: Azati Prime
Episodes.Description: Archer decides he should pilot a kamikaze shuttle to destroy the Xindi weapon. Temporal agent Daniels urges him to reconsider.

Episodes.Name: Damage
Episodes.Description: Captain Archer has been returned to Enterprise by the Xindi council awaiting a hearing. But after a heavy attack by the Reptilians, Enterprise is stranded without a functional warp drive. They meet another ship in trouble because of space anomalies. The ship's captain isn't willing to trade in their warp coil and Archer must make a tough decision. Meanwhile T'Pol is having some strange sensations and can't control her emotions.

Episodes.Name: The Forgotten
Episodes.Description: Enterprise has arrived on time for the appointment with Degra. Captain Archer invites them to their ship, while he does his best to convince both Degra and Jannar that the destruction of Earth is actually part of the grand scheme of the sphere builders to conquer the universe. While Jannar remains reluctant, Degra seems to be slightly won over. Trip Tucker is having a hard time keeping Enterprise in shape and is also having difficulties with writing a letter to the parents of crewman Taylor, informing of her death. Then trouble arises when out of the blue a Reptilian ...

Episodes.Name: E²
Episodes.Description: Trying to pass through a subspace corridor, Enterprise is stopped by a version of itself from the future.

Episodes.Name: The Council
Episodes.Description: Enterprise has arrived at the location of the Xindi Council and with the help of Degra, Archer can make his plea in front of the five races of Xindi. Archer needs to prove that the Sphere Builders have been telling lies. While the Primates and Arboreals are already aware of the truth, convincing the other three races will not be easy. The Reptilians and Insectoids refuse to even listen to Archer. Meanwhile, the Sphere Builders haven't been sitting still, and have arranged a secret meeting with the Reptilians.

Episodes.Name: Countdown
Episodes.Description: While the Reptilians force Hoshi to decipher a launch code, the Primates, Arboreals and Archer think of a way to stop the Xindi weapon.

Episodes.Name: Zero Hour
Episodes.Description: Archer takes Degra's ship to try to prevent Earth from being destroyed and gets some unexpected help. Enterprise tries to destroy Sphere 41, but the Sphere Builders know about the plan.

Episodes.Name: Storm Front
Episodes.Description: Following the destruction of the Xindi weapon, the Enterprise crew discovers that they have been sent back in time to 1944. However, history has been altered, leaving Nazi Germany in control of a large portion of the eastern United States.

Episodes.Name: Storm Front, Part II
Episodes.Description: After Silik attacks Trip, Vosk wants to make a deal with Archer: supplies of the ship for the completion of his time machine in return for a trip to the 22nd Century.

Episodes.Name: Home
Episodes.Description: The crew take some time off. Archer meets an old friend, Captain Erika Hernandez. T'Pol takes Trip to Vulcan, with a surprise waiting. Phlox finds out Earth has become xenophobic.

Episodes.Name: Borderland
Episodes.Description: After a Klingon ship is attacked, it's discovered the imprisoned Dr. Soong's genetically enhanced humans are responsible. Archer takes him to prevent a war.

Episodes.Name: Cold Station 12
Episodes.Description: The Augments are on their way to Cold Station 12, where Augments embryos are kept.

Episodes.Name: The Augments
Episodes.Description: The Augments have yet again escaped. While Dr. Soong wants to hide the embryos, Malik has an entirely different and way more cruel plan.

Episodes.Name: The Forge
Episodes.Description: After a bombing destroyed the Earth embassy on Vulcan, a group known as the Syrrannites are suspected. T'Pol receives a map from her Syrrannite mother, leading into a dangerous desert, the Forge.

Episodes.Name: Awakening
Episodes.Description: T'Pol and Archer confront the Syrrannites and meet T'Pau who denies the embassy bombing. Archer, who has Surak's essence, is asked to help. V'Las threatens Enterprise to make sure an attack on the Syrrannites isn't witnessed.

Episodes.Name: Kir'Shara
Episodes.Description: While Enterprise travels to Andoria to warn them of the attack, Archer tries to bring the Kir'Shara to the High Command.

Episodes.Name: Daedalus
Episodes.Description: Dr. Emory Erickson comes aboard to supposedly conduct tests for subquantum transportation. However, he seems to have a different agenda.

Episodes.Name: Observer Effect
Episodes.Description: Noncorporeal aliens inhabit the bodies of Enterprise crew members to study how the crew reacts to a lethal virus infection that has afflicted Trip and Hoshi.

Episodes.Name: Babel One
Episodes.Description: Enterprise escorts Tellarites to peace talks with Andorians. While transporting they rescue Andorians and say the Tellarites attacked them. Enterprise is soon attacked by an Andorian ship, and Archer must prove who is responsible.

Episodes.Name: United
Episodes.Description: Captain Archer must convince Vulcans, Tellarites and Andorians to unite to find the Romulan ship.

Episodes.Name: The Aenar
Episodes.Description: Enterprise finds out the marauder was piloted telepathically by an Aenar, a subspecies from Andoria.

Episodes.Name: Affliction
Episodes.Description: While Enterprise is visiting Earth, Phlox is abducted by the Klingons and forced to research a cure for a virus destined to wipe out the race. Reed is tapped by a secret agency and ordered to betray Archer. Trip transfers to the Columbia.

Episodes.Name: Divergence
Episodes.Description: While Enterprise tries to bring Trip on board to reverse the malicious Klingon modifications, Phlox and Antaak find a cure for the virus that will not please General K'Vagh.

Episodes.Name: Bound
Episodes.Description: The men of Enterprise fall under the seductive control of three Orion women. Trip is the only male member of the crew not to succumb to the women.

Episodes.Name: In a Mirror, Darkly
Episodes.Description: Set in the dark and oppressive Mirror Universe, Commander Archer leads a mutiny in a bold attempt to seize control of an advanced starship - a vessel from the future that may be the key to saving the Terran Empire.

Episodes.Name: In a Mirror, Darkly, Part II
Episodes.Description: The Mirror Universe saga concludes as Archer declares himself captain of a formidable starship from the future, while his alien crew launch a rebellion in a desperate bid to keep him from achieving ultimate power.

Episodes.Name: Demons
Episodes.Description: While attending a conference on a proposed interplanetary alliance, Trip and T'Pol find out from a dying woman that they have a baby. Investigation shows the woman was a member of the xenophobic organization Terra Prime.

Episodes.Name: Terra Prime
Episodes.Description: Paxton threatens to destroy Starfleet Headquarters if all aliens don't leave Earth. Enterprise must shut down the verteron array on Mars, but it is extremely well defended.

Episodes.Name: These Are the Voyages...
Episodes.Description: In 2370, Commander William T. Riker is trying to clear his mind and relives the last mission of the first Enterprise on the holodeck.

Name: Enterprise
Summary: A century before Captain Kirk's five-year mission, Jonathan Archer captains the United Earth ship Enterprise during the early years of Starfleet, leading up to the Earth-Romulan War and the formation of the Federation.

Trailers.Title: Star Trek: Enterprise (TV series) the cast from 2001/05 to 2022 Then and now
Trailers.Description: How the main cast has changed in these 21 years and the last appearance: Scott Bakula as Capt. Jonathan Archer John ...

Trailers.Title: Star Trek: Enterprise (2001) - TV Series
Trailers.Description: Enterprise (retitled Star Trek: Enterprise at the start of its third season) is a science fiction television program created by Brannon ...

Trailers.Title: Lot 354 Star Trek: Enterprise (TV 2001-2005) - Communicator
Trailers.Description: A prop communicator device from Star Trek: Enterprise. The Enterprise crew used their prop communicators throughout the ...

Episodes.Name: Trouble Don't Last Always
Episodes.Description: After changing her mind to run away with Jules at the train station and relapsing, Rue celebrates Christmas.

Episodes.Name: Fuck Anyone Who's Not a Sea Blob
Episodes.Description: Over the Christmas holiday, Jules reflects on the year.

Episodes.Name: Pilot
Episodes.Description: Rue returns home from rehab and meets Jules; Nate and Maddy attempt to make each other jealous; Kat is pressured to lose something.

Episodes.Name: Stuntin' Like My Daddy
Episodes.Description: On the first day of school, Rue struggles to put the past behind her; Nate's obsessions turn violent; Kat finds a video of her online.

Episodes.Name: Made You Look
Episodes.Description: Kat starts camming; Jules falls for a boy online; Rue is confronted about her lies at NA; Cassie and McKay spend the weekend at his college.

Episodes.Name: Shook Ones Pt II
Episodes.Description: Rue, trying to get clean for Jules, chaperones Gia at the carnival; Kat misreads a situation; Jules encounters Cal; Nate reveals who he really is.

Episodes.Name: '03 Bonnie and Clyde
Episodes.Description: In the aftermath of the carnival, Maddy and Nate are forced to deal with a police investigation; Jules begins to feel pressured by her role in Rue's sobriety; Cal worries about his actions.

Episodes.Name: The Next Episode
Episodes.Description: On Halloween, Jules starts exhibiting concerning behavior; McKay questions his future in football; Cassie spends some time with Daniel; Kat continues to push Ethan away; Nate comes up with a plan.

Episodes.Name: The Trials and Tribulations of Trying to Pee While Depressed
Episodes.Description: Rue falls into a depressive episode and binge-watches 22 episodes of a British reality show; Jules visits an old friend; Cassie looks for advice to help her deal with the fallout of Halloween night.

Episodes.Name: And Salt the Earth Behind You
Episodes.Description: It's the winter formal at East Highland.

Episodes.Name: Trying to Get to Heaven Before They Close the Door
Episodes.Description: Rue and Jules cross paths for the first time since Christmas as East Highland rings in the new year.

Episodes.Name: Out of Touch
Episodes.Description: As the semester kicks off, Jules questions Rue and Elliot's new friendship. While Cal hunts for answers, Nate makes a tough decision. The lines between fantasy and reality begin to blur as Kat ponders her relationship, and Maddy contemplates the decision to end hers.

Episodes.Name: Ruminations: Big and Little Bullys
Episodes.Description: Rue pursues a new business venture as she helps forge a friendship between Jules and Elliot. Cassie settles into a routine, while Lexi pours herself into mounting a school play. Maddy considers getting back together with Nate, and Cal finds a target.

Episodes.Name: You Who Cannot See, Think of Those Who Can
Episodes.Description: At Maddy's birthday party, relationships are celebrated and questioned. Jules turns to Elliot for advice. Cal takes a trip down memory lane.

Episodes.Name: Stand Still Like the Hummingbird
Episodes.Description: Fate has a way of catching up with those who try to outrun it.

Episodes.Name: A Thousand Little Trees of Blood
Episodes.Description: As relationships with mothers are tested, Rue tries to recover. Nate enjoys his newfound freedom.

Episodes.Name: The Theater and Its Double
Episodes.Description: Art imitates life as the East Highland crew watches their complicated dynamics reflected in Lexi's long-awaited play.

Episodes.Name: All My Life, My Heart Has Yearned for a Thing I Cannot Name
Episodes.Description: Snippets of memory collide with the present and future.

Name: Euphoria
Summary: A look at life for a group of high school students as they grapple with issues of drugs, sex, and violence.

Trailers.Title: EUPHORIA Trailer (2019) Zendaya, Teen Series
Trailers.Description: EUPHORIA Trailer (2019) Zendaya, Teen Series © 2019 - HBO.

Trailers.Title: EUPHORIA Official Trailer (NEW 2019) Zendaya New HBO Series HD
Trailers.Description: EUPHORIA Official Trailer (NEW 2019) Zendaya New HBO Series HD © 2019 - HBO Comedy, Kids, Family and Animated Film, ...

Trailers.Title: Euphoria Season 1 Trailer | Rotten Tomatoes TV
Trailers.Description: Check out the new Euphoria Season 1 Trailer starring Zendaya! Let us know what you think in the comments below. ▻ Learn ...

Episodes.Name: Death Has a Shadow
Episodes.Description: After drinking too much at a stag party and falling asleep at work, Peter loses his job, signs up for welfare, and gets more money than expected.

Episodes.Name: I Never Met the Dead Man
Episodes.Description: Peter goes into shock after he disables the entire Quahog cable system while giving Meg driving lessons; Stewie plots to rid the world of broccoli.

Episodes.Name: Chitty Chitty Death Bang
Episodes.Description: Peter tries to make the best of a bad situation after he ruins Lois's plans for Stewie's birthday party; Meg's new friend tries to recruit her into a cult.

Episodes.Name: Mind Over Murder
Episodes.Description: Under house arrest, Peter transforms the basement into a bar, where Lois' singing becomes the main attraction.

Episodes.Name: A Hero Sits Next Door
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes very jealous, when his handi-capable new neighbor turns out to be the new star player on the toy company's softball team.

Episodes.Name: The Son Also Draws
Episodes.Description: A chance encounter with a prune smoothie puts in motion a series of events that ultimately allows Peter to accept Chris' artistic side.

Episodes.Name: Brian: Portrait of a Dog
Episodes.Description: Brian's life is on the line after he refuses to be treated like a dog.

Episodes.Name: Peter, Peter, Caviar Eater
Episodes.Description: Peter changes for the worse after he and Lois inherit a mansion in Newport.

Episodes.Name: Holy Crap
Episodes.Description: Peter seeks divine inspiration when his retired father comes to visit and makes life troublesome; Chris suffers a gastrointestinal impasse.

Episodes.Name: Da Boom
Episodes.Description: Peter's paranoia about the end of the world makes the family cancel their New Year's Eve '99 plans, but for once, Peter is actually somewhat right.

Episodes.Name: Brian in Love
Episodes.Description: Brian turns to a therapist after his unrequited love for Lois causes him to lose control of his bladder.

Episodes.Name: Love Thy Trophy
Episodes.Description: Everyone on Spooner Street becomes enemies when a trophy they all won mysteriously goes missing; Meg makes extra tips as a waitress by telling everyone she's Stewie's teenage mother.

Episodes.Name: Death Is a Bitch
Episodes.Description: Death pays a visit to the Griffins after Peter fakes his death on an insurance form to avoid paying a hefty hospital bill.

Episodes.Name: The King Is Dead
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes the director of the Quahog Player's Theatre, until Peter becomes producer and changes everything.

Episodes.Name: I Am Peter, Hear Me Roar
Episodes.Description: Peter receives feminine training at a woman's retreat after his joke about women offends a female co-worker.

Episodes.Name: If I'm Dyin' I'm Lyin'
Episodes.Description: Peter pretends Chris is dying so that Make-A-Dream-Come-True foundation can save a cancelled TV Show.

Episodes.Name: Running Mates
Episodes.Description: Peter resorts to mudslinging, when he and Lois run as opponents in an election for the school board; Chris has a sexual awakening.

Episodes.Name: A Picture Is Worth 1,000 Bucks
Episodes.Description: Chris becomes the toast of the New York art scene, after Peter uses one his painting as the car's window.

Episodes.Name: Fifteen Minutes of Shame
Episodes.Description: A vivacious actress will replace Meg, when a reality show based on the Griffins' home life becomes a ratings sensation in the MTV network.

Episodes.Name: Road to Rhode Island
Episodes.Description: Brian and Stewie embark on a cross-country journey home; Peter becomes addicted to marriage counselling videos hosted by an adult film star.

Episodes.Name: Let's Go to the Hop
Episodes.Description: Peter infiltrates the high school after it's gripped by a toad-licking craze.

Episodes.Name: Dammit Janet
Episodes.Description: Stevie falls madly in love with another toddler at his new daycare; Peter takes advantage of Lois' new career as a stewardess.

Episodes.Name: There's Something About Paulie
Episodes.Description: The mob puts a hit out on Lois, after her meddling puts an end to Peter's unwanted friendship with a crime lord's obnoxious nephew.

Episodes.Name: He's Too Sexy for His Fat
Episodes.Description: Peter's drastic plastic surgery and liposuction procedures will transform him from a fatherly slob into a beautiful snob, and the family is not sure what to do.

Episodes.Name: E. Peterbus Unum
Episodes.Description: A zoning malfunction committed by the city planners gives Peter the opportunity to convert the Griffin household in the sovereign nation of Petirua.

Episodes.Name: The Story on Page One
Episodes.Description: Peter substitutes Meg's dreary newspaper article on Mayor Adam West with a steamy exposé that tries to out Hollywood actor Luke Perry.

Episodes.Name: Wasted Talent
Episodes.Description: Lois learns that Peter is a drunken savant when it comes to playing the piano, after he goes on a drinking binge to win one of Pawtucket Pat's silver scrolls.

Episodes.Name: Fore, Father
Episodes.Description: Peter tries to teach Chris a lesson in responsibility by getting him a job at the local golf course; Brian convinces Stewie he was poisoned by a booster shot.

Episodes.Name: The Thin White Line
Episodes.Description: Brian becomes a drug-sniffing dog for police to get out of a rut after taking the advice of his therapist, but the cocaine may be more than he can handle.

Episodes.Name: Brian Does Hollywood
Episodes.Description: When Brian leaves the family for Hollywood with dreams of becoming a screenwriter and director, he winds up directing a porn video.

Episodes.Name: Mr. Griffin Goes to Washington
Episodes.Description: After the toy company is taken over by a tobacco company, Peter is set up as the president and is sent to Washington to lobby against a bill.

Episodes.Name: One If by Clam, Two If by Sea
Episodes.Description: When a hurricane destroys The Drunken Clam, it is bought by a British man who turns it into an English pub to the dismay of Peter and the gang.

Episodes.Name: And the Wiener Is...
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes jealous of Chris' very large endowment.

Episodes.Name: Death Lives
Episodes.Description: Peter dies again, and Death shows him the errors of his ways.

Episodes.Name: Lethal Weapons
Episodes.Description: Lois takes Tae-Jitsu, quickly becomes a black-belt and scares away all of the frustrating New Yorkers that had come to Quahog to view the leaves.

Episodes.Name: The Kiss Seen Round the World
Episodes.Description: Meg takes an internship to work for Tom with Neil as her partner and kisses him during a life-threading situation that is caught on tape.

Episodes.Name: Mr. Saturday Knight
Episodes.Description: Losing his job at the toy factory is he least of his concerns, when Peter is caught monkeying around with a renaissance fair wench.

Episodes.Name: A Fish Out of Water
Episodes.Description: Peter tries to pay of the debts he accrued while pursuing his dream of owning a commercial fishing boat by catching an infamous, man-eating fish.

Episodes.Name: Emission Impossible
Episodes.Description: After Peter helps deliver Lois's sister's baby, he and Lois decide to try to have another kid, but Stewie will attempt to foil their new plan.

Episodes.Name: To Love and Die in Dixie
Episodes.Description: After Chris witnesses a convenience store robbery, the Griffins are put in the witness protection program and relocated to the Deep South.

Episodes.Name: Screwed the Pooch
Episodes.Description: Brian confesses to Peter and Lois that he has had sexual yearnings lately, so Lois suggests that Brian join them for a change of scenery.

Episodes.Name: Peter Griffin: Husband, Father... Brother?
Episodes.Description: While learning about his family history, Chris discovers that one of Peter's ancestors was a black slave once owned by the Pewterschmidts.

Episodes.Name: Ready, Willing and Disabled
Episodes.Description: Joe becomes a media darling after Peter spikes his sports drink with steroids during a track and field event for the disabled; the kids bicker over $26 they found.

Episodes.Name: A Very Special Family Guy Freakin' Christmas
Episodes.Description: Holiday mishaps include Lois going ballistic after losing her Christmas cheer and Peter not being able to watch the KISS Christmas special.

Episodes.Name: Brian Wallows and Peter's Swallows
Episodes.Description: Brian is sentenced to community service following a drunk driving episode; Peter cares for three endangered nestlings living in his freshly-grown beard.

Episodes.Name: From Method to Madness
Episodes.Description: When Brian shows interest in theatre, Lois convinces him to try out for School of Performing Arts, but during the audition, Brian is dismissed by the judges.

Episodes.Name: Stuck Together, Torn Apart
Episodes.Description: Peter's jealously reaches its peak when going with Lois to the gynecologist, who prepares to examine Lois, but Peter refuses to let him near her.

Episodes.Name: Road to Europe
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian go on a Pan-European journey back home after becoming stranded in Saudi Arabia; Peter is aghast to learn Lois is not really a fan of KISS.

Episodes.Name: Family Guy Viewer Mail #1
Episodes.Description: Peter gets three wishes by a genie; The Griffins get superpowers; Quahog turns into the Little Rascals.

Episodes.Name: When You Wish Upon a Weinstein
Episodes.Description: Driven by his tilted views on Judaism, Peter goes from finding a Jewish accountant to throwing Chris a Bar Mitzvah to make him smart. Meanwhile, a group of angry Catholics are trying to hunt down Peter.

Episodes.Name: North by North Quahog
Episodes.Description: Peter and Lois try for a second honeymoon, but things go awry when he poses as Mel Gibson.

Episodes.Name: Fast Times at Buddy Cianci Jr. High
Episodes.Description: Chris gets seduced by his new homicidal English teacher; Brian becomes a substitute teacher to a class of thugs.

Episodes.Name: Blind Ambition
Episodes.Description: Peter's desire to become famous for something causes him to go blind.

Episodes.Name: Don't Make Me Over
Episodes.Description: After a makeover, Meg becomes an insufferable starlet.

Episodes.Name: The Cleveland-Loretta Quagmire
Episodes.Description: Cleveland's wife Loretta has an affair with Quagmire.

Episodes.Name: Petarded
Episodes.Description: After winning at the children's edition of trivial pursuit, Peter thinks he's a genius until testing proves that he's actually intellectually disabled.

Episodes.Name: Brian the Bachelor
Episodes.Description: Brian takes part in "The Bachelorette"; Chris takes advice from his talking pimple.

Episodes.Name: 8 Simple Rules for Buying My Teenage Daughter
Episodes.Description: Peter resorts to selling Meg to Mort Goldman to pay off his pharmacy tab; Stewie falls in love with his babysitter.

Episodes.Name: Breaking Out Is Hard to Do
Episodes.Description: Lois goes to jail after a shoplifting crime spree, but when the family breaks her out, they're forced to live in Asiantown.

Episodes.Name: Model Misbehavior
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes a model, but goes overboard with the glamour life.

Episodes.Name: Peter's Got Woods
Episodes.Description: Brian tries to rename James Woods High School, but Peter pulls out a surprise weapon.

Episodes.Name: The Perfect Castaway
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys get stranded on an island, and after being rescued months later, Peter realizes things aren't what they used to be.

Episodes.Name: Jungle Love
Episodes.Description: To avoid Freshman hazing, Chris runs away to South America, when the family get him, Peter learns that he's the richest man in the tribe.

Episodes.Name: PTV
Episodes.Description: After an incident at the Emmys, the FCC overreacts, so Peter decides to start his own cable network, until the FCC shut him down and start censoring his life.

Episodes.Name: Brian Goes Back to College
Episodes.Description: Brian re-enrolls at Brown while Peter and the guys become the new A-Team.

Episodes.Name: The Courtship of Stewie's Father
Episodes.Description: Peter tries to bond with Stewie in a number of different ways.

Episodes.Name: Fat Guy Strangler
Episodes.Description: Lois discovers a long-lost brother, but her new relative has a deadly secret.

Episodes.Name: The Father, the Son and the Holy Fonz
Episodes.Description: Peter's father Francis visits and learns Stewie has not been baptized. He and Peter take Stewie without Lois' permission and have him baptized. Learning this, Lois impresses upon Peter that Stewie should have a choice so he starts one.

Episodes.Name: Brian Sings and Swings
Episodes.Description: Brian and Stewie go on tour singing classic tunes with Frank Sinatra, Jr.

Episodes.Name: Patriot Games
Episodes.Description: After quarterback Tom Brady witnesses Peter pummeling several people in order to get to the bathroom, he recruits him to play for the New England Patriots.

Episodes.Name: I Take Thee, Quagmire
Episodes.Description: Quagmire falls in love with and marries the maid that Peter won on a game show only to find out that she's a psycho and must figure out a way to get out of it.

Episodes.Name: Sibling Rivalry
Episodes.Description: Peter reluctantly agrees to get a vasectomy, and refuses to have sex, causing Lois to gain weight; Stewie's half-brother Bertram declare an all-out war for control over the playground.

Episodes.Name: Deep Throats
Episodes.Description: While Meg interns for Mayor West, Brian uncovers a scandal; Peter and Lois decide to reunite their old groovy band

Episodes.Name: Peterotica
Episodes.Description: Peter writes an erotic novel, but a lawsuit leaves his investor, Carter, broke, forcing him to move in with the Griffins; Stewie trains for the Olympics.

Episodes.Name: You May Now Kiss the... Uh... Guy Who Receives
Episodes.Description: Brian's gay cousin Jasper comes to town to marry his fiancé, until Mayor West bans gay marriage to distract everyone from a financial scandal.

Episodes.Name: Petergeist
Episodes.Description: Peter's attempt to open build a movie theater on the Indian burial ground in his backyard releases a poltergeist that sucks Stewie into the television set.

Episodes.Name: Untitled Griffin Family History
Episodes.Description: When burglars break into the house, the Griffins take cover in the attic, where Peter tells them about their family history.

Episodes.Name: Stewie B. Goode
Episodes.Description: A near-death experience inspires Stewie to change his life.

Episodes.Name: Bango Was His Name Oh!
Episodes.Description: Stewie searches for a man he saw on TV who he believes is his real father.

Episodes.Name: Stu & Stewie's Excellent Adventure
Episodes.Description: Stewie meets his future self, who lives a pathetic life.

Episodes.Name: Stewie Loves Lois
Episodes.Description: After she saves Rupert, Stewie smothers Lois with affection; After his first prostate exam, Peter sues Dr. Hartman for sexual harassment.

Episodes.Name: Mother Tucker
Episodes.Description: Peter's mom starts dating Tom Tucker; Brian and Stewie host their own raunchy radio program.

Episodes.Name: Hell Comes to Quahog
Episodes.Description: Meg takes a job at a new superstore, which causes Peter to lose his job and the town's electricity.

Episodes.Name: Saving Private Brian
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian join the army and are sent to Iraq; Chris becomes the lead singer of a rock band.

Episodes.Name: Whistle While Your Wife Works
Episodes.Description: Lois does Peter's work while he recovers from losing his fingers in an accident; Brian begins dating an unintelligent woman, much to Stewie's delight.

Episodes.Name: Prick Up Your Ears
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes the school's sex ed teacher, but is fired for having "radical" views; Stewie attempts to kill the Tooth Fairy.

Episodes.Name: Chick Cancer
Episodes.Description: Stewie tries to win over retired child actress Olivia; Peter makes his own chick flick.

Episodes.Name: Barely Legal
Episodes.Description: After taking her to the prom, Meg becomes obsessed with Brian; The guys join the police force to help Joe.

Episodes.Name: Road to Rupert
Episodes.Description: After Brian accidentally sells Rupert at a yard sale, he and Stewie travel to Aspen to get him back; Meg is forced to be Peter's driver after he loses his license.

Episodes.Name: Peter's Two Dads
Episodes.Description: After Francis dies, Peter learns his real father lives in Ireland, so he and Brian set out to find him.

Episodes.Name: The Tan Aquatic with Steve Zissou
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes the neighborhood bully; Stewie has a cancer scare after staying in a tanning bed too long.

Episodes.Name: Airport '07
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes a redneck and gets Quagmire fired. So the gang sets out to get Quagmire his job back.

Episodes.Name: Bill & Peter's Bogus Journey
Episodes.Description: Peter's attempts to become physically fit lead to a friendship with Bill Clinton, which inadvertently nearly destroys Peter & Lois' marriage.

Episodes.Name: No Meals on Wheels
Episodes.Description: After Peter finds a valuable coin and sells it for $50, 000, he opens his own restaurant, but things don't end well when he bans Joe and all of his handicapped friends.

Episodes.Name: Boys Do Cry
Episodes.Description: When Stewie gets sick from communion, the town is convinced he's possessed by the devil, forcing the family to go on the run, and end up in Texas.

Episodes.Name: No Chris Left Behind
Episodes.Description: After being expelled for having the lowest average standardized test score, Chris is accepted into a snobby private school, forcing the family to struggle to pay the tuition.

Episodes.Name: It Takes a Village Idiot, and I Married One
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes the new Mayor of Quahog, but soon becomes corrupt with power.

Episodes.Name: Meet the Quagmires
Episodes.Description: Death grants Peter's wish to go back in time to 1984 to be 18 again, but when he bails on Lois, he soon learns he's alters the present, where Lois is married to Quagmire.

Episodes.Name: Blue Harvest
Episodes.Description: With the Griffins stuck at home during a blackout, Peter tells the story of Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope.

Episodes.Name: Movin' Out (Brian's Song)
Episodes.Description: Brian moves in with Jillian, but Stewie moves in to to help pay the rent. Meg and Chris both get jobs at the local convenience store.

Episodes.Name: Believe It or Not, Joe's Walking on Air
Episodes.Description: Joe gets a leg transplant to allow him to walk again, only for his new legs to make him abandon Bonnie and the guys.

Episodes.Name: Stewie Kills Lois
Episodes.Description: Stewie kills Lois, and one year after her disappearance, Peter is charged with her death.

Episodes.Name: Lois Kills Stewie
Episodes.Description: With Lois back in Quahog, Stewie escapes with Brian to Washington, D.C. and sets out to initiate his latest plan for world domination.

Episodes.Name: Padre de Familia
Episodes.Description: Peter discovers that he is an illegal Mexican immigrant, so he is forced to take a job as a day laborer for Lois's father.

Episodes.Name: Peter's Daughter
Episodes.Description: When Meg awakens from a coma, Peter vows to treat her better than before, but doesn't approve of her dating an attractive doctor.

Episodes.Name: McStroke
Episodes.Description: Peter sues a fast food chain after he suffers a stroke from eating over 30 hamburgers in one sitting.

Episodes.Name: Back to the Woods
Episodes.Description: James Woods gets his revenge on Peter by stealing his identity and moving in with his family.

Episodes.Name: Play It Again, Brian
Episodes.Description: Brian decides to declare his love for Lois as she and Peter accompany him to a writers' convention, and the Griffin kids are babysat by Herbert.

Episodes.Name: The Former Life of Brian
Episodes.Description: When Brian decides to look up an old flame on a whim, he discovers, to his horror, that he is the father of her teenage son.

Episodes.Name: Long John Peter
Episodes.Description: Peter begins to act like a pirate when he gets a parrot, creating havoc in Quahog; Chris falls for vet intern Anna.

Episodes.Name: Love Blactually
Episodes.Description: Stewie convinces Brian to take it slow with his new girlfriend, but she becomes impatient and hooks up with Cleveland. Brian then tries to get Cleveland back together with his ex-wife Loretta to get him out of the picture.

Episodes.Name: I Dream of Jesus
Episodes.Description: Peter rediscovers his favorite song, "Surfin' Bird" by the Trashmen, and discovers that Jesus Christ is working at a used record store in Quahog, and sets out to let everyone know that he has come back.

Episodes.Name: Road to Germany
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian use a time machine to go back to Nazi-era Poland and rescue Mort.

Episodes.Name: Baby Not on Board
Episodes.Description: The Griffins decide to take a vacation to the Grand Canyon, only to leave Stewie behind.

Episodes.Name: The Man with Two Brians
Episodes.Description: Peter gets the Griffins a new, younger dog to eventually replace an aging Brian.

Episodes.Name: Tales of a Third Grade Nothing
Episodes.Description: Peter must pass the third grade in order to get a promotion at the brewery; Stewie turns Brian and Frank Sinatra Jr.'s nightclub into a trendy hotspot.

Episodes.Name: Ocean's Three and a Half
Episodes.Description: The guys try to help Joe and Bonnie get money for their hospital bill after their baby is born, a baby who Stewie develops a crush on.

Episodes.Name: Family Gay
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes temporarily gay after participating in a medical study.

Episodes.Name: The Juice Is Loose!
Episodes.Description: Everyone is up in arms after Peter becomes friends with O.J. Simpson.

Episodes.Name: FOX-y Lady
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes a Fox News anchor; Peter and Chris try to sell a cartoon pilot to the Fox network.

Episodes.Name: Not All Dogs Go to Heaven
Episodes.Description: Meg who is ill with the mumps, becomes religious and tries to convert Brian from Atheism; Stewie teleports the cast of Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987) to Quahog.
Brian becomes the leading proponent for legalization of marijuana in Quahog.

Episodes.Name: Stew-Roids
Episodes.Description: Stewie begins taking steroids after being beat up by Susie; Chris starts dating popular girl Connie.

Episodes.Name: We Love You Conrad
Episodes.Description: Brian dates "Hills" star Lauren Conrad while trying to hide the fact that he is in love with someone else.

Episodes.Name: Three Kings
