Episodes.Description: A series of parodies based on the Stephen King movies "Stand by Me," "Misery," and "The Shawshank Redemption."

Episodes.Name: Peter's Progress
Episodes.Description: The story of Griffin Peterson and the founding of Quahog.

Episodes.Name: Road to the Multiverse
Episodes.Description: Brian and Stewie explore a series of alternate universes.

Episodes.Name: Family Goy
Episodes.Description: When Lois finds out her mother was a Holocaust survivor, Peter decides to adopt the Jewish faith.

Episodes.Name: Spies Reminiscent of Us
Episodes.Description: With the help of Chevy Chase and Dan Aykroyd, Stewie and Brian discover that Mayor West is a Cold War sleeper agent; Peter and the guys start an improv group.

Episodes.Name: Brian's Got a Brand New Bag
Episodes.Description: Brian becomes the laughing stock of the family when he begins dating an older woman, but things get worse when she breaks her hip and he has to be her errand-boy.

Episodes.Name: Hannah Banana
Episodes.Description: Brian helps Stewie meet Miley Cyrus, only to discover a secret about her identity; The family discovers that the evil monkey in Chris's closet isn't actually evil.

Episodes.Name: Quagmire's Baby
Episodes.Description: Quagmire is forced to take care of a baby he fathered when she is left on his doorstep, while Stewie creates clones of himself and Brian.

Episodes.Name: Jerome Is the New Black
Episodes.Description: The guys find a new black friend to join their group, until Peter finds out that he slept with Lois. Meanwhile, Brian tries to find out why Quagmire hates him and tries to make amends.

Episodes.Name: Dog Gone
Episodes.Description: After accidentally killing another dog and surprised that no one cares, Brian tries to convince everyone that dogs should have the same value as humans.

Episodes.Name: Business Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter takes over Pewterschmidt Industries when Carter has a heart attack and goes into a coma.

Episodes.Name: Big Man on Hippocampus
Episodes.Description: When Peter develops amnesia after hitting his head, he forgets everything and everyone, forcing the family to help regain his memory.

Episodes.Name: Dial Meg for Murder
Episodes.Description: Meg goes to prison after her boyfriend escapes from jail, and returns as a frightening, hardened sociopath.

Episodes.Name: Extra Large Medium
Episodes.Description: Peter pretends to be a psychic after Lois sees one after Chris and Stewie get lost in the woods; Chris asks a girl with Down Syndrome out on a date.

Episodes.Name: Go, Stewie, Go!
Episodes.Description: Stewie poses as a girl so that he can appear on Jolly Farm, and falls for a female co-star; Peter makes Lois feel bad about her age.

Episodes.Name: Peter-assment
Episodes.Description: Peter is sexually harassed by Angela, but will he follow through with her advances and keep his job?

Episodes.Name: Brian Griffin's House of Payne
Episodes.Description: CBS turns Brian's pilot for a heartwarming drama into a sitcom starring James Woods; Meg and Chris try to hide Stewie's accidental head injury.

Episodes.Name: April in Quahog
Episodes.Description: Peter makes an embarrassing confession about his kids as everyone thinks the world is about to come to an end.

Episodes.Name: Brian & Stewie
Episodes.Description: Brian and Stewie get locked in a bank vault where they are forced to deal with each other on a whole new level.

Episodes.Name: Quagmire's Dad
Episodes.Description: Quagmire's dad undergoes a sex change, and Brian, who was out of town for a seminar, ends up sleeping with him after the sex change.

Episodes.Name: The Splendid Source
Episodes.Description: With Cleveland's help, Peter, Joe, and Quagmire blow off a couples' getaway to Maine to search for the origin of the world's funniest dirty joke.

Episodes.Name: Something, Something, Something, Dark Side
Episodes.Description: Peter makes good on another power outage at home by retelling Star Wars Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back.

Episodes.Name: Partial Terms of Endearment
Episodes.Description: Lois agrees to be a surrogate mother for her friend, but when she unexpectedly dies, Lois and Peter argue over whether to continue with the pregnancy.

Episodes.Name: And Then There Were Fewer
Episodes.Description: The residents of Quahog are invited to James Woods' house, where a murder mystery takes place.

Episodes.Name: Excellence in Broadcasting
Episodes.Description: Brian does a 180 on Rush Limbaugh and befriends him after he reads one of his books.

Episodes.Name: Welcome Back Carter
Episodes.Description: After Peter catches Carter having an affair, he is strong-armed into keeping a secret, until he accidentally spills the beans.

Episodes.Name: Halloween on Spooner Street
Episodes.Description: Peter and Joe team up to execute Halloween pranks on Quagmire; Brian shows Stewie the ropes of trick-or-treating; Meg sets out to attend her first high school Halloween party.

Episodes.Name: Baby, You Knock Me Out
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes a champion foxy boxer, and Peter acts as her manager.

Episodes.Name: Brian Writes a Bestseller
Episodes.Description: Brian's self-help book becomes a best-seller after Stewie becomes his manager; Lois decides that she and Peter need separate beds, leaving him to look for a new cuddle buddy.

Episodes.Name: Road to the North Pole
Episodes.Description: Disappointed with the Mall Santa, Stewie and Brian decide to go up to the North Pole to teach Santa a lesson, only to face a shocking revelation.

Episodes.Name: New Kidney in Town
Episodes.Description: Peter needs a new kidney after he destroys his making his own Red Bull; Chris gets to introduce President Obama after plagiarizing Meg's poem.

Episodes.Name: And I'm Joyce Kinney
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes friends with the new news anchor, only to have her reveal Lois's most embarrassing secret on air.

Episodes.Name: Friends of Peter G.
Episodes.Description: After a public disturbance, Peter and Brian are forced to attend a 12-step meeting to help kick their drinking problems. Unable to recognize his issue, Peter gets a visit from Death, who gives him a glimpse of what life would be like with and without "Mr. Booze" in his bloodstream.

Episodes.Name: German Guy
Episodes.Description: A jealous Mr. Herbert tries to tell Chris that the elderly German puppeteer that he is hanging out with is actually a notorious Nazi war criminal.

Episodes.Name: The Hand That Rocks the Wheelchair
Episodes.Description: While taking care of Joe, Meg develops a crush on him; Stewie creates an evil clone who escapes the house.

Episodes.Name: Trading Places
Episodes.Description: Chris and Meg think their parents have it easy, and Peter and Lois beg to differ, so in order to teach them a lesson, they all trade places.

Episodes.Name: Tiegs for Two
Episodes.Description: Brian enlists Quagmire's help to score a date with a new friend, but things get nasty when they start to compete for the affections of each other's old flames, Cheryl Tiegs and Jillian.

Episodes.Name: Brothers & Sisters
Episodes.Description: After yet another failed marriage, Lois' sister, Carol, comes to stay, and quickly falls in love with Mayor West.

Episodes.Name: The Big Bang Theory
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian go back in time to stop Bertram from killing Leonardo da Vinci.

Episodes.Name: Foreign Affairs
Episodes.Description: Lois goes on a vacation with Bonnie to Paris, unaware of her intentions; Peter homeschools Chris and Meg.

Episodes.Name: It's a Trap!
Episodes.Description: The Griffins reprise their intergalactic roles in an outrageous retelling of Return of the Jedi.

Episodes.Name: Lottery Fever
Episodes.Description: When the Griffins win millions in the lottery, they can't handle the good fortune and struggle to stay grounded.

Episodes.Name: Seahorse Seashell Party
Episodes.Description: As a hurricane hits Quahog, Brian gets high on mushrooms; Meg finally summons up the courage to confront the family.

Episodes.Name: Screams of Silence: The Story of Brenda Q
Episodes.Description: Quagmire and the guys try to save his sister Brenda from her abusive boyfriend.

Episodes.Name: Stewie Goes for a Drive
Episodes.Description: Stewie runs away after crashing Brian's car; Peter befriends Ryan Reynolds.

Episodes.Name: Back to the Pilot
Episodes.Description: Brian and Stewie travel back in time to January 31, 1999 to change history, only to alter the past with dire consequences.

Episodes.Name: Thanksgiving
Episodes.Description: Joe's son, who was reported missing in Iraq, suddenly and unexpectedly appears during Thanksgiving dinner, but the story of his disappearance doesn't add up.

Episodes.Name: Amish Guy
Episodes.Description: The Griffins stay in an Amish village after their car breaks down, but problems arise when Meg falls for a boy in the village.

Episodes.Name: Cool Hand Peter
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys take a stand against their wives and flee to the Deep South on a road trip, only to earn a one-way ticket to jail.

Episodes.Name: Grumpy Old Man
Episodes.Description: Lois's dad retires to a senior community in Florida, but has trouble getting used to it.

Episodes.Name: Meg and Quagmire
Episodes.Description: When Meg turns 18, Quagmire tries to make his move on her, but Peter tries to stop him.

Episodes.Name: The Blind Side
Episodes.Description: Brian dates a blind woman who hates dogs; Peter can't stop falling down the new stairs.

Episodes.Name: Livin' on a Prayer
Episodes.Description: Lois takes matters into her own hands when Stewie's sick friend is denied medical treatment by his Christian Scientists parents.

Episodes.Name: Tom Tucker: The Man and His Dream
Episodes.Description: Peter helps Tom Tucker revive his acting career; Chris starts dating a girl who looks exactly like Lois.

Episodes.Name: Be Careful What You Fish For
Episodes.Description: Peter befriends a dolphin who moves in, and soon becomes annoying; Stewie asks for Brian's help in busting a negligent day care worker.

Episodes.Name: Burning Down the Bayit
Episodes.Description: Mort, Peter and Quagmire burn down Goldman's pharmacy to collect the insurance money, but things go awry when Joe starts to look into the case.

Episodes.Name: Killer Queen
Episodes.Description: Peter and Chris are sent to fat camp, where a serial killer targets overweight kids; Stewie is traumatized by the frightening Queen album cover that included a robot.

Episodes.Name: Forget-Me-Not
Episodes.Description: After a car accident, Peter, Brian, Joe, and Quagmire wake up in a hospital with no memory and discover that they're the last people left on Earth.

Episodes.Name: You Can't Do That on Television, Peter
Episodes.Description: Peter creates his own children's TV show, portraying Lois as an annoying nag; Meg shadows Dr. Hartman.

Episodes.Name: Mr. & Mrs. Stewie
Episodes.Description: Stewie falls for a girl who's just as wicked as him; Peter and Quagmire take their friendship to the next level.

Episodes.Name: Leggo My Meg-O
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian gets kidnapped in Paris. Meg and Ruth fly to Paris to save both of them.

Episodes.Name: Tea Peter
Episodes.Description: Peter joins the Tea Party, only to discover that Carter Pewterschmidt is using the party to get rid of the government for his own selfish motives.

Episodes.Name: Family Guy Viewer Mail #2
Episodes.Description: A British version of Family Guy (Chap of the manor); Everybody Peter touches turns into Robin Williams (Fatman and Robin); A day through Stewie's point of view (Point of Stew).

Episodes.Name: Internal Affairs
Episodes.Description: Peter talks Joe into having an affair with his new attractive partner, until Bonnie finds out.

Episodes.Name: Into Fat Air
Episodes.Description: The Griffins try to beat Lois's obnoxious ex-boyfriend's family to the top of Mount Everest.

Episodes.Name: Ratings Guy
Episodes.Description: After the Griffins become a Nielsen Family, everyone gets mad at Peter for convincing the networks to make ridiculous changes to popular shows.

Episodes.Name: The Old Man and the Big 'C'
Episodes.Description: Brian and Stewie learn that Carter Pewterschmidt's company has developed a cure for cancer, but is keeping it from the public.

Episodes.Name: Yug Ylimaf
Episodes.Description: Brian causes time to move backwards when he tampers with Stewie's time machine, which may result in Stewie being unborn.

Episodes.Name: Joe's Revenge
Episodes.Description: Joe, with the help of Peter and Quagmire, looks to track down the person responsible for his injuries.

Episodes.Name: Lois Comes Out of Her Shell
Episodes.Description: Lois goes through a mid-life crisis; Stewie discovers that his new pet turtle is evil.

Episodes.Name: Friends Without Benefits
Episodes.Description: Meg finds out that her crush is actually gay and is interested in Chris.

Episodes.Name: Jesus, Mary and Joseph!
Episodes.Description: The Griffins decorate their tree while Peter tells the story of Christmas.

Episodes.Name: Space Cadet
Episodes.Description: The Griffins wind up stuck in orbit on a space shuttle after Peter and Lois send Chris to Florida for space camp.

Episodes.Name: Brian's Play
Episodes.Description: Brian receives widespread acclaim for his new play, until Stewie writes one overnight that puts his to shame.

Episodes.Name: The Giggity Wife
Episodes.Description: After a drunken night out at Harvard with the guys, Quagmire discovers that he married a decrepit old prostitute.

Episodes.Name: Valentine's Day in Quahog
Episodes.Description: Shows how the individual characters spend their Valentine's Day.

Episodes.Name: Chris Cross
Episodes.Description: Chris is fed up with Meg blackmailing him, so he moves in with Mr. Herbert; Stewie and Brian become huge fans of Anne Murray.

Episodes.Name: Call Girl
Episodes.Description: Lois works for a phone sex line and Peter falls in love with her, not knowing that he is actually speaking to his wife.

Episodes.Name: Turban Cowboy
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes a Muslim but later discovers that he is also part of a terrorist plot to blow up a bridge in Quahog.

Episodes.Name: 12 and a Half Angry Men
Episodes.Description: Mayor West is on trial for murder, and Brian is the only one on the jury who thinks he is not guilty.

Episodes.Name: Bigfat
Episodes.Description: Peter reverts back to a feral state after being lost in the Canadian wilderness for two months after a plane crash.

Episodes.Name: Total Recall
Episodes.Description: Stewie tries to rescue Rupert after he is recalled; Lois hangs out with Joe and Quagmire while Peter is sick.

Episodes.Name: Save the Clam
Episodes.Description: The guys fight to save The Drunken Clam from closing after Horace dies; Meg gets a job at a funeral home.

Episodes.Name: Farmer Guy
Episodes.Description: Due to the high crime rate in Quaghog, the family move to a farm, where they discover a meth lab in the basement.

Episodes.Name: Roads to Vegas
Episodes.Description: Stewie's teleportation device malfunctions when he and Brian use it to travel to Las Vegas.

Episodes.Name: No Country Club for Old Men
Episodes.Description: The Griffins are introduced to the Country Club lifestyle when Chris begins dating the owner's daughter, much to the chagrin of Carter.

Episodes.Name: Finders Keepers
Episodes.Description: Peter goes on a real-life treasure hunt based on a treasure map from a child's meal menu.

Episodes.Name: Vestigial Peter
Episodes.Description: Peter has a vestigial twin growing of his neck, and he has surgery to remove it and have it become a separate entity.

Episodes.Name: Quagmire's Quagmire
Episodes.Description: Quagmire begins dating a sexually insatiable woman; Stewie finds himself torn between Rupert and his old teddy bear Oscar.

Episodes.Name: A Fistful of Meg
Episodes.Description: Lois helps Peter get over his fear of Principle Shepherd naked. Meanwhile Meg and her friends witnessed Brian and Stewie getting beat up by Trevor, Mad Dog and Mental Mike. Meg decides to help them stand up before they commit suicide.

Episodes.Name: Boopa-dee Bappa-dee
Episodes.Description: The Griffins take a trip to Italy and are forced to deal with annoying immigration laws after Peter destroys the family's passports.

Episodes.Name: Life of Brian
Episodes.Description: Brian dies and Stewie cannot use his time machine to save him. Meanwhile, Peter replaces Brian with an Italian dog named Vinny.

Episodes.Name: Into Harmony's Way
Episodes.Description: Fame gets to Peter when he forms a song writing team with Quagmire.

Episodes.Name: Christmas Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter fills Carter with the spirit of Christmas. Meanwhile, Stewie goes back in time to save Brian.

Episodes.Name: Peter Problems
Episodes.Description: Lately Peter hasn't been able to perform very well in the bedroom. So he asks Quagmire and Joe to step in and help him get his mojo back.

Episodes.Name: Grimm Job
Episodes.Description: Peter tells Stewie the stories "Jack and the Beanstalk," "Little Red Riding Hood," and "Cinderella."

Episodes.Name: Brian's a Bad Father
Episodes.Description: Brian uses his son to get a writing job for a TV show, and Quagmire stops being friends with Peter after he accidentally shoots him.

Episodes.Name: Mom's the Word
Episodes.Description: Peter is seduced by his late mother's longtime friend, while Stewie is distraught over the realities of death.

Episodes.Name: 3 Acts of God
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys set out to find God and ask him to stop interfering in the outcomes of football games.

Episodes.Name: Fresh Heir
Episodes.Description: When Carter makes Chris the sole future heir to his fortune after caring for him, Peter takes drastic measures to keep the wealth within his reach.

Episodes.Name: Secondhand Spoke
Episodes.Description: Peter is asked to be the face of an anti-smoking campaign after taking up smoking cigarettes, while Stewie helps Chris face school bullies.

Episodes.Name: Herpe, the Love Sore
Episodes.Description: Stewie gets herpes from Brian, while Peter and the guys discover that another group has taken their favorite booth at the Drunken Clam.

Episodes.Name: The Most Interesting Man in the World
Episodes.Description: Lois calls Peter an idiot for bringing home the wrong baby, so he goes to Chicago on a business trip and returns a smart, classy person.

Episodes.Name: Baby Got Black
Episodes.Description: Chris runs away with Jerome's daughter Pam, whom Jerome has forbidden Chris from dating, so Jerome must work with Peter to find their kids.

Episodes.Name: Meg Stinks!
Episodes.Description: Peter takes Meg to a college for an interview, but end up partying; Brian is forced to live outside after being sprayed by a skunk.

Episodes.Name: He's Bla-ack!
Episodes.Description: Cleveland returns to Quahog, but is forbidden from spending time with Peter when their wives get into an argument over parenting.

Episodes.Name: Chap Stewie
Episodes.Description: Stewie tries to erase himself from history when Peter and Chris constantly interrupt his TV time, only to end up as the baby of a British family.

Episodes.Name: The Simpsons Guy
Episodes.Description: After fleeing Quahog due to Peter's misogynistic comic strip, the Griffins get their car stolen and end up getting stuck in Springfield.

Episodes.Name: The Book of Joe
Episodes.Description: Peter is hired to read Joe's new children's book; Brian takes up running to impress a girl.

Episodes.Name: Baking Bad
Episodes.Description: Peter and Lois open a bakery, but things get out of hand when Peter comes up with a way to attract customers.

Episodes.Name: Brian the Closer
Episodes.Description: After getting a cosmetic surgery, Brian becomes a real estate agent, only to get in trouble with Quagmire.

Episodes.Name: Turkey Guys
Episodes.Description: On the night before Thanksgiving, Peter and Brian get drunk and eat the whole turkey, so they have to get a new one on Thanksgiving Day. With Peter gone, Stewie tries to help Chris take over as the man of the house.

Episodes.Name: The 2,000-Year-Old Virgin
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys set out to throw Jesus the best birthday party in order to help him lose his virginity.

Episodes.Name: Stewie, Chris & Brian's Excellent Adventure
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian take Chris back through time to help him with history class, only to end up stuck in the past.

Episodes.Name: Our Idiot Brian
Episodes.Description: Brian begins to think he's not so smart when he takes the SAT'S for Meg and gets a low score, so Peter decides to show him the joys of being an idiot.

Episodes.Name: This Little Piggy
Episodes.Description: Meg becomes a foot-fetish model; Brian accompanies Stewie on an adventure outside of preschool.

Episodes.Name: Quagmire's Mom
Episodes.Description: Quagmire faces charges of statutory rape, and during his trial, his mom makes a surprise appearance to explain why he is the way that he is.

Episodes.Name: Encyclopedia Griffin
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys start a detective agency and discover that Chris is a thief. In the meantime, Lois is worried about Chris when gets involved in a delusional relationship.

Episodes.Name: Stewie Is Enceinte
Episodes.Description: Stewie impregnates himself with Brian's DNA to save their friendship, while Peter and the guys try to make a viral video.

Episodes.Name: Dr. C and the Women
Episodes.Description: Cleveland becomes an unlicensed therapist and gives Lois marriage advice that Peter does not like, and Quagmire gets Meg a job working in airport security.

Episodes.Name: #JOLO
Episodes.Description: Joe decides to embrace life by taking the guys on a road trip to Niagra Falls, where he makes an unexpected decision.

Episodes.Name: Once Bitten
Episodes.Description: Brian becomes more submissive as a result of attending obedience school and Chris discovers his new friend is using him to get close to Meg.

Episodes.Name: Roasted Guy
Episodes.Description: When Peter's insulted by old friends at a roasting of him, he joins a group of mean girls.

Episodes.Name: Fighting Irish
Episodes.Description: Peter prepares for a fight with Liam Neeson, while Lois becomes a class mom and pays more attention to the other children over Stewie.

Episodes.Name: Take My Wife
Episodes.Description: Lois books a couple's vacation, but it turns out to be a marriage counseling program. Carter is frustrated because the kids are so into their electronics.

Episodes.Name: Pilling Them Softly
Episodes.Description: Stewie gets addicted to ADHD medication; Peter and Quagmire make their own cooking shows which rival each other.

Episodes.Name: Papa Has a Rollin' Son
Episodes.Description: When Joe learns his father hates handicapped people, Peter pretends to be Joe; Stewie becomes friends with Tom Cruise after learning he will grow up to be only 5'1.

Episodes.Name: Guy, Robot
Episodes.Description: Stewie builds a robot friend; Lois makes Peter buy a new mattress.

Episodes.Name: Peternormal Activity
Episodes.Description: Things go horribly wrong when the guys try to come up with a horror movie; Stewie becomes irritated by Brian's new glasses.

Episodes.Name: Peter, Chris & Brian
Episodes.Description: After watching a VHS tape of his younger self, Peter, with Brian's help, launch a plan to make sure Chris doesn't take the same path.

Episodes.Name: Peter's Sister
Episodes.Description: Peter's sister Karen comes over for Thanksgiving, while Stewie goes a little too far as he and Brian go on a cleanse to avoid overeating.

Episodes.Name: Hot Pocket-Dial
Episodes.Description: Quagmire finally confesses his love for Lois, but it happens while he accidentally pocket dials Peter, who is furious, so Brian tries to fix the situation.

Episodes.Name: Brokeback Swanson
Episodes.Description: Joe becomes a quadriplegic while Brian has an affair with a married woman.

Episodes.Name: A Shot in the Dark
Episodes.Description: While participating in a newly formed neighborhood watch group, Peter is arrested and charged with a hate crime.

Episodes.Name: Candy, Quahog Marshmallow
Episodes.Description: When the guys travel to Korea to retrieve the final episode of a soap opera Quagmire starred in, Quagmire is reunited with a former lover.

Episodes.Name: The Peanut Butter Kid
Episodes.Description: Stewie's new role brings Peter and Lois into show business.

Episodes.Name: Scammed Yankees
Episodes.Description: Peter and Carter go to Africa to return Carter's money he lost to a Nigerian scammer. Meanwhile, Brian tries to hook up with one of Meg's friends after he finds out that she has a surprisingly great body.

Episodes.Name: An App a Day
Episodes.Description: Peter learns about phone apps and overloads his phone with them. He buys a new phone with more memory and gives his old phone to Chris, which causes a series of horrible events. Meanwhile, Stewie joins a tennis club and invites Brian to be his tennis partner.

Episodes.Name: Underage Peter
Episodes.Description: Peter uses Brian as a way to get alcohol, after Mayor West bans alcohol from all people under 50.

Episodes.Name: A Lot Going on Upstairs
Episodes.Description: Stewie builds a device to enable Brian to help him conquer his terrifying nightmares; Peter turns the attic into a man cave.

Episodes.Name: The Heartbreak Dog
Episodes.Description: Brian and Bonnie run away together after declaring their love for each other; Meg and Chris team up to steal from the residents in a retirement home.

Episodes.Name: Take a Letter
Episodes.Description: An old flame returns to Peter's life after Lois finds a dead letter at the post office. Stewie goes to a new preschool and tries to fit in with a rich new friend.

Episodes.Name: The New Adventures of Old Tom
Episodes.Description: Peter helps Tom Tucker when he's replaced with a young reporter; Brian pretends to be rich to impress a woman.

Episodes.Name: Run, Chris, Run
Episodes.Description: Meg discovers the cool kids only elected Chris homecoming king just to prank him; Cleveland starts hanging out with Jerome instead of the guys.

Episodes.Name: Road to India
Episodes.Description: Brian falls in love with a tech support girl, so he and Stewie go to India to find her; Peter becomes the center of attention when he's invited to Joe's bingo night.

Episodes.Name: The Boys in the Band
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian form a children's band that threatens to fall apart when Olivia gets involved; Chris gets a job managing Quagmire's sex life.

Episodes.Name: Bookie of the Year
Episodes.Description: Peter starts betting on Chris when he becomes a pitcher; Brian and Stewie re-team with Frank Sinatra, Jr. to start an Italian restaurant.

Episodes.Name: American Gigg-olo
Episodes.Description: After the pilots go on strike, Quagmire becomes a gigolo. Meanwhile, Brian works at a hardware store for the health insurance.

Episodes.Name: Inside Family Guy
Episodes.Description: James Woods leads viewers behind the scenes of the studios of Family Guy.

Episodes.Name: Chris Has Got a Date, Date, Date, Date, Date
Episodes.Description: Taylor Swift agrees to be Chris' Homecoming date; Peter becomes an Uber driver.

Episodes.Name: Hot Shots
Episodes.Description: Lois decides not to vaccinate Stewie to "save" him from autism, causing Stewie to run away, and cause the town to have an outbreak.

Episodes.Name: High School English
Episodes.Description: The classic novels "The Great Gatsby", "The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn", and "Of Mice and Men" are re-enacted.

Episodes.Name: Carter and Tricia
Episodes.Description: Carter falls in love with Channel 5 News reporter, Tricia Takanawa; Stewie becomes Brian's driving instructor.

Episodes.Name: How the Griffin Stole Christmas
Episodes.Description: Peter fills in for the mall Santa and becomes drunk with power; Stewie and Brian crash holiday office parties for free food, drama, and women.

Episodes.Name: Passenger Fatty-Seven
Episodes.Description: Quagmire's piloting skills are questioned when he scores free tickets to a guys' trip to San Francisco, and the plane is hijacked on the flight home.

Episodes.Name: Gronkowsbees
Episodes.Description: Rob Gronkowski moves in behind the Griffins; Stewie begins beekeeping, and gives them steroids, which makes them aggressive.

Episodes.Name: Peter's Def Jam
Episodes.Description: When the guys start a podcast, Peter goes solo and becomes a DJ; Lois' allergy forces Brian to move into Stewie's room.

Episodes.Name: The Finer Strings
Episodes.Description: Peter fails to make the cut when the guys form a string quartet; Brian enjoys the life of luxury too much as Carter's seeing eye dog.

Episodes.Name: The Dating Game
Episodes.Description: Quagmire discovers Tinder, forcing the guys to intervene; Stewie learns the perks of scoliosis.

Episodes.Name: Cop and a Half-Wit
Episodes.Description: Peter helps Joe solve crime cases; Stewie joins a football team, and panics when he gets a concussion.

Episodes.Name: Saturated Fat Guy
Episodes.Description: When Lois forces him to eat healthy food, Peter opens up his own food truck with fattening foods; Meg joins a roller derby team.

Episodes.Name: Peter's Lost Youth
Episodes.Description: Peter gets jealous when Lois upstages him at a Red Sox Fantasy Baseball camp; Stewie runs away when Meg babysits him.

Episodes.Name: The Peter Principal
Episodes.Description: Meg takes advantage of Peter's temporary job as principal to get even with her bullies; Brian and Stewie open a B&B that quickly turns into a brothel.

Episodes.Name: Dearly Deported
Episodes.Description: Chris volunteers to take care of his Mexican girlfriend's twin babies, but after learning that she can't come back to the U.S, the Griffins go to Mexico.

Episodes.Name: A House Full of Peters
Episodes.Description: Peter's past participation as a sperm donor catches up to him when his children start showing up at his house.

Episodes.Name: Emmy-Winning Episode
Episodes.Description: Peter decides to make "Family Guy" more like Emmy-winning shows so it can finally win TV's highest award.

Episodes.Name: Foxx in the Men House
Episodes.Description: Peter dumps Quagmire, Joe, and Cleveland when he becomes friends with a cool paramedic.

Episodes.Name: Nanny Goats
Episodes.Description: The Griffins get a nanny for the kids, giving Peter and Lois the opportunity to reconnect.

Episodes.Name: Follow the Money
Episodes.Description: Chris receives a special one-dollar bill for his birthday that gets passed throughout Quahog.

Episodes.Name: Three Directors
Episodes.Description: The story of Peter's firing from the brewery, as told in the styles of Quentin Tarantino, Wes Anderson, and Michael Bay.

Episodes.Name: The D in Apartment 23
Episodes.Description: Brian gets kicked out of the house for posting an offensive tweet that goes viral. And moves into an apartment temporarily.

Episodes.Name: Petey IV
Episodes.Description: Vladimir Putin comes to Quahog after Peter writes to him. Meanwhile, strapped-for-cash Brian gets a job at a suicide hotline and pursues a coworker.

Episodes.Name: Crimes and Meg's Demeanor
Episodes.Description: Meg's drinking both concerns and delights Peter; Brian suspects Principal Shepherd of a crime.

Episodes.Name: Don't Be a Dickens at Christmas
Episodes.Description: Paying tribute to A Christmas Carol, Peter is visited by the ghost of Patrick Swayze, who takes him on a journey around Quahog.

Episodes.Name: Boy (Dog) Meets Girl (Dog)
Episodes.Description: Brian enters a dog show to breed with a female dog; Peter and Lois try to convince Chris that "Arthur Valentine" doesn't exist.

Episodes.Name: Dog Bites Bear
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian have a falling out; Peter refuses to wash his hand after meeting his favorite cereal mascot.

Episodes.Name: Send in Stewie, Please
Episodes.Description: Stewie reveals secrets about himself in a session with his school psychologist.

Episodes.Name: V is for Mystery
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian become detectives and embark on solving a string of murders set in Victorian era London.

Episodes.Name: Veteran Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys get caught pretending to be military veterans and are sentenced to join the Coast Guard.

Episodes.Name: The Woof of Wall Street
Episodes.Description: Brian convinces Stewie to teach him how to invest in the stock market; Peter and the guys look after the Drunken Clam while Jerome is away.

Episodes.Name: 'Family Guy' Through the Years
Episodes.Description: The show looks back at the cultural events and issues that were tackled in the '50s, '60s and '70s.

Episodes.Name: Switch the Flip
Episodes.Description: Chaos ensues in Quahog when Stewie's body-swapping machine malfunctions.

Episodes.Name: HTTPete
Episodes.Description: Peter adopts the millennial lifestyle, attracting the attention of a high-powered Silicon Valley executive.

Episodes.Name: The Unkindest Cut
Episodes.Description: Quagmire has a freak accident; Stewie and Brian search for Mort after learning there is a $10,000 reward for turning him into the police.

Episodes.Name: Are You There God? It's Me, Peter
Episodes.Description: After falling into a coma, Peter comes face-to-face with God, leading him to ask some of life's tough questions.

Episodes.Name: Married with Cancer
Episodes.Description: Brian quickly falls in love with a woman, and after receiving devastating news regarding her cancer diagnosis, he proposes marriage.

Episodes.Name: Dead Dog Walking
Episodes.Description: Brian's marriage to Jess doesn't go as planned, so at Peter's suggestion, he lets himself go, leading Jess to make a surprising decision.

Episodes.Name: Pal Stewie
Episodes.Description: Stewie befriends a boy his age; Peter and Lois attend a seminar on self-empowerment.

Episodes.Name: Big Trouble in Little Quahog
Episodes.Description: Stewie invents a shrinking machine that shrinks him and Brian down to microscopic size.

Episodes.Name: Regarding Carter
Episodes.Description: Carter gives Lois a surprising birthday present that leads to an unfortunate accident, leaving him dependent on the Griffins' care.

Episodes.Name: Stand by Meg
Episodes.Description: Stewie vows to make Meg's life better after she saves him from choking; Chris is sent to a vocational school.

Episodes.Name: The Griffin Winter Games
Episodes.Description: Meg takes the family by surprise when she makes the US Winter Olympics team.

Episodes.Name: Con Heiress
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian compete for the inheritance of a wealthy old heiress with a long name. Peter and Chris battle for Mr. Herbert's affection.

Episodes.Name: Pawtucket Pete
Episodes.Description: When the Pawtucket Brewery's new bosses take over and want to change the company's mascot after the original boss Angela dies, Peter and Brian go head-to-head to become the new face.

Episodes.Name: Hefty Shades of Gray
Episodes.Description: Tom Tucker teaches Peter how to report fake news; Brian and Stewie help Chris improve his love life.

Episodes.Name: Trump Guy
Episodes.Description: The Griffins move to the White House where Peter is hired as the new Press Secretary.

Episodes.Name: Bri, Robot
Episodes.Description: Brian worries about his legacy, so Stewie makes him a robot duplicate as a living biography; Peter starts working at a massage parlor.

Episodes.Name: Trans-Fat
Episodes.Description: Peter learns an important lesson when he's mistakenly identified as transgender.

Episodes.Name: Family Guy Lite
Episodes.Description: Peter goes on a health kick; when Lois starts writing a romantic fantasy novel, Brian and Stewie investigate into her possible crush.

Episodes.Name: No Giggity, No Doubt
Episodes.Description: Quagmire discovers a long-lost daughter and makes a serious effort to embrace parenting.

Episodes.Name: You Can't Handle the Booth
Episodes.Description: The Griffins provide DVD commentary on a recent episode and reveal never-before-told drama between Peter and Lois.

Episodes.Name: Island Adventure
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Brian travel to Garbage Island to retrieve his tricycle after Peter throws it out; Lois tries to help Quagmire court a middle-aged woman.

Episodes.Name: Throw It Away
Episodes.Description: Lois challenges the other Griffins to throw out anything that no longer gives them joy, only to take the decluttering to a surprising extreme.

Episodes.Name: Girl, Internetted
Episodes.Description: Meg becomes famous on the internet for her unhealthy eating; Brian and Stewie enjoy a new ride while Brian's car gets fixed.

Episodes.Name: Adam West High
Episodes.Description: Brian runs for Mayor after successfully renaming James Woods High after the late Adam West, only for Quagmire to campaign against him.

Episodes.Name: Yacht Rocky
Episodes.Description: When the brewery announces it will be firing one employee, the family take Peter on a cruise to calm his nerves, but the trip doesn't go as planned.

Episodes.Name: Bri-Da
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys use Joe's body cams to remember the million-dollar ideas they have while drinking; Quagmire must come to terms with an unexpected family development.

Episodes.Name: Absolutely Babulous
Episodes.Description: Stewie wins a participation award in his school's toddler games, leading him to question everything he's ever won; Peter causes a fight between Lois' parents and has to repair the damage.

Episodes.Name: Disney's The Reboot
Episodes.Description: The network decides to reboot FAMILY GUY and the feedback takes surprising turns when three versions are shown to a focus group.

Episodes.Name: Cat Fight
Episodes.Description: Brian tries to shut down Quagmire's cat café; Lois decides to send Meg and Chris to church camp when they get in trouble at school.

Episodes.Name: Peter & Lois' Wedding
Episodes.Description: When the Wi-Fi goes out, Peter and Lois tell the kids the story of how they met and fell in love in this spoof of the '90s sitcom Friends and everything else '90s.

Episodes.Name: Heart Burn
Episodes.Description: To celebrate Peter and Lois' wedding anniversary, the Griffins present their own versions of three well-known love stories.

Episodes.Name: Shanksgiving
Episodes.Description: Peter gets himself arrested to avoid Lois' special Thanksgiving dinner; A secret that Stewie's been keeping from everyone is revealed.

Episodes.Name: Christmas Is Coming
Episodes.Description: Meg gets a surprising response when she takes Stewie to meet Santa at the mall; Brian tries to help when the experience leaves Stewie scarred.

Episodes.Name: Connie's Celica
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes the target of Connie's antics when she gets a job as the high school's music teacher.

Episodes.Name: Short Cuts
Episodes.Description: When Brian accidentally becomes a local hero, an old street pal who is now a successful millionaire dog reaches out and tries to convince him to get neutered; Lois gets a pixie cut against Peter's wishes.

Episodes.Name: Undergrounded
Episodes.Description: Peter builds a tunnel to the Drunken Clam after Lois grounds him for secretly getting a credit card and spending all of the family's money.

Episodes.Name: Rich Old Stewie
Episodes.Description: In the future, Stewie is a rich old man enjoying his retirement when Brian brings news about Peter dying.

Episodes.Name: The Movement
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes the face of racial justice when diarrhea makes him kneel during the national anthem as he starts coaching a minor league baseball team.

Episodes.Name: Baby Stewie
Episodes.Description: Stewie builds a machine to help him stay smart, but it turns him into an actual baby.

Episodes.Name: Start Me Up
Episodes.Description: Peter is told to work from home when his sweat becomes a liability; Stewie and Chris create a fake Kickstarter campaign with Brian to pay for the damages done to an electronics store.

Episodes.Name: Coma Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter's newfound love for rocking out to Van Halen results in him getting into a car accident and falling into a coma.

Episodes.Name: Better Off Meg
Episodes.Description: The Griffins experience life without Meg when she's erroneously reported to have died in a car crash, and she goes along with the story to start a new life elsewhere.

Episodes.Name: Holly Bibble
Episodes.Description: Following another blackout, the Griffins re-imagine three stories from the Bible about Adam and Eve, Noah, and the Last Supper while cooped up in a motel room during a storm.

Episodes.Name: Movin' In (Principal Shepherd's Song)
Episodes.Description: Principal Shepherd moves in with the Griffins when he gets fired for fat-shaming Chris at school; Brian sues Stewie for portraying him as an idiot in a series of children's books.

Episodes.Name: Stewie's First Word
Episodes.Description: Stewie finally says his first word - and it's a swear, leaving Lois shunned by the other moms, so she tries to figure out where Stewie could've heard it.

Episodes.Name: The Talented Mr. Stewie
Episodes.Description: Stewie "breaks up with" Rupert after learning that he used to belong to Chris and decides to take action.

Episodes.Name: Boys & Squirrels
Episodes.Description: When Peter hurts himself and a family of squirrels in a chainsaw accident, Chris and Stewie nurse one of the squirrels back to health; a chiropractor realigns Peter's spine and restores him to his true height.

Episodes.Name: CutawayLand
Episodes.Description: Peter and Lois get transported into a cutaway that they inadvertently set up at the same time.

Episodes.Name: La Famiglia Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter becomes a real gangster when Joe asks him to be the godfather of his daughter.

Episodes.Name: Meg's Wedding
Episodes.Description: Meg plans her wedding to an unexpected resident of Quahog; Peter loses his arms on one of his many adventures after finding a new vest.

Episodes.Name: Wild Wild West
Episodes.Description: Peter seeks out the cousin of the late Adam West when he disapproves of Lois' first choice to be the next mayor of Quahog.

Episodes.Name: Pawtucket Pat
Episodes.Description: Brian gets a job as a journalist and discovers that Pawtucket Pat, the hero of Quahog and founder of the brewery, was a racist, so the town becomes divided over whether to take down his commemorative statue.

Episodes.Name: The First No L
Episodes.Description: The Griffins must save Christmas without Lois when she walks out on them for failing to help her with the shopping.

Episodes.Name: Fecal Matters
Episodes.Description: Peter volunteers at the hospital after making it through a bad flu season and finds himself at a crossroads when his mortal enemy, The Giant Chicken, is admitted to ER. After learning he's part cat, Brian has an identity crisis.

Episodes.Name: Boy's Best Friend
Episodes.Description: Brian bonds with his new girlfriend's son; Peter, Quagmire, and Cleveland take a joyride in Joe's new classic Corvette.

Episodes.Name: And Then There's Fraud
Episodes.Description: Peter and Chris start a memorabilia business after going to a baseball game; Stewie gets plastic surgery to combat aging, but takes it too far.

Episodes.Name: PeTerminator
Episodes.Description: Stewie builds a Terminator resembling Peter to destroy Lois for trying to make him eat broccoli, but his life is in danger when things don't go as planned.

Episodes.Name: The Marrying Kind
Episodes.Description: Stewie experiences domestic life when he gets a mail-order bride from Ukraine; Peter and Chris become addicted to free hotel breakfast buffets.

Episodes.Name: Customer of the Week
Episodes.Description: After feeling unappreciated by the family, Lois taps into her villainous side and attempts to win "Best Customer" at her favorite coffee shop.

Episodes.Name: Who's Brian Now?
Episodes.Description: A microchip in Brian reveals that he once lived with another family, making it difficult for him to enjoy his life with the Griffins.

Episodes.Name: Young Parent Trap
Episodes.Description: A couple at Stewie's school mistake Peter and Lois for "younger parents" and invite them to live in a millennial apartment complex, leaving Meg and Chris home alone.

Episodes.Name: Meg Goes to College
Episodes.Description: Meg endures a college admissions scandal caused by Peter and Lois; Brian goes on a fitness journey.

Episodes.Name: Family Cat
Episodes.Description: Meg adopts a cat that Brian believes is evil.

Episodes.Name: Tales of Former Sports Glory
Episodes.Description: Cleveland, Quagmire, and Peter share stories of athletic accomplishments from their youth.

Episodes.Name: LASIK Instinct
Episodes.Description: Lois decides to get LASIK surgery, but exploits her failing vision for personal gain; Peter, Chris, Stewie, and Brian must partake in activities with Doug that his father neglects.

Episodes.Name: Rock Hard
Episodes.Description: While at an old record store, Peter and the guys tell stories of three rock legends: Jim Morrison, Muddy Waters, and Elton John.

Episodes.Name: Must Love Dogs
Episodes.Description: Quagmire pretends Brian is his dog when he meets an avid dog lover; Chris helps Stewie retrieve his stolen Halloween candy.

Episodes.Name: 80's Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter's nostalgia for the '80s compels him to recreate iconic movie scenes from that decade; Stewie competes with Doug to retrieve a frisbee from the top of the jungle gym.

Episodes.Name: Brief Encounter
Episodes.Description: Peter and Quagmire mimic each other's behavior when they accidentally switch underwear; Stewie and Doug agree to commit each other's murders.

Episodes.Name: Cootie & The Blowhard
Episodes.Description: Stewie fears he has a terminal case of "cooties"; Peter enjoys Bonnie's cooking.

Episodes.Name: Peterschmidt Manor
Episodes.Description: Peter turns the Pewterschmidt mansion into a hotel while Lois and Carter attend the funeral of Lois' childhood nanny.

Episodes.Name: The Birthday Bootlegger
Episodes.Description: Peter's new boss bans his favorite part about work: office birthdays; Stewie gets detention and turns rough.

Episodes.Name: The Fatman Always Rings Twice
Episodes.Description: Peter does a noir-style investigation of Meg's disappearance.

Episodes.Name: Christmas Crime
Episodes.Description: Brian is accused of ruining Mayor West's nativity scene.

Episodes.Name: Mister Act
Episodes.Description: Peter has an accident that leaves him with a high-pitched voice, so Jesus helps him fend off the other choir boys; Stewie becomes attracted to Lois' masculine physique.

Episodes.Name: The Lois Quagmire
Episodes.Description: Lois takes Quagmire to her high school reunion instead of Peter; the rest of the family tries to cover up a pizza delivery man's death.

Episodes.Name: Lawyer Guy
Episodes.Description: Peter hires the town's new lawyer, Brick Baker, to represent him in litigation against his new neighbor, who turns out to be Brick. Brian and Stewie become lobstermen and save Rupert from the perils of the deep.

Episodes.Name: HBO-No
Episodes.Description: The Griffins present their versions of three HBO shows: "Game of Thrones", "Succession" and "Big Little Lies".

Episodes.Name: Hard Boiled Meg
Episodes.Description: Meg becomes a getaway driver; Quagmire, unable to cure his hiccups, asks Peter to kill him.

Episodes.Name: Prescription Heroine
Episodes.Description: Lois becomes addicted to painkillers prescribed for Brian after he gets hurt. Peter's ping pong table becomes the hot spot in the neighborhood.

Episodes.Name: All About Alana
Episodes.Description: Lois' piano student, Alana, comes to work for the Griffins and turns out to have sinister intentions.

Episodes.Name: Girlfriend, Eh?
Episodes.Description: Peter and Chris go to Canada to prove that Chris' girlfriend exists; Lois and Meg fight each other for the attention of a handsome handyman.

Episodes.Name: First Blood
Episodes.Description: Peter and the guys test their physical prowess at Mayor West's dude ranch; Stewie believes he's gotten his first period.

Episodes.Name: Jersey Bore
Episodes.Description: Peter goes to a business conference in Atlantic City with Preston; Stewie helps Chris prepare for his role in Adam West High's presentation of "Romeo and Juliet".

Episodes.Name: Oscars Guy
Episodes.Description: The Griffins reenact three Oscar-winning films: "The Silence of the Lambs", "American Beauty", and "Forrest Gump."

Episodes.Name: Bend or Blockbuster
Episodes.Description: The Griffins go on a road trip to Bend, Oregon - to the last Blockbuster on Earth - so they can rent a VHS for movie night.

Episodes.Name: A Wife-Changing Experience
Episodes.Description: Joe reinvigorates his sex life with Bonnie after seeing Lois naked; Stewie receives an electric SUV as a gift and embraces the "Range Rover" lifestyle.

Episodes.Name: The Munchurian Candidate
Episodes.Description: Lois hypnotizes Peter into fulfilling her sexual desires, while Stewie renovates his treehouse in the hope of winning over Brian and Chris.

Episodes.Name: Unzipped Code
Episodes.Description: Cleveland loses his job as a mail carrier because of a mishap, but he gets a new, more successful job at the brewery.

Episodes.Name: Happy Holo-ween
Episodes.Description: Peter creates a hologram of himself to get out of household duties on Halloween.

Episodes.Name: The Stewaway
Episodes.Description: Stewie winds up in Paris when he takes refuge in Quagmire's suitcase during a game of hide and seek. Peter and Lois go to Vermont, where Lois intends to get more Instagram "likes" than Bonnie.

Episodes.Name: Get Stewie
Episodes.Description: Stewie finds himself in public disgrace after a pop star unleashes her fan base on him for a benign comment. Peter gets lap band surgery and enjoys the merriment of excess skin.

Episodes.Name: Carny Knowledge
Episodes.Description: Peter and Chris try to reconnect when they finish last in a "Generation Gap" game at a carnival; Brian dates a carny whom he tries to break up with after seeing some of her bad habits.

Episodes.Name: The Candidate
Episodes.Description: Stewie and Doug run opposing campaigns to be the class "snack captain".

Episodes.Name: Love Story Guy
Episodes.Description: The guys tell stories of their first true loves.

Name: Family Guy
Summary: In a wacky Rhode Island town, a dysfunctional family strives to cope with everyday life as they are thrown from one crazy scenario to another.

Episodes.Name: The Crocodile's Dilemma
Episodes.Description: A ruthless, manipulative man meets a small-town insurance salesman and sets him on a path of destruction.

Episodes.Name: The Rooster Prince
Episodes.Description: Molly begins to suspect that Lester is involved in the murders, but her boss points her in a different direction. Meanwhile, Malvo investigates the plot against a man known as the Supermarket King.

Episodes.Name: A Muddy Road
Episodes.Description: Malvo flips the script on the blackmail operation. Molly sets a trap, and Gus debates whether he should come clean. Lester's return to work has complicated repercussions.

Episodes.Name: Eating the Blame
Episodes.Description: When Gus tries to right a wrong, Malvo embraces his alter ego. Lester finds himself in a surprising situation, and Molly uncovers a promising lead.

Episodes.Name: The Six Ungraspables
Episodes.Description: When Lester has a close call, Molly makes an unorthodox decision. Gus weighs some neighborly advice, and Malvo gets what he wants.

Episodes.Name: Buridan's Ass
Episodes.Description: Malvo executes his master plan, while Lester attempts to craft one of his own. Gus and Molly team up in Duluth.

Episodes.Name: Who Shaves the Barber?
Episodes.Description: Molly recuperates from her injury, while Malvo looks to dispatch a syndicate in Fargo. Lester continues his descent into darkness with the unfolding of his plan.

Episodes.Name: The Heap
Episodes.Description: Molly faces pressure to close the case, while Lester starts to feel like a new man.

Episodes.Name: A Fox, a Rabbit, and a Cabbage
Episodes.Description: Lester has an unexpected encounter, Malvo changes course, and a new investigation leads Molly down a familiar path.

Episodes.Name: Morton's Fork
Episodes.Description: Molly takes the lead, while Gus pursues a hunch. Lester manipulates a situation, and Malvo finds a new target.

Episodes.Name: Waiting for Dutch
Episodes.Description: In a small Minnesota town, a shooting at a diner disrupts the lives of a state officer, a married couple, and a North Dakota crime syndicate.

Episodes.Name: Before the Law
Episodes.Description: The Gerhardts receive a surprising offer, while two unlikely murderers do their best to clean up their mess.

Episodes.Name: The Myth of Sisyphus
Episodes.Description: The Gerhardts' search for Rye intensifies, Lou takes a trip to Fargo, and Peggy overhears a new theory about the Waffle Hut shooter.

Episodes.Name: Fear and Trembling
Episodes.Description: The Gerhardts respond to Kansas City's proposal, while Hanzee finds a new lead in Rye's disappearance. Lou questions Ed and Peggy.

Episodes.Name: The Gift of the Magi
Episodes.Description: Floyd takes action and Charlie tries to prove himself; Peggy and Ed disagree about what to do next; Lou finds himself sidelined during Ronald Reagan's campaign tour.

Episodes.Name: Rhinoceros
Episodes.Description: With Ed and Charlie in custody, the Gerhardts arrive at the police station, forcing Lou and Hank to try and prevent any more bloodshed.

Episodes.Name: Did You Do This? No, You Did It!
Episodes.Description: The police bring in Floyd for questioning, in an attempt to make her talk. Bear goes on a ride with Simone. Karl keeps an eye on Lou's family.

Episodes.Name: Loplop
Episodes.Description: Ed and Peggy hold Dodd hostage in a secluded cabin and try to strike up a deal with the Gerhardts, while Hanzee attempts to hunt them down.

Episodes.Name: The Castle
Episodes.Description: In an attempt to stop the Kansas City mob, the police decide to use Ed and Peggy as bait. Hanzee betrays the Gerhardts and takes revenge.

Episodes.Name: Palindrome
Episodes.Description: In the events following the motel massacre, Hanzee goes after Ed and Peggy.

Episodes.Name: The Law of Vacant Places
Episodes.Description: A twisted sibling rivalry leads to murder, mobsters and cutthroat competitive bridge in a small Midwestern town.

Episodes.Name: The Principle of Restricted Choice
Episodes.Description: Gloria deals with the aftermath of the crime, Varga makes a move, and Ray and Nikki move on to their next plan.

Episodes.Name: The Law of Non-Contradiction
Episodes.Description: Gloria revisits her stepfather's past to try and find some answers.

Episodes.Name: The Narrow Escape Problem
Episodes.Description: Emmit and Sy try to sort things out; Nikki and Ray track down some collateral; Gloria learns more about Maurice.

Episodes.Name: The House of Special Purpose
Episodes.Description: Nikki and Ray's retaliation has consequences for Emmit; Gloria and Winnie start connecting the dots.

Episodes.Name: The Lord of No Mercy
Episodes.Description: Gloria and Winnie get closer to the truth; Emmit tries to make things right; Nikki and Ray prepare for payback; Varga cleans up a mess.

Episodes.Name: The Law of Inevitability
Episodes.Description: Gloria tries to work around the system; Nikki finds herself in a familiar place; Varga comes up with an alternative plan; Emmit goes to dinner.

Episodes.Name: Who Rules the Land of Denial?
Episodes.Description: Nikki struggles to survive; Emmit gets spooked; Sy joins Varga for tea.

Episodes.Name: Aporia
Episodes.Description: Emmit sits down with Gloria; Nikki negotiates a deal.

Episodes.Name: Somebody to Love
Episodes.Description: Gloria follows the money; Nikki plays a game; Emmit learns a lesson about progress from Varga.

Episodes.Name: Welcome to the Alternate Economy
Episodes.Description: The head of an African American crime syndicate goes to war with the Italian mafia in Kansas City, Missouri during the 1950s.

Episodes.Name: The Land of Taking and Killing
Episodes.Description: The Smutnys receive unexpected guests, Josto and Gaetano reunite, Loy challenges the status quo, and Oraetta is caught.

Episodes.Name: Raddoppiarlo
Episodes.Description: Deafy and Odis join forces, Josto seeks revenge, Oraetta finds new employment, Gaetano makes a move, and Zelmare and Swanee help the Smutneys with their debt.

Episodes.Name: The Pretend War
Episodes.Description: Loy retaliates, Josto asserts his leadership, Ethelrida makes a disturbing discovery, and the walls begin to close in on Odis.

Episodes.Name: The Birthplace of Civilization
Episodes.Description: The Smutnys receive unexpected guests, Josto and Gaetano reunite, Loy challenges the status quo and Oraetta is caught.

Episodes.Name: Camp Elegance
Episodes.Description: Loy attacks, Gaetano pays the price, Oraetta goes crazy, Josto challenges authority and Rabbi risks his life.

Episodes.Name: Lay Away
Episodes.Description: Josto Fadda makes a bold move, Loy Cannon battles his demons, and Oraetta Mayflower silences her critics.

Episodes.Name: The Nadir
Episodes.Description: Loy plays with fire, Josto wears his heart on his sleeve, Oraetta makes a surprising discovery and Deafy closes in on Zelmare and Swanee.

Episodes.Name: East/West
Episodes.Description: Rabbi and Satchel hit the road.

Episodes.Name: Happy
Episodes.Description: Loy forms an uneasy alliance, Odis finds peace, Josto settles the score, Ethelrida takes a risk and Oraetta gets spooked.

Episodes.Name: Storia Americana
Episodes.Description: Josto gets revenge, Oraetta comes clean and Ebal teaches Loy a lesson about business.

Summary: Various chronicles of deception, intrigue and murder in and around frozen Minnesota. Yet all of these tales mysteriously lead back one way or another to Fargo, North Dakota.

Episodes.Name: The Train Job
Episodes.Description: Mal has second thoughts after discovering that two boxes of Alliance goods his crew has been hired to steal are full of badly needed medical supplies headed for the mining town of Paradiso.

Episodes.Name: Bushwhacked
Episodes.Description: Serenity is pulled in by an Alliance cruiser while investigating a spaceship that was attacked by Reavers. Simon and River must hide to prevent capture, while something is wrong with the lone survivor of the attacked spaceship.

Episodes.Name: Our Mrs. Reynolds
Episodes.Description: A woman claiming to be Mal's wife appears aboard Serenity.

Episodes.Name: Jaynestown
Episodes.Description: The crew has a job in a town where Jayne once robbed the magistrate but dropped the stolen money, making him a local folk hero, and a target for the local boss.

Episodes.Name: Out of Gas
Episodes.Description: When Serenity's life support system fails, Mal orders the crew off the ship - but he stays behind.

Episodes.Name: Shindig
Episodes.Description: In order to secure a job transporting cargo off-planet for a client, Mal attends a social event where a dance with Inara leads to him being challenged to a swordfight in defense of her honor.

Episodes.Name: Safe
Episodes.Description: Mal must choose which crew members to save when one is gravely wounded and two others are kidnapped. Simon finds an uneasy haven in a remote village, but River's uncanny perceptions jeopardize the Tams' temporary safety.

Episodes.Name: Ariel
Episodes.Description: Serenity travels to the core world Ariel and Simon comes up with a plan to steal drugs from the hospital.

Episodes.Name: War Stories
Episodes.Description: Niska catches up with the Serenity crew.

Episodes.Name: Objects in Space
Episodes.Description: Serenity encounters a ruthlessly professional bounty hunter, Jubal Early, who will stop at nothing to retrieve River. But River, feeling unwelcome on the ship, takes a novel approach to escaping from the Alliance.

Episodes.Name: Serenity
Episodes.Description: Malcolm Reynolds is a veteran and the captain of Serenity. He and his crew are smuggling goods, but they need to pick up some passengers for extra money. However, not all the passengers are what they seem.

Episodes.Name: Heart of Gold
Episodes.Description: A Companion-trained friend of Inara's who runs a brothel on a remote planet calls for help from Serenity when a local reveals his intentions to take the baby from a woman he impregnated.

Episodes.Name: Trash
Episodes.Description: Saffron returns to offer the crew a mission but not everyone is willing to trust her again.

Episodes.Name: The Message
Episodes.Description: A dying request from an old army buddy turns treacherous for Mal, Zoë, and the rest of the crew.

Name: Firefly
Summary: Five hundred years in the future, a renegade crew aboard a small spacecraft tries to survive as they travel the unknown parts of the galaxy and evade warring factions as well as authority agents out to get them.

Episodes.Name: Sally
Episodes.Description: Transplanted New Zealanders Bret and Jemaine--a.k.a. Flight of the Conchords--search for romance and gigs in New York City. At a bohemian party, Jemaine falls for Sally (who used to date Bret), but Bret spoils the moment back at their apartment.

Episodes.Name: Bret Gives Up the Dream
Episodes.Description: Desperate for cash, Bret and Jemaine decide to get jobs. Only Bret is successful--he gets a job holding up signs. When Murray books them a show, Bret can't get off work, so Jemaine is forced to play with a replacement: a recording of Bret.

Episodes.Name: Mugged
Episodes.Description: Bret loses Jemaine's trust by abandoning him to a 'gang' of two, and fears the worst when Jemaine doesn't come home.

Episodes.Name: Yoko
Episodes.Description: Murray is perturbed when Bret cancels a band tour to be with his girlfriend Coco. Jemaine's dismay, coupled with the betrayal felt by lone fan Mel (who has a crush on Bret), threatens the band's future.

Episodes.Name: Sally Returns
Episodes.Description: A lonely Jemaine runs into Sally, who dumped him (and Bret) earlier in the year. Envisioning a new life with Sally, Jemaine's dreams take a detour when he learns she won't spend time with him until he gets his own place.

Episodes.Name: Bowie
Episodes.Description: Upset when Murray says he's too small during a photo shoot, Bret decides that Jemaine can help him get over his funk. That night, a 1972-era David Bowie advises Bret to wear an eye patch. The plan backfires when Bret has depth-perception problems.

Episodes.Name: Drive By
Episodes.Description: Dissed by a rude fruit vendor, Bret and Jemaine concoct an animated music video in retaliation. But as slights against the boys continue, Bret and Jemaine find themselves in the middle of a race war with anti-Kiwi mutha 'uckas.

Episodes.Name: Girlfriends
Episodes.Description: Brett and Jemaine encounter girlfriend problems in the USA.

Episodes.Name: What Goes on Tour
Episodes.Description: Using the band's 'emergency fund,' Murray organizes a warm-up tour before a big gig in Central Park. At a bar, the boys get hooked by some 'mermaids' from a women's water-polo team--nearly ruining the tour and their relationship with Murray.

Episodes.Name: New Fans
Episodes.Description: The Conchords triple their fan base after playing a local world music jam, but Mel is suspicious of the two new fans' motives.

Episodes.Name: The Actor
Episodes.Description: Bret and Jemaine enlist a semi-pro actor to cheer up Murray after a disappointing gig. Asked to place a good-hearted rejection call, the actor gets carried away, offering Murray and the Conchords a recording deal that's too good to be true.

Episodes.Name: The Third Conchord
Episodes.Description: Season One Finale. Murray foists a new bongo-playing band member on Bret and Jemaine, triggering angry dances and mutant half-bands.

Episodes.Name: A Good Opportunity
Episodes.Description: Season Two premiere. After rejecting Murray for spending too much time with another band, Bret and Jemaine find success managing themselves and land a deal to record an ad jingle; Dave shares his 'double-down' deal strategy.

Episodes.Name: New Cup
Episodes.Description: Bret and Jemaine's fortunes unravel after Bret buys a new tea cup. With emergency band funds unavailable, Jemaine takes desperate measures in hopes of supplementing their income.

Episodes.Name: The Tough Brets
Episodes.Description: Bret organizes a gang to protect himself from rappers he dissed in a song; Murray and Jemaine get their feelings hurt by Aussie counterparts; Mel paints a portrait Jemaine can't get rid of.

Episodes.Name: Murray Takes It to the Next Level
Episodes.Description: Murray tries to elevate Bret and Jemaine on his friendship graph, bringing his questioning pal Jim in on the plan; Mel demands an apology from Bret for inappropriate dream behavior.

Episodes.Name: Unnatural Love
Episodes.Description: Jemaine starts dating an Australian, to Bret's dismay and inconvenience.

Episodes.Name: Love Is a Weapon of Choice
Episodes.Description: Bret and Jemaine both fall for a woman whose missing dog has epilepsy, triggering a duel, a canine benefit, and a couple of new tunes.

Episodes.Name: Prime Minister
Episodes.Description: Foiled by the White House, Murray arranges a presidential meeting for the visiting Prime Minister of New Zealand; a tribute gig ends with Jemaine getting mixed up with an Art Garfunkel fanatic.

Episodes.Name: New Zealand Town
Episodes.Description: Trying to look cool for a gig at the Grand Opening of New York's one-block New Zealand enclave, the Conchords end up getting hooked on hair gel.

Episodes.Name: Wingmen
Episodes.Description: Bret enlists Jemaine and Dave to help him try to land a girlfriend; Murray regrets making Greg his scapegoat.

Episodes.Name: Evicted
Episodes.Description: Season Two finale. Unable to pay off their back rent, Bret and Jermaine move in with Mel and Doug; Murray looks to cash in on a stage play about the Conchords' travails.

Name: Flight of the Conchords
Summary: Bret and Jemaine are Flight of the Conchords, a folk-rock band from New Zealand living in New York City in search of stardom.

Trailers.Title: Flight Of The Conchords Season 2 Trailer
Trailers.Description: Official Trailer for Flight Of The Conchords Season 2 2009.

Trailers.Title: Flight of the Conchords trailer
Trailers.Description: One of the funniest shows on HBO is coming to New Zealand.

Trailers.Title: Bret and Jemaine Get Into Character Promo (2007)
Trailers.Description: Promo for Season 1 of Flight of the Conchords on HBO. A bit better quality than the one we uploaded previously.

Episodes.Name: Red Moon
Episodes.Description: NASA is in crisis as the Soviets land the first man on the moon in 1969, the beginning of an alternate history.

Episodes.Name: He Built the Saturn V
Episodes.Description: Director von Braun opposes President Nixon's directive, with dire consequences.

Episodes.Name: Nixon's Women
Episodes.Description: Deke must recruit female astronauts after Russia lands a woman on the moon.

Episodes.Name: Prime Crew
Episodes.Description: A training accident spurs a national debate about women astronauts.

Episodes.Name: Into the Abyss
Episodes.Description: Ed and the crew change Apollo 15's landing site after lunar ice is detected.

Episodes.Name: Home Again
Episodes.Description: A launchpad accident leads to delayed missions and FBI background checks.

Episodes.Name: Hi Bob
Episodes.Description: Ed, Gordo, and Danielle struggle with an extended Jamestown mission.

Episodes.Name: Rupture
Episodes.Description: NASA preps a Jamestown relief mission, while Karen waits for news at the hospital.

Episodes.Name: Bent Bird
Episodes.Description: A crisis in space puts the Apollo 24 and 25 crews in peril.

Episodes.Name: A City Upon a Hill
Episodes.Description: Ed handles a trespasser. Ellen and Deke chart a new course without Mission Control.

Episodes.Name: Every Little Thing
Episodes.Description: Nearly a decade later, technology and lunar exploration have taken huge strides - but a solar storm threatens the astronauts on Jamestown.

Episodes.Name: The Bleeding Edge
Episodes.Description: Margo must lead a seemingly impossible mission. Danielle wants to return to the moon. Gordo grapples with life on Earth.

Episodes.Name: Rules of Engagement
Episodes.Description: A dispute on the moon prompts NASA officials to consider arming astronauts. Ed's past comes back to haunt him.

Episodes.Name: Pathfinder
Episodes.Description: With a little help from Molly, Ed plans a career change - as his old Jamestown crewmates Gordo and Danielle struggle.

Episodes.Name: The Weight
Episodes.Description: Ed's reckless behavior at NASA shakes the foundation of the Baldwin family. Tracy attempts to readapt to life in space.

Episodes.Name: Best-Laid Plans
Episodes.Description: American astronauts and NASA leadership prepare for a new mission with unlikely partners. Ellen gets in touch with an old friend.

Episodes.Name: Don't Be Cruel
Episodes.Description: Ellen is challenged by her new role. Margo's allegiances are put to the test. Karen explores new opportunities - personally and professionally.

Episodes.Name: And Here's to You
Episodes.Description: Gordo returns to space. Molly faces an upsetting new reality. Aleida confronts her first major hurdle at work.

Episodes.Name: Triage
Episodes.Description: The rivalry between American astronauts and Soviet cosmonauts intensifies as last-minute changes impact the Pathfinder mission plan.

Episodes.Name: The Grey
Episodes.Description: Tensions between the U.S. and the Soviet Union reach an all-time high on the moon, throwing multiple missions into jeopardy.

Episodes.Name: Polaris
Episodes.Description: Nearly 10 years have passed. Danielle and Ed attend a celebration, where things take a terrifying turn.

Episodes.Name: Game Changer
Episodes.Description: A commercial spaceflight company makes an announcement. The choice over who'll command the Mars mission leads to a shift in personnel.

Episodes.Name: All In
Episodes.Description: As NASA scrambles to prepare for the launch to Mars, Margo is confronted with a harsh personal reality.

Episodes.Name: Happy Valley
Episodes.Description: A surprise maneuver during the journey to Mars provokes desperate measures.

Episodes.Name: Seven Minutes of Terror
Episodes.Description: The race to land first on Mars brings together unexpected allies.

Episodes.Name: New Eden
Episodes.Description: The astronauts move quickly to build Martian bases.

Episodes.Name: Bring It Down
Episodes.Description: A joint mission brings about conflict between crew members.

Episodes.Name: The Sands of Ares
Episodes.Description: After a sudden crisis, the Martian crews pull together.

Episodes.Name: Coming Home
Episodes.Description: Plans to leave Mars are complicated by an unforeseen issue.

Episodes.Name: Stranger in a Strange Land
Episodes.Description: The Martian crew debates how to save the life of one of their own.

Name: For All Mankind
Summary: In an alternative version of 1969, the Soviet Union beats the United States to the Moon, and the space race continues on for decades with still grander challenges and goals.

Trailers.Title: For All Mankind — Official First Look Trailer | Apple TV+
Trailers.Description: What if the space race had never ended? Watch For All Mankind now on the Apple TV app: http://apple.co/_ForAllMankind For All ...

Trailers.Title: For All Mankind — Season 3 Official Trailer | Apple TV+
Trailers.Description: Over two decades after the Moon landing, there's a new battle to face— Mars. Stream For All Mankind Season 3 now on Apple ...

Trailers.Title: For All Mankind Season 1 Trailer | Rotten Tomatoes TV
Trailers.Description: Check out the new For All Mankind Season 1 Trailer starring Joel Kinnaman! Let us know what you think in the comments below.

Episodes.Name: The Emperor's Peace
Episodes.Description: Gaal Dornick leaves her life at Synnax behind when the galaxy's greatest mathematician, Hari Seldon, invites her to Trantor.

Episodes.Name: Preparing to Live
Episodes.Description: The Foundation makes the long journey to Terminus as Gaal and Raych grow closer. The Empire faces a difficult decision.

Episodes.Name: The Mathematician's Ghost
Episodes.Description: Brother Dusk reflects on his legacy as he prepares for ascension. The Foundation arrives on Terminus and finds a mysterious object.

Episodes.Name: Barbarians at the Gate
Episodes.Description: Salvor faces off with an enemy of the Empire. Brothers Day and Dusk are at odds, while Brother Dawn wrestles with his truth.

Episodes.Name: Upon Awakening
Episodes.Description: A flashback reveals the origins of Gaal's conflict between faith and science. The standoff on Terminus takes an unfortunate turn.

Episodes.Name: Death and the Maiden
Episodes.Description: Brother Day meets Zephyr Halima-a would-be leader who opposes the Empire. Brother Dusk grows suspicious of Brother Dawn.

Episodes.Name: Mysteries and Martyrs
Episodes.Description: The Anacreons and their hostages board the fabled Invictus warship. The bond between Brother Dawn and Azura intensifies.

Episodes.Name: The Missing Piece
Episodes.Description: Brother Day embarks on a journey no other Cleon has ever attempted. Salvor prepares to make the ultimate sacrifice to return home.

Episodes.Name: The First Crisis
Episodes.Description: On Terminus, Salvor witnesses how powerful the null field has become. Brother Dawn makes a daring choice.

Episodes.Name: The Leap
Episodes.Description: An unexpected ally helps Salvor broker an alliance. A confrontation between the Brothers leads to unthinkable consequences.

Name: Foundation
Summary: A complex saga of humans scattered on planets throughout the galaxy all living under the rule of the Galactic Empire.

Trailers.Title: Foundation — Official Trailer | Apple TV+
Trailers.Description: The fate of an entire galaxy rests on the beliefs of Dr. Hari Seldon (Jared Harris). Will his conviction save humanity or doom it?

Trailers.Title: Foundation — Official Teaser 2 | Apple TV+
Trailers.Description: The Galactic Empire has brought peace to thousands of worlds, but the beliefs of one man now threaten their very existence.

Trailers.Title: Foundation — Official Season 2 Sneak Peek | Apple TV+
Trailers.Description: The Second Crisis begins Summer 2023. https://apple.co/_Foundation Based on the award-winning novels by Isaac Asimov, ...

Episodes.Name: Pilot
Episodes.Description: After a plane from Hamburg returns with no survivors, FBI agent Olivia Dunham goes after the only person that might shed some light on the incident - a scientist that has been in a mental hospital for the last 17 years.

Episodes.Name: The Same Old Story
Episodes.Description: A woman gives birth to a baby which ages 80 years in just a few minutes and Olivia soon finds connection between the incident and a serial killer she had been chasing.

Episodes.Name: The Ghost Network
Episodes.Description: Following a strange apparent terrorist attack on a bus, Olivia, Peter and Walter find a man who foresees future disasters before they happen.

Episodes.Name: The Arrival
Episodes.Description: A strange cylinder which is somehow connected to Walter and a man known as "the Observer" appears from the ground at a construction site.

Episodes.Name: Power Hungry
Episodes.Description: An elevator crashes, killing a number of people, leading Olivia and the Bishops to a man who appears to unknowingly be able to manipulate electricity.

Episodes.Name: The Cure
Episodes.Description: A number of people in a diner die of radiation exposure and Olivia and the Bishops believe a woman who disappeared two weeks earlier was the source.

Episodes.Name: In Which We Meet Mr. Jones
Episodes.Description: An FBI agent experiencing huge pain is brought to a hospital where it is discovered that there is a strange parasite wrapped around his heart.

Episodes.Name: The Equation
Episodes.Description: A young musical genius is kidnapped and Walter recalls a patient at St Clair's who might have been kidnapped by the same people and forced to try and figure out the solution to an equation.

Episodes.Name: The Dreamscape
Episodes.Description: The Fringe division investigate the questionable fall of a Massive Dynamic executive analyst. John helps Olivia crack the case. Peter meets up with an old girlfriend.

Episodes.Name: Safe
Episodes.Description: After a series of mysterious bank robberies, a suspect is found embedded into a wall, causing Walter to realize that they have not only found a way to literally walk through walls, but are looking for something he's made in the past.

Episodes.Name: Bound
Episodes.Description: Olivia has been abducted, and Broyles and the Fringe division must investigate her disappearance - while also undergoing an audit by an agent from Olivia's past who bears a major grudge against her.

Episodes.Name: The No-Brainer
Episodes.Description: Two men's brains are liquefied and their only apparent connection is that they both downloaded a huge file before dying.

Episodes.Name: The Transformation
Episodes.Description: A man undergoes a painful and ultimately fatal transformation aboard a plane. Meanwhile, Nina Sharp and Broyles reveal more information about John Scott to Olivia.

Episodes.Name: Ability
Episodes.Description: The team investigates a number of people who died faceless after their orifices are sealed while German agents investigating David Robert Jones' escape question Olivia.

Episodes.Name: Inner Child
Episodes.Description: A mysterious child is recovered from a secret chamber that has been sealed for more than a half-century.

Episodes.Name: Unleashed
Episodes.Description: A group of animal rights activists are killed in action when trying to flee from a lab animal which doesn't exist in nature.

Episodes.Name: Bad Dreams
Episodes.Description: FBI agent Dunham believes that she is killing random people in her dreams.

Episodes.Name: Midnight
Episodes.Description: Walter examines a number of dead bodies that had the spinal fluid removed. Olivia and Charlie go after the scientist who created the person behind the murders.

Episodes.Name: The Road Not Taken
Episodes.Description: The Fringe team investigate a case of spontaneous human combustion. Olivia starts experiencing visions of the alternate Universe. She uses this ability to solve the case.

Episodes.Name: There's More Than One of Everything
Episodes.Description: David Robert Jones comes out of hiding following an attempt on Nina Sharp's life while Walter leaves accompanied by the mysterious Observer.

Episodes.Name: A New Day in the Old Town
Episodes.Description: Olivia is in a car accident, an unusual person is looking for a member of the team, and Walter makes plans for celebrating Peter's birthday.

Episodes.Name: Night of Desirable Objects
Episodes.Description: Olivia and Peter investigate a series of strange disappearances. Olivia hears and sees things from the alternate Universe but fails to realize Charlie isn't really Charlie.

Episodes.Name: Fracture
Episodes.Description: The Fringe division investigates the explosion of a police officer. Olivia starts having visions about her experience on the other side.

Episodes.Name: Momentum Deferred
Episodes.Description: Walter analyzes the body of a shapeshifter and then reconnects with an old patient that has the ability to distinguish the people from the other world. Olivia finally recalls her encounter with Belly.

Episodes.Name: Dream Logic
Episodes.Description: People who once had sleeping problems but were cured by having a biochip inserted in their brain suddenly start to die. Walter suspects the chips were accessed by someone who used mind control.

Episodes.Name: Earthling
Episodes.Description: Strange deaths by a mysterious shadow leads the Fringe Team to the scene where they learn that a Russian astronaut was possessed by an alien and his brother is convincing Dr. Bishop to solve the equation to free him.
