Episodes.Name: Of Human Action
Episodes.Description: The Fringe team investigate a child that is supposed to have mind control abilities. Peter is kidnapped and controlled by him. Walter is extremely worried and afraid he might lose Peter again.

Episodes.Name: August
Episodes.Description: Peter and Olivia look into the latest appearance of an observer, other than September, who kidnaps a young woman. August prevents her from getting on a plane that would crash.

Episodes.Name: Snakehead
Episodes.Description: Walter examines some bodies that have been infected with unusual worms. Olivia and Peter run an investigation after speaking with a survivor. Meanwhile Walter demands more independence from Peter.

Episodes.Name: Grey Matters
Episodes.Description: Olivia and Peter look into some patients of mental institutions that regain their mental state after having gone through a brain intervention performed by a shape-shifter named Newton. This is directly related to Walter and his brain.

Episodes.Name: Unearthed
Episodes.Description: A teenager comes back from the dead possessed by a soldier who's gone missing. Walter does an experiment so that the Fringe team can find the soldier's murderer.

Episodes.Name: Johari Window
Episodes.Description: When the sheriff of a small town nearby Edina City gives a ride to a boy that is fleeing home, he finds at the police station that the boy has changed to a deformed child. Out of the blue, a group of deformed man slaughter the sheriff and two marshals and bring the boy with them. The Fringe Division is assigned to investigate the case and they head to Edina, here they are received by the local sheriff. They overhear a humming and the sheriff explains that it comes from a military base. Soon Olivia and Peter are attacked by a local in a truck but Peter succeeds to kill...

Episodes.Name: What Lies Below
Episodes.Description: After a man spreads a pathogen on the grounds of a company, the Fringe team start an investigation. While stuck inside the quarantine zone, Peter and Olivia try to identify the origin of the pathogen. Outside, Walter tries to find a cure.

Episodes.Name: The Bishop Revival
Episodes.Description: A man uses a toxin to target specific groups of people. Walter finds out that the toxin was created by his father in Berlin, long before DNA was even discovered.

Episodes.Name: Jacksonville
Episodes.Description: An earthquake from the other side is being felt on our Universe as well. Furthermore, the only survivor seems to be from the alternate Universe. Walter attempts to get Olivia "recover" her ability to make out things from the other side.

Episodes.Name: Peter
Episodes.Description: Walter flashes back to 1985 while explaining Peter's otherworldly origins to Olivia. Also, Peter's mother is introduced, and details of the neighboring world reaffirms that there is more than one of everything.

Episodes.Name: Olivia. In the Lab. With the Revolver
Episodes.Description: The Fringe team investigate a series of mysterious deaths caused by cancer that seems to have been transmitted by touch. Olivia realizes the perpetrator is after the kids who were part of the Coretexiphan trials.

Episodes.Name: White Tulip
Episodes.Description: The Fringe team investigate a train full of people who died in a mysterious way. Olivia and the others then meet the astrophysicist who was responsible for the "experiment" and who can reset the time.

Episodes.Name: The Man from the Other Side
Episodes.Description: The body of a male teenager is found along with shapeshifter marks. Walter examines the embryo of a shapeshifter, that came from the alternate Universe. The team try to anticipate the shapeshifters' next moves.

Episodes.Name: Brown Betty
Episodes.Description: Walter has just smoked a drug that he calls "Brown Betty" when Olivia arrives at the laboratory to leave Ella with Astrid. The girl asks Walter to tell a story and he creates a detective story where the Fringe Division are the characters.

Episodes.Name: Northwest Passage
Episodes.Description: Peter stumbles across Newton and his people while running away from Walter and the FBI. He teams up with the local sheriff to try and find Newton.

Episodes.Name: Over There: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Walter and Olivia travel to the parallel universe, and the anticipated face-off between Walter Bishop and William Bell occurs.

Episodes.Name: Over There: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Sacrifices will be made and both universes may never be the same again after Walter and Olivia visit the "other side."

Episodes.Name: Olivia
Episodes.Description: After the extraordinary turn of events that shockingly left an imprisoned Olivia "over there," she fights to find her way home. Meanwhile, Peter and Walter try to move on with their lives unknowingly alongside alternate Olivia.

Episodes.Name: The Box
Episodes.Description: Three men abduct and keep a family tied up and gagged in the living room. Two of them dig the basement while the third one watches the family. The men find a box and decide to take a peek inside. The two men and the family immediately die. The Fringe Division investigate the case and Walter performs an autopsy on the bodies. Soon he finds that they die because they have been exposed to an ultrasound signal. Walter receives an envelope from William Bell's lawyer as inheritance and he discloses to Astrid what William left for him. Meanwhile the alternate Olivia and ...

Episodes.Name: The Plateau
Episodes.Description: In the alternate universe, Olivia and the Fringe Division investigate weird accidents with casualties apparently with no connection except ballpoint pens found on the spots. But when Olivia sees the freak Milo, she suspects that he might be the responsible. Olivia and Charlie investigates and soon they follow a lead to a hospital where they learn what happened to Milo.

Episodes.Name: Do Shapeshifters Dream of Electric Sheep?
Episodes.Description: When the American Senator James Van Horn has a serious car accident, he immediately goes to surgery; however Newton invades the hospital and abducts him shooting the staff. There is a shootout with Broyles and Newton shoots Van Horn in the eye. The Fringe Division finds that the senator is a shapeshifter and they take his body to Walter's laboratory. He finds that it is possible to revive the shapeshifter and recover his data disc. But the alternate Olivia calls Newton and he sends the shapeshifter Ray to the hospital to retrieve the disc. When he returns home, Newton...

Episodes.Name: Amber 31422
Episodes.Description: In the parallel universe, a man releases his twin brother from an area in quarantine, removing him from the amber. The Fringe Division investigates the case that is classified since The Secretary does not want that the population learns that the family and friends are alive enclosed in amber. Olivia interviews Matthew, who is the twin brother of Joshua, and suspects that he is lying. Meanwhile The Secretary lures Olivia and convinces her to be submitted to n experiment while she has daydreams with Peter.

Episodes.Name: 6955 kHz
Episodes.Description: The latest broadcast on a numbers station transmits amnesia to its listeners. Walter clashes with Peter over Peter's work on the machine from alternate Earth.

Episodes.Name: The Abducted
Episodes.Description: In the parallel universe, a kidnapper called The Candy Man abducts the boy Max. The Fringe Division is assigned to investigate the case and soon Olivia learns that Broyles' son Christopher was also abducted two years ago and returned blind and with physical deficiencies to his family. She asks Broyles to interview Christopher to see any missing information but Broyles does not accept; however his wife agrees that Olivia meets Christopher. Olivia recalls an old case and guess whether The Candy Man would be draining the pituitary gland from the children to use the ...

Episodes.Name: Entrada
Episodes.Description: Peter grapples with the aftermath of recent events as Olivia desperately searches for an ally. Meanwhile, the Fringe Team discovers a critical device that communicates between universes.

Episodes.Name: Marionette
Episodes.Description: Fringe Division seeks a man who has been harvesting transplanted organs, leaving victims with nearly nullified decay rates. Olivia faces the aftermath of Fauxlivia running her life.

Episodes.Name: The Firefly
Episodes.Description: The Observer returns, taking an active role in righting an old wrong (which includes - mundane for him - thwarting a bank robbery).

Episodes.Name: Reciprocity
Episodes.Description: The Fringe Division visits the Massive Dynamic to see the Doomsday Machine and the presence of Peter assembles the device. He is submitted to tests by Dr. James Falcon against Walter's will. Walter asks Nina to find William Bell's research since he wants to restore his brain to increase his IQ and help Peter. Meanwhile Broyles gives access to the main frame where the alternate Olivia's files are to help the investigation and they suspect there is a mole accessing the information. Soon they find that someone is killing the shapeshifters. Who might be the killer?

Episodes.Name: Concentrate and Ask Again
Episodes.Description: When a scientist is killed by a blue dust that grinds his bones up, the Fringe Division investigates the case and suspects a biological attack. The investigation leads them to a former marine that flees but is hit by a car. In coma, Walter recalls his Cortexiphan patient Simon Phillips that is capable to read mind. Olivia, Peter and Walter try to convince Simon, who lives in a deserted area, to help them to locate the terrorists, but he is sensitive to other people since he cannot control his ability. Simon agrees to help and also disclose Peter's real feelings for ...

Episodes.Name: Immortality
Episodes.Description: In the parallel universe, the Fringe Division investigates a case where a man was eaten from inside out by an extinct beetle. Meanwhile Broyles is considered missing and Lincoln is the head of the division. Olivia welcomes her boyfriend Frank that has just returned from Texas and wants to propose her. When a second man is also eaten by the insects, the Fringe Division identifies the scientist Dr. Armand Silva that was researching the cure for avian flu using this insect. Lincoln and Olivia goes to his address and split. Lincoln is locked in a refrigerating chamber ...

Episodes.Name: 6B
Episodes.Description: A series of Fringe events leads the team to the home of a woman grieving over the death of her husband, while Peter and Olivia make an effort to repair the emotional rift between them.

Episodes.Name: Subject 13
Episodes.Description: This follow-up to last season's "Peter" flashback episode revisits a poignant period of time for both the Bishops and Olivia.

Episodes.Name: Os
Episodes.Description: The Fringe team attempts to find out what process enables people to become lighter than air and float. Peter and Olivia deal with trust issues in their relationship, while Walter becomes increasingly obsessed with retrieving William Bell's consciousness from beyond the grave.

Episodes.Name: Stowaway
Episodes.Description: As the Fringe team hopes to alleviate Olivia's possession quickly, Agent Lincoln Lee of the F.B.I. meets them for the first time over the curious case of what he calls "the compassionate soul vampire."

Episodes.Name: Bloodline
Episodes.Description: The intensity of life "over there" accelerates as Olivia finds herself in mortal danger.

Episodes.Name: Lysergic Acid Diethylamide
Episodes.Description: With the latest estimate that the team has only one day to save Olivia's consciousness, Walter leads a group on an LSD trip into Olivia's mind.

Episodes.Name: 6:02 AM EST
Episodes.Description: The beginning of the end is triggered when Walternate finds a way to wreak havoc "over here" - putting both universes in jeopardy.

Episodes.Name: The Last Sam Weiss
Episodes.Description: Olivia joins forces with the mysterious Sam Weiss in a desperate race against time.

Episodes.Name: The Day We Died
Episodes.Description: Peter successfully enters the machine with Olivia's help, and is transported to the future days where Walternate's universe is the one which has been destroyed. Walter learns about the origins of the machine and its ultimate purpose and sends back Peter to change his choice but gets lost in time warp.

Episodes.Name: Neither Here Nor There
Episodes.Description: Just one week after Peter Bishop saved the day and was then wiped from existence, the truce between the two worlds remains intact and the two sides are forced to work together. Lincoln Lee joins the Fringe team as they investigate a shapeshifter case that is very personal to him.

Episodes.Name: One Night in October
Episodes.Description: The "Over Here" team helps the "Over There" team look into a string of murders in which the victims are frozen from the inside out.

Episodes.Name: Alone in the World
Episodes.Description: Two bullying boys die and exhibit an alarming state of rapid decay. Their would-be victim, an extremely lonely boy, has a remarkably unusual connection to the killer. Meanwhile, Walter fears for his sanity.

Episodes.Name: Subject 9
Episodes.Description: Olivia is haunted by an energy force that attracts metallic objects and Walter recalls his subject 9 that has the ability for astral projection. They chase the patient Cameron Jones but they conclude he is not the responsible for the energy force. However and Cameron faces the force, something happen.

Episodes.Name: Novation
Episodes.Description: Shapeshifter Nadine hunts down a former Massive Dynamics scientist to help rectify her cellular translucence. Meanwhile, Peter finds conversing with Walter difficult.

Episodes.Name: And Those We've Left Behind
Episodes.Description: The Fringe Division begins to wonder if Peter or his presence is behind a series of time displacements between 2007 and 2011. Walter imposes a self-exile to his bedroom.

Episodes.Name: Wallflower
Episodes.Description: A manhunt begins for an invisible killer who steals human pigmentation.

Episodes.Name: Back to Where You've Never Been
Episodes.Description: In an effort to find a way home, Peter journeys to the Other Side to confront Walternate. His venture proves more dangerous than expected. Meanwhile, Olivia receives a dire premonition from an Observer.

Episodes.Name: Enemy of My Enemy
Episodes.Description: Peter's visit to the other side intensifies as the alternate Fringe division faces off against a formidable new foe in a harrowing race against time.

Episodes.Name: Forced Perspective
Episodes.Description: Olivia continues to cope with the ominous warning from the Observers, while Peter and the team track a girl with the mysterious ability to predict death.

Episodes.Name: Making Angels
Episodes.Description: Our Astrid gets an unexpected visit from her Alternate, while Peter and Olivia track a killer using a toxin that has yet to be invented. Both universes collide in a case that pushes the boundaries of what is possible.

Episodes.Name: Welcome to Westfield
Episodes.Description: Peter, Olivia and Walter come face to face with a mysterious and terrifying Fringe event as they get trapped in a town that there's no escaping.

Episodes.Name: A Better Human Being
Episodes.Description: As the Fringe team investigates a mentally ill patient who appears to be connected to a series of murders, frightening clues and connections are uncovered that lead Olivia to some shocking revelations.

Episodes.Name: The End of All Things
Episodes.Description: Peter and the Fringe team take extraordinary measures in an attempt to stop life-threatening events.

Episodes.Name: A Short Story About Love
Episodes.Description: The team hunts a killer who seems to be targeting couples - dehydrating the husbands and smothering the wives - with a very unusual motive. Peter and Olivia try to come to terms with her surfacing memories and emotions from the original time-line and the fact that she's beginning to forget parts of her life from the new time-line. Meanwhile, Walter and Peter try to figure out September's disappearance from the lab the week before.

Episodes.Name: Nothing As It Seems
Episodes.Description: An incident occurs that bears remarkable similarities to an early case in the original time-line, though there are some notable differences. Olivia's memories of the new time-line continue to fade, and Broyles places her on temporary leave, but her memories of original case assist Peter and Lincoln. Lincoln gets infected with a virus and Walter must figure out a cure.

Episodes.Name: Everything in Its Right Place
Episodes.Description: Lincoln travels to the other side to join forces with Faulivia and his own alternate, as they search for a vigilante with a surprising connection to the shapeshifters.

Episodes.Name: The Consultant
Episodes.Description: When both of the two identities of people from the separate worlds experience the same catastrophes from incidents in just one world, the two Fringe teams collaborate. Walter crosses over to find that Jones is behind the phenomena, but to what ends? Also, the investigation into the Fringe-mole continues.

Episodes.Name: Letters of Transit
Episodes.Description: In the future, the Observers rule and humans that survived the purge serve them. There are still a small number of people fighting for the resistance, and one of them has discovered one of the original Fringe team in the form of Walter protected in amber. As the resistance attempts to get rid of the Observers, we get a glimpse into a rather dark dystopian future.

Episodes.Name: Worlds Apart
Episodes.Description: Multiple earthquakes are happening simultaneously around both our world and the alt-world. Walter believes he knows what the end game of David Robert Jones is. And, even though Olivia has a connection to one of the players Jones is using that she thinks she can utilize, in the end it leads to some hard decisions for the Fringe team.

Episodes.Name: Brave New World: Part 1
Episodes.Description: A mysterious Fringe event, causing people to spontaneously combust, forces Walter to revisit his painful past while the Fringe team faces off against David Robert Jones to save the world - or worlds.

Episodes.Name: Brave New World: Part 2
Episodes.Description: In the Season Four finale, the Fringe team is pushed to their breaking point as they desperately attempt to prevent a catastrophic event threatening the lives of everyone.

Episodes.Name: Transilience Thought Unifier Model-11
Episodes.Description: In 2036 the Observers have begun terraforming the earth. Walter has a plan to defeat them but his capture by the Observers may be problematic. Peter searches for Olivia who is encased in amber to reunite his family

Episodes.Name: In Absentia
Episodes.Description: Harvard is now a secret observer installation. But Walter remembers a secret entrance that will give him access to his lab and perhaps a way to recover his plan to rid the world of the Observers. Olivia gets a distasteful look at Observer interrogation methods as Etta questions a loyalist security guard in hopes of finding a way to restore power to the lab. As Olivia and Etta disagree on how to dispose of their captive they gain a greater appreciation of each others character.

Episodes.Name: The Recordist
Episodes.Description: After piecing together the videos of Walter's plan Olivia, Peter, Walter and Etta head to rural Pennsylvania to retrieve essential materials for the plan. There they encounter a group of archivists who may be able to help with some local obstacles.

Episodes.Name: The Bullet That Saved the World
Episodes.Description: An act of kindness by Peter draws attention to Etta. The Observers deal with an infiltrator, and we learn of a resistance leader known as the Dove and, coincidentally, that Phillip Broyles is working with the Observers.

Episodes.Name: An Origin Story
Episodes.Description: Peter, in the grip of mourning Henrietta's death, resorts to extreme measures in order to gain powers that will allow him to surpass those that the Observers possess and hopefully, and eventually, find a means to defeat them.

Episodes.Name: Through the Looking Glass and What Walter Found There
Episodes.Description: Walter retrieves another video tape from the amber and it leads the team into a pocket universe.

Episodes.Name: Five-Twenty-Ten
Episodes.Description: The team retrieves another cassette tape from the amber. With Nina Sharp's help, the team recovers 2 cylinders. While Peter works independently to score a minor victory against the Observers, Olivia ascertains Peter's secret.

Episodes.Name: The Human Kind
Episodes.Description: Following the bread crumbs, Olivia collects a truck with cargo from a scrap yard but runs into bounty hunters. Peter, with newly gained powers, has to make a decision.

Episodes.Name: Black Blotter
Episodes.Description: Walter Bishop opens Pandora's Box. He finds a young Observer once he has hidden in the Pocket Universe.

Episodes.Name: Anomaly XB-6783746
Episodes.Description: Young observer remains muted. The team seeks Nina Sharp's help to understand him, but the mission is compromised.

Episodes.Name: The Boy Must Live
Episodes.Description: Young Observer's origin is revealed. And his existence and an additional time travel are necessary to change the history of Observers' invasion.

Episodes.Name: Liberty
Episodes.Description: As the Observers evaluate Michael and begin to learn of his abilities and potential, Olivia embarks on a dangerous quest to rescue him.

Episodes.Name: An Enemy of Fate
Episodes.Description: As the Observers close in, Walter and September desperately work to complete the plan, but one obstacle after another hinders their progress.

Name: Fringe
Summary: An F.B.I. agent is forced to work with an institutionalized scientist and his son in order to rationalize a brewing storm of unexplained phenomena.

Trailers.Title: Fringe Trailer 1
Trailers.Description: Fringe Trailer 1.

Trailers.Title: Fringe -  Trailer DVD Season 1
Trailers.Description: DVD da 1ª Temporada de FRINGE* FOX TV FRINGE/-FRONTEIRAS [DVD of Season 1 of FRINGE FOX TV FRINGE-BORDERS]

Trailers.Title: Fringe Season 1 Preview
Trailers.Description: The Fringe Season 1 preview clip, featuring scenes from the first few episodes. More more information, visit FringeTelevision.com.

Episodes.Name: Space Pilot 3000
Episodes.Description: A down-on-his-luck pizza delivery guy is accidentally frozen on New Year's Eve 1999, and wakes up in 2999.

Episodes.Name: The Series Has Landed
Episodes.Description: For the crew's first mission, they must make a delivery to the moon, which is now home to a cheesy amusement park.

Episodes.Name: I, Roommate
Episodes.Description: Fry is forced to choose between friendship and television when Bender's antenna impairs TV reception at their stylish new apartment building.

Episodes.Name: Love's Labours Lost in Space
Episodes.Description: While on a mission to save animals from a doomed planet, Leela finds herself the object of a starship captain's amorous advances.

Episodes.Name: Fear of a Bot Planet
Episodes.Description: Fry and Leela disguise themselves as robots to find Bender after he fails to return from a delivery to a robot planet, only to learn that he has become a celebrity in a culture which fears humans.

Episodes.Name: A Fishful of Dollars
Episodes.Description: Fry discovers his bank account interest has made him a billionaire and buys the one thing the year 3000 doesn't have: anchovies.

Episodes.Name: My Three Suns
Episodes.Description: Delivery Boy Philip J. Fry is promoted to Emperor after accidentally drinking his fluid-based predecessor.

Episodes.Name: A Big Piece of Garbage
Episodes.Description: When a big ball of garbage from the 20th Century returns to threaten New New York, Philip is the only expert on making the weapon to fight it.

Episodes.Name: Hell Is Other Robots
Episodes.Description: Bender joins a robot church after fighting an addiction to electricity, but reverts to his pre-addictive behavior of cigars, booze and robot hookers, leading to a musical confrontation with the Robot Devil.

Episodes.Name: A Flight to Remember
Episodes.Description: The crew takes a vacation cruise on the maiden voyage of the new space Titanic.

Episodes.Name: Mars University
Episodes.Description: Fry matriculates at Mars University and competes with a monkey made smart by Prof. Farnsworth's latest invention while Bender tries to make the local chapter of his robot fraternity cool.

Episodes.Name: When Aliens Attack
Episodes.Description: A monumental attack from Lrrr of Omicron Persei 8 is precipitated by the loss of a television signal that Fry disrupted in 1999.

Episodes.Name: Fry and the Slurm Factory
Episodes.Description: Fry wins a contest to visit the factory of his favorite addictive drink, but danger ensues when he accidentally discovers the real factory.

Episodes.Name: I Second That Emotion
Episodes.Description: Bender flushes Nibbler down the toilet in a fit of jealousy, which prompts Professor Farnsworth to implant in him a chip that will allow him to feel empathy.

Episodes.Name: Brannigan, Begin Again
Episodes.Description: Zapp Brannigan gets thrown out of the service for destroying a space meeting and as a result of this he begins to work for Planet Express.

Episodes.Name: A Head in the Polls
Episodes.Description: When a mine disaster causes the market value of titanium to soar, Bender becomes highly profitable and sells his body.

Episodes.Name: Xmas Story
Episodes.Description: Fry learns how Christmas has changed and remained the same over the last 1000 years when a Robot Santa terrorizes New New York.

Episodes.Name: Why Must I Be a Crustacean in Love?
Episodes.Description: When the group begins to notice that Zoidberg is acting erratically, Professor Farnsworth deduces that it is mating season on his home planet.

Episodes.Name: Put Your Head on My Shoulders
Episodes.Description: After a horrendous accident requires his body to be rebuilt, Fry's head is attached to the shoulder of a co-worker while Bender opens a dating service just in time for Valentine's Day.

Episodes.Name: The Lesser of Two Evils
Episodes.Description: Suspicion falls on a new employee when a shipment goes missing.

Episodes.Name: Raging Bender
Episodes.Description: Bender becomes a champion robot wrestler.

Episodes.Name: A Bicyclops Built for Two
Episodes.Description: After learning that there is a second Cyclops still in existence, Leela travels back to her home World to ensure that her species does not go extinct.

Episodes.Name: How Hermes Requisitioned His Groove Back
Episodes.Description: The Bureaucracy loves Hermes less while loving Fry loads more.

Episodes.Name: A Clone of My Own
Episodes.Description: Prof. Farnsworth reveals that he cloned himself years ago and introduces his clone to the Planet Express staff.

Episodes.Name: The Deep South
Episodes.Description: While stranded at the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean with the rest of the Planet Express crew, Fry meets a mermaid and quickly falls in love.

Episodes.Name: Bender Gets Made
Episodes.Description: Bender gets inducted into the Robot mafia but has a crisis of conscience when their next score involves his friends on the Planet Express ship.

Episodes.Name: The Problem with Popplers
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew discovers a delicious snack food on a remote planet, but Leela has a change of heart when she discovers a disturbing fact about the snack food that endangers Earth.

Episodes.Name: Mother's Day
Episodes.Description: When Mom of Mom's Robot Factory takes control of every robot on Earth, the only man who can save the planet is Prof. Farnsworth.

Episodes.Name: Anthology of Interest I
Episodes.Description: The Professor's "What If" machine answers 4 questions.

Episodes.Name: The Honking
Episodes.Description: When the inheritance Bender claims in the Old Country isn't quite what he expected, the Planet Express crew has to find the source of an age-old curse.

Episodes.Name: War Is the H-Word
Episodes.Description: Fry and Bender enroll in the Army to receive military discounts, but a war breaks out and the two friends are forced to serve on the front lines.

Episodes.Name: The Cryonic Woman
Episodes.Description: Fry discovers his 20th-century girlfriend at the cryogenics lab, but problems arise when she wants them both to be refrozen for another 1,000 years.

Episodes.Name: Parasites Lost
Episodes.Description: Ingesting a bad egg-salad sandwich leads to Fry developing a colony of parasitic worms in his bowels, which set out to make him smarter and stronger.

Episodes.Name: Amazon Women in the Mood
Episodes.Description: Gigantic feminist Amazons give Fry, Kif, and Zap a grueling workout.

Episodes.Name: Bendless Love
Episodes.Description: A sleep-walking Bender creates havoc with his uncontrollable bending and is sent to the Bending Factory where he meets Angelyne, a curvaceous fembot.

Episodes.Name: The Day the Earth Stood Stupid
Episodes.Description: When flying brains invade, Fry is the only one who can save the Earth from destruction.

Episodes.Name: That's Lobstertainment!
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express staff is amazed to learn that Dr. Zoidberg is related to a famous comedian. Bender convinces a robot soap opera star to finance a movie in the hopes of getting an acting award.

Episodes.Name: The Birdbot of Ice-Catraz
Episodes.Description: The professor decides to ship hazardous cargo to the outer reaches of space, but the ship travels through some environmentally sensitive areas, including the penguin refuge on Pluto.

Episodes.Name: The Luck of the Fryrish
Episodes.Description: Fry goes on a quest to recover his lucky 7-leaf clover after being convinced that his brother took over his identity after he was frozen.

Episodes.Name: The Cyber House Rules
Episodes.Description: Leela returns to the Orphanarium and she meets with her friend Adlai Atkins after some years, and they begin to go out. Adlai is a surgeon and operates Leela to let her have two eyes, and Bender decides to adopt all the children at the Orphanarium to get money from the Government.

Episodes.Name: Insane in the Mainframe
Episodes.Description: Fry and Bender are mistakenly convicted of robbing a bank and are both sent to a robot mental institution.

Episodes.Name: Bendin' in the Wind
Episodes.Description: After being crippled, Bender gets a new career as a folk rock singer. Fry, Leela, Amy and Dr. Zoidberg follow him around the country.

Episodes.Name: Time Keeps on Slipping
Episodes.Description: After being challenged to a game of basketball by the planet of the Globetrotters, Prof. Farnsworth creates a team of mutant, atomic supermen, but the side effects of their rapid growth endangers the universe.

Episodes.Name: I Dated a Robot
Episodes.Description: Fry ignores the warnings of the Planet Express staff and starts dating a robot with the downloaded personality and holographic image of Lucy Liu. Leela and Bender make a disturbing discovery while trying to save Fry from his short-sighted decision.

Episodes.Name: Roswell That Ends Well
Episodes.Description: Fry causes trouble for himself and the rest of the crew when he accidentally causes them all to be transported back in time to Roswell, New Mexico in 1947.

Episodes.Name: A Tale of Two Santas
Episodes.Description: When Fry, Leela and Bender make a delivery to Neptune, they run afoul of the robot Santa Claus. Bender takes his place, but the previous Santa's fearsome reputation makes his job difficult.

Episodes.Name: Anthology of Interest II
Episodes.Description: An anthology of three "what if" stories: what if Bender was human, what if life was more like a video game, and what if Leela found her true home.

Episodes.Name: Love and Rocket
Episodes.Description: When the Planet Express ship gets a selectable personality upgrade, Bender chooses one and falls in love... but too briefly.

Episodes.Name: Leela's Homeworld
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew must suffer the wrath of the mutants who live under the city after disposing too much toxic waste into the sewers.

Episodes.Name: Where the Buggalo Roam
Episodes.Description: Intern Amy Wong's rich parents host the annual Mars Day picnic, but the original Martians have different plans, so Lieutenant Kif Kroker comes to the rescue.

Episodes.Name: A Pharaoh to Remember
Episodes.Description: Bender worries that no one will remember him when he dies, but he encounters a chance to leave a legacy when he discovers a planet in need of a new pharaoh.

Episodes.Name: Godfellas
Episodes.Description: When Bender is lost in space, he becomes home and spiritual leader to a race of worshipers who misinterpret his wisdom.

Episodes.Name: Future Stock
Episodes.Description: Fry bonds with a revived 1980s guy who takes over Planet Express and takes on Mom's Delivery Company, but has a crisis of conscience when his new mentor plans to sell the company.

Episodes.Name: A Leela of Her Own
Episodes.Description: A pickup game with the family-owned pizza place across the street leads to Leela being the first female Blernsball player, but she has to struggle to avoid being the worst player ever.

Episodes.Name: The 30% Iron Chef
Episodes.Description: Bender goes on a quest to learn the secret of Ultimate Flavor so he can humiliate his former idol on television.

Episodes.Name: Where No Fan Has Gone Before
Episodes.Description: Fry is placed on trial for his life because he traveled to the forbidden planet of Omega 3 to rescue all 79 episodes of "Star Trek".

Episodes.Name: Crimes of the Hot
Episodes.Description: Earth is unable to offset its rising temperature through the usual process, which is the dropping of a giant ice cube into the ocean.

Episodes.Name: Jurassic Bark
Episodes.Description: Fry discovers the intact fossilized remains of his pet dog from his old life. The Professor reveals he can clone the animal.

Episodes.Name: The Route of All Evil
Episodes.Description: Prof. Farnsworth's and Hermes' 12 year old sons combine forces to take over Planet Express, but their ambition is more than their ability and they need their fathers' help to save the day.

Episodes.Name: A Taste of Freedom
Episodes.Description: Dr. Zoidberg's exuberant celebration of Freedom Day makes him Public Enemy #1.

Episodes.Name: Kif Gets Knocked Up a Notch
Episodes.Description: Amy is distressed when her alien boyfriend Kif becomes pregnant.

Episodes.Name: Less Than Hero
Episodes.Description: After using a tube of "miracle cream" Fry and Leela gain super powers and form "The New Justice Team" along with Bender.

Episodes.Name: Teenage Mutant Leela's Hurdles
Episodes.Description: After an overdose at a health club makes the Planet Express staff get younger and younger, they have to find a mysterious Fountain of Aging. Meanwhile, Leela experiences the teenage life she never had with her parents.

Episodes.Name: The Why of Fry
Episodes.Description: Fry learns that his accidental freezing 1004 years earlier wasn't an accident and he is given a choice that could prevent its happening, but at a cost.

Episodes.Name: The Sting
Episodes.Description: Sent on the same mission which caused the deaths of the previous Planet Express crew, Leela mourns the apparent death of Fry.

Episodes.Name: The Farnsworth Parabox
Episodes.Description: Prof. Farnworth creates a box which contains an entire universe and sends Leela into it, where she discovers another Planet Express with a few notable differences.

Episodes.Name: Three Hundred Big Boys
Episodes.Description: Everyone on Earth gets $300 after the spoils of a military victory are distributed. The members of the Planet Express staff spend it on different things, with varying degrees of success.

Episodes.Name: Spanish Fry
Episodes.Description: After being abducted by "human horn" poachers, Fry goes on a search for his missing nose.

Episodes.Name: Bend Her
Episodes.Description: Bender enters the Olympics as a Fembot and has modifications to maintain the illusion, leading to a romantic encumbrance with a soap opera star.

Episodes.Name: Obsoletely Fabulous
Episodes.Description: The introduction of a new type of robot makes Bender rethink his devotion to technology.

Episodes.Name: Bender Should Not Be Allowed on TV
Episodes.Description: Bender becomes a star on his favorite soap opera by forgetting his lines and reverting to character, but becomes concerned about the effect he is having on the audience.

Episodes.Name: The Devil's Hands Are Idle Playthings
Episodes.Description: Fry makes a deal with the Robot Devil so he can get robot hands to play the holophoner and impress Leela. In a twist of fate, Fry trades hands with the Robot Devil and writes a masterpiece opera about Leela. However, the Robot Devil has evil plans of his own.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Big Score: Part 1
Episodes.Description: The crew fall for a scam while relaxing on the Nude Beach planet and end up losing both Planet Express and Bender. While Hermes has a nasty accident and Nibbler summons the Nibblonian forces to try save the day.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Big Score: Part 2
Episodes.Description: The scammers start using time travel to steal valuable items from the past, Professor Farnsworth enlists the Globetrotters' help, Zoidberg tries to help Hermes recover, Leela goes on a date, and Bender is sent back in time to kill Fry.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Big Score: Part 3
Episodes.Description: Fry lives his alternate life in the past, Bender returns to the crew having been released by the scammers. Hermes has another accident and Leela gets engaged during a rampage by Robot Santa, but will the wedding go smoothly.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Big Score: Part 4
Episodes.Description: When the Scammers pull a last scam to take ownership of Earth, everyone is forced off planet. Can they all band together to regain their home planet and also stop the numerous time paradox's causing a huge catastrophe?

Episodes.Name: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Amy and Kif have a ceremony to become part of the same clan and Fry moves in with his new girlfriend discovering she has a very differing lifestyle to his. While the Earth's scientists debate what to do about the rift in space.

Episodes.Name: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Bender starts stalking Calculon and ends up introduced to a special group. A depressed Fry enters the rift, while Farnsworth teams up with rival Wernstrom to collaborate on the rift problem. And tragedy strikes close to home for the crew.

Episodes.Name: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 3
Episodes.Description: A tentacle monster bursts forth from the rift with Fry as it's mouthpiece and it intends to join with all people on Earth. The Planet Express crew plan to stop the takeover and rescue Fry but can they succeed and will Bender help them?

Episodes.Name: The Beast with a Billion Backs: Part 4
Episodes.Description: Bender takes control of the League of Robots and makes a deal with the Robot Devil for an army. While everyone else makes a deal with Yivo to get along together, but things don't go smoothly for long when Bender attacks.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Game: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Leela has to work on her anger issues after being goaded into entering a Space Demolition Derby with the Planet Express ship and Bender has to work on his lack of imagination after seeing the kids have fun playing Dungeons and Dragons.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Game: Part 2
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew learn Mom is profiting by creating a fake shortage of Dark Matter and set out to stop her but can the Professor recall where he put an important energy crystal. And Bender undergoes therapy at a Robot Insane Asylum.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Game: Part 3
Episodes.Description: When Bender's out of control imagination mixes with the Die of Power it creates an alternate Lord of the Rings influenced universe where the Planet Express crew must go on a journey across strange lands to destroy the Die of Power.

Episodes.Name: Bender's Game: Part 4
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew continue their journey to destroy the Die of Power, which has a negative effect on Fry. Mom and her sons make a last gambit to get the Die for themselves and Leela tries to convince the Centaurs to join the battle.

Episodes.Name: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 1
Episodes.Description: When a new Mars Vegas is built, the crew wrangle invites to the opening weekend and the 3009 Universal Poker Championship. Fry discovers he has a new ability to read people's thoughts and Bender starts a secret affair with Donbot's wife.

Episodes.Name: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Leo Wong is building a galaxy sized miniature golf course regardless of the damage it causes, so Leela joins some protesters to oppose him, while Fry joins a group with the same goal of stopping Leo, but President Nixon has other ideas.

Episodes.Name: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 3
Episodes.Description: Bender and Zapp Brannigan team up to capture Leela by using an unwitting Fry. Fry learns more about the Dark Ones, who strike at a new victim. And the Nimbus chases the Feministas across the miniature golf course galaxy.

Episodes.Name: Into the Wild Green Yonder: Part 4
Episodes.Description: The Feministas face the Supreme Court over their 'crimes' but Bender has his own ideas about their fate. As Leo Wong prepares to destroy the Violet Dwarf Star, Fry must decide what the right thing to do is. Then the Dark One arrives.

Episodes.Name: Rebirth
Episodes.Description: After the events of Over The Wild Green Yonder, Leela is put in an irreversible coma. Fry must find a way to cope with his loss, so he builds a robotic Leela.

Episodes.Name: In-A-Gadda-Da-Leela
Episodes.Description: Zapp and Leela are alone on an unknown planet after their mission to destroy a death star fails, while the rest of the gang tries to save Earth from being the star's next victim.

Episodes.Name: Attack of the Killer App
Episodes.Description: Fry and Bender compete to see who can get the most fans on their Twitter-like application on their new eyePhones, not knowing that it's actually part of Mom's evil conspiracy to unleash a new virus on people's brains.

Episodes.Name: Proposition Infinity
Episodes.Description: Amy gets together with Bender after she breaks up with Kif, which catches the ire of Dr. Farnsworth and others who oppose human/robot relationships.

Episodes.Name: The Duh-Vinci Code
Episodes.Description: Professor Farnsworth accidentally uncovers the blueprint for a mysterious Leonardo da Vinci invention, and he and his crew travel to Rome for answers.

Episodes.Name: Lethal Inspection
Episodes.Description: Bender discovers that he has no backup capabilities--meaning that he is mortal, and he and Hermes travel to Mexico so that he can take out his frustrations on his inspector.

Episodes.Name: The Late Philip J. Fry
Episodes.Description: Fry agrees to travel one minute into the future in Farnsworth's new time machine right before a big date with Leela, but they wind up going far into the future with no way to go back in time.

Episodes.Name: That Darn Katz!
Episodes.Description: A sinister cat uses Amy's failed dissertation to launch his plan to save his home planet by destroying Earth.

Episodes.Name: A Clockwork Origin
Episodes.Description: After a dispute with creationists, Farnsworth flees with the others to a remote, uninhabited planet. Upon releasing microrobots in a pond, non-organic life begins to evolve on the planet.

Episodes.Name: The Prisoner of Benda
Episodes.Description: The Professor's body swapping experiment produces a result he didn't have in mind.

Episodes.Name: Lrrreconcilable Ndndifferences
Episodes.Description: Lrrr is being pressured to conquer Earth.

Episodes.Name: The Mutants Are Revolting
Episodes.Description: Fry accidentally reveals that Leela is a mutant, so she is banished to the sewers where all mutants must live. Not willing to accept this, Leela and Fry organize the mutant uprising against this segregation.

Episodes.Name: The Futurama Holiday Spectacular
Episodes.Description: Three separate holiday stories: X-mas, Robanaca and Kwanzaa. 1. Once more Robot Santa comes to town. Besides the violence he spreads, this time he sings to the crew of the pine tree that are needed for a proper "X-mas". The only problem is that the pine trees have been extinct for over 800 years. However they manage to get some seeds, reforesting the earth. As the oxygen levels explode Bender causes the whole earth to catch fire. 2. Several weeks later, out of laziness Bender insists on celebrating the fake "Robanaca". For the traditional oil wrestling he needs ...

Episodes.Name: Neutopia
Episodes.Description: To avoid an imminent bankruptcy, the "Planet Express" is converted into an airline company, but on its the first flight the airliner crash-lands on a strange planet.

Episodes.Name: Benderama
Episodes.Description: Professor invents a device that creates two half-sized duplicates of any object. Bender uses this device to create copies of himself, so he doesn't have to work, but things quickly get out of control.

Episodes.Name: Ghost in the Machines
Episodes.Description: Fry believes that a human life is more important than a robot life, so Bender decides to kill himself again, only this time he really follows through. But instead of dying he turns into a ghost that haunts Fry.

Episodes.Name: Law and Oracle
Episodes.Description: Fry realizes he's stuck in a dead-end job, so he quits and enrolls in the police academy.

Episodes.Name: The Silence of the Clamps
Episodes.Description: Bender testifies in open court against Donbot, and has to go into Witness Relocation Program, because the entire robot mafia is now after him.

Episodes.Name: Yo Leela Leela
Episodes.Description: Against all odds, Leela manages to write a successful children story, which becomes a huge TV hit. But Leela's success comes with a secret.

Episodes.Name: All the Presidents' Heads
Episodes.Description: The crew changes the outcome of the American revolution when they travel back in time.

Episodes.Name: Möbius Dick
Episodes.Description: While traveling through the Bermuda Tetrahedron, the crew encounters a giant 4-dimensional space whale.

Episodes.Name: Fry Am the Egg Man
Episodes.Description: Leela buys some alien eggs, and Fry decides to hatch one of them instead of eating it, hoping to get a pet bird, but gets something else instead.

Episodes.Name: The Tip of the Zoidberg
Episodes.Description: The Professor consistently refuses to fire Zoidberg, despite his complete incompetence in medicine. The reason for such devotion is finally revealed.

Episodes.Name: Cold Warriors
Episodes.Description: Fry gets the common cold, which is bad news for the 31st century Earth, where the common cold has been extinct for a long time, so no one is immune to it.

Episodes.Name: Overclockwise
Episodes.Description: Cubert overclocks Bender's CPU to make him more powerful, but that creates some unexpected results. Meanwhile, Leela decides to dump Fry and move on.

Episodes.Name: Reincarnation
Episodes.Description: The episode contains three separate stories. In the first, which parodies the 1930s B&W cartoons, Fry wants to propose to Leela, so he blows up a comet made of "dimondium" to make her a diamond ring. In the second, which parodies the 1980s video games, the Professor invents a microscope with an infinite magnification and learns all the secrets of the Universe, which puts him and other scientists out of business. In the third part, which parodies Japanese anime, the team must defend Earth from dancing aliens.

Episodes.Name: The Bots and the Bees
Episodes.Description: Bender fathers a child with the office beverage machine.

Episodes.Name: A Farewell to Arms
Episodes.Description: Earth gets evacuated after a prediction of the end of the planet.

Episodes.Name: Decision 3012
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew gets involved in the running campaigns for the new world presidency.

Episodes.Name: The Thief of Baghead
Episodes.Description: Bender gets his friends in trouble by becoming a paparazzo.

Episodes.Name: Zapp Dingbat
Episodes.Description: Leela's parents break up and while Leela's mother starts dating, her father picks up his youth where he left it off.

Episodes.Name: The Butterjunk Effect
Episodes.Description: Leela and Amy get involved in the tough world of the Butterfly sport.

Episodes.Name: The Six Million Dollar Mon
Episodes.Description: After Hermes gets replaced by a machine he gets himself upgraded to become useful again for the company.

Episodes.Name: Fun on a Bun
Episodes.Description: When Fry gets trapped in ice during Oktoberfest he is mistaken for a caveman and accepted in the isolated world of the Neanderthals. Convinced he is a Neanderthal himself he decides to plot a war against the stuck up Homo Sapiens.

Episodes.Name: Free Will Hunting
Episodes.Description: After Bender realizes he has no power over the decisions he makes, he goes on a soul searching trip to liberate himself from the shackles of his pre-deterministic operation system.

Episodes.Name: Near-Death Wish
Episodes.Description: After Fry had a quarrel with Dr Farnsworth about family issues, Fry decides to look up Dr Farnsworths' parents to enjoy the family he never had.

Episodes.Name: Viva Mars Vegas
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew goes gambling in Mars Vegas where they risk far more than losing their chips.

Episodes.Name: 31st Century Fox
Episodes.Description: When Bender joins the local Fox Hunting Club ethical questions about killing things arise.

Episodes.Name: Naturama
Episodes.Description: A humorous mockumentary about nature.

Episodes.Name: 2-D Blacktop
Episodes.Description: After Planet Express ship is scrapped, professor saves it from the junkyard and rebuilds it into a super racer. But an accident during a race sends the ship into a two-dimensional universe.

Episodes.Name: Fry and Leela's Big Fling
Episodes.Description: Fry and Leela try to have some private time, but no matter where they go someone gets in their way. Finally they pay for a secluded romantic getaway, which turns out to be even worse.

Episodes.Name: T.: The Terrestrial
Episodes.Description: The crew goes to Omicron Persei 8, where Fry is left behind, and rescued by a local boy, but his only wish is to go home.

Episodes.Name: Forty Percent Leadbelly
Episodes.Description: Bender finally fulfills his dream of becoming a folk singer by creating a copy of a famous guitar, but then something goes terribly wrong.

Episodes.Name: The Inhuman Torch
Episodes.Description: Bender accidentally becomes a firefighting hero, and loves it so much that he becomes a full-time firefighter. And he has plenty of opportunities to display his heroism, because fires mysteriously start everywhere he goes.

Episodes.Name: Saturday Morning Fun Pit
Episodes.Description: President Nixon is watching his favorite TV shows, which spoof three actual cartoon series using Futurama characters.

Episodes.Name: Calculon 2.0
Episodes.Description: Fry and Bender resurrect Calculon to make "All My Circuits" interesting again. But things don't go exactly as planned.

Episodes.Name: Assie Come Home
Episodes.Description: Bender searches the entire universe for his shiny metal rear end.

Episodes.Name: Leela and the Genestalk
Episodes.Description: After a rare condition causes Leela to grow tentacles, she stumbles upon a secret genetic engineering facility.

Episodes.Name: Game of Tones
Episodes.Description: The Planet Express crew journeys into Fry's dreams to pull off a mission in the year 1999.

Episodes.Name: Murder on the Planet Express
Episodes.Description: The crew get trapped aboard the Planet Express ship with a horrific alien creature.

Episodes.Name: Stench and Stenchibility
Episodes.Description: Zoidberg's budding romance with a flower shop owner who cannot smell his unpleasant odor is tested when he's given the opportunity to give her a nose transplant.

Episodes.Name: Meanwhile
Episodes.Description: Professor Farnsworth invents a button that can take a person 10 seconds back in time, inadvertently causing major consequences.

Name: Futurama
Summary: Philip J. Fry, a pizza delivery boy, is accidentally frozen in 1999 and thawed out on New Year's Eve 2999.

Trailers.Title: Futurama TV Series  1999    Season 1 Trailer
Futurama (TV Series 1999) Trailer - FilmsLobby.Com
Trailers.Description: For more info....http://trailerandpromo.blogspot.com/

Trailers.Title: Futurama Series Premiere Promos
Trailers.Description: This NOSTALGIC video is for adults who wish to remember and relive something from their past. Great things were to come in the ...

Episodes.Name: Winter Is Coming
Episodes.Description: Eddard Stark is torn between his family and an old friend when asked to serve at the side of King Robert Baratheon; Viserys plans to wed his sister to a nomadic warlord in exchange for an army.

Episodes.Name: The Kingsroad
Episodes.Description: While Bran recovers from his fall, Ned takes only his daughters to King's Landing. Jon Snow goes with his uncle Benjen to the Wall. Tyrion joins them.

Episodes.Name: Lord Snow
Episodes.Description: Jon begins his training with the Night's Watch; Ned confronts his past and future at King's Landing; Daenerys finds herself at odds with Viserys.

Episodes.Name: Cripples, Bastards, and Broken Things
Episodes.Description: Eddard investigates Jon Arryn's murder. Jon befriends Samwell Tarly, a coward who has come to join the Night's Watch.

Episodes.Name: The Wolf and the Lion
Episodes.Description: Catelyn has captured Tyrion and plans to bring him to her sister, Lysa Arryn, at the Vale, to be tried for his, supposed, crimes against Bran. Robert plans to have Daenerys killed, but Eddard refuses to be a part of it and quits.

Episodes.Name: A Golden Crown
Episodes.Description: While recovering from his battle with Jaime, Eddard is forced to run the kingdom while Robert goes hunting. Tyrion demands a trial by combat for his freedom. Viserys is losing his patience with Drogo.

Episodes.Name: You Win or You Die
Episodes.Description: Robert has been injured while hunting and is dying. Jon and the others finally take their vows to the Night's Watch. A man, sent by Robert, is captured for trying to poison Daenerys. Furious, Drogo vows to attack the Seven Kingdoms.

Episodes.Name: The Pointy End
Episodes.Description: The Lannisters press their advantage over the Starks; Robb rallies his father's northern allies and heads south to war; The White Walkers attack the Wall; Tyrion returns to his father with some new friends.

Episodes.Name: Baelor
Episodes.Description: Robb goes to war against the Lannisters. Jon finds himself struggling on deciding if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Drogo has fallen ill from a fresh battle wound. Daenerys is desperate to save him.

Episodes.Name: Fire and Blood
Episodes.Description: Robb vows to get revenge on the Lannisters. Jon must officially decide if his place is with Robb or the Night's Watch. Daenerys says her final goodbye to Drogo.

Episodes.Name: The North Remembers
Episodes.Description: Tyrion arrives at King's Landing to take his father's place as Hand of the King. Stannis Baratheon plans to take the Iron Throne for his own. Robb tries to decide his next move in the war. The Night's Watch arrive at the house of Craster.

Episodes.Name: The Night Lands
Episodes.Description: Arya makes friends with Gendry. Tyrion tries to take control of the Small Council. Theon arrives at his home, Pyke, in order to persuade his father into helping Robb with the war. Jon tries to investigate Craster's secret.

Episodes.Name: What Is Dead May Never Die
Episodes.Description: Tyrion tries to see who he can trust in the Small Council. Catelyn visits Renly to try and persuade him to join Robb in the war. Theon must decide if his loyalties lie with his own family or with Robb.

Episodes.Name: Garden of Bones
Episodes.Description: Lord Baelish arrives at Renly's camp just before he faces off against Stannis. Daenerys and her company are welcomed into the city of Qarth. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie find themselves imprisoned at Harrenhal.

Episodes.Name: The Ghost of Harrenhal
Episodes.Description: Tyrion investigates a secret weapon that King Joffrey plans to use against Stannis. Meanwhile, as a token for saving his life, Jaqen H'ghar offers to kill three people that Arya chooses.

Episodes.Name: The Old Gods and the New
Episodes.Description: Theon seizes control of Winterfell. Jon captures a wildling, named Ygritte. The people of King's Landing begin to turn against King Joffrey. Daenerys looks to buy ships to sail for the Seven Kingdoms.

Episodes.Name: A Man Without Honor
Episodes.Description: Bran and Rickon have escaped Winterfell. Theon tries to hunt them down. Daenerys' dragons have been stolen. Jon travels through the wilderness with Ygritte as his prisoner. Sansa has bled and is now ready to have Joffrey's children.

Episodes.Name: The Prince of Winterfell
Episodes.Description: Stannis is just days from King's Landing. Tyrion prepares for his arrival. Jon and Qhorin are taken prisoner by the wildlings. Catelyn is arrested for releasing Jaime. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie plan to escape from Harrenhal.

Episodes.Name: Blackwater
Episodes.Description: Stannis Baratheon's fleet and army arrive at King's Landing and the battle for the city begins. Cersei plans for her and her children's future.

Episodes.Name: Valar Morghulis
Episodes.Description: Joffrey puts Sansa aside for Margaery Tyrell. Robb marries Talisa Maegyr. Jon prepares to meet Mance Rayder. Arya says farewell to Jaqen H'ghar. Daenerys tries to rescue her dragons.

Episodes.Name: Valar Dohaeris
Episodes.Description: Jon is brought before Mance Rayder, the King Beyond the Wall, while the Night's Watch survivors retreat south. In King's Landing, Tyrion asks for his reward. Littlefinger offers Sansa a way out.

Episodes.Name: Dark Wings, Dark Words
Episodes.Description: Bran and company meet Jojen and Meera Reed. Arya, Gendry, and Hot Pie meet the Brotherhood. Jaime travels through the wilderness with Brienne. Sansa confesses her true feelings about Joffery to Margaery.

Episodes.Name: Walk of Punishment
Episodes.Description: Robb and Catelyn arrive at Riverrun for Lord Hoster Tully's funeral. Tywin names Tyrion the new Master of Coin. Arya says goodbye to Hot Pie. The Night's Watch returns to Craster's. Brienne and Jaime are taken prisoner.

Episodes.Name: And Now His Watch Is Ended
Episodes.Description: Jaime mopes over his lost hand. Cersei is growing uncomfortable with the Tyrells. The Night's Watch is growing impatient with Craster. Daenerys buys the Unsullied.

Episodes.Name: Kissed by Fire
Episodes.Description: Robb's army is falling apart. Jaime reveals a story, to Brienne, that he has never told anyone. Jon breaks his vows. The Hound is granted his freedom. The Lannisters hatch a new plan.

Episodes.Name: The Climb
Episodes.Description: Jon and the wildlings scale the Wall. The Brotherhood sells Gendry to Melisandre. Robb does what he can to win back the Freys. Tyrion tells Sansa about their engagement.

Episodes.Name: The Bear and the Maiden Fair
Episodes.Description: Jon and the wildlings travel south of the Wall. Talisa tells Robb that she's pregnant. Arya runs away from the Brotherhood. Daenerys arrives at Yunkai. Jaime leaves Brienne behind at Harrenhal.

Episodes.Name: Second Sons
Episodes.Description: Daenerys tries to persuade the Second Sons to join her against Yunkai. Stannis releases Davos from the dungeons. Sam and Gilly are attacked by a White Walker. Sansa and Tyrion wed.

Episodes.Name: The Rains of Castamere
Episodes.Description: Robb and Catelyn arrive at the Twins for the wedding. Jon is put to the test to see where his loyalties truly lie. Bran's group decides to split up. Daenerys plans an invasion of Yunkai.

Episodes.Name: Mhysa
Episodes.Description: Bran and company travel beyond the Wall. Sam returns to Castle Black. Jon says goodbye to Ygritte. Jaime returns to King's Landing. The Night's Watch asks for help from Stannis.

Episodes.Name: Two Swords
Episodes.Description: Tyrion welcomes a guest to King's Landing. At Castle Black, Jon stands trial. Daenerys is pointed to Meereen, the mother of all slave cities. Arya runs into an old enemy.

Episodes.Name: The Lion and the Rose
Episodes.Description: Joffrey and Margaery's wedding has come. Tyrion breaks up with Shae. Ramsay tries to prove his worth to his father. Bran and company find a Weirwood tree.

Episodes.Name: Breaker of Chains
Episodes.Description: Tyrion is arrested for the murder of Joffrey and awaits trial. Sansa escapes King's Landing. Sam sends Gilly to Mole's Town as the Night's Watch finds itself in a tight spot. Meereen challenges Daenerys.

Episodes.Name: Oathkeeper
Episodes.Description: Jaime entrusts a task to Brienne. Daenerys frees Meereen. Jon is given permission to lead a group of Night's Watchmen to Craster's Keep. Bran and company are taken hostage.

Episodes.Name: First of His Name
Episodes.Description: Tommen is crowned King of the Seven Kingdoms. Cersei builds her case against Tyrion. Sansa and Lord Baelish arrive at the Eyrie. The Night's Watch attacks Craster's Keep.

Episodes.Name: The Laws of Gods and Men
Episodes.Description: Tyrion's trial has come. Yara and her troops storm the Dreadfort to free Theon. Daenerys meets Hizdar zo Loraq. Stannis makes a deal with the Iron Bank of Braavos.

Episodes.Name: Mockingbird
Episodes.Description: Tyrion tries to find a champion. Daenerys sleeps with Daario. The Hound becomes wounded. Jon's advice is ignored at Castle Black. Brienne and Podrick receive a tip on Arya's whereabouts.

Episodes.Name: The Mountain and the Viper
Episodes.Description: Theon helps Ramsay seize Moat Cailin. The wildlings attack Mole's Town. Sansa comes up with a story to protect Lord Baelish. Daenerys finds out a secret about Jorah Mormont. Oberyn Martell faces Gregor Clegane, the Mountain.

Episodes.Name: The Watchers on the Wall
Episodes.Description: The battle between the Night's Watch and the wildlings has come.

Episodes.Name: The Children
Episodes.Description: Jon makes an important decision. Daenerys experiences new consequences. Brienne and Podrick have an unexpected encounter. Bran achieves a goal, while Tyrion makes an important discovery.

Episodes.Name: The Wars to Come
Episodes.Description: Cersei and Jaime adjust to a world without Tywin. Tyrion and Varys arrive at Pentos. In Meereen, a new enemy emerges. Jon is caught between two kings.

Episodes.Name: The House of Black and White
Episodes.Description: Arya arrives in Braavos. Jaime takes on a secret mission. Ellaria Sand seeks revenge for Oberyn's death. Stannis makes Jon a generous offer as the Night's Watch elects a new Lord Commander. Daenerys is faced with a difficult decision.

Episodes.Name: High Sparrow
Episodes.Description: Tommen and Margaery wed. Arya has trouble adapting to her new life. Littlefinger reveals his plans to Sansa. Jon gives his first orders as Lord Commander. Tyrion and Varys arrive in Volantis.

Episodes.Name: Sons of the Harpy
Episodes.Description: Jorah Mormont sets sail alongside his prisoner, Tyrion. Cersei makes a move against the Tyrells. Jaime and Bronn sneak into Dorne. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their plans. Melisandre tempts Jon. The Harpies attack.

Episodes.Name: Kill the Boy
Episodes.Description: Daenerys arrests the heads of Meereen's great families. Jon makes a difficult decision. Theon is forced to face Sansa. Stannis rides south. Tyrion and Jorah enter the ruins of Old Valyria.

Episodes.Name: Unbowed, Unbent, Unbroken
Episodes.Description: Arya is put to the test. Tyrion and Jorah are captured by slavers. Loras Tyrell is judged by the Sparrows. Jaime and Bronn face the Sand Snakes. Sansa marries Ramsay Bolton.

Episodes.Name: The Gift
Episodes.Description: Jon heads east as trouble begins to stir for Sam and Gilly at Castle Black. Sansa asks Theon for help. Tyrion and Jorah are sold as slaves. Cersei savors her triumph over the Tyrells as new plots are developed in the shadows.

Episodes.Name: Hardhome
Episodes.Description: Tyrion advises Daenerys. Sansa forces Theon to tell her a secret. Cersei remains stubborn. Arya meets her first target. Jon and Tormund meet with the wildling elders.

Episodes.Name: The Dance of Dragons
Episodes.Description: Jon and the wildlings return to Castle Black. Jaime meets with Doran Martell. Stannis makes a hard choice. Arya runs into Meryn Trant. Daenerys attends the grand reopening of the fighting pits.

Episodes.Name: Mother's Mercy
Episodes.Description: Stannis arrives at Winterfell. Tyrion runs Meereen as Daario and Jorah go after Daenerys. Jaime and Myrcella leave Dorne. Jon sends Sam and Gilly to Oldtown. Arya challenges the Many-Faced God. Cersei confesses her sins.

Episodes.Name: The Red Woman
Episodes.Description: The fate of Jon Snow is revealed. Daenerys is brought before Khal Moro. Tyrion gets used to living in Meereen. Ramsay sends his dogs after Theon and Sansa. Ellaria and the Sand Snakes make their move. Cersei mourns for Myrcella.

Episodes.Name: Home
Episodes.Description: Bran trains with the Three-Eyed Raven. Tommen meets with Cersei. Tyrion makes a bold move. Theon leaves while at Pyke new issues arise. Ramsay's brother is born. Davos asks Melisandre for a miracle.

Episodes.Name: Oathbreaker
Episodes.Description: Daenerys arrives at Vaes Dothrak. Sam and Gilly sail for Horn Hill. Arya trains as No One. Varys finds information on the Sons of the Harpy. Ramsay receives a gift. Tommen meets with the High Sparrow. At Castle Black, a miracle occurs.

Episodes.Name: Book of the Stranger
Episodes.Description: Sansa arrives at Castle Black. Tyrion makes a deal with the slave masters. Jorah and Daario sneak into Vaes Dothrak. Ramsay sends a letter to Jon. Theon arrives at Pyke. Cersei and Olenna Tyrell plot against the High Sparrow.

Episodes.Name: The Door
Episodes.Description: Sansa and Jon make plans. Arya is given another chance to prove herself. Jorah confesses a secret to Daenerys. Tyrion meets with a red priestess. Yara finds her rule tested. Bran discovers the origin of the White Walkers.

Episodes.Name: Blood of My Blood
Episodes.Description: Bran and Meera find a new ally. Gilly meets Sam's family. Arya makes a difficult choice. The Lannisters and Tyrells march against the High Sparrow.

Episodes.Name: The Broken Man
Episodes.Description: Jon and Sansa gather troops. Jaime arrives at Riverrun. Olenna Tyrell plans to leave King's Landing. Theon and Yara plan a destination. Arya makes plans to leave.

Episodes.Name: No One
Episodes.Description: Brienne arrives at Riverrun. Arya seeks shelter. Jaime meets with Edmure Tully. Cersei challenges the Faith. Sandor Clegane hunts for revenge. Tyrion faces the consequences of earlier decisions.

Episodes.Name: Battle of the Bastards
Episodes.Description: Jon and Sansa face Ramsay Bolton on the fields of Winterfell. Daenerys strikes back at her enemies. Theon and Yara arrive in Meereen.

Episodes.Name: The Winds of Winter
Episodes.Description: Cersei and Loras Tyrell stand trial by the gods. Daenerys prepares to set sail for Westeros. Davos confronts Melisandre. Sam and Gilly arrive in the Citadel. Bran discovers a long-kept secret. Lord Frey has an uninvited guest.

Episodes.Name: Dragonstone
Episodes.Description: Jon organizes the North's defenses. Cersei tries to even the odds. Daenerys comes home. Arya reminds the Freys "the North remembers." Sam adapts to life in Oldtown. The Night King makes his way south.

Episodes.Name: Stormborn
Episodes.Description: Daenerys receives an unexpected visitor. Jon faces resistance. Tyrion plans the conquest of Westeros. Cersei gathers her allies. Arya has a reunion with old friends. Sam risks his career and life.

Episodes.Name: The Queen's Justice
Episodes.Description: Jon and Daenerys finally meet. Cersei gains a new ally. Sansa receives an unexpected visitor. Sam is confronted for his actions.

Episodes.Name: The Spoils of War
Episodes.Description: Daenerys takes matters into her own hands. Arya reaches her destination. Jaime and Bronn collect the spoils from the war with the Tyrells.

Episodes.Name: Eastwatch
Episodes.Description: Daenerys demands loyalty from the surviving Lannister soldiers; Jon heeds Bran's warning about White Walkers on the move; Cersei vows to vanquish anyone or anything that stands in her way.

Episodes.Name: Beyond the Wall
Episodes.Description: Jon and his team go beyond the wall to capture a wight. Daenerys has to make a tough decision.

Episodes.Name: The Dragon and the Wolf
Episodes.Description: Everyone meets in King's Landing to discuss the fate of the realm. In Winterfell, Sansa confronts Arya. Sam reaches Winterfell, where he and Bran discover a shocking secret about Jon Snow.

Episodes.Name: Winterfell
Episodes.Description: Jon and Daenerys arrive in Winterfell and are met with skepticism. Sam learns about the fate of his family. Cersei gives Euron the reward he aims for. Theon follows his heart.

Episodes.Name: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
Episodes.Description: Jaime faces judgment and Winterfell prepares for the battle to come.

Episodes.Name: The Long Night
Episodes.Description: The Night King and his army have arrived at Winterfell and the great battle begins.

Episodes.Name: The Last of the Starks
Episodes.Description: The Battle of Winterfell is over and a new chapter for Westeros begins.

Episodes.Name: The Bells
Episodes.Description: Forces have arrived at King's Landing for the final battle.

Episodes.Name: The Iron Throne
Episodes.Description: In the aftermath of the devastating attack on King's Landing, Daenerys must face the survivors.

Name: Game of Thrones
Summary: Nine noble families fight for control over the lands of Westeros, while an ancient enemy returns after being dormant for millennia.

Trailers.Title: Game of Thrones (TV Series 2011) - Trailer
Trailers.Description: Kings, queens, knights and renegades use schemes and swords to battle for the throne ** Starrin: Sean Bean, Lena Headey, Jack ...

Trailers.Title: Game of Thrones: Season 1 Trailer
Trailers.Description: Let the game begin for winter is coming! I have been a fan of this show for a while now and thought it would be fun to make a ...

Trailers.Title: Game of Thrones | Official Series Trailer (HBO)
Trailers.Description: It's time to return to Westeros.

Episodes.Name: Of Mice and Men
Episodes.Description: A burned-out attorney gets a second chance for redemption when he agrees to pursue a wrongful death lawsuit against the biggest client of his former law firm.

Episodes.Name: Pride and Prejudice
Episodes.Description: Billy scrambles to get his wrongful death lawsuit into court by any means necessary.

Episodes.Name: Game On
Episodes.Description: The judge gives Billy only a day to make a compelling offer of proof before he dismisses the lawsuit.

Episodes.Name: It's Donald
Episodes.Description: The beginning of discovery unearths a startling new piece of evidence that threatens to unravel Billy's entire theory of the case.

Episodes.Name: Cover Your Ass
Episodes.Description: As both sides begin their depositions, more secrets start to come to the surface, threatening to destroy everyone involved.

Episodes.Name: Line of Fire
Episodes.Description: Billy has to go to great lengths to secure his physical evidence's safety and preserve his witnesses' credibility.

Episodes.Name: Beauty and the Beast
Episodes.Description: With danger mounting around every corner, Billy has to decide whether to head directly to trial or take his chances with a continuance.

Episodes.Name: Citizens United
Episodes.Description: The trial concludes as former partners and old friends have their final showdown in court.

Episodes.Name: La Mano
Episodes.Description: Billy McBride is reluctantly pulled back into criminal defense when his friend's 16- year-old son is arrested for a double murder.

Episodes.Name: Politics
Episodes.Description: After a brutal loss, Billy decides to formally take on Julio Suarez's defense, but before he can go back to court, he has to get his team back together first.

Episodes.Name: Fresh Flowers
Episodes.Description: When Billy learns the name of the real shooter, he has to turn to the FBI to help him bring his elusive suspect in for questioning.

Episodes.Name: Alo
Episodes.Description: Billy tries a risky strategy to suppress the prosecution's two key pieces of evidence, hoping he can clear Julio's name before trial even begins.

Episodes.Name: Who's Gabriel
Episodes.Description: Billy finally gets a witness who can exonerate Julio, but he won't talk unless Billy can convince the prosecutor to give him a deal.

Episodes.Name: Two Cinderellas
Episodes.Description: Believing his client will soon be a free man, Billy joins Marisol for a romantic weekend in Mexico, only for his case to fall apart at home.

Episodes.Name: Diablo Verde
Episodes.Description: Held hostage by strangers and with no memory of how he got there, Billy has to make a harrowing escape from Mexico.

Episodes.Name: Tongue Tied
Episodes.Description: On the night of the mayoral election, Billy and his team race to take down the people responsible before they become an unstoppable Goliath.

Episodes.Name: The Subsidence Adventure
Episodes.Description: The unexpected death of an old friend takes Billy McBride to California's Central Valley, where a record drought has made water more valuable than human life.

Episodes.Name: Happiness from the Ground Up
Episodes.Description: Billy's investigation into the Central Valley's water problem threatens the launch of Diana Blackwood's almond-based lifestyle brand.

Episodes.Name: Good Morning, Central Valley
Episodes.Description: As Billy and Patty begin a class action lawsuit against the corporate farmers, the Blackwoods start dealing with everyone who gets in their way, including Billy.

Episodes.Name: Full Circle
Episodes.Description: Flashing back to before the events of the season, Billy has a drunken weekend at the Rising Sun Hotel and Casino, crossing paths with the Blackwoods and their scheme to steal water.

Episodes.Name: Argus 2: Battledome
Episodes.Description: As Billy and Patty make their first appearance in court, their class action is threatened when they walk into traps set for them by the Blackwoods.

Episodes.Name: Fer-De-Lance
Episodes.Description: Billy and Patty grill the Blackwoods in their depositions, shining a light on their complicated relationship and how they obtained ownership of the county's water supply.

Episodes.Name: Conscious Uncoupling
Episodes.Description: Billy puts Wade Blackwood on the stand and under oath, forcing him to admit every detail of his scheme to steal the state's water.

Episodes.Name: Joy Division
Episodes.Description: As Billy and Patty close in on the Blackwoods, Wade tries to cover up their crimes while Diana makes one final, desperate play, regardless who gets in her way.

Episodes.Name: Hadleyville
Episodes.Description: Recovering from a world-shattering injury, Billy reunites with Patty at a prestigious white-shoe law firm in San Francisco to take down the opioid industry. Although he may have found a friend in the firm’s managing partner, Sam Margolis, who’s dealing with a slew of physical struggles of her own, Billy’s discomfort in the corporate environment causes a stir with the rest of the firm.

Episodes.Name: The Pain Killer
Episodes.Description: As Billy settles into his new neighborhood, he learns a few things about one of his more eccentric neighbors. Patty realizes her position at Margolis & True may be contingent upon Billy's success. Meanwhile, opioid giant George Zax takes measures to protect his company.

Episodes.Name: Signed, William Hamilton McBride
Episodes.Description: Billy's unconventional strategy leads to a surprising result for Margolis & True. Billy and George Zax finally come face-to-face, giving each man an opportunity to size up his opponent. Billy and Sam’s personal relationship grows more intimate, but an unexpected visitor jerks him back to reality. Meanwhile, Patty learns about her future at the firm, but it comes at a cost.

Episodes.Name: Forcibly Removed
Episodes.Description: When Billy's concerns fall upon deaf ears at Margolis & True, he takes matters into his own hands. Patty must face an issue from her past that she'd rather keep buried. George tightens the reins at Zax Pharma to bring his family into line. Rob is shaken by troubling news, and he struggles to maintain his composure at the firm in its wake.

Episodes.Name: Spilt Milk
Episodes.Description: "After School with Mrs. Katy" - cartoon indoctrination of school kids goes wrong. A new development in the case leads Billy to seek help from an unlikely ally. Billy's unorthodox strategy to get the Attorney General involved causes Margolis & True to reevaluate their tactics. Patty fights to preserve her position at the firm. Meanwhile, George Zax maneuvers to keep his company's secrets safe.

Episodes.Name: Rundleworks
Episodes.Description: While Billy and Brittany work the case from the outside, Rob enlists their help to settle some of his suspicions. Patty and Rob prep a new witness who's crucial to the success of the case but might present them with more problems than solutions. New revelations force members of the Zax family to juggle loyalties.

Episodes.Name: Lawyer Trickery Bullshit
Episodes.Description: After a wrench is thrown into their plans, Billy and Patty must turn to an unexpected alternative. However, George has a few tricks up his sleeve that threaten their entire case. Meanwhile, Patty struggles to maintain her focus in the wake of some family trouble, and Sam is forced to confront the consequences of her actions.

Episodes.Name: It's Time
Episodes.Description: Billy and Patty lose control of the case when Sam finally makes her big play in court. As the trial comes to a close, the defense calls a witness who turns everything inside out. Billy seeks some long-due closure with his estranged friends and family.

Name: Goliath
Summary: A disgraced lawyer, now an ambulance chaser, gets a case that could bring him redemption or at least revenge on the firm which expelled him.

Trailers.Title: GOLIATH Season 1 TRAILER (2016) New Amazon Series
Trailers.Description: Goliath Season 1 Trailer - 2016 Amazon Studios Series starring Billy Bob Thornton, William Hurt, Maria Bello and Olivia Thirlby ...

Trailers.Title: Goliath Official Teaser with Billy Bob Thornton | Prime Video
Trailers.Description: The Goliath series portrays a once powerful lawyer, Billy McBride as burned out and washed up. A Billy Bob Thornton TV show ...

Trailers.Title: David & Goliath Official Trailer (2016)
Trailers.Description: At the crossroads of two great ancient empires, a simple shepherd named David transforms into a powerful warrior and takes on a ...

Episodes.Name: Contact
Episodes.Description: In the year 2552, humans on the planet Madrigal fight for independence from Earth, but a fatal encounter with the Alien Covenant complicates things; Master Chief John 117 and his super-soldier "Spartans" join the fight.

Episodes.Name: Unbound
Episodes.Description: John takes Kwan to an old friend and learns more about the mystery object, which the Covenant and Makee are determined to steal. With the alien threat growing, Dr. Halsey has a plan to deal with John's unpredictable behavior.
