Episodes.Name: Natural Selection
Episodes.Description: Sarah Manning witnesses the death of a woman who looks exactly like her. She decides to escape her dramatic life and take the woman's identity for her own. But converting to a new life is harder than she expected.

Episodes.Name: Instinct
Episodes.Description: Sarah looks deeper into the secret life that Beth seems to have led. Art refuses to return Beth's money until Sarah goes through with the hearing.

Episodes.Name: Variation Under Nature
Episodes.Description: Sarah has reinstated Beth into the detective force just as law enforcement finds Katja Obinger's body.

Episodes.Name: Effects of External Conditions
Episodes.Description: While Sarah tries to track down her mysterious blonde clone, Alison fills in for Sarah on a visit to see her daughter.

Episodes.Name: Conditions of Existence
Episodes.Description: Both Sarah and Alison believe that their lovers are actually monitoring them. Vic finds out that Sarah's alive.

Episodes.Name: Variations Under Domestication
Episodes.Description: Sarah's hunt for answers is interrupted by a trip to the suburbs. Alison's paranoia has boiled over, putting all the Orphans at risk. But when Sarah, Alison and Beth's worlds dangerously collide, Sarah must decide who to trust with her secret.

Episodes.Name: Parts Developed in an Unusual Manner
Episodes.Description: With Paul missing, Sarah is forced to confront the conspiracy head on. But when Paul learns Sarah has kept essential information from him, the fragile trust between them threatens to shatter. Meanwhile, Cosima grows closer to Delphine and the dangerously fascinating Dr. Leekie.

Episodes.Name: Entangled Bank
Episodes.Description: Art and Angela investigate Sarah's life. Alison has an affair with her best friend's husband. Paul ties up a loose end. Helena finds Sarah's weak spot.

Episodes.Name: Unconscious Selection
Episodes.Description: After Kira's life is threatened, Sarah is on the warpath, but Dr. Leekie makes her think twice about her plans for revenge. Meanwhile, Cosima faces the truth about Delphine, forcing her to choose sides. Now, it's up to Sarah to decide the killer's fate, but the truth about where Sarah came from changes everything.

Episodes.Name: Endless Forms Most Beautiful
Episodes.Description: Dr. Leekie offers deals to both Alison and Cosima. Sarah meets Rachel Duncan. Delphine tries to make amends. Alison tries to get her life back together. Helena escapes.

Episodes.Name: Nature Under Constraint and Vexed
Episodes.Description: Rachel has kidnapped Kira and Mrs. S. While trying to elude Rachel's thugs herself, Sarah has to decide whether to trust Paul as the person who has the best access to Rachel of those she knows in order to get Kira back. All Paul does tell Sarah is that there is a black tie event at Dyad at which Rachel will be in attendance. Sarah decides that she needs to attend the event - Cosima who already is an invitee - but has no plan beyond knowing that she will need to get in there with concealed gun in hand. With this scant outline of a plan, Sarah enlists the help of Felix ...

Episodes.Name: Governed by Sound Reason and True Religion
Episodes.Description: On information from Art, Sarah learns that it is not Rachel who abducted Kira, but rather the Prolethians, the reasons she does not know behind the abduction. However, there is no news whatsoever about Mrs. S, who she believes must have also been abducted along with Kira, which is only of little concern to her based on what her birth mother told her before her death. Regardless, Sarah decides to trust Art so that he can help her locate Kira. What Sarah discovers in the matter is not quite what she expects, which results in her not knowing who to trust. Art also tries ...

Episodes.Name: Mingling Its Own Nature with It
Episodes.Description: Sarah is able to escape with Kira from the bird watchers and Mrs. S, and now, along with Felix, are on the run with no money. They decide to take refuge at a secluded house where the owner seems to be away. But the choice of the house is no accident. This stop has an unintended effect on Felix. As Alison prepares for opening night, she slowly begins to unravel under all the pressure, which includes meeting someone who she believes is another monitor. Cosima learns from Delphine of yet another clone, Jennifer, who recently died from whatever ails Cosima herself. They ...

Episodes.Name: Governed as It Were by Chance
Episodes.Description: Sarah survives the car crash, is quickly reunited with Kira and sets off with Cal in his camper. She decides to head back to the city to find out from Mrs. S just what is going on. She also pays a visit to Rachel which doesn't quite go as expected. At the Dyad Institute, Cosima takes on the task of finding out about Project Leda. Alison awakens from her drug and alcohol stupor to find her right arm in a sling - and that she's in a rehab clinic. Felix convinces her she should spend a week there and just rest. Henrik Johanssen makes it clear to his daughter Gracie that ...

Episodes.Name: Ipsa Scientia Potestas Est
Episodes.Description: Rachel returns home to find Rosen dead, which she takes out on Sarah and Cosima. She also makes Paul an offer he can't refuse, even if he wanted to. In this new position, Paul decides to use Felix to help Rachel. Leekie, unlike Rachel, shows that his plans veer toward the truly scientific, he who provides Cosima and Delphine with some information about the clones' past. Feeling indebted to Helena for saving her from Rosen, Sarah decides to help Helena within the bounds of what Sarah believes is right. Helena may have thoughts of her own about what she wants to achieve...

Episodes.Name: To Hound Nature in Her Wanderings
Episodes.Description: Sarah and Helena are traveling together to Cold River to find out more about their clone past and specifically the person who Helena refers to as the Swan Man. This trip marks the first time that Helena has felt a sense of freedom in a long time. This freedom, however, may ultimately cause problems for her. Sarah's quest for information takes her to some unlikely places, or more precisely to some unexpected people. She gets some help in this quest by Art and Felix, who have the information obtained from Maggie Chen's storage unit. Felix, however, is often in a state ...

Episodes.Name: Knowledge of Causes, and Secret Motion of Things
Episodes.Description: When a rehab confidante betrays Alison and threatens to expose the truth about Aynsley's death, she goes into free fall on the eve of Family Day. With Donnie and the kids set to visit, it's all clones on deck to contain the fallout.

Episodes.Name: Variable and Full of Perturbation
Episodes.Description: A new player in the clone conspiracy turns up at Felix's door, sending him into crisis mode. With Cosima running out of options, Sarah struggles with the decision to surrender a crucial piece of leverage and make a deal with DYAD.

Episodes.Name: Things Which Have Never Yet Been Done
Episodes.Description: Cosima takes a turn for the worse, forcing Sarah to take desperate action - with tragic consequences for those she loves. The Proletheans set their ultimate plan in motion. Alison and Donnie tangle with the law.

Episodes.Name: By Means Which Have Never Yet Been Tried
Episodes.Description: After the successful abduction of Kira, Sarah prepares to surrender to Rachel and the Dyad Group; but the Clone Club has other ideas as they band together to pull off the ultimate rescue.

Episodes.Name: The Weight of This Combination
Episodes.Description: Sarah pursues the missing Helena who is held in a faraway compound. Sarah must use her wiles - and acting chops - to deter a Topside investigator who threatens the Leda sisters' lives. Meanwhile, Cosima appears to be rebounding from her illness, while Alison and Donnie face newfound financial woes. But when the menace of Castor rears its head once more, Sarah and her entire family must come together to survive.

Episodes.Name: Transitory Sacrifices of Crisis
Episodes.Description: Castor pursues the Leda clones for original tissue samples. Helena, who is pregnant and imprisoned, is examined by a mysterious new villain. The Castor boys are also out to play, sexually assaulting a frightened young woman, Patty, which ultimately sets Sarah - and Art - hot on the Castor trail. Sarah gleans they may have a mysterious defect that puts their lives in peril.

Episodes.Name: Formalized, Complex, and Costly
Episodes.Description: Leda and Castor are both on the hunt for original clone DNA. On-the-lam, Mark and Gracie pursue new leads to find the samples that might set them free, while Art and Sarah reunite to track them down. Meanwhile, Cosima and Scott try to learn more about Castor's biology and Alison's new money-making venture is going gangbusters. A shocking revelation about the Castor-Leda connection leaves the sisters reeling, just before Sarah witnesses a deadly Prolethean-Castor face-off.

Episodes.Name: Newer Elements of Our Defense
Episodes.Description: Sarah's fate hangs in the balance as she tries to save her sister.

Episodes.Name: Scarred by Many Past Frustrations
Episodes.Description: Sarah and Helena suffer a strained reunion; the Leda family worries about Sarah's absence.

Episodes.Name: Certain Agony of the Battlefield
Episodes.Description: Paul learns the truth about Coady's plans for Castor and has no choice but to make a dangerous play.

Episodes.Name: Community of Dreadful Fear and Hate
Episodes.Description: Sarah and Helena have managed to escape from the Castor compound, and arranging with Mrs. S are awaiting Benjamin's arrival in the Mexican desert to retrieve them. However, they are surprised to see that their retriever is Mrs. S herself. This meeting allows for a showdown between Helena and Mrs. S, the former who wants to kill the latter for selling her out. With Cosima's new relationship with Shay being strong, Cosima is having problems dealing with Delphine, whether it be on a professional or personal level. Cosima feels like betraying a request by Delphine without...

Episodes.Name: Ruthless in Purpose, and Insidious in Method
Episodes.Description: Ruthless in Purpose, and Insidious in Method Rachel bargains for her freedom with decoding Duncan's Moreau book.

Episodes.Name: Insolvent Phantom of Tomorrow
Episodes.Description: Clone Club heads to London to track down the Castor Original, but their enemies follow closely.

Episodes.Name: History Yet to Be Written
Episodes.Description: Kendall may be the key to stop Castor; the sisters appear to be thwarting their most dangerous foe.

Episodes.Name: The Collapse of Nature
Episodes.Description: A flashback to Beth Childs' final investigation, days before her suicide.

Episodes.Name: Transgressive Border Crossing
Episodes.Description: After fleeing Iceland, Sarah begins searching for M.K. and uncovers new clues to Beth's breakdown. Scott learns Kendall Malone is hiding something.

Episodes.Name: The Stigmata of Progress
Episodes.Description: As Sarah scrambles to learn more about her implant, Alison and Donnie take a drastic step to help. Meanwhile, Kira has a disturbing vision.

Episodes.Name: From Instinct to Rational Control
Episodes.Description: While Cosima examines Leekie's body, Felix and Donnie pose as a couple to learn more about a fertility clinic. Sarah discovers M.K. has her own agenda.

Episodes.Name: Human Raw Material
Episodes.Description: A risky cover mission at Brightborn yields several big surprises. The rift between Sarah and Felix grows as she checks up on Adele.

Episodes.Name: The Scandal of Altruism
Episodes.Description: Seeing that it is the best overall solution yet not perfect by any means, Sarah and Cosima decide with Kendall's OK to set up an agreement with Susan Duncan, which they will not divulge to Mrs. S. until everything is arranged as they know she won't like what they've done. That agreement is an agent representing Susan will remove the bot from Sarah's cheek, with Cosima on site to ensure Sarah's safety. As Scott and Cosima have not yet come up with a "cure" for Cosima and the other affected Leda clones, they in turn will provide their research and Kendall to Susan, with...

Episodes.Name: The Antisocialism of Sex
Episodes.Description: Sarah regresses to old habits while struggling to cope with the consequences of her decisions - reconnecting with Beth on a dark night of the soul. Back at the lab, Cosima, haunted by vicious memories and news of Delphine, attempts a dangerous Hail Mary to find a cure. At the Hendrixes, Alison is more determined than ever to create normalcy for her kids. As she forges ahead with a birthday party, Donnie is caught in the Neolution crosshairs.

Episodes.Name: The Redesign of Natural Objects
Episodes.Description: Siobhan wants vengeance for her mother. Cosima and Susan Duncan try to come together to try to finally find the cure. Neolution continues with their threats causing Alison to be terrified, and Mrs. To question her loyalty to her sestras.

Episodes.Name: The Mitigation of Competition
Episodes.Description: The formal alliance between the sisters on one side Susan/Rachel/Ira on the other side begins in earnest. Cosima has arrived on the island where she and Susan will begin the process of finding a cure for both Leda and Castor by developing original DNA in the absence of Kendall through fertilization of one of Sarah's eggs with Ira's sperm, while Sarah and Felix meet with Rachel and Ira to discuss the next step in bringing down Evie Cho and restoring Susan as the head of Neolution. As Evie ramps up her media campaign to bring BrightBorn's work to the masses, Sarah, ...

Episodes.Name: From Dancing Mice to Psychopaths
Episodes.Description: When communication with Cosima is cut off and Neolution appears to be within striking distance, Sarah's alliance with Rachel goes out the window. Sarah lures a high-level Neolutionist into a trap, and sets out to bring down Neolution once and for all.

Episodes.Name: The Few Who Dare
Episodes.Description: Desperate to get off the island and reunite with her family, a wounded Sarah journeys into the island's interior, only to discover a mysterious village - the beating heart of the Neolution agenda.

Episodes.Name: Clutch of Greed
Episodes.Description: Dragged home from the Island by Neolution, Sarah refuses to follow Rachel's new regime. Sarah sets a plan in motion to get her and her daughter out of Neolution's reach for good.

Episodes.Name: Beneath Her Heart
Episodes.Description: As Clone Club reels from the loss of one of their own, Sarah gnaws at the shackles Rachel has firmly placed around her family. Alison struggles to find her place in the sisterhood.

Episodes.Name: Let the Children and Childbearers Toil
Episodes.Description: Sarah and Siobhan follow a lead on a Neolution defector, hoping for enough leverage to free Kira from Dyad's clutches. Also, Cosima investigates rumors about a creature in the woods.

Episodes.Name: Ease for Idle Millionaires
Episodes.Description: While Sarah and Kira spend time at home bonding, Cosima unlocks the island's biggest secret, discovering a link between the village's so-called creature and the science around Kira.

Episodes.Name: Manacled Slim Wrists
Episodes.Description: Cosima is forced into an alliance with Susan Duncan when an old enemy returns to the Island. Meanwhile, on the mainland, Krystal stumbles onto a vital clue to the Neolution endgame.

Episodes.Name: Gag or Throttle
Episodes.Description: As Westmoreland demands a more aggressive approach with Kira, and Sarah fights to save her daughter, Rachel discovers a dark secret that makes her question her place within Neolution.

Episodes.Name: Guillotines Decide
Episodes.Description: Now that Sarah and Mrs. S have Kira back, they need to get her into a safe place. The activity around their house is remarkably quiet which Sarah believes is not a good sign. However, Mrs. S would like them now to focus on other things in their lives, namely Felix's first art exhibit in two years, he and Adele who have come back from their sleuthing in Switzerland. This exhibit is important for Felix as major art dealers and critics will be in attendance. All the sisters who are around - Sarah, Alison and Cosima - know the role they are to play in Felix's big day. ...

Episodes.Name: One Fettered Slave
Episodes.Description: Sarah, Felix and Kira mourning the death of S coincides with them and the other sisters learning from Sister Irina that Helena has been kidnapped. The sisters' first thought is that she has been taken to the island, but they figure that the one person who they now may seemingly be able to trust to some extent who would know for sure is Rachel. Rachel is only able to fill in some of the pieces. However, with news of Dyad's involvement in the genetics project hitting the media, Interpol has been called in to take over from the police the investigation of the deaths of ...

Episodes.Name: To Right the Wrongs of Many
Episodes.Description: Now in labor, Helena is forced to hunker down in the basement of Old Dyad for the delivery. It's a cage match for survival as Sarah and Art struggle to protect her in a desperate last stand against Neolution.

Name: Orphan Black
Summary: A streetwise hustler is pulled into a compelling conspiracy after witnessing the suicide of a girl who looks just like her.

Trailers.Title: Orphan Black - Series Trailer
Trailers.Description: Follow the Weekly 'Wood show for more entertainment updates http://www.youtube.com/channel/SW-B051IpGRbU In BBC ...

Trailers.Title: Orphan Black - Trailer #2
Trailers.Description: Get another look at the new series about a woman (Tatiana Maslany) who discovers she is one of many clones. Subscribe to ...

Episodes.Name: One Planet
Episodes.Description: Witness the planet's breathtaking diversity -- from seabirds carpet-bombing the ocean to wildebeests eluding the wild dogs of the Serengeti.

Episodes.Name: Frozen Worlds
Episodes.Description: On the unforgiving frontier of climate change, polar bears, walruses, seals and penguins find their icy Edens in peril.

Episodes.Name: Jungles
Episodes.Description: Jungles and rainforests are home to an incredible variety of species like preening birds, intelligent orangutans and remarkably ambitious ants.

Episodes.Name: Coastal Seas
Episodes.Description: From fearsome sharks to lowly urchins, 90 percent of marine creatures live in coastal waters. Protecting these habitats is a battle humanity must win.

Episodes.Name: From Deserts to Grasslands
Episodes.Description: Cameras follow desert elephants seeking sustenance, bison roaming North American grasslands and caterpillars living the good life underground.

Episodes.Name: The High Seas
Episodes.Description: Venture into the deep, dark and desolate oceans that are home to an abundance of beautiful - and downright strange - creatures.

Episodes.Name: Fresh Water
Episodes.Description: The need for fresh water is as strong as ever. However, the supply is becoming increasingly unpredictable for all manner of species.

Episodes.Name: Forests
Episodes.Description: Examine the fragile interdependence that exists between forests' wide variety of residents, including bald eagles, hunting dogs and Siberian tigers.

Name: Our Planet
Summary: Documentary series focusing on the breadth of the diversity of habitats around the world, from the remote Arctic wilderness and mysterious deep oceans to the vast landscapes of Africa and diverse jungles of South America.

Trailers.Title: Our Planet | Official Trailer [HD] | Netflix
Trailers.Description: Share the wonder of the extraordinary place we call home. Utilizing the latest technology Our Planet was filmed entirely in Ultra ...

Trailers.Title: Our Planet | Official Teaser [HD] | Netflix
Trailers.Description: The new nature series, reminding us that we're all on one team. #OurPlanet, narrated by Sir David Attenborough, explores ...

Trailers.Title: OUR PLANET Trailer (2019) Netflix
Trailers.Description: Official Our Planet Series Trailer 2019 | Subscribe ➤ http://abo.yt/ki | David Attenborough Series Trailer | Release: 5 Apr 2019 ...

Episodes.Name: Sassenach
Episodes.Description: 1945 England: Claire Randall reunites with her husband after five years of war. A second honeymoon goes awry when she falls back through time to 1740's Scotland.

Episodes.Name: Castle Leoch
Episodes.Description: Claire is brought to Castle Leoch under suspicion as an English spy. Learning that the year is 1743, she tries to arrange travel back to the standing stones. Colum MacKenzie uses her ability as a healer as an excuse to detain her.

Episodes.Name: The Way Out
Episodes.Description: Claire's abilities as a healer puts her at odds with the town priest when she saves a boy's life, and deepens the suspicions against her. Hearing a folk-tale, Claire realizes that she may be able to travel back through the stones to Frank.

Episodes.Name: The Gathering
Episodes.Description: The Gathering shows Claire's attempt at her first real planned escape. The run-ins she has with various characters on the way include a major run-in with Dougal, and yet another moment with Jamie alone - building their relationship. Also an oath-taking ceremony could have awful results if not handled carefully.

Episodes.Name: Rent
Episodes.Description: Claire goes on the road with Dougal as he collects rents from the tenants. She meets the clans solicitor who is riding with them. She also becomes aware of Dougal's involvement in trying to raise money for the Jacobite rebellion.

Episodes.Name: The Garrison Commander
Episodes.Description: Claire and Dougal are questioned at the local garrison.

Episodes.Name: The Wedding
Episodes.Description: Marriage to a Scot seems to be the only legal way out to save Claire from falling into the paws of Black Jack Randall.

Episodes.Name: Both Sides Now
Episodes.Description: In 1945, Frank is still seeking Claire, but is starting to lose hope of ever finding her. Meanwhile in 1743, Claire is trying to come to terms with her marriage to Jamie. While traveling, a life changing opportunity arises.

Episodes.Name: The Reckoning
Episodes.Description: Jamie and the Highlanders attempt to rescue Claire from Black Jack Randall.

Episodes.Name: By the Pricking of My Thumbs
Episodes.Description: Jamie hopes the Duke of Sandringham can help remove the price on his head.

Episodes.Name: The Devil's Mark
Episodes.Description: Claire and Geillis stand trial for witchcraft; Claire learns a secret about Geillis' past.

Episodes.Name: Lallybroch
Episodes.Description: Old wounds are reopened when Jamie returns to his family home.

Episodes.Name: The Watch
Episodes.Description: A Redcoat deserter from Jamie's past returns; Jenny goes into labor; Jamie and Ian join the Watch.

Episodes.Name: The Search
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jenny set out to rescue Jamie from his redcoat captors; unorthodox tactics are used.

Episodes.Name: Wentworth Prison
Episodes.Description: A visit from Black Jack causes Jamie to realize a fate exists that is worse than his death sentence.

Episodes.Name: To Ransom a Man's Soul
Episodes.Description: Jamie is freed following a daring rescue, but his mind lingers on the torture he endured.

Episodes.Name: Through a Glass, Darkly
Episodes.Description: Returning to her own time, Claire must reconcile her future with the life she left behind. Shifting back to the 18th century, Jamie, Claire and Murtagh arrive in France, but learn that Paris presents its own challenges.

Episodes.Name: Not in Scotland Anymore
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jamie plan to infiltrate Royal Court of France to disrupt Jacobite Rebellion. Jamie is forced to deal with Prince Charlie in Paris Brothels.

Episodes.Name: Useful Occupations and Deceptions
Episodes.Description: Claire finds an outlet for her skills at L'Hôpital des Anges treating the sick, while Jamie tries to derail the Jacobite Rebellion with the help of a pickpocket. Claire's new relationship with Mother Hildegarde provides a source of needed help for Jamie.

Episodes.Name: La Dame Blanche
Episodes.Description: Jamie has an unusual response to Claire's news, which brings about a confrontation. Louise asks Claire for assistance with a delicate situation, and friendly revelations provide disagreements at a dinner party with uninvited guests.

Episodes.Name: Untimely Resurrection
Episodes.Description: After the dinner party, Claire tends to Mary (and Alex), while Jamie deals with Charles' plotting. A visit to Versailles leads to turmoil for Claire and Jamie.

Episodes.Name: Best Laid Schemes...
Episodes.Description: Jamie and Claire use Claire's medical knowledge to devise a scheme to stop a wine deal which could fill the Prince's war chest. When Claire learns Jamie has gone back on his word, the couple is met with dire consequences that will forever change their lives.

Episodes.Name: Faith
Episodes.Description: Doctors at L'Hopital des Anges attempt to save the lives of Claire and her unborn baby; King Louis asks Claire to judge two men accused of engaging in the dark arts.

Episodes.Name: The Fox's Lair
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jamie return to Scotland, and back to their home, Lallybroch. Away from the nightmares of Paris, they find solace until a letter arrives. Jamie must go and visit his grandfather Lord Lovat, Simon Fraser aka The Old Fox. Claire accompanies Jamie to meet The Old Fox.

Episodes.Name: Je Suis Prest
Episodes.Description: Jamie trains his militia men for the upcoming Rising before joining the forces. Claire keeps to Jamie and gives him full disclosure on what little she knows about Scotland's fate in the Rising. Meanwhile, a young British soldier tries to kill Jamie.

Episodes.Name: Prestonpans
Episodes.Description: Jamie needs to bypass a swamp to lead the Jacobite army to win over the British army in a critical battle. Benefiting from her experience as a combat nurse during WWII, Claire tends to wounded and dying warriors.

Episodes.Name: Vengeance Is Mine
Episodes.Description: Claire and Highlanders are sent north after the Jacobite leaders decided to halt their march on London. A band of Redcoats makes trouble for the Scots, leading to the most unexpected reunion for Claire.

Episodes.Name: The Hail Mary
Episodes.Description: As Jamie puts all of his efforts into turning the Jacobite army away from the impending slaughter at Culloden Moor, Claire attempts to comfort the sick Alex Randall. She is stunned when Alex reveals an outrageous plan to save the mother of his child.

Episodes.Name: Dragonfly in Amber
Episodes.Description: In 1968, Claire attends a wake with her daughter; in 1746, the battle of Culloden Moor is looming.

Episodes.Name: The Battle Joined
Episodes.Description: Jamie's past provides his only hope of survival following the Battle of Culloden; a pregnant Claire attempts to adjust to life in 1940s Boston.

Episodes.Name: Surrender
Episodes.Description: Hiding in an isolated cave, Jamie leads a lonely life until Lallybroch is threatened by redcoats pursuing the elusive Jacobite traitor known as "Red Jamie." Back in Boston, Claire and Frank struggle to coexist in a marriage haunted by the ghost of Jamie's love."

Episodes.Name: All Debts Paid
Episodes.Description: In prison, Jamie discovers that an old foe has become the warden - and now has the power to make his life a living hell. Over the years, Claire and Frank both put their best foot forward to share a harmonious marriage, but an uninvited guest shatters this illusion, bringing their differences to light.

Episodes.Name: Of Lost Things
Episodes.Description: While serving as groomsman at the aristocratic estate of Helwater, Jamie is reluctantly pulled into the intrigue of a noble British family. In 1968 Scotland, Claire, Brianna and Roger struggle to trace Jamie's whereabouts in history, leaving Claire to wonder if they will ever find him again.

Episodes.Name: Freedom & Whisky
Episodes.Description: As Brianna grapples with the life-changing revelations of the past summer, Claire must help her come to terms with the fact that she is truly her father's daughter - her 18th century Highlander father. To complicate matters further, Roger brings news that forces Claire and Brianna to face an impossible choice.

Episodes.Name: A. Malcolm
Episodes.Description: After decades apart, Jamie and Claire finally reunite and rekindle their emotional and physical bonds. But Jamie's new business dealings jeopardize the couples' hopes for a simple life together.

Episodes.Name: Crème de Menthe
Episodes.Description: In the aftermath of a violent confrontation, Claire follows her conscience as a surgeon, even though it could put her and Jamie's lives at risk. At the same time, Jamie attempts to evade the reach of the Crown as its representative closes in on his illegal dealings.

Episodes.Name: First Wife
Episodes.Description: Claire returns to Lallybroch with Jamie, where she does not receive quite the reception she was expecting; the choices Jamie made during their time apart comes back to haunt them.

Episodes.Name: The Doldrums
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jamie leave Scotland, sailing to the West Indies on an urgent quest. But when the superstitious crew looks for someone to blame after a string of bad luck, rescue comes from an unlikely source.

Episodes.Name: Heaven and Earth
Episodes.Description: Claire races to discover the source of an epidemic aboard a disease-stricken ship before hundreds of sailors die. And as Jamie locks horns with Captain Raines, Fergus finds himself torn between loyalty and love.

Episodes.Name: Uncharted
Episodes.Description: After making a leap of faith, Claire washes up on a seemingly deserted island where survival is her only option. Navigating treacherous waters has crippled the Artemis, so Jamie devises a joyful moment for his crew in the midst of devastating setbacks.

Episodes.Name: The Bakra
Episodes.Description: The Artemis finally reaches Jamaica bringing Jamie and Claire that much closer to their goal. During a lavish ball on the island, the Frasers encounter old allies, as well as former adversaries who threaten to derail their mission.

Episodes.Name: Eye of the Storm
Episodes.Description: Claire is forced to play a game of cat and mouse with an old adversary as she searches for Young Ian. The Frasers race through the jungles of Jamaica to prevent the unthinkable.

Episodes.Name: America the Beautiful
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jamie cross paths with Stephen Bonnet, a pirate and smuggler who enlists their help. Claire illuminates Jamie on some of America's history, leading him to wonder if it's possible for them to lay down roots.

Episodes.Name: Do No Harm
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jamie visit his Aunt Jocasta at her plantation, River Run. When tragedy strikes at the plantation, Jamie and Claire find themselves caught between what's right and the law of the land.

Episodes.Name: The False Bride
Episodes.Description: Jamie and Claire search for a place to call home. Meanwhile, in the 20th century, Brianna and Roger's romance heats up and then fizzles during a road trip that winds up highlighting their differences.

Episodes.Name: Common Ground
Episodes.Description: Having been led by providence to Fraser's Ridge, Jamie, Claire and Young Ian begin to build a home in the Blue Ridge Mountains. In the 20th Century, Roger tries to reconnect with Brianna.

Episodes.Name: Savages
Episodes.Description: Claire's medical expertise proves invaluable, but she begins to fear for her life when tragedy strikes her patients' household. Jamie and Young Ian travel to a nearby town to recruit settlers for Fraser's Ridge.

Episodes.Name: Blood of My Blood
Episodes.Description: Jamie and Claire are surprised when Lord John Grey drops in on Fraser's Ridge with an unexpected traveling companion; when Grey takes ill, Claire must reconcile her personal feelings with her duties as a doctor.

Episodes.Name: Down the Rabbit Hole
Episodes.Description: Brianna follows in her mother's footsteps and travels through the stones back in time to 18th century Scotland, where she struggles to make her way to the Colonies to find her parents

Episodes.Name: Wilmington
Episodes.Description: Roger's diligent search for Brianna pays off when he finds her in Wilmington, but their romantic reunion comes to an abrupt halt when she discovered pertinent information that he intentionally kept from her.

Episodes.Name: The Birds and The Bees
Episodes.Description: As Brianna struggles to compartmentalize the trauma she suffered in the wake of the tragedy that befell her in Wilmington, she refocuses on finding her parents.

Episodes.Name: The Deep Heart's Core
Episodes.Description: Jamie and Claire keep secrets from one another as they try to help Brianna process her recent trauma; however, the secrets they keep cause a bigger familial rift once they are revealed.

Episodes.Name: If Not For Hope
Episodes.Description: Jamie, Claire and Young Ian embark on a long and uncertain journey to rescue Roger, while Brianna forges a friendship with one of Jamie's old friends.

Episodes.Name: Providence
Episodes.Description: Brianna confronts a violent figure from her past in an attempt to cope with her trauma; Roger befriends a fellow captive and endeavors to escape the Mohawk Village, while Fergus and Marsali plan a dangerous mission.

Episodes.Name: Man of Worth
Episodes.Description: The attempt to rescue Roger from his Mohawk captors goes awry when a ghost from Claire's past lays waste to their plan. Meanwhile, a heavily pregnant Brianna anxiously awaits their return at River Run.

Episodes.Name: The Fiery Cross
Episodes.Description: The celebrations in honor of the wedding of Brianna and Roger. Governor Tryon reminds Jamie of his obligation to persecute and kill Murtagh Fitzgibbons.

Episodes.Name: Between Two Fires
Episodes.Description: As Jamie continues to hunt Murtagh with the aid of the zealous Lieutenant Hamilton Knox, he's forced to consider whether or not he's on the right side of history.

Episodes.Name: Free Will
Episodes.Description: The growing Regulator threat forces Jamie, Claire and Roger to embark on a mission to raise a militia.

Episodes.Name: The Company We Keep
Episodes.Description: Roger leads Jamie's militia to the trading post of Brownsville and finds himself embroiled in a bitter feud. Jamie and Claire arrive to find that Roger's unusual strategy may have cost them the loyalty of the militia.

Episodes.Name: Perpetual Adoration
Episodes.Description: Jamie and his militia arrive at Hillsborough to learn that Governor Tryon has proposed a rather unorthodox solution to deal with the threat posed by the Regulators and to resolve the growing political crisis.

Episodes.Name: Better to Marry Than Burn
Episodes.Description: At Jocasta's wedding, Jamie learns Tryon's true motivation for ending the Regulator threat.

Episodes.Name: The Ballad of Roger Mac
Episodes.Description: The Regulator Rebellion reaches a boiling point, forcing Jamie to face his fear and confront the consequence of his divided loyalties.

Episodes.Name: Famous Last Words
Episodes.Description: The Frasers must come to terms with all that has changed in the aftermath of the Battle of Alamance Creek. Brianna tries to help Roger overcome the trauma he has endured. An unexpected visitor arrives at the Ridge.

Episodes.Name: Monsters and Heroes
Episodes.Description: When Jamie is bitten by a venomous snake, Claire fears she may not have the resources to save him; Jamie asks Roger to complete an important task in the event of his death.

Episodes.Name: Mercy Shall Follow Me
Episodes.Description: Jamie and Roger implement their plan to eliminate the threat looming over them, but it goes awry; Brianna is forced to confront her greatest fear and fight for her and her son's lives.

Episodes.Name: Journeycake
Episodes.Description: Roger and Brianna need to decide if they want to stay or return to the future; Jamie discovers a new power that started from an unrest in the backcountry.

Episodes.Name: Never My Love
Episodes.Description: Claire struggles to survive brutal treatment from her captors, as Jamie gathers a group of loyal men to help him rescue his wife; Roger and Brianna's journey takes a surprising turn.

Episodes.Name: Echoes
Episodes.Description: Claire and Jamie continue the fight to protect those they love, as the threat of the Revolutionary War looms over Fraser's Ridge.

Episodes.Name: Allegiance
Episodes.Description: Jamie struggles with his first request as Indian Agent. Roger presides over an unusual funeral. Marsali gives birth. However, the joy is short lived when a discovery is made.

Episodes.Name: Temperance
Episodes.Description: Fergus worries about his new son's quality of life when the baby is bullied by superstitious Protestants. Claire performs surgery on Tom's hand.

Episodes.Name: Hour of the Wolf
Episodes.Description: Ian reveals to Jamie his life among the Mohawks. Jamie tells Chief Bird something he should consider in the future.

Episodes.Name: Give Me Liberty
Episodes.Description: There is something in the air. Jamie and lord John talk about politics. Roger receives an excellent news.

Episodes.Name: The World Turned Upside Down
Episodes.Description: A dysentery epidemic spreads on the Ridge, and Claire falls deathly ill. She is almost recovered when the Christies arrive and drop a bombshell. As nefarious rumors spread like wildfire on the Ridge, tragedy strikes.

Episodes.Name: Sticks and Stones
Episodes.Description: Claire struggles with her inner demons as a nefarious rumor begins to spread on the Ridge. Tensions rise as residents fear there is a dangerous person in their midst.

Episodes.Name: I Am Not Alone
Episodes.Description: Richard Brown and his Committee of Safety arrive to arrest Claire for murder. However, due to the rising political tensions in the colonies, Brown's plan to find a judge for a trial does not go as expected.

Name: Outlander
Summary: An English combat nurse from 1945 is mysteriously swept back in time to 1743.

Trailers.Title: Outlander | Official Trailer | STARZ
Trailers.Description: What if your future was your past? Get an extended new look into the STARZ Original Series, Outlander. Watch Outlander now on ...

Trailers.Title: OUTLANDER - Season 1 Trailer
Trailers.Description: Pre-order the Complete Season One Collector's Edition now http://amzn.to/1OPFidL Outlander follows the story of Claire Randall, ...

Trailers.Title: Outlander | First Look Trailer | STARZ
Trailers.Description: The epic tale becomes a reality. Welcome to the world of Outlander. Watch Outlander now on the STARZ app: ...

Episodes.Name: Sugarwood
Episodes.Description: After his business partner cheats a dangerous client, financial adviser Marty must devise a radical plan to save the lives of himself and his family.

Episodes.Name: Blue Cat
Episodes.Description: In the Ozarks, Marty struggles to find a local business he can use for money laundering, while his kids make new friends but neglect a crucial duty.

Episodes.Name: My Dripping Sleep
Episodes.Description: Marty finds a way to control Ruth. Wendy worms her way into a job. Looking for another business to invest in, Marty digs for info on the strip bar.

Episodes.Name: Tonight We Improvise
Episodes.Description: Marty hires Ruth to pull off a heist. Agent Petty forges a relationship with a member of the Langmore family. Jonah exhibits disturbing behavior.

Episodes.Name: Ruling Days
Episodes.Description: Marty decides to invest in the religious sector, unaware he will disrupt a discreet business operation. A surprise visitor shows up at the Byrde home.

Episodes.Name: Book of Ruth
Episodes.Description: Jacob educates Marty on his business. Ruth devises and sets in motion a deadly plan. Rachel learns Marty is cooking the books at the Blue Cat Lodge.

Episodes.Name: Nest Box
Episodes.Description: To stop Jacob from carrying out his threat, Marty makes an offer. Agent Petty gets what he needs to turn Russ. Charlotte grows desperate to escape.

Episodes.Name: Kaleidoscope
Episodes.Description: In a flashback to 10 years prior, Wendy struggles with depression, Del asks Marty to be his financial advisor, and Agent Petty faces a family crisis.

Episodes.Name: Coffee, Black
Episodes.Description: Russ learns Agent Petty's true identity and makes plans to murder, steal and flee. Wendy stumbles on an ideal business to add to the Byrde portfolio.

Episodes.Name: The Toll
Episodes.Description: During his next sermon, Mason falters. Wendy and the kids are caught trying to flee their home. Marty brokers a deal between Jacob and Del.

Episodes.Name: Reparations
Episodes.Description: Ruth's dad gets out of jail. Approval for a riverboat casino calls for Wendy's political skills. The Mexican cartel demands reparations from the Snells.

Episodes.Name: The Precious Blood of Jesus
Episodes.Description: When a mobster jeopardizes the casino bill, Marty enlists Buddy's help. Wendy resorts to dirty tactics to get votes. Cade reminds Ruth of her roots.

Episodes.Name: Once a Langmore...
Episodes.Description: Wendy does damage control when Wilkes's pressure on Sen. Blake backfires. Rachel is sent on a mission. Ruth resists accepting her Langmore destiny.

Episodes.Name: Stag
Episodes.Description: The FBI sends out a second lure. Charlotte slips up while chatting with Wyatt. The Byrdes grow wary of Rachel, who deflects suspicion onto someone else.

Episodes.Name: Game Day
Episodes.Description: Agent Petty's revelation tests the loyalties of Marty, Ruth and the cartel. Despite the FBI closing in, the Snells refuse to destroy their poppies.

Episodes.Name: Outer Darkness
Episodes.Description: An FBI search of the Snells' field yields a surprise. Playing hardball, Agent Petty questions Wilkes. The Byrdes mourn a loss.

Episodes.Name: One Way Out
Episodes.Description: Mason goes off the deep end and focuses his rage on the Byrdes. Ruth tries to make her dad proud during a boat-part heist.

Episodes.Name: The Big Sleep
Episodes.Description: Darlene makes one too many rash moves. Marty tries to free Rachel from Agent Petty's grasp. Jonah helps his mom force Wilkes to continue his support.

Episodes.Name: The Badger
Episodes.Description: Marty finds a way around the Snells. Charlotte hires a lawyer. The Byrdes get a meeting with the gaming commission, whose approval comes with a big ask.

Episodes.Name: The Gold Coast
Episodes.Description: Marty makes plans without telling Wendy. Darlene sends a message via Jonah. Wyatt learns the truth about his dad. Ruth realizes Cade must be stopped.

Episodes.Name: Wartime
Episodes.Description: Marty is pressured to move money ahead of schedule, Wendy pitches a high-stakes plan, Wyatt lives the good life, and Ruth butts heads in the casino.

Episodes.Name: Civil Union
Episodes.Description: Wendy asks Helen - not Marty - to help close a deal, the Byrdes get a new houseguest, and business goes boom aboard a rival casino.

Episodes.Name: Kevin Cronin Was Here
Episodes.Description: The FBI dives into the casino's finances, Wendy's dreams take a dark turn, and Marty worries that the writing may be on the wall.

Episodes.Name: Boss Fight
Episodes.Description: As Wendy, Helen and Ruth strive to keep the business humming, Navarro plays mind games with Marty, who worries he'll never see his family again.

Episodes.Name: It Came from Michoacán
Episodes.Description: Maya steps up her bid to turn Marty, whose eerily calm demeanor has Wendy worried. The Byrdes buy a horse farm on behalf of Navarro.

Episodes.Name: Su Casa Es Mi Casa
Episodes.Description: Marty and Wendy tell each other how they really feel, Ruth confronts Wyatt, Darlene lets her ambitions be known, and Ben's past comes into focus.

Episodes.Name: In Case of Emergency
Episodes.Description: The FBI questions Ruth, tensions between Cosgrove and Marty hit a new high, Sue takes on a new patient, and Wendy recruits for her foundation.

Episodes.Name: BFF
Episodes.Description: Ruth isn't happy about Marty and Wendy's plan to bury the hatchet with Frank Jr. The Byrdes make a difficult decision about Ben. Maya is reprimanded.

Episodes.Name: Fire Pink
Episodes.Description: Ben's confrontation with Helen and Erin sends the Byrdes into crisis mode. Meanwhile, Sam's concerns about the FBI inspire little sympathy.

Episodes.Name: All In
Episodes.Description: While Wendy battles personal demons, Marty struggles to keep their lives from falling apart. Darlene does Ruth a favor.

Episodes.Name: The Beginning of the End
Episodes.Description: Marty and Wendy wrestle with a problematic offer. Ruth goes out on her own, Jonah rebels, and Omar's nephew makes his presence known.

Episodes.Name: Let the Great World Spin
Episodes.Description: Maya pushes back on Marty's plan for Omar. Ruth pursues the hipster heroin market. Wendy tries to raise $150 million. The new sheriff causes problems.

Episodes.Name: City on the Make
Episodes.Description: Maya and Omar meet face-to-face. Wendy has a contentious business meeting. Ruth goes behind Darlene's back. Jonah finds a new place to set up shop.

Episodes.Name: Ace Deuce
Episodes.Description: Wendy's claims about Ben anger Ruth. Mel the P.I. tracks down Wendy's father. Ruth's trip to the Missouri Belle with Kerry doesn't go as planned.

Episodes.Name: Ellie
Episodes.Description: The Senator extends an olive branch--with a twist. Ruth and Marty scramble to rebuy the drugs Darlene sold. Charlotte ponders life after high school.

Episodes.Name: Sangre Sobre Todo
Episodes.Description: Marty is tasked with proving Omar wasn't involved with a bombing. Wendy pays a visit to the Lazy-O Motel. Ruth and Wyatt make a plan.

Episodes.Name: Sanctified
Episodes.Description: The FBI's long-awaited meeting with Omar takes place. Wyatt shares some news with Ruth. Feeling betrayed, Javi gets aggressive.

Episodes.Name: The Cousin of Death
Episodes.Description: Devastated by a tremendous loss, Ruth heads to Chicago to enact revenge as Marty tries to talk her out of doing something she might regret.

Episodes.Name: Pick a God and Pray
Episodes.Description: Their deal with the FBI now dead, the Byrdes desperately search for more solutions to their growing problems. Wendy's father comes to town.

Episodes.Name: You're the Boss
Episodes.Description: Marty travels to the Navarro estate, Ruth asks Frank Jr. for a favour, a new acting sheriff makes waves and Wendy tries to bring Jim back into the fold.

Episodes.Name: Pound of Flesh and Still Kickin'
Episodes.Description: Ruth makes a play for the casino with some help from a familiar face. Wendy cozies up to Omar's sister and arranges a meeting with Clare.

Episodes.Name: Trouble the Water
Episodes.Description: Nathan angers Wendy by making Charlotte and Jonah a surprising offer. Ruth tries to erase her own past with an assist from Charles Wilkes.

Episodes.Name: Mud
Episodes.Description: Omar pressures Marty to launder more money, but Ruth wants to keep her casino clean. Wendy goes to extremes to keep her children.

Episodes.Name: A Hard Way to Go
Episodes.Description: Every desperate deal. Every broken promise. Every bloody murder. Eager to leave their murky past behind, the Byrdes make a final bid for freedom.

Name: Ozark
Summary: A financial advisor drags his family from Chicago to the Missouri Ozarks, where he must launder money to appease a drug boss.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.1
Episodes.Description: Thomas Shelby plans to fix a horse race; some guns turn up stolen.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.2
Episodes.Description: Thomas Shelby starts a feud with a gypsy family and finally meets with Inspector Campbell to talk about the stolen guns.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.3
Episodes.Description: Thomas is livid to find out that Ada and Freddie are married; IRA sympathizers tries to get information from Thomas about the stolen guns.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.4
Episodes.Description: Thomas attempts to make a deal with Campbell; The Peaky's war with the Lees intensifies.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.5
Episodes.Description: The Shelbys get a surprise visit by an almost forgotten relative. Thomas has one more dangerous plan with the cops.

Episodes.Name: Episode #1.6
Episodes.Description: Tommy and the Peaky Blinders prepare for a big operation, that quickly becomes way trickier than they thought.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.1
Episodes.Description: When Birmingham crime boss Tommy Shelby's beloved Garrison pub is bombed, he finds himself blackmailed into murdering an Irish dissident.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.2
Episodes.Description: After murdering an Irish dissident, Tommy has no choice but to be a pawn in Inspector Campbell's treacherous political game.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.3
Episodes.Description: After joining London crime boss Alfie Solomons in a business venture, Tommy worries that Alfie's newly revealed volatility could pose a problem.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.4
Episodes.Description: The Peaky Blinders take over London's Eden Club; Sabini convinces his old adversary Alfie Solomons to join forces and eradicate the gang.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.5
Episodes.Description: The Peaky Blinders are under attack. Tommy's power base in London is obliterated, and both Arthur and Michael are arrested and imprisoned.

Episodes.Name: Episode #2.6
Episodes.Description: Tommy plans to execute the mission given to him by Campbell: the assassination of a high-ranking member of the military establishment.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.1
Episodes.Description: It is Thomas Shelby's long-awaited wedding day. A mysterious visitor imperils the entire Shelby family, and Tommy finds himself pulled into a web of intrigue more lethal than anything he has yet encountered.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.2
Episodes.Description: Tommy discovers the extent of the mission given to him and the extreme lengths his new paymasters are willing to go to in their quest for power. Meanwhile his own family's activities lead to escalating danger in Birmingham.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.3
Episodes.Description: Tommy travels to Wales seeking absolution and uncovers a traitor in the Economic League. Michael develops a taste for guns. Arthur gets good news.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.4
Episodes.Description: Polly goes to confession, igniting a chain of events that reveals a trap being laid at the Shelbys' expense. Tommy plans an exit from dirty business.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.5
Episodes.Description: As the Russians test the Peaky Blinders, Tommy realises that he is seriously outmaneuvered. But he has an ace up his sleeve.

Episodes.Name: Episode #3.6
Episodes.Description: As Tommy prepares to commit the most audacious crime of his career, an unexpected blow forces him to face his worst fears in a race against time.

Episodes.Name: The Noose
Episodes.Description: It is Christmas and Tommy Shelby receives a letter that makes him realize that he and every member of the family are in danger. He knows that it is time for the family to bury their differences and face the enemy together.

Episodes.Name: Heathens
Episodes.Description: As the Shelbys come to terms with shocking events, Tommy makes a decision he may come to regret. Meanwhile, a bold new enemy makes his move.

Episodes.Name: Blackbird
Episodes.Description: Luca Changretta understands the complexity of his enemy, as the weight of gypsy tradition hangs upon Arthur. But could there be a traitor within the Peaky Blinders' midst?

Episodes.Name: Dangerous
Episodes.Description: In a daring cat and mouse chase, will Tommy be outwitted by his enemies? And with the return of an old friend, Tommy tries to distract himself with other pursuits.

Episodes.Name: The Duel
Episodes.Description: Tommy prepares himself as the bloody battle lines are drawn between the Peaky Blinders and Changretta. A deal is struck - with potentially devastating consequences.

Episodes.Name: The Company
Episodes.Description: During the fight between Goliath and Bonnie Gold events escalate. Then Audrey Changretta appears at a funeral, waving a white flag. She proposes to declare the Vendetta between her family and the Shelbys settled. And she names her price.

Episodes.Name: Black Tuesday
Episodes.Description: In the wake of the Wall Street Crash, Tommy faces new dangers from unexpected quarters.

Episodes.Name: Black Cats
Episodes.Description: As the Peaky Blinders come under fire, Tommy is warned about a traitor in his midst.

Episodes.Name: Strategy
Episodes.Description: As the charismatic Mosley shows his hand, Tommy makes a treacherous new alliance.

Episodes.Name: The Loop
Episodes.Description: Tommy agrees to dangerous new partnerships, and a Shelby party promises fireworks.

Episodes.Name: The Shock
Episodes.Description: As Tommy reveals his intentions for Mosley, someone close to the Shelbys is targeted.

Episodes.Name: Mr. Jones
Episodes.Description: Family tensions surface after an unexpected announcement. Tommy puts his plan for Oswald Mosley into action, but has he underestimated his opponent?

Episodes.Name: Black Day
Episodes.Description: Tommy sets off to North America, where the end of Prohibition brings new opportunities. But he faces new danger from an old adversary who is finally making his move.

Episodes.Name: Black Shirt
Episodes.Description: Tommy gets involved in a power game with fascists, freedom fighters and Boston gangsters. As the players plan to double cross him, Tommy visits an old ally in Camden.

Episodes.Name: Gold
Episodes.Description: Faced with devastating news, Tommy goes on a quest to discover who it was that placed a curse on his family. In Birmingham, Ada takes charge, and Arthur takes on some new recruits

Episodes.Name: Sapphire
Episodes.Description: Tommy establishes a connection between crime and political power that could alter the course of history. He also receives life-changing news from an unexpected source.

Episodes.Name: The Road to Hell
Episodes.Description: In the light of extraordinary personal revelations, Tommy takes a course of action that will change everything. Meanwhile, his enemies' plans start to fall into place.

Episodes.Name: Lock and Key
Episodes.Description: As the clouds of the coming storm gather, Tommy Shelby faces the consequences of his experiences and his actions

Episodes.Name: Pentagram
Episodes.Description: Mother receives unexpected guests with sinister plans. Are humans and androids the only inhabitants of Kepler-22b?

Episodes.Name: Virtual Faith
Episodes.Description: After the Mithraic kids fall sick, Campion believes Mother is poisoning them and plans an escape. As Mother and Father attempt to prove otherwise, Marcus and Sue work to convince the other surviving Mithraic to mount a rescue of the children, desperate to get their son Paul back.

Episodes.Name: Nature's Course
Episodes.Description: Father tries to teach the children how to hunt some of Kepler-22b's mysterious creatures for food. Meanwhile, the Mithraic make a stunning discovery that potentially fulfills a Mithraic prophecy, and a debate about how to proceed ignites a conflict between Marcus and the Mithraic leader, Ambrose.

Episodes.Name: Infected Memory
Episodes.Description: Marcus moves forward with a plan to rescue the Mithraic children, but first he has to find them. Back at the settlement, Campion and Paul bond while on a hunting expedition with Father, and Mother attempts to learn more about her origins.

Episodes.Name: Lost Paradise
Episodes.Description: After rekindling her connection to her creator, Mother finds herself distracted by intense feelings she didn't know she was capable of having, unaware that Marcus, Sue and the Mithraic are closing in on the settlement.

Episodes.Name: Faces
Episodes.Description: Marcus' decisions stress his relationship to his family as he struggles to maintain his clout as leader of the Mithraic. Mother is able to see Marcus for who he truly is, which threatens his power and puts Mother in a precarious situation she might not recover from. Meanwhile, Campion is faced with a choice that could result in dire consequences.

Episodes.Name: Mass
Episodes.Description: As Marcus continues to embrace his Mithraic devotion, Sue worries he may no longer have her and Paul's best interests at heart. Mother experiences what she believes to be malfunctions, and Hunter works on a secret project with Father.

Episodes.Name: Umbilical
Episodes.Description: Sue is determined to keep the children safe, and in doing so, struggles with whether or not she can trust Mother. Meanwhile, a new threat arises and an increasingly erratic Marcus causes the Mithraic to question their leader.

Episodes.Name: The Beginning
Episodes.Description: Paul displays troubling behavior that leads to a revelation; Sue confides in Mother, while Father battles human-like emotions; as Campion questions his place in his new family, Mother and Father uncover a secret about the native creatures.

Episodes.Name: The Collective
Episodes.Description: While Mother, Father, and the children face hostility from their new atheist collective, Marcus sets out to fill the walls of an ancient church with Sol's worshipers.

Episodes.Name: Seven
Episodes.Description: Campion is hurt meeting the serpent. The Trust tasks the collective with hunting #7 down. Mother must reconcile her feelings. Convinced the serpent will lead him to the Tree of Knowledge, Marcus sets out to find it before the atheists do.

Episodes.Name: Good Creatures
Episodes.Description: Upon learning that the serpent is nonviolent, Mother fiercely protects it, while Father busies himself with the regeneration of a new android. Endowed with mysterious new powers, Marcus grows his congregation.

Episodes.Name: Control
Episodes.Description: After the Trust uses Paul to strike back against Marcus, Mother confronts the Trust and threatens a coup. Meanwhile, on the run from Mother, Marcus has to keep his followers from losing faith as his powers suddenly disappear.

Episodes.Name: King
Episodes.Description: Mother struggles to keep the collective from falling apart as she struggles to lead while Sue resorts to prayer in her desperation to cure Paul. Meanwhile, Marcus and his followers are given new hope as they discover an ancient temple. But as Marcus investigates the temple's secrets, Decima and the rest of his followers are made to answer for their sins.

Episodes.Name: The Tree
Episodes.Description: As they try and fail to open the seed box, Sue and Paul realize they need Marcus's help. Sue makes a plan to break Marcus out of the brig while Mother is distracted with the imminent birth of Tempest's baby. But when Sue, Paul and Marcus finally open the seed box, they make a horrifying discovery.

Episodes.Name: Feeding
Episodes.Description: A reeling Marcus and Paul join forces with Mother to disarm the newly weaponized serpent before it wreaks unimaginable havoc.

Episodes.Name: Happiness
Episodes.Description: Grandmother reveals her own agenda. Marcus seeks revenge, and Mother sets out to neutralize the serpent - but is leveled by the fallout.

Episodes.Name: Pilot

Episodes.Name: Lawnmower Dog

Episodes.Description: It's Christmas. Rick shrinks Morty, injecting him into a homeless man to save Anatomy Park. Jerry tries to have a Christmas free of electronic devices, but regrets his decision when his parents introduce him to their new friend.

Episodes.Name: Big Trouble in Little Sanchez
Episodes.Description: Rick joins in on some hijinks by transferring his consciousness into teenage "Tiny Rick." Beth and Jerry sort out their relationship.

Episodes.Name: Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate
Episodes.Description: Jerry is faced with the difficult decision of losing his manhood in order to save an alien leader from imminent death. Meanwhile, Rick, Morty and Summer explore the possibilities of interdimensional television.

Episodes.Name: Look Who's Purging Now
Episodes.Description: Rick and Morty arrive on an alien planet to fix their ship just as the day of the purge begins there, Jerry and Summer work on their father-daughter relationship, but his lack of employment keeps coming up.

Episodes.Name: The Wedding Squanchers
Episodes.Description: The Smith family is invited to the wedding of Rick's best friend, Birdperson. Things go south when it's discovered that the bride isn't who she says she is.

Episodes.Name: The Rickshank Rickdemption
Episodes.Description: Rick, still in galactic prison, puts an intricate escape plan into action. Back on Earth, which is now under federation control, Morty and Summer have an argument about their grandpa.

Episodes.Name: Rickmancing the Stone
Episodes.Description: With the kids dealing with their parents' divorce, Rick takes them to a Mad Max-style universe where he tries to steal a green crystal from a group of scavengers.

Episodes.Name: Pickle Rick
Episodes.Description: Rick turns himself into a pickle while Beth, Summer, and Morty go to family therapy.

Episodes.Name: Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender
Episodes.Description: Rick and Morty are summoned by the Vindicators to stop Worldender but end up in a deathtrap conceived by Drunk Rick.

Episodes.Name: The Whirly Dirly Conspiracy
Episodes.Description: Rick takes Jerry on a sympathy adventure to a resort where everyone is immortal when there, and Jerry meets some old acquaintances of Rick's who want payback.

Episodes.Name: Rest and Ricklaxation
Episodes.Description: Following a stressful adventure, Rick and Morty go on a break to a spa where they remove their toxins, which in turn take a form of their own.

Episodes.Name: The Ricklantis Mixup
Episodes.Description: Whilst Rick and Morty go off to adventure in Atlantis, we take a look at how the Citadel has rebuilt itself since both Rick and Morty visited.

Episodes.Name: Morty's Mind Blowers
Episodes.Description: Rick reveals to Morty his "Morty's mind blowers," a collection of memories Morty asked Rick to erase from his mind.

Episodes.Name: The ABCs of Beth
Episodes.Description: Rick brings Beth to a world he created for her when she was younger while Beth looks for a long-lost childhood friend trapped there for years.

Episodes.Name: The Rickchurian Mortydate
Episodes.Description: Rick and Morty are called upon by the president to kill a vicious alien in the secret tunnels under the White House.

Episodes.Name: Edge of Tomorty: Rick Die Rickpeat
Episodes.Description: Rick brings Morty to a planet containing crystals that show whoever is touching them all the ways they may die depending on their choices.

Episodes.Name: The Old Man and the Seat
Episodes.Description: Rick goes to his private bathroom to find that someone else has used it. Jerry creates an app with an unlikely alien and Morty pays the price.

Episodes.Name: One Crew over the Crewcoo's Morty
Episodes.Description: On a treasure-seeking expedition in an alien temple, Rick and Morty discover that a heist expert has snatched the prize from under their noses. Further twists, turns and double-crosses abound.

Episodes.Name: Claw and Hoarder: Special Ricktim's Morty
Episodes.Description: Morty asks Rick for a dragon and Rick finds a wizard of another dimension who makes a soul bonding contract between Morty and a dragon called Balthromaw. Meanwhile, Jerry meets a talking cat in his bedroom who wants to fly to Florida.

Episodes.Name: Rattlestar Ricklactica
Episodes.Description: Morty discovers a race of intelligent space snakes after suffering a potentially lethal bite. Jerry attempts to prove that he isn't completely incompetent.

Episodes.Name: Never Ricking Morty
Episodes.Description: An anthology episode that follows Rick and Morty on a train with people who don't like Rick. They have to find their way out but they bump into unexpected situations along the way.

Episodes.Name: Promortyus
Episodes.Description: Rick, Morty and Summer visit an alien civilisation, where Rick and Morty are controlled by parasites and Summer lives a luxurious lifestyle.

Episodes.Name: The Vat of Acid Episode
Episodes.Description: Rick & Morty go on a simple exchange as Rick tells Morty if something goes wrong jump into the same vat of acid as he does.

Episodes.Name: Childrick of Mort
Episodes.Description: Rick, Morty, Beth, Summer and Jerry share a galactic adventure.

Episodes.Name: Star Mort Rickturn of the Jerri
Episodes.Description: An adventure with an invisibility belt, but a family that disappears together, must stay together.

Episodes.Name: Mort Dinner Rick Andre
Episodes.Description: Rick hosts dinner for his ocean dwelling nemesis, while Morty gets the wine.

Episodes.Name: Mortyplicity
Episodes.Description: The Smiths suspect they're being hunted. But who's even real?

Episodes.Name: A Rickconvenient Mort
Episodes.Description: Morty falls in love with an ecological heroine named Planetina, and quickly has trouble with the people that created her. Rick and Summer visit planets that are about to stop existing to have crazy parties and forget their problems.

Episodes.Name: Rickdependence Spray
Episodes.Description: Morty has the idea to use a horse breeding mount to extract his semen, but after Rick tries to use it to create a weapon, thinking it was horse sperm, he ends up creating sperm monsters that threaten the entire country.

Episodes.Name: Amortycan Grickfitti
Episodes.Description: Summer and Morty steal Rick's car to impress a new kid at school. Meanwhile, Rick and Jerry have a guys' night from hell.

Episodes.Name: Rick & Morty's Thanksploitation Spectacular
Episodes.Description: In this Thanksgiving episode, Rick and Morty need to get a presidential pardon.

Episodes.Name: Gotron Jerrysis Rickvangelion
Episodes.Description: Summer enables Rick's addiction to collecting giant combining robots, and the family becomes The Family.

Episodes.Name: Rickternal Friendshine of the Spotless Mort
Episodes.Description: Rick attempts to save a beloved friend.

Episodes.Name: Forgetting Sarick Mortshall
Episodes.Description: Rick gets new sidekicks, while Morty makes a new friend.

Episodes.Name: Rickmurai Jack
Episodes.Description: Rick is living his best anime life. Meanwhile in the Citadel of Ricks, a long game played by one particular Morty is reaching its conclusion.

Episodes.Name: Solaricks
Episodes.Description: The Smiths deal with last season's fallout, and Rick and Morty are stranded in space floating in the remnants of the Citadel.

Episodes.Name: Rick: A Mort Well Lived
Episodes.Description: Morty is trapped and Rick needs to save him, but to do so, Summer must do a Die Hard (1988). This won't be easy, because she's never seen it.

Episodes.Name: Bethic Twinstinct
Episodes.Description: Thanksgiving brings Space Beth home, with the two Beths forming a bond. Morty has the most realistic gaming console ever.

Episodes.Name: Night Family
Episodes.Description: Rick's latest piece of alien technology allows the family to order their sleeping bodies to perform tasks whilst they continue to rest. Whilst the family see immediate benefits, the "night family" start to question their side of the deal.

Episodes.Name: Final DeSmithation
Episodes.Description: After a fortune cookie at Panda Express somehow has the ability to change someone's fate, Rick and Jerry must go on an adventure to stop and steal this ability.

Episodes.Name: Juricksic Mort
Episodes.Description: Seemingly out of the blue, Earth's old rulers return. They make a great case for changing the way society does business, but Rick isn't going to put up with it.

Episodes.Name: Full Meta Jackrick
Episodes.Description: Rick and Morty find themselves caught in a confusing, meta-powered loop of adventures, leading to a showdown with an unmotivated nemesis.

Episodes.Name: Analyze Piss
Episodes.Description: Tired of being attacked by goofball supervillains, Rick decides to seek advice about why he's always a target, leading to a breakthrough - for Jerry.

Episodes.Name: A Rick in King Mortur's Mort
Episodes.Description: Morty starts a war on worlds after debunking the entire existence of the Knights of the Sun and is forced to take extreme measures in order to put an end to it all.

Episodes.Name: Ricktional Mortpoon's Rickmas Mortcation
Episodes.Description: What starts as a merry Christmas in the Smith household takes an ugly turn when Morty uncovers a betrayal thanks to a gift from a galaxy far, far away.

Name: Rick and Morty
Summary: An animated series that follows the exploits of a super scientist and his not-so-bright grandson.

Episodes.Name: Godflame
Episodes.Description: A journey of survival begins when an army of Witchfinders attacks the village of Alkenny.

Episodes.Name: Message in a Bottle
Episodes.Description: A special gift for the twins sparks tension in the group.

Episodes.Name: Fresh Blood
Episodes.Description: The twins struggle to keep a secret from their mother.

Episodes.Name: The River
Episodes.Description: An attack on the village leads to sacrifice and new challenges.

Episodes.Name: Plastic
Episodes.Description: As Tamacti Jun's army nears Baba and family, Maghra's past comes to light

Episodes.Name: Silk
Episodes.Description: Baba and family are betrayed. Queen Kane uses her cunning to face a new conflict.

Episodes.Name: The Lavender Road
Episodes.Description: The Witchfinder searches for his queen with Maghra and Boots. Haniwa, Kofun and others are nearing Jerlamarel.

Episodes.Name: House of Enlightenment
Episodes.Description: The twins meet Jerlamarel and finally discover the truth.

Episodes.Name: Brothers and Sisters
Episodes.Description: Baba ventures into hostile territory in search of Haniwa. Queen Kane consecrates a new Payan capital and makes a surprising announcement.

Episodes.Name: Forever
Episodes.Description: An old enemy comes face-to-face with Baba. Jerlamarel struggles to accept a life without sight.

Episodes.Name: The Compass
Episodes.Description: Edo's leadership is called into question. Baba and Haniwa meet a secret tribe of warriors known as The Compass.

Episodes.Name: The Witchfinder
Episodes.Description: Kofun and Toad arrive in Pennsa just as Maghra makes a life-changing decision. Baba, Paris, and Haniwa run into a trusted friend.

Episodes.Name: The Dinner Party
Episodes.Description: Baba and his family are finally reunited, but his joy is cut short when he learns about the queen's plans.

Episodes.Name: The Truth About Unicorns
Episodes.Description: Maghra, Lord Harlan, and Baba head to the peace summit. Haniwa warns them about Paris' vision. The queen and Kofun spend the day together.

Episodes.Name: The Queen's Speech
Episodes.Description: Queen Kane's treachery forces Maghra's hand. Kofun gets upsetting news. Haniwa makes a final plea to Wren in a bid for peace.

Episodes.Name: Rock-a-Bye
Episodes.Description: Baba and Edo lead their armies into an epic battle that builds to an intense face-off between the brothers.

Episodes.Name: Heavy Hangs the Head
Episodes.Description: Baba embraces life in the mountains as hatred for the sighted grows in Pennsa. A Trivantian scientist develops a terrifying new weapon.

Episodes.Name: Watch Out for Wolves
Episodes.Description: After a devastating loss, Baba heads to Pennsa to warn his family. Maghra debates the Witchfinders' fate. Wren stages a daring escape.

Episodes.Name: This Land Is Your Land
Episodes.Description: Wren arrives in Pennsa and shares information about Tormada's plans. Tamacti Jun tries once more to quell the Witchfinders' insurgency.

Episodes.Name: The Storm
Episodes.Description: Tormada presents his new weaponry to The Triangle as Baba leads a group to the House of Enlightenment to destroy Tormada's arsenal.

Episodes.Name: The House of Enlightenment
Episodes.Description: A standoff at the House of Enlightenment gives way to a bloody siege between Baba's party and Tormada's soldiers.

Episodes.Name: The Lowlands
Episodes.Description: Baba and his group take a dangerous shortcut through the lowlands to get to Pennsa. Maghra and Tamacti Jun make a horrifying discovery.

Episodes.Name: God Thunder
Episodes.Description: Tormada and Sibeth launch a violent attack on Pennsa that puts Maghra and the city's inhabitants in grave danger.

Episodes.Name: I See You
Episodes.Description: Baba and Ranger infiltrate Sibeth's camp, determined to stop her and Tormada once and for all.

Name: See
Summary: Far in a dystopian future, the human race has lost the sense of sight, and society has had to find new ways to interact, build, hunt, and to survive. All of that is challenged when a set of twins are born with sight.

Episodes.Name: Reborn
Episodes.Description: Young nanny Leanne is hired to care for baby Jericho. But all is not as it seems.

Episodes.Name: Wood
Episodes.Description: As Leanne settles in, Sean worries that Dorothy and Jericho are not in good hands.

Episodes.Name: Eel
Episodes.Description: Sean enlists Dorothy's brother Julian to monitor her relationship with Leanne.

Episodes.Name: Bear
Episodes.Description: Leanne disobeys an order and discovers why Sean is so protective of baby Jericho.

Episodes.Name: Cricket
Episodes.Description: With Dorothy and Sean gone for the day, Leanne makes a new friend.

Episodes.Name: Rain
Episodes.Description: Leanne's strange uncle arrives unexpectedly; Dorothy fights to keep her nanny.

Episodes.Name: Haggis
Episodes.Description: Dorothy throws a tense dinner party. Sean entrusts Leanne to help keep a secret.

Episodes.Name: Boba
Episodes.Description: Julian is forced to relive a dark memory during a night of babysitting.

Episodes.Name: Jericho
Episodes.Description: Leanne acts out at Dorothy after learning the truth about baby Jericho.

Episodes.Name: Balloon
Episodes.Description: After Jericho's baptism, uninvited guests force difficult decisions.

Episodes.Name: Doll
Episodes.Description: Jericho and Leanne are missing. Dorothy devises a 72-hour game plan, while Sean and Julian continue hiding the truth.

Episodes.Name: Spaceman
Episodes.Description: With Natalie's help, Sean and Julian uncover disturbing details about the cult. Dorothy sacrifices her career reputation for her family.

Episodes.Name: Pizza
Episodes.Description: The Turners open up a family business as a front for a more important mission.
With a new guest in the house, Dorothy resorts to bold tactics to get what she wants.

Episodes.Name: Cake
Episodes.Description: The Turners scramble to prepare for a pivotal meeting. Leanne bakes a mysterious cake.

Episodes.Name: Espresso
Episodes.Description: An unexpected visitor pushes everyone to their limits as Sean re-examines his past and Dorothy attempts to negotiate a delicate exchange.

Episodes.Name: Marino
Episodes.Description: The Marino family tragedy raises more questions about Leanne. Uncle George's presence in the house creates a problem for the Turners.

Episodes.Name: Loveshack
Episodes.Description: Dorothy and Sean get a hopeful sign. Leanne and Julian get to know each other better.

Episodes.Name: Goose
Episodes.Description: As they wait for Jericho's return, Dorothy and Sean pretend everything is fine at a tense Christmas Eve lunch.

Episodes.Name: Josephine
Episodes.Description: An unexpected arrival threatens to tear Dorothy and Sean apart, leaving Leanne defenseless.

Episodes.Name: Donkey
Episodes.Description: Three months after the attack, the Turners head down the shore. Left alone, Leanne has a more exciting day than she anticipated.

Episodes.Name: Hive
Episodes.Description: Dorothy hosts a mommy-and-me group, but Leanne finds that she can't trust strangers.

Episodes.Name: Hair
Episodes.Description: Julian digs for the truth about Jericho. New visitors at the local park worry Leanne.

Episodes.Name: Ring
Episodes.Description: Leanne continues to be upset by other people. Bad luck strikes the Turner brownstone.

Episodes.Name: Tiger
Episodes.Description: The Turners attend a block party on Spruce Street. Leanne finally feels comfortable outside of the house, but she finds herself in danger.

Episodes.Name: Fish
Episodes.Description: Sean's dinner party goes south when Leanne is rude to a guest. Dorothy uncovers frightening details from the block party.

Episodes.Name: Camp
Episodes.Description: Dorothy works with Veera to get Leanne out of the house, but Jericho and Leanne are more connected than they know.

Episodes.Name: Donut
Episodes.Description: Isabelle threatens to uncover Dorothy's past.

Episodes.Name: Commitment
Episodes.Description: Dorothy and Frank hatch a plan to get Leanne out of the Turner household for good.

Episodes.Name: Mama
Episodes.Description: Dorothy makes a desperate final plan.

Episodes.Name: Pigeon
Episodes.Description: The war between Leanne and the Church of the Lesser Saints reaches its peak.

Name: Servant
Summary: A Philadelphia couple is in mourning after an unspeakable tragedy creates a rift in their marriage and opens the door for a mysterious force to enter their home.

Episodes.Name: Good News About Hell
Episodes.Description: Mark is promoted to lead a team who've had their memories surgically divided between their work and personal lives.

Episodes.Name: Half Loop
Episodes.Description: The team train new hire Helly on macrodata refinement. Mark takes a day off to meet with a mysterious former colleague.

Episodes.Name: In Perpetuity
Episodes.Description: Mark takes the team on a field trip, but Helly continues to rebel. A deteriorating Petey struggles to tell Mark about Lumon's misdeeds.

Episodes.Name: The You You Are
Episodes.Description: Irving finds an intriguing book at work. Helly aggressively pursues a meeting with her Outie. Mark attends a funeral with Ms. Selvig.

Episodes.Name: The Grim Barbarity of Optics and Design
Episodes.Description: Irving and Dylan confront Burt about his lies. Mark and Helly discover a strange new department.

Episodes.Name: Hide and Seek
Episodes.Description: The team angers Cobel by forming an alliance.

Episodes.Name: Defiant Jazz
Episodes.Description: Mark and the team encounter new security measures from Cobel.

Episodes.Name: What's for Dinner?
Episodes.Description: The team prepares a plan. Mark attends Devon and Ricken's party.

Episodes.Name: The We We Are
Episodes.Description: The team discovers troubling revelations.

Name: Severance
Summary: Mark leads a team of office workers whose memories have been surgically divided between their work and personal lives. When a mysterious colleague appears outside of work, it begins a journey to discover the truth about their jobs.

Trailers.Title: Severance — Official Trailer | Apple TV+
Trailers.Description: How far would you go to achieve a perfect work/life balance? Stream Severance now on Apple TV+ https://apple.co/_Severance ...

Trailers.Description: Welcome to Lumon. From Ben Stiller and creator Dan Erickson, Severance centers around Mark Scout (Adam Scott), a leader of a ...

Episodes.Name: Air: Part 1
Episodes.Description: Part 1: When Icarus Base is attacked, its inhabitants are forced to flee through the Stargate. The base was created on a distant planet to take advantage of a powerful energy supply located there. Their goal is to try to determine the purpose of the mysterious ninth symbol of the Stargate, which they've never been able to lock in. In going through the Stargate, they are transported not to Earth, but to a very old apparently uninhabited spacecraft. With the group's commander injured, Lt. Scott and the chief scientist - Dr. Nicholas Rush - lead the exploration of the ...

Episodes.Name: Air: Part 2
Episodes.Description: While they are stranded on-board the Destiny, the new reluctant crew discover that their life support system is worn out, and they have to repair it fast or they will all suffocate in a matter of hours.

Episodes.Name: Air: Part 3
