Episodes.Description: As the U.S.S. Discovery crew attempts to let loose at a party, an unwelcome visitor comes aboard bringing about a problematic and twisted sequence of events.

Episodes.Name: Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum
Episodes.Description: The U.S.S. Discovery is tasked with a high priority mission to the planet Pahvo and learn the science behind the Klingons' cloaking technology.

Episodes.Name: Into the Forest I Go
Episodes.Description: Bypassing Starfleet's orders, Lorca uses the USS Discovery crew's ultimate asset, the ship itself, in an effort to end the war with the Klingons once and for all.

Episodes.Name: Despite Yourself
Episodes.Description: While in unfamiliar territory, the U.S.S. Discovery crew is forced to get creative in their next efforts to survive opposing and unprecedented forces and return home.

Episodes.Name: The Wolf Inside
Episodes.Description: As the crew continues their guise, Burnham undergoes a merciless mission in hopes of helping the U.S.S. Discovery return home. Tilly works on restoring Stamets' neurofunction.

Episodes.Name: Vaulting Ambition
Episodes.Description: Burnham heads to the ISS Charon with a special "gift" for the Emperor. With the help of an unexpected source, Stamets gains clarity while trapped inside the mycelial network. Saru asks for L'Rell's help.

Episodes.Name: What's Past Is Prologue
Episodes.Description: Lorca plans to move forward with a coup against the Emperor, propelling Burnham to make a quick decision to save not only herself, but the U.S.S. Discovery.

Episodes.Name: The War Without, the War Within
Episodes.Description: Burnham and the crew are faced with the harsh reality of the war during their absence. In order to move forward, Starfleet must use unconventional tactics and sources to take their next action against the Klingons.

Episodes.Name: Will You Take My Hand?
Episodes.Description: With Georgiou at the helm of the plan to end the Klingon war once and for all, the USS Discovery crew struggles to fathom and tolerate her hostile tactics. Memories of past hardships are rekindled within Burnham.

Episodes.Name: Brother
Episodes.Description: The crew of the U.S.S. Discovery joins forces with Captain Pike to unravel the mystery of seven mysterious red signals that have appeared across the universe.

Episodes.Name: New Eden
Episodes.Description: A new signal brings the Discovery to a distant planet, Terralysium, that is inhabited by the descendants of human survivors of World War III, which was fought on Earth 200 years earlier.

Episodes.Name: Point of Light
Episodes.Description: A surprise visitor to the U.S.S. Discovery brings shocking news about Spock and dredges up past regrets for Burnham. Following the asteroid incident, Tilly struggles to keep a grip on her reality. L'Rell's authority on Qo'noS is threatened.

Episodes.Name: An Obol for Charon
Episodes.Description: A mysterious sphere threatens the U.S.S. Discovery even as May, in her original form, implements a plan that puts Tilly's life in danger. Saru and Burnham's bond grows when Saru is forced to acknowledge a deeply unsettling Kelpien truth. Pike receives new intel on Spock from a loyal friend.

Episodes.Name: Saints of Imperfection
Episodes.Description: Burnham and the crew navigate a dangerous alien landscape in a race against time to save Tilly's life, but Stamets is not at all prepared for what they find in the process. Section 31 is assigned to help track down Spock, much to Pike's dismay.

Episodes.Name: The Sound of Thunder
Episodes.Description: When a new signal appears over Saru's home planet, Burnham, Saru and the crew embark on a perilous mission that puts Saru in danger and raises questions about the Red Angel's intentions. Hugh struggles to come to terms with his new reality.

Episodes.Name: Light and Shadows
Episodes.Description: Burnham goes to Vulcan in search of Spock, where she unearths surprising family secrets. In researching what is left of the Red Angel's signal over Kaminar, Pike and Tyler end up in battle with time itself. Georgiou has a few tricks up her sleeve for Leland and Section 31.

Episodes.Name: If Memory Serves
Episodes.Description: Spock and Burnham head to Talos IV, where the process of healing Spock forces the siblings to confront their troubled past. Stamets desperately tries to reconnect with an increasingly disconnected Hugh, while Tyler struggles to shed the crew's suspicions of him due to his past as Voq.

Episodes.Name: Project Daedalus
Episodes.Description: The Discovery crew infiltrates Section 31's headquarters and suspicions arise that the crew may have a traitor in their midst. Meanwhile, Burnham tries to help Spock, but her efforts don't go as planned.

Episodes.Name: The Red Angel
Episodes.Description: Burnham is stunned when she learns her ties to Section 31 run deeper than she ever fathomed. Armed with the identity of the Red Angel, the U.S.S. Discovery goes to work on its most critical mission to date.

Episodes.Name: Perpetual Infinity
Episodes.Description: Burnham receives the reunion she's been longing for, but it doesn't go quite as she imagined. Georgiou and Tyler sense a disturbing change in Leland.

Episodes.Name: Through the Valley of Shadows
Episodes.Description: A fourth signal leads the U.S.S. Discovery to an insular world, where Pike is forced to make a life-changing choice. Burnham and Spock investigate a Section 31 ship gone rogue, leading to a discovery with catastrophic consequences.

Episodes.Name: Such Sweet Sorrow
Episodes.Description: When the U.S.S. Discovery's crucial mission does not go according to plan, Burnham realizes what must ultimately be done. The crew prepares for the battle of a lifetime as Leland's Control ships get closer.

Episodes.Name: Such Sweet Sorrow, Part 2
Episodes.Description: The U.S.S. Discovery battles against Control in a fight not only for their lives but for the future, with a little help from some unexpected friends. Spock and Burnham discern vital new connections between the red signals while Burnham faces one of life's harshest truths: the right decisions are often the hardest to make.

Episodes.Name: That Hope Is You, Part 1
Episodes.Description: Arriving 930 years in the future, Burnham navigates a galaxy she no longer recognizes while searching for the rest of the U.S.S. Discovery crew.

Episodes.Name: Far from Home
Episodes.Description: After the U.S.S. Discovery crash-lands on a strange planet, the crew finds themselves racing against time to repair their ship. Meanwhile, Saru and Tilly embark on a perilous first-contact mission in hopes of finding Burnham.

Episodes.Name: People of Earth
Episodes.Description: Finally reunited, Burnham and the U.S.S. Discovery crew journey to Earth, eager to learn what happened to the Federation in their absence.

Episodes.Name: Forget Me Not
Episodes.Description: Burnham and Adira visit the Trill homeworld while Saru's efforts on the Discovery to help the crew reconnect yield surprises.

Episodes.Name: Die Trying
Episodes.Description: After reuniting with what remains of Starfleet and the Federation, the U.S.S. Discovery and its crew must prove that a 930 year old crew and starship are exactly what this new future needs.

Episodes.Name: Scavengers
Episodes.Description: After receiving a message from Book, Burnham and Georgiou embark on a rogue mission to find him, leaving Saru to pick up the pieces with Admiral Vance. Meanwhile, Stamets forms an unexpected bond with Adira.

Episodes.Name: Unification III
Episodes.Description: While grappling with the fallout of her recent actions, and what her future might hold, Burnham agrees to represent the Federation in an intense debate about the release of politically sensitive - but highly valuable - Burn data.

Episodes.Name: The Sanctuary
Episodes.Description: The U.S.S. Discovery crew travel to Book's home planet to help rescue it from Osyraa, the formidable leader of the Emerald Chain; Stamets and Adira continue their search for valuable information on the origin of the Burn.

Episodes.Name: Terra Firma, Part 1
Episodes.Description: The U.S.S. Discovery crew journey to a mysterious planet in hopes of finding a cure for Georgiou's deteriorating condition. Stamets and Adira make a stunning breakthrough with the newly acquired Burn data.

Episodes.Name: Terra Firma, Part 2
Episodes.Description: Georgiou uncovers the true depths of the plot against her, leading her to a revelation about how deeply her time on the U.S.S. Discovery truly changed her.

Episodes.Name: Su'Kal
Episodes.Description: Discovery ventures to the Verubin Nebula, where Burnham, Saru, and Culber make a shocking realization about the origin of the Burn as the rest of the crew faces an unexpected threat.

Episodes.Name: There Is a Tide...
Episodes.Description: After capturing the U.S.S. Discovery, Osyraa seeks a meeting with Admiral Vance while Burnham and the crew must overcome unimaginable odds as they attempt to regain command of their ship.

Episodes.Name: That Hope Is You, Part 2
Episodes.Description: As the Emerald Chain tightens its grip and the mystery of the Burn is finally solved, Burnham and the crew have one last chance to save themselves - and the Federation.

Episodes.Name: Kobayashi Maru
Episodes.Description: After months spent reconnecting the Federation with distant worlds, Captain Michael Burnham and the crew of the U.S.S. Discovery are sent to assist a damaged space station.

Episodes.Name: Anomaly
Episodes.Description: Saru returns to help the U.S.S. Discovery uncover the mystery of an unusually destructive new force; as Burnham leads the crew, she must also find a way to help Book cope with an unimaginable loss.

Episodes.Name: Choose to Live
Episodes.Description: Burnham and Tilly hunt the killer of a Starfleet officer as Stamets and the science team race against the clock to prevent the anomaly from killing anyone else.

Episodes.Name: All Is Possible
Episodes.Description: Tilly and Adira lead a team of Starfleet Academy cadets on a training mission that takes a dangerous turn. Meanwhile, Burnham is pulled into tense negotiations on Ni'Var.

Episodes.Name: The Examples
Episodes.Description: Burnham and Book race to evacuate a group of stranded colonists in the anomaly's path as one of the Federation's brightest scientists comes aboard the U.S.S. Discovery to do high-stakes research with Saru and Stamets.

Episodes.Name: Stormy Weather
Episodes.Description: Seeking answers, the U.S.S. Discovery ventures into a subspace rift created by the Dark Matter Anomaly. Meanwhile, Book faces a strange visitor from his past.

Episodes.Name: ...But to Connect
Episodes.Description: Tensions rise as representatives from across the galaxy gather to confront the threat of the Dark Matter Anomaly. Zora's new sentience raises difficult questions.

Episodes.Name: All In
Episodes.Description: Following a hunch, Captain Burnham tracks Book to an old haunt from their courier days and gets drawn into a high-stakes competition for a powerful weapon.

Episodes.Name: Rubicon
Episodes.Description: Captain Burnham and the U.S.S. Discovery race to stop Book and Ruon Tarka from launching a rogue plan that could inadvertently endanger the galaxy.

Episodes.Name: The Galactic Barrier
Episodes.Description: Captain Burnham and her crew must go where few have gone before: beyond the Galactic Barrier. Meanwhile, Book learns the truth of what drives Ruon Tarka.

Episodes.Name: Rosetta
Episodes.Description: While Captain Burnham leads an away mission to a planet that was once home to the aliens responsible for the DMA, Book and Tarka secretly infiltrate the U.S.S. Discovery.

Episodes.Name: Species Ten-C
Episodes.Description: As the DMA approaches Earth and Ni'Var, Captain Burnham and the crew of the U.S.S. Discovery attempt to make First Contact with the powerful species responsible before it's too late.

Episodes.Name: Coming Home
Episodes.Description: As the DMA approaches Earth and Ni'Var, and with evacuations underway, Burnham and the team aboard the U.S.S. Discovery must find a way to communicate and connect with a species far different from their own before time runs out.

Name: Star Trek: Discovery
Summary: Ten years before Kirk, Spock, and the Enterprise, the USS Discovery discovers new worlds and lifeforms as one Starfleet officer learns to understand all things alien.

Trailers.Title: Star Trek: Discovery - Official Trailer
Trailers.Description: Watch the explosive trailer for the next chapter of the Star Trek franchise. Star Trek: Discovery premieres September 24th on CBS ...

Trailers.Title: STAR TREK DISCOVERY Official Trailer (2017) Netflix, TV Show HD
Trailers.Description: STAR TREK DISCOVERY Official Trailer (2017) Netflix, TV Show HD © 2017 - Netflix Comedy, Kids, Family and Animated Film, ...

Trailers.Description: Star Trek Discovery Official Trailer 2017.

Episodes.Name: Remembrance
Episodes.Description: Fourteen years after retiring from Starfleet, Jean-Luc Picard, still haunted by the death of Data, is living a quiet life on his family vineyard when a woman comes to him for help.

Episodes.Name: Maps and Legends
Episodes.Description: Without the support of Starfleet, Picard turns to Dr. Agnes Jurati and his estranged colleague Raffi Musiker for help in finding the truth about Dahj, unaware that hidden enemies are also interested in what he'll find.

Episodes.Name: The End Is the Beginning
Episodes.Description: After reflecting on the past with Raffi, Picard hires her partner, Cristobal Rios, to help him in his search for Bruce Maddox; Soji's work on the Borg cube catches the attention of the executive director.

Episodes.Name: Absolute Candor
Episodes.Description: On the way to Freecloud, Picard requests a stop at a Romulan refugee planet where he reunites with Elnor, the young Romulan he befriended fourteen years ago; Narek continues to learn more about Soji.

Episodes.Name: Stardust City Rag
Episodes.Description: The La Sirena crew reach Freecloud and find Bruce Maddox in a precarious situation, so Seven of Nine, the ex-Borg they recently picked up, lends her assistance.

Episodes.Name: The Impossible Box
Episodes.Description: Picard and the crew trace Soji to the Borg cube, forcing Picard to face memories of being Locutus; Narek believes he's found a way to safely exploit information from Soji.

Episodes.Name: Nepenthe
Episodes.Description: Picard and Soji, who's struggling to make sense of her recently unlocked memories, travel to a planet that happens to be the home of Picard's old friends Will Riker and Deanna Troi; Elnor and Hugh are left on the Borg cube to face Narissa.

Episodes.Name: Broken Pieces
Episodes.Description: Picard realizes how far some will go to protect secrets that go back generations when truths about the attack on Mars are revealed; Narissa orders her guards to capture Elnor, setting off a chain reaction on the Borg cube.

Episodes.Name: Et in Arcadia Ego, Part 1
Episodes.Description: With the Romulans in pursuit, Picard and the crew finally reach Soji's home planet - and discover more than they expected about the inhabitants.

Episodes.Name: Et in Arcadia Ego, Part 2
Episodes.Description: Picard and his team are pitted against the Romulans and the synthetics of Coppelius in a final confrontation.

Episodes.Name: The Star Gazer
Episodes.Description: Starfleet must once again call on legendary Jean-Luc Picard after members of his former crew - Cristóbal Rios, Seven of Nine, Raffi Musiker, and Dr. Agnes Jurati - discover an anomaly in space that threatens the galaxy.

Episodes.Name: Penance
Episodes.Description: Picard finds himself transported to an alternate timeline in the year 2400 where he must face one last trial orchestrated by his longtime nemesis Q.

Episodes.Name: Assimilation
Episodes.Description: Picard and the crew travel back to 2024 Los Angeles in search of the one person who can help them identify the point at which time diverged.

Episodes.Name: Watcher
Episodes.Description: With time running out to save the future, Picard seeks out an old friend for help; Rios winds up on the wrong side of the law; Jurati makes a deal with the Borg Queen.

Episodes.Name: Fly Me to the Moon
Episodes.Description: Picard discovers an important person from his past may be integral to the divergence in the timeline. Q continues his manipulation of the timeline, taking an interest in Dr. Adam Soong. Seven and Raffi attempt a daring rescue of Rios, while Jurati faces the consequences of her deal with the Borg Queen.

Episodes.Name: Two of One
Episodes.Description: Tallinn helps Picard and the crew infiltrate a gala on the eve of a joint space mission to protect an astronaut they believe is integral in restoring the timeline - Renee Picard; Kore makes a startling discovery about her father's work.

Episodes.Name: Monsters
Episodes.Description: Tallinn enters Picard's subconscious mind to help him wake from a coma and face his deepest fears; Seven and Raffi search for Jurati fearing she's succumbed to her inner monster; Rios struggles to hide the truth about himself from Teresa.

Episodes.Name: Mercy
Episodes.Description: With time running out before the launch of the Europa Mission, Picard and Guinan must free themselves from FBI custody. Seven and Raffi come face-to-face with Jurati and the horror of what she's become.

Episodes.Name: Hide and Seek
Episodes.Description: Picard must face the ghosts of his past when he and his crew are attacked by a new incarnation of an old enemy; Seven and Raffi face Jurati in a final showdown.

Episodes.Name: Farewell
Episodes.Description: With just hours until the Europa Launch, Picard and the crew find themselves in a race against time to save the future.

Name: Star Trek: Picard
Summary: Follow-up series to Star Trek: The Next Generation (1987) and Star Trek: Nemesis (2002) that centers on Jean-Luc Picard in the next chapter of his life.
KeyWords: reference to star trek first contact

Episodes.Name: Strange New Worlds
Episodes.Description: Captain Christopher Pike comes out of self-imposed exile to rescue an officer gone missing during a secret mission.

Episodes.Name: Children of the Comet
Episodes.Description: An ancient alien relic thwarts the Enterprise crew from re-routing a comet on track to strike an inhabited planet.

Episodes.Name: Ghosts of Illyria
Episodes.Description: Una must confront a secret she's been hiding when a contagion ravages the ship, incapacitating the rest of the crew.

Episodes.Name: Memento Mori
Episodes.Description: Pike must find unconventional Starfleet methods to deal with a malevolent force that attacks the Enterprise.

Episodes.Name: Spock Amok
Episodes.Description: A personal visit causes a comedy of errors during Spock & Pike's crucial negotiations with an unusual alien species.

Episodes.Name: Lift Us Where Suffering Cannot Reach
Episodes.Description: A threat to an idyllic planet reunites Captain Pike with the lost love of his life. To protect her and a scientific holy child from a conspiracy, Pike offers his help and is forced to face unresolved feelings of his past.

Episodes.Name: The Serene Squall
Episodes.Description: While on a dangerous humanitarian mission, the crew of the Enterprise stumbles into a harrowing game of leverage with the quadrant's deadliest space pirate.

Episodes.Name: The Elysian Kingdom
Episodes.Description: The USS Enterprise becomes stuck in a nebula that's home to an alien consciousness which traps the crew in a fairy tale.

Episodes.Name: All Those Who Wander
Episodes.Description: Enterprise crew comes face-to-face with their demons - and scary monsters too - when their landing party's stranded on a barren planet with a ravenous enemy.

Episodes.Name: A Quality of Mercy
Episodes.Description: In the season one finale, just as Captain Pike thinks he's figured out how to escape his fate, he's visited by his future self, who shows him the consequences of his actions.

Name: Star Trek: Strange New Worlds
Summary: A prequel to Star Trek: The Original Series, the show will follow the crew of the USS Enterprise under Captain Christopher Pike.

Trailers.Title: Star Trek: Strange New Worlds | Official Trailer | Paramount+
Trailers.Description: STAR TREK: STRANGE NEW WORLDS is based on the years Captain Christopher Pike manned the helm of the U.S.S. ...

Trailers.Description: STAR TREK: Strange New Worlds Trailer (2022) Official © 2022 @Paramount Pictures All audiovisual content are the © copyright ...

Trailers.Title: Star Trek: Strange New Worlds Season 1 Trailer | Rotten Tomatoes TV
Trailers.Description: Check out the new Star Trek: Strange New Worlds Season 1 Trailer starring Anson Mount! Let us know what you think in the ...

Episodes.Name: Ambush
Episodes.Description: Yoda, along with three clone troopers, must face off against Asajj Ventress and her droid army while on a mission to a moon of Rugosa.

Episodes.Name: Rising Malevolence
Episodes.Description: General Grievous uses his latest weapon, the Malevolence, to destroy Plo Koon's fleet. Stuck in an escape pod with three clone troopers, Koon fends off more battle droids while Anakin and Ahsoka mount a rescue mission.

Episodes.Name: Shadow of Malevolence
Episodes.Description: The Malevolence has been revealed to the Republic. Anakin and Shadow Squad, accompanied by Ahsoka and Master Koon, launch an attack in their new long-range Y-wing bombers.

Episodes.Name: Destroy Malevolence
Episodes.Description: Padmé Amidala and C-3PO are taken hostage by Grievous aboard the Malevolence. Anakin and Obi-Wan board the ship to rescue the senator and her protocol droid.

Episodes.Name: Rookies
Episodes.Description: Alone on a distant outpost, Commander Cody and Captain Rex must inspire the rookie clones to believe in themselves to stave off a commando droid invasion.

Episodes.Name: Downfall of a Droid
Episodes.Description: Anakin must find the missing R2-D2 before the Separatists discover the Jedi military secrets locked in his memory banks.

Episodes.Name: Duel of the Droids
Episodes.Description: Anakin, Ahsoka and replacement droid R3-S6 embark on a dual rescue/sabotage mission when they discover R2-D2 is being held at General Grievous' secret enemy listening post.

Episodes.Name: Bombad Jedi
Episodes.Description: Padmé travels to Rodia to meet with old family friend Onaconda Farr about the lack of food rations. Unfortunately Farr has just made a deal with the Separatists. Padmé is imprisoned, leaving it up to Jar Jar Binks and C-3PO to rescue her.

Episodes.Name: Cloak of Darkness
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka and Master Luminara escort captured Nute Gunray to trial, unaware that Count Dooku has dispatched his deadly apprentice Asajj Ventress to free the prisoner and eliminate the Jedi.

Episodes.Name: Lair of Grievous
Episodes.Description: General Grievous must prove himself worthy of the Separatists when Count Dooku leads Kit Fisto and his former Padawan to Grievous' villainous enclave.

Episodes.Name: Dooku Captured
Episodes.Description: During their own attempt to kidnap Count Dooku, Anakin and Obi-Wan discover that the Sith Lord has already been captured by pirates.

Episodes.Name: The Gungan General
Episodes.Description: While negotiating Count Dooku's ransom, Anakin and Obi-Wan are taken prisoner. The Jedi and Sith form an unlikely alliance in a bid to escape, with Jar Jar Binks as their only hope.

Episodes.Name: Jedi Crash
Episodes.Description: Anakin is injured while rescuing Aayla Secura from Super Battle Droids equipped with rocket packs. Ahsoka crash-lands their shuttle on the neutral planet of Maridun, where the native Lurmen villagers refuse to takes sides in the war.

Episodes.Name: Defenders of Peace
Episodes.Description: While the Jedi combat a new Separatist weapon, the pacifist Lurmen must decide whether they will surrender or fight with Anakin, Ahsoka and Aayla Secura.

Episodes.Name: Trespass
Episodes.Description: While investigating the disappearance of a clone security force, Anakin and Obi-Wan get caught in the middle of a conflict between the territorial inhabitants of a desolate ice world and the greedy representatives of a nearby moon.

Episodes.Name: The Hidden Enemy
Episodes.Description: Anakin and Obi-Wan discover evidence of a traitor amongst their ranks while attempting to lead Republic forces to liberate Christophsis from a Separatist siege.

Episodes.Name: Blue Shadow Virus
Episodes.Description: Evil scientist Dr. Nuvo Vindi is recreating the dreaded Blue Shadow Virus in his secret underground lab on Naboo. When he captures Senator Amidala and Jar Jar Binks, Anakin and Obi-Wan mount a rescue operation.

Episodes.Name: Mystery of a Thousand Moons
Episodes.Description: The fatal Blue Shadow Virus is released, infecting Ahsoka, Padmé and many clone troopers. Anakin and Obi-Wan must find the antidote on a mysterious planet from which no visitor has ever returned.

Episodes.Name: Storm Over Ryloth
Episodes.Description: The Separatists have invaded the Twi'lek home planet of Ryloth. Anakin and Ahsoka lead a squadron of fighters against a Trade Federation battleship commanded by Neimoidian Captain Mar Tuuk.

Episodes.Name: Innocents of Ryloth
Episodes.Description: To sabotage a powerful Separatist weapon, Obi-Wan and a small clone force enter an occupied town, and discover that its residents are being used as a living shield.

Episodes.Name: Liberty on Ryloth
Episodes.Description: Mace Windu and his clone troopers aim to liberate the Ryloth capitol of Lessu but needs to acquire the help of a Twi'lek resistance group led by Cham Syndulla in order to do so.

Episodes.Name: Hostage Crisis
Episodes.Description: To free crime lord Ziro the Hutt, bounty hunters seize control of the Senate Building and take hostages, unaware that Anakin Skywalker is still inside.

Episodes.Name: Holocron Heist
Episodes.Description: Darth Sidious commissions a bounty hunter to break into the Jedi Temple Archives.

Episodes.Name: Cargo of Doom
Episodes.Description: With Anakin and Ahsoka in pursuit, Cad Bane seeks the last piece to unlock the holocron he stole for Darth Sidious.

Episodes.Name: Children of the Force
Episodes.Description: With the information from the stolen holocron, Darth Sidious orders Cad Bane to kidnap several Force-sensitive children for his scheme.

Episodes.Name: Senate Spy
Episodes.Description: At the Jedi High Council's request, Padmé investigates a Separatist conspiracy in the Senate.

Episodes.Name: Landing at Point Rain
Episodes.Description: Anakin, Ahsoka, Obi-Wan and Ki-Adi-Mundi lead a landing party to destroy a droid factory on Geonosis.

Episodes.Name: Weapons Factory
Episodes.Description: Luminara and Anakin act as decoys to divert new enemy super-tanks, while Padawans Barriss Offee and Ahsoka attempt to destroy a Separatist droid factory.

Episodes.Name: Legacy of Terror
Episodes.Description: Luminara Unduli disappears during a sandstorm while following Poggle the Lesser. When Anakin and Obi-Wan track her to an ancient temple, they are attacked by undead Geonosian warriors.

Episodes.Name: Brain Invaders
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka, Barris and Tango Company board a supply ship to a station near Ord Cestus. But one of the troopers has been infected by a Geonosian brain worm and has taken along a nest full of worm eggs to submit the others.

Episodes.Name: Grievous Intrigue
Episodes.Description: Master Eeth Koth has tracked down General Grievous, but is soon captured and tortured as an example to the Jedi. Obi-Wan, Anakin and Adi Gallia mount a rescue attempt, unaware that Grievous is expecting them to do just that.

Episodes.Name: The Deserter
Episodes.Description: Obi-Wan and a detachment of the 501st track down General Grievous on Saleucami. When Captain Rex is injured he is taken to a farmhouse to recuperate, only to find the farmer has a familiar face.

Episodes.Name: Lightsaber Lost
Episodes.Description: During a mission in the underworld of Coruscant, a pickpocket steals Ahsoka's lightsaber. Too ashamed to tell Anakin, she sets out to look for the thief alone, but gets help from Tera Sinube, an ancient Jedi Master.

Episodes.Name: The Mandalore Plot
Episodes.Description: Firmly opposed to war, Duchess Satine of Mandalore heads the Council of Neutral Systems. Obi-Wan Kenobi investigates rumors of the resurgence of the so-called Death Watch on her planet.

Episodes.Name: Voyage of Temptation
Episodes.Description: Obi-Wan and Anakin guard the Duchess Satine and members of The Council of Neutral Systems as they travel to Coruscant aboard the luxury vessel Coronet, but a traitor amongst them has smuggled aboard a spider-shaped assassin droid.

Episodes.Name: Duchess of Mandalore
Episodes.Description: On Coruscant, word reaches Duchess Satine that Death Watch is mobilizing, sparking a preemptive Republic invasion. On the run from Republic authorities, Satine and Obi-Wan set off to discover the group's true motives.

Episodes.Name: Senate Murders
Episodes.Description: Padmé is working to to introduce a bill to minimize military spending and halt the creation of clone troopers. But when one of her most trusted allies is poisoned, she and Bail Organa set out to expose the murderer.

Episodes.Name: Cat and Mouse
Episodes.Description: Anakin is tasked to fly a prototypical cloaked ship to get supplies to Bail Organa on Christophsis, but can't resist an urge to attack a blockade headed by the infamous Admiral Trench.

Episodes.Name: Bounty Hunters
Episodes.Description: Obi-Wan, Anakin and Ahsoka crash land on Felucia and reluctantly join four bounty hunters in defending a village from Hondo Ohnaka's pirate gang.

Episodes.Name: The Zillo Beast
Episodes.Description: When the Republic detonates a powerful electro-proton bomb to settle the battle of Malastare, it accidentally wakens an ancient and thought to be extinct Zillo Beast.

Episodes.Name: The Zillo Beast Strikes Back
Episodes.Description: The Zillo Beast has been captured and is brought to Coruscant for testing. Chancellor Palpatine wants to learn the secrets of its invulnerability but only manages to make the beast angry enough to escape.

Episodes.Name: Death Trap
Episodes.Description: Determined to have his revenge on Mace Windu, Boba Fett infiltrates Jedi cruiser Endurance as part of a group of young clone cadets.

Episodes.Name: R2 Come Home
Episodes.Description: When Anakin and Mace try to rescue Admiral Kilian from his crashed cruiser, they walk into a trap set by Boba Fett and his bounty hunter associates. Then it is up to R2-D2 to try and get a message out.

Episodes.Name: Lethal Trackdown
Episodes.Description: Boba Fett and Aurra Sing are using hostages to force Mace Windu to face them. With Mace and Anakin still recovering, Plo Koon and Ahsoka Tano track down the bounty hunters.

Episodes.Name: Clone Cadets
Episodes.Description: Unless they want to flunk out, the clones of Domino Squad must learn to work together during their training on Kamino.

Episodes.Name: ARC Troopers
Episodes.Description: General Grievous and Asajj Ventress combine forces in an attack on Kamino. As Anakin and Obi-Wan rush to aid Tipoca City, the clones prepare to defend their home planet.

Episodes.Name: Supply Lines
Episodes.Description: Jedi Master Ima-Gun Di and his men are trapped on the besieged world of Ryloth. Senator Bail Organa teams up with Representative Jar Jar Binks to convince neutral King Katuunko of Toydaria to send aid to the Twi'leks of Ryloth.

Episodes.Name: Sphere of Influence
Episodes.Description: When newly elected Chairman Papanoida's daughters are kidnapped, Senator Chuchi and Ahsoka Tano investigate the Trade Federation while Papanoida and his son follow a lead to Jabba's palace.

Episodes.Name: Corruption
Episodes.Description: When Padmé visits Mandalore on a diplomatic mission she finds herself investigating an outbreak of a mysterious illness at a school with Duchess Satine.

Episodes.Name: The Academy
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka is assigned to tutor at a leadership academy on Mandalore. Duchess Satine's nephew Korkie and three of his classmates discover a conspiracy involving the black market and the planet's food supplies.

Episodes.Name: Assassin
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka receives visions about Aurra Sing attempting to assassinate Padmé Amidala and decides to accompany the Senator on a peace mission to Alderaan.

Episodes.Name: Evil Plans
Episodes.Description: C-3PO and R2-D2 are tasked to get some Jogan fruit for a reception honoring Roonan Senator Aang. But the droids are targeted by bounty hunter Cad Bane who wants to extract information regarding the Senate from their data banks.

Episodes.Name: Hunt for Ziro
Episodes.Description: Obi-Wan Kenobi and Quinlan Vos are assigned to retrieve Ziro the Hutt after his escape from prison. But Ziro is instantly put on trial by the five Hutt families on Nal Hutta, where his only ally may be an old lover.

Episodes.Name: Heroes on Both Sides
Episodes.Description: Padmé visits her old mentor Mina Bonteri, who has chosen the side of the Separatists but is urging for peace talks. But the Banking Clan and several corrupt senators conspire against this initiative.

Episodes.Name: Pursuit of Peace
Episodes.Description: Senators Amidala and Organa are opposed to funding five million new clone troopers, but they and other like-minded dignitaries find themselves targeted by thuggish bounty hunters set on changing their vote.

Episodes.Name: Nightsisters
Episodes.Description: Darth Sidious orders Lord Tyrannus to eliminate Asajj Ventress, lest her becoming too powerful. But Ventress escapes and manages to make her way back to her home planet of Dathomir, vowing revenge on Count Dooku.

Episodes.Name: Monster
Episodes.Description: Count Dooku accepts Mother Talzin's offer to present him with a warrior from the same tribe as Darth Maul. However, Talzin and Asajj Ventress pick and train the warrior and use Nightsister magic to bend him to their will.

Episodes.Name: Witches of the Mist
Episodes.Description: As Count Dooku trains Savage Opress in the ways of the Dark Side, Obi-Wan and Anakin travel to Dathomir to learn more about this Zabrak Jedi killer.

Episodes.Name: Overlords
Episodes.Description: A mysterious force draws Anakin, Obi-Wan and Ahsoka to a distant planet to determine whether Anakin is truly the Chosen One.

Episodes.Name: Altar of Mortis
Episodes.Description: Before the Jedi can leave Mortis, the Son abducts Ahsoka and infects her with the dark side. While Anakin faces his Padawan, the Daughter reveals to Obi-Wan the only weapon that can defeat her brother: the Dagger of Mortis.

Episodes.Name: Ghosts of Mortis
Episodes.Description: The Son shows Anakin a vision of the future to sway him to his side. Obi-Wan and Ahsoka must make sure the Son does not leave Mortis aboard their Jedi shuttle.

Episodes.Name: The Citadel
Episodes.Description: Obi-Wan, Anakin and some of their best troopers allow themselves to be frozen in carbonite in an attempt to break into the Separatist prison known as the Citadel to rescue Master Even Piell.

Episodes.Name: Counter Attack
Episodes.Description: The Jedi and their troops have split up to safeguard the vital information but find that getting out of the Citadel is even harder than getting in.

Episodes.Name: Citadel Rescue
Episodes.Description: Masters Plo Koon and Saesee Tiin head a desperate rescue operation to get the survivors of the Citadel infiltration mission and the information they carry.

Episodes.Name: Padawan Lost
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka is captured by a Trandoshan during a battle on Felucia. The reptilian aims to hunt her down for sport together with his kin.

Episodes.Name: Wookiee Hunt
Episodes.Description: The Jedi younglings led by Ahsoka free a Wookiee prisoner from a transport. Together they form a plan to attack the Trandoshan base ship.

Episodes.Name: Water War
Episodes.Description: The water planet Mon Calamari is on the brink of civil war. Senator Amidala and her Jedi protector Anakin Skywalker take the side of the Mon Cal, while Separatist representative Riff Tamson spurs on the Quarren.

Episodes.Name: Gungan Attack
Episodes.Description: The Mon Cal and Jedi are in hiding beneath the underwater capital city of Mon Cal. The Jedi Council calls on the help of the Gungan army led by Jar Jar Binks.

Episodes.Name: Prisoners
Episodes.Description: Only Prince Lee-Char and Padawan Ahsoka Tano have escaped capture and must find a way to free their comrades as well as the entire planet from the impending rule of Riff Tamson.

Episodes.Name: Shadow Warrior
Episodes.Description: There is unrest on Naboo and the Gungans are considering to join the Separatists. But General Skywalker discovers Boss Lyonie is being influenced by dark magic against his will.

Episodes.Name: Mercy Mission
Episodes.Description: Commander Wolffe and his men aid the Aleena whose planet has recently suffered terrible quakes. Translator droid C-3PO and his counterpart R2-D2 find the natives need them to fulfill a special task.

Episodes.Name: Nomad Droids
Episodes.Description: 3PO and R2 escape Master Galia's Jedi Cruiser in a Y-Wing fighter and find themselves in one bizarre situation after the other.

Episodes.Name: Darkness on Umbara
Episodes.Description: During an assault on the shadowy world of Umbara, General Skywalker is called back to Coruscant. He has to relinquish command of the 501st legion to legendary Jedi Master Krell, who turns out to have a low opinion of clones.

Episodes.Name: The General
Episodes.Description: Krell sends Captain Rex and his troopers on an impossible mission: to conquer a heavily fortified Umbaran airbase.

Episodes.Name: Plan of Dissent
Episodes.Description: ARC Trooper Fives disagrees with General Krell's strategies and comes up with his own unauthorized plan using captured Umbaran star fighters.

Episodes.Name: Carnage of Krell
Episodes.Description: Rex and the 501st troopers refuse to execute Fives and Jesse for their insubordination. They are in for even bigger shock when General Krell orders another offensive.

Episodes.Name: Kidnapped
Episodes.Description: The Separatists support Zygerrian slavers in taking over a Togruta colony on the neutral planet Kiros. Anakin and Ahsoka race to defuse a series of bombs, while Obi-Wan faces the Zygerrian leader, Darts D'Nar.

Episodes.Name: Slaves of the Republic
Episodes.Description: On the planet Zygerria, Anakin poses as a slaver with Ahsoka as his prize while Obi-Wan and Rex seek out the whereabouts of the missing Togruta colony.

Episodes.Name: Escape from Kadavo
Episodes.Description: While Obi-Wan and Rex are forced to work at the Kadavo slave camps, Count Dooku arrives at Zygerria and demands the execution of the captured Jedi.

Episodes.Name: A Friend in Need
Episodes.Description: Lux Bonteri disrupts a peace conference between Seperatist and Republic representatives on Mandalore. Intent on safeguarding him, Ahsoka becomes involved in Lux's plan to take revenge on Count Dooku for his mother's death.

Episodes.Name: Deception
Episodes.Description: Obi-Wan fakes his own death and goes undercover as his own 'killer', Rako Hardeen, so he can infiltrate Moralo Eval's plot to kidnap Chancellor Palpatine.

Episodes.Name: Friends and Enemies
Episodes.Description: Disguised as Bounty Hunter Rako Hardeen, Obi-Wan Kenobi is on the run with criminal mastermind Moralo Eval and Cad Bane. But their partnership is on thin ice and Anakin and Ahsoka are in hot pursuit.

Episodes.Name: The Box
Episodes.Description: Count Dooku challenges eleven bounty hunters to survive several deadly levels devised by Moralo Eval. The winners will participate in the plot to kidnap Chancellor Palpatine on Naboo.

Episodes.Name: Crisis on Naboo
Episodes.Description: Cad Bane leads Dooku's team of bounty hunters, including a disguised Obi-Wan, in a plot to kidnap the Supreme Chancellor during the Festival of Lights on Naboo.

Episodes.Name: Massacre
Episodes.Description: Asajj Ventress returns to Dathomir to become a true Nightsister. But then Count Dooku orders General Grievous to wipe out Mother Talzin and her entire clan of witches.

Episodes.Name: Bounty
Episodes.Description: Asajj Ventress joins a group of bounty hunters led by Boba Fett. Their mission is to deliver a box with unknown cargo to the leader of the planet Quarzite.

Episodes.Name: Brothers
Episodes.Description: The search for his long lost brother, Darth Maul, leads Savage Opress to the junk planet of Lotho Minor.

Episodes.Name: Revenge
Episodes.Description: Mother Talzin restores Darth Maul's sanity and gives him a better pair of mechanical legs. Now Maul wants revenge on Obi-Wan Kenobi and lures the Jedi to the remote planet of Raydonia.

Episodes.Name: Revival
Episodes.Description: Maul takes Savage as his apprentice and together they set out to gather an army. Their attempt to recruit Hondo Ohnaka and his pirates is interrupted by Jedi Council members Obi-Wan Kenobi and Adi Gallia.

Episodes.Name: A War on Two Fronts
Episodes.Description: By a request from Lux Bonteri, Anakin, Obi-Wan, Ahsoka and Rex travel to Onderon to help train a group of rebels so they can take back the capital city of Iziz from the Separatists.

Episodes.Name: Front Runners
Episodes.Description: The Jedi and Rex return to Coruscant and leave Ahsoka in charge of supervising the Onderon Rebels as they carry out a series of strikes in the capital.

Episodes.Name: The Soft War
Episodes.Description: The Onderon Rebels attempt to rescue former King Dendup before he is executed.

Episodes.Name: Tipping Points
Episodes.Description: The people of Onderon have decided to revolt against the Separatists, leading to a full scale revolt between the rebels and battle droids.

Episodes.Name: The Gathering
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka escorts a group of younglings to Ilum where they meet with Yoda and seek out the Kyber crystals needed to build their own lightsabers.

Episodes.Name: A Test of Strength
Episodes.Description: As the six younglings prepare to construct their lightsabers, their training vessel Crucible is attacked by Hondo Ohnaka and his pirates.

Episodes.Name: Bound for Rescue
Episodes.Description: Hondo has failed to capture the Kaiburr crystals, but does hold Ahsoka as a prisoner. The younglings form a plan to infiltrate the pirate hideout on Florrum.

Episodes.Name: A Necessary Bond
Episodes.Description: General Grievous leads an attack on Hondo Ohnaka's base, forcing the pirates to form a temporary alliance with Ahsoka and the Jedi younglings.

Episodes.Name: Secret Weapons
Episodes.Description: R2-D2 joins a team of Republic Droids known as D-Squad, led by Colonel Gascon. Their mission: to steal an encryption module from a Separatist dreadnought.

Episodes.Name: A Sunny Day in the Void
Episodes.Description: D-Squad has obtained their mission objective, but crash-land on a desolate planet after a run-in with comets.

Episodes.Name: Missing in Action
Episodes.Description: Colonel Gascon and the five droids of D-Squad have arrived at the remote town of Pons Ora on the planet Abafar and find a clone commando suffering from amnesia.

Episodes.Name: Point of No Return
Episodes.Description: Finally on their way back to Republic space, D-Squad uncovers a Separatist plan involving a sabotaged Jedi cruiser.

Episodes.Name: Eminence
Episodes.Description: Darth Maul and Savage Opress join forces with the Death Watch and together they recruit the Black Sun and Hutt crime lords to form the Shadow Collective.

Episodes.Name: Shades of Reason
Episodes.Description: The Sith brothers and their criminal allies attack Mandalore and the Death Watch pretends to defeat them, causing the gullible people to choose Pre Vizsla's rule over Duchess Satine's.

Episodes.Name: The Lawless
Episodes.Description: Darth Maul has taken over leadership of Death Watch. Though the Jedi cannot officially interfere, Obi-Wan Kenobi travels to Mandalore to rescue Satine.

Episodes.Name: Sabotage
Episodes.Description: Anakin and Ahsoka are tasked to investigate a bombing at the Jedi Temple since they were two of the few Jedi off-planet at the time it occurred.

Episodes.Name: The Jedi Who Knew Too Much
Episodes.Description: When the suspect of the Temple bombing is murdered in her cell, Ahsoka suddenly finds herself framed and on the run from the Republic military.

Episodes.Name: To Catch a Jedi
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka is on the run and hiding in the criminal underworld of Coruscant. She strikes up an unlikely alliance with a former enemy turned bounty hunter.

Episodes.Name: The Wrong Jedi
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka is put on trial by the Jedi Council and must face the Galactic Senate. Anakin searches for a way to prove his Padawan's innocence.

Episodes.Name: The Unknown
Episodes.Description: Clone trooper Tup is suffering from a severe neurological disorder that causes the death of a Jedi master. Trying to find the motives for the assassination, Anakin escorts Tup back to Kamino for examination.

Episodes.Name: Conspiracy
Episodes.Description: Clone trooper Tup is undergoing a medical examination in the sterile laboratories of Kamino to find the motives for his shocking attack on the Jedi Master. For the examination to succeed, trooper Fives must enter the depth of Tup's mind.

Episodes.Name: Fugitive
Episodes.Description: Tup's body is transported back to Coruscant where it is to be examined by the Chancellor's personal physician, while Fives furtively investigates his death with the help of a droid.

Episodes.Name: Orders
Episodes.Description: Fives believes he's uncovered a major conspiracy regarding the mysterious actions of clone trooper Tup, and finds himself on-the-run after he's falsely accused of attempting to murder the Chancellor.

Episodes.Name: An Old Friend
Episodes.Description: While on Scipio to fund a mercy mission, Senator Amidala is called upon by an old friend to help uncover corruption in the Banking Clan.

Episodes.Name: The Rise of Clovis
Episodes.Description: Clovis and Padmé head back to Coruscant to expose the financial corruption of the Banking Clan.

Episodes.Name: Crisis at the Heart
Episodes.Description: After making a deal with Count Dooku to resuscitate the ailing Banking Clan, Clovis finds himself as a pawn in Dooku's designs.

Episodes.Name: The Disappeared: Part 1
Episodes.Description: The peaceful world of Bardotta and its mystic ways are threatened by an ancient prophecy, and its top spiritual leaders have vanished.

Episodes.Name: The Disappeared: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Jar Jar Binks' beloved Queen Julia of the planet Bardotta has been abducted by the bloodthirsty Frangawl Cult to fulfill a dark and ancient prophecy.

Episodes.Name: The Lost One
Episodes.Description: A Jedi mission finds a lightsaber belonging to the long-dead Master Sifo-Dyas, prompting Yoda, Obi-Wan and Anakin to begin an investigation into his decade-old disappearance.

Episodes.Name: Voices
Episodes.Description: Yoda is deeply unsettled when he hears a voice from beyond the grave - the voice of Qui-Gon Jinn.

Episodes.Name: Destiny
Episodes.Description: Letting the Force guide him, Yoda voyages into the heart of the galaxy to an ancient world that is one of the wellsprings of the Force and the source of midi-chlorians.

Episodes.Name: Sacrifice
Episodes.Description: After many grueling trials, Yoda next travels to the ancient Sith home world of Moraband, where he must face an ancient evil determined to rule the galaxy.

Episodes.Name: The Bad Batch
Episodes.Description: Rex, Cody, and Clone Force 99 (an unorthodox, elite squad also known as the Bad Batch), look to recover the Republic's strategy algorithm from Admiral Trench, but a haunting truth awaits.

Episodes.Name: A Distant Echo
Episodes.Description: Believing that MIA soldier Echo may still be alive, Rex's mission becomes doubly important. Alongside Bad Batch and Anakin, the clone captain launches a dangerous covert rescue.

Episodes.Name: On the Wings of Keeradaks
Episodes.Description: With Echo recovered, Rex, Bad Batch and Anakin look to fight their way out of a Separatist base.

Episodes.Name: Unfinished Business
Episodes.Description: The Republic plans a daring final strike against Admiral Trench, once again bringing together Rex, Echo, Anakin, and the elite Bad Batch squad.

Episodes.Name: Gone with a Trace
Episodes.Description: After leaving the Jedi Order, Ahsoka finds herself in the underworld of Coruscant where she meets aspiring pilot, Trace Martez. Enlisted by Trace's sister, Rafa, to help build dangerous droids, Ahsoka opts to keep her Jedi past a secret.

Episodes.Name: Deal No Deal
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka, Trace and Rafa are hired to deliver some spice, but things soon get complicated.

Episodes.Name: Dangerous Debt
Episodes.Description: Taken prisoner by the Pykes, Ahsoka and the Martez sisters attempt to escape.

Episodes.Name: Together Again
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka bargains for the sisters' freedom and makes a startling discovery.

Episodes.Name: Old Friends Not Forgotten
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka contacts Anakin and Obi-Wan, who must decide whether to help her pursue Maul on Mandalore or defend Coruscant.

Episodes.Name: The Phantom Apprentice
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka leads Republic clones to confront Maul's forces on Mandalore. Maul senses the impending chaos and makes a calculated play to ensure his own survival.

Episodes.Name: Shattered
Episodes.Description: After capturing Maul on Mandalore, Ahsoka's journey to the Jedi Council is disrupted when Order 66 is declared, turning her world upside down.

Episodes.Name: Victory and Death
Episodes.Description: Ahsoka and Rex must use their wit and skills to survive the turbulent end of the Clone Wars.

Name: Star Wars: The Clone Wars
Summary: Jedi Knights lead the Grand Army of the Republic against the droid army of the Separatists.

Trailers.Title: Star Wars: The Clone Wars Official Trailer
Trailers.Description: PARENTS STREAMING NOW ON DISNEY+ Subscription required, 18+. Star Wars: The Clone Wars. Reporting in for another tour ...

Trailers.Title: STAR WARS CLONE WARS MOVIE TRAILER 2008 HD 1080P
Trailers.Description: A NEW FIRST TIME ANIMATED STAR WARS MOVIE.

Trailers.Title: Star Wars: The Clone Wars | Official Trailer | Disney+
Trailers.Description: PARENTS STREAMING NOW ON DISNEY+ Subscription required, 18+. Witness the end of the groundbreaking series. The final ...

Episodes.Name: Rising
Episodes.Description: A team of scientists think they have found the location of the long lost city of Atlantis. It can be reached by a Stargate address that leads to the Pegasus galaxy.

Episodes.Name: Hide and Seek
Episodes.Description: Rodney can't remove an Ancient device that makes him invincible but prevents him from eating or drinking. Meanwhile, there are power malfunctions throughout the city and one of the Athosians mentions seeing a shadow.

Episodes.Name: Thirty Eight Minutes
Episodes.Description: Sheppard gets bitten by a Wraith-like bug and is dying. While the puddle jumper returns, it gets stuck in the Stargate. There's 38 minutes to find a solution.

Episodes.Name: Suspicion
Episodes.Description: There's suspicion of a Wraith collaborator and some of the team suspect the Athosians. Ford and Sheppard find land on Atlantis' planet.

Episodes.Name: Childhood's End
Episodes.Description: Rodney investigates a ZPM from a planet whose inhabitants kill themselves when they turned 25 years old to prevent the Wraith from feeding on them.

Episodes.Name: Poisoning the Well
Episodes.Description: Atlantis offers help to the Hoffans, who are working on a defense against the Wraith.

Episodes.Name: Underground
Episodes.Description: Atlantis wants to trade food with the Genii, a simple civilization who turn out to be not so simple. They are planning a nuclear attack against the Wraith.

Episodes.Name: Home
Episodes.Description: A strange energy generating fog allows travel back to Earth. But something's wrong.

Episodes.Name: The Storm
Episodes.Description: Two hurricanes are approaching Atlantis and an evacuation is necessary. The leader of the planet taking them in tells the Genii about the situation.

Episodes.Name: The Eye
Episodes.Description: McKay and Weir start repairing the grounding station, while Sheppard tries to fight Kolya. The puddle jumper on the mainland enters the eye of the storm.

Episodes.Name: The Defiant One
Episodes.Description: Major John Sheppard, Rodney McKay and two scientists explore a planet where a Wraith spaceship, which crashed there 10,000 years ago, during the Atlantis-Wraith War, is still sending a SOS signal.

Episodes.Name: Hot Zone
Episodes.Description: A team of scientists, including McKay, Zelenka and Ford, are exposed to a deadly virus. Sheppard goes after one of the scientists trying to escape.

Episodes.Name: Sanctuary
Episodes.Description: Sheppard invites a priestess, who claims to not know about a weapon protecting her planet from the Wraith, to Atlantis to discuss asylum for refugees.

Episodes.Name: Before I Sleep
Episodes.Description: It's Elizabeth's birthday and she gets a very special gift: a woman who has been in stasis in an Atlantis' laboratory for 10,000 years and is actually herself.

Episodes.Name: The Brotherhood
Episodes.Description: The team is on Dagan, where they must find key stones to retrieve a ZPM. Zelenka finds out Atlantis has a deep space scanner.

Episodes.Name: Letters from Pegasus
Episodes.Description: McKay finds a way to send a message to Earth, leaving space for personal messages. Sheppard and Teyla are off to spy on the Wraith fleet approaching Atlantis.

Episodes.Name: The Gift
Episodes.Description: Teyla is haunted by nightmares, leaving her agitated. After seeing a psychologist, an old Athosian woman tells her a secret about her ability to sense the Wraith.

Episodes.Name: The Siege: Part 1
Episodes.Description: McKay and Zelenka come up with a plan to repair the Ancients' weapon satellite. Bates and Teyla get into a fight. He is found unconscious and badly injured shortly afterwards.

Episodes.Name: The Siege: Part 2
Episodes.Description: All hope seems lost, until Colonel Everett arrives suddenly from Earth. He is determined to defend the city until the arrival of a ZPM, brought by a new ship.

Episodes.Name: The Siege: Part 3
Episodes.Description: The Daedalus arrives and the two hive ships are destroyed. Atlantis seems saved, then Zelenka detects 12 more ships. Ford seems changed after a fall in the water.

Episodes.Name: The Intruder
Episodes.Description: McKay, Sheppard, Beckett and Weir are on the Daedalus. McKay finds a Wraith virus that is infecting ship systems and sending a signal to the Wraith.

Episodes.Name: Runner
Episodes.Description: The team is searching for Ford on a planet. Teyla and Sheppard are taken hostage by a stranger, while Ford tries to convince McKay that he's normal.

Episodes.Name: Duet
Episodes.Description: After an attempt to retrieve McKay and Lt. Laura Cadman from the memory banks of a Wraith dart, Cadman gets stuck in McKay's mind.

Episodes.Name: Condemned
Episodes.Description: The team discovers a planet where the Stargate is kept on a prison island to keep the Wraith satisfied. Their magistrate is willing to trade a rare mineral.

Episodes.Name: Trinity
Episodes.Description: The team discover an Ancient project to create the ultimate power source. McKay thinks he can finish it. Ronon finds out he is not the only surviving Satedan.

Episodes.Name: Instinct
Episodes.Description: The team find a hidden Wraith girl, cared for by a man with a serum that he claims can satisfy her hunger. Beckett wants to perfect a retrovirus that can turn Wraith into humans.

Episodes.Name: Conversion
Episodes.Description: Sheppard is infected with the Wraith retrovirus and slowly turns into an Iratus bug. To provide a treatment, stem cells must be retrieved from one of their eggs.

Episodes.Name: Aurora
Episodes.Description: McKay finds an Ancient warship adrift in space. Sheppard finds out they are carrying a communique that mentions a weakness in Wraith technology.

Episodes.Name: The Lost Boys
Episodes.Description: The team is captured by Ford and are forced to take the Wraith enzyme. Ford has a plan.

Episodes.Name: The Hive
Episodes.Description: Sheppard's interrogation is suddenly aborted. Teyla senses another hive ship has arrived. Meanwhile McKay tries to convince his guard to call in help.

Episodes.Name: Epiphany
Episodes.Description: The teams discovers a ridge that can only be entered through a door. Sheppard gets pulled in by a field. McKay discovers time goes very fast behind it.

Episodes.Name: Critical Mass
Episodes.Description: The Trust, a Goa'uld terrorist organization, has planted a bomb in Atlantis.

Episodes.Name: Grace Under Pressure
Episodes.Description: McKay and a pilot crash with a puddle jumper into the ocean on Atlantis. They start to sink.

Episodes.Name: The Tower
Episodes.Description: Colonel Sheppard's team finds a world where the leader lives in a tower that possesses the power to stop Wraith attacks.

Episodes.Name: The Long Goodbye
Episodes.Description: The team discovers two life pods with a dying woman and man in it. Upon opening Weir gets imprinted with the mind of the woman. She asks a special favor.

Episodes.Name: Coup D'etat
Episodes.Description: While Teyla and Ronon investigate the mysterious death of Major Lorne, the Genii Ladon Radim contacts Atlantis. He wants to trade a ZPM for weapons supplies.

Episodes.Name: Michael
Episodes.Description: Michael Kenmore, a new lieutenant, awakes in the infirmary and doesn't remember a thing. The other expedition members are very concerned about his well-being as he seems different.

Episodes.Name: Inferno
Episodes.Description: Atlantis helps with repairing an Ancient shield generator on Taranis. They discover the Taranians are in possession of an Ancient warship.

Episodes.Name: Allies
Episodes.Description: The hive ship approaching Atlantis is Michael's. He wants a trade: the retrovirus for not revealing the secret of Atlantis and insights on Wraith technology.

Episodes.Name: No Man's Land
Episodes.Description: On board the Wraith hive ship, Ronon Dex and Rodney McKay are taken prisoner after the Wraith reveal their true plot: to learn the location of Earth and use it as a feeding ground. Both Wraith ships manage to jump into hyperspace before the Daedalus or the Orion can inflict much damage. Sheppard however has found a way to travel along with them. When they come out of hyperspace, the battle begins. Elizabeth Weir is ordered to return to Stargate Command headquarters on Earth to be questioned by the International Oversight Advisory about her handling of the dealings ...

Episodes.Name: Misbegotten
Episodes.Description: Sheppard and the others are now in control of the one remaining hive ship with most of the Wraith transformed into human form, courtesy of the retrovirus. They do learn something interesting about female Wraiths, however. After they return to Atlantis, the question becomes one of what to do with the Wraiths who are again human, especially Michael who has proved to be quite helpful. Elizabeth Weir meanwhile is surprised to hear that she is to return to Atlantis as the expedition leader. She will be accompanied however by Richard Woolsey who is to review her leadership ...

Episodes.Name: Irresistible
Episodes.Description: Sheppard and the team continue their visits to new planets. McKay is tired of all these visits and is keen on implementing a series of gates that will allow them to travel from Atlantis to Earth in a mere 30 minutes without using the power of a ZPM or the two weeks it takes them on the Daedalus. He takes a somewhat different tack however when he sees all of the very friendly young women in the village. Their leader, Lucius Lavin, seems to be a very affable sort and has the locals eating out of their hands. He claims to be an apothecary of sorts and have a cure for ...

Episodes.Name: Sateda
Episodes.Description: After a group of people capture and give Ronon to the Wraith, he becomes a runner again, but this time he's left in his home planet, Sateda, where the Stargate has been disabled.

Episodes.Name: Progeny
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis expedition encounters a highly advanced race, the Asurans. They initially believe them to be the Ancients. However, this new race is just a new face of an old nemesis.

Episodes.Name: The Real World
Episodes.Description: Dr Weir finds herself on Earth where, to everyone else, the Atlantis Expedition was just her delusion.

Episodes.Name: Common Ground
Episodes.Description: John Sheppard is kidnapped by the Genii and is in the company of a Wraith.

Episodes.Name: McKay and Mrs. Miller
Episodes.Description: Rodney's sister is brought to Atlantis to make use of one of her theories.

Episodes.Name: Phantoms
Episodes.Description: A device that creates hallucinations affects the team off-world.

Episodes.Name: The Return: Part 1
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis expedition must turn to an old friend for help as the Asurans prepare to invade the city.

Episodes.Name: The Return: Part 2
Episodes.Description: The team returns to Atlantis in an attempt to regain control of the city.

Episodes.Name: Echoes
Episodes.Description: Teyla witnesses what appear to be an Ancient apparitions, which soon other people start to see.

Episodes.Name: Irresponsible
Episodes.Description: The team investigate rumours of an invincible hero off-world, only to find Lucius Lavin again manipulating a hapless village.

Episodes.Name: Tao of Rodney
Episodes.Description: When Rodney uses an Ancient device, he gets special powers, but soon Dr Weir discovers it's a double-handled gift: if he doesn't ascend, he'll die.

Episodes.Name: The Game
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis team finds a program in the Atlantis database which throws Mckay and Sheppard into a Simsesque game that could destroy two civilizations in the Pegasus Galaxy.

Episodes.Name: The Ark
Episodes.Description: The team boards a crippled space station to discover people have been preserved there with the hope to outlive their enemy, the Wraith.

Episodes.Name: Sunday
Episodes.Description: With everyone having a Sunday off - something recommended by psychologist Dr. Heightmeyer - all of the members of the Atlantis team pursue leisure activities. Rodney McKay and Carson Beckett are scheduled to go fishing; Sheppard decides to teach Ronon Dex about golf; Teyla spends some time in the gym; and Elizabeth Weir has a lunch date with the handsome Mike Branton. Their day off however is interrupted by a powerful explosion near the mess hall killing and injuring several members of the team. McKay thinks he knows the cause of the problem - a device found by two ...

Episodes.Name: Submersion
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis team finds an Ancient underwater research facility and puts a team together to check it out.

Episodes.Name: Vengeance
Episodes.Description: After losing contact with the new Taranin (the people rescued by the Atlantis team when a super volcano threatened to destroy their planet) settlement, Sheppard's team leaves to investigate. Finding the town deserted, they move to investigate an extensive subterranean tunnel system. What they find there holds dark tidings for the entire Pegasus Galaxy.

Episodes.Name: First Strike
Episodes.Description: After learning the Asurians are building a fleet of ships, Earth sends its newest ship, the Apollo, under the command of Colonel Abe Ellis to initiate a preemptive first strike to stop them from attacking Atlantis or worse, Earth itself.

Episodes.Name: Adrift
Episodes.Description: With a damaged ZPM, and diminished hopes of survival, the Atlantis team finds themselves stranded in the middle of empty space with hardly any time before they run out of power completely. Dr. McKay is challenged to the max as he tries to find a way to save Atlantis from its doom. Meanwhile, Dr. Keller races to treat Weir's increasing head injuries, but the only answer she can come up with could have grave results for everyone on board.

Episodes.Name: Lifeline
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis team, along with Weir and now with the ability to make large hyperspace jumps in only a puddle jumper, must now journey to the replicator home planet to steal one of their many ZPMs to bring the city back to life, and finish the journey to their new planet.

Episodes.Name: Reunion
Episodes.Description: While on a regular mission, Ronan runs into some Satedan friends from his past. As old emotions start to return, new thoughts come with them, one of which involves leaving Atlantis. But could danger be lurking just around the corner?

Episodes.Name: Doppelganger
Episodes.Description: While exploring a new planet, Sheppard started to watch a strange crystal. He doesn't know why, but he had to touch it. Back on Atlantis, everybody but him started to have some bad nightmares.

Episodes.Name: Travelers
Episodes.Description: Sheppard is kidnapped by a group of people living in a starship fleet. They were telling him that they were living on these ships for a long time, due to the war with the Wraith. He was forced to help them make an Ancients ship fly. Sheppard tricked them and flew with the ship, and 3 of the kidnappers.

Episodes.Name: Tabula Rasa
Episodes.Description: Rodney McKay awakens in his lab, tied to a chair and with no memory of who or where he is. He did seemingly leave himself a video message telling him to look for Teyla. The problem began some 14 hours before when Dr. Katie Brown returned to Atlantis with plants from a planet she had visited. The plants had been cleared through the normal quarantine procedure but she is soon afflicted with severe headaches and loss of memory, eventually falling into a coma. Memory loss begins to afflict other members of the crew but they soon become distrustful of one another, making ...

Episodes.Name: Missing
Episodes.Description: Teyla and Dr. Keller go to the Athosians' new planet, where they discover that the Athosians have gone missing. It seems to be the work of a warrior tribe, the Bola Kai.

Episodes.Name: The Seer
Episodes.Description: Having been told by the Genii spy on New Athos that her people were still alive, Teyla asks permission to visit a man named Davos who is a legendary seer and may be able to help her. When they arrive, Dr. Keller realizes that the man is dying. His ability to see the future is real, but the snippets of the future he is able to show them are open to interpretation. John is called back to Atlantis when they receive a message from the Wraith whose life he had previously saved. He offers to work with McKay to fix the nano virus that is now malfunctioning. As if this ...

Episodes.Name: Miller's Crossing
Episodes.Description: When McKay's sister Jeanie is kidnapped, the team returns to Earth to find her.

Episodes.Name: This Mortal Coil
Episodes.Description: When what appears to be a satellite crashes into Atlantis, the team becomes aware of strange behaviour on the base.

Episodes.Name: Be All My Sins Remember'd
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis team decides to attack the numerous ships of the Replicators, with the help of uneasy alliances.

Episodes.Name: Spoils of War
Episodes.Description: A transmission from space leads the team to the discovery of a breeding ground for Wraith soldiers.

Episodes.Name: Quarantine
Episodes.Description: The entire city locks down for a false quarantine, leaving people stranded with a decreasing amount of oxygen, while Rodney is unable to reach a computer.

Episodes.Name: Harmony
Episodes.Description: Sheppard and McKay must escort a prospective queen as part of their diplomatic duties, unaware that an ambush has been set by some familiar enemies.

Episodes.Name: Outcast
Episodes.Description: After returning to Earth for his father's funeral, John Sheppard discovers the existence of a human form Replicator loose on the population.

Episodes.Name: Trio
Episodes.Description: Keller, Carter and McKay are stranded in an abandoned Genii mine while off-world.

Episodes.Name: Midway
Episodes.Description: The IOA is conducting interviews back on Earth to ensure that any personnel serving on Atlantis (in particular, aliens) are suitable for their roles. The episode opens up with a pregnant Teyla having been interviewed and reporting back to Atlantis. Ronon is next. Col. Carter is unsure about Ronon's ability to handle the IOA's interview and therefore asks Teal'c to come to Atlantis in a coaching capacity for Ronon. After a rocky start to their relationship, Ronon and Teal'c return to Earth, via the series of Stargates and a Midway Station, that McKay had previously ...

Episodes.Name: The Kindred: Part 1
Episodes.Description: A plague of sorts is spreading across the Pegasus galaxy and Dr. Keller estimates that hundreds of thousands will die if they don't don't find a way to stop it. Her research shows however that the disease's origin is with the Hoff, who had been working on a way to kill the Wraith. Sheppard and the others think they know who might be spreading the virus and why. Teyla meanwhile believes she is receiving messages from Kanaan, the father of her child. She's getting his messages while sleeping and most think she's just dreaming. She follows the clues he gives her but she ...

Episodes.Name: The Kindred: Part 2
Episodes.Description: Slowly, everyone on Atlantis comes to terms with the sudden re-appearance of Dr. Carson Beckett who, he claims, has been Michael's prisoner for some two years. He tells them what he was doing in Michael's laboratory and they set off to find the kidnapped Teyla. Dr. Keller figures out just how he's come to there at all. Sheppard meanwhile has been using all of his contacts to try and locate Teyla but they come across someone from the past. Teyla in turn has found some of the Athosians alive but they are few in number as a result of Michael's experiments. Michael ...

Episodes.Name: The Last Man
Episodes.Description: After yet another fruitless search for the missing Teyla, Sheppard returns to Atlantis, only to find it deserted. Worse yet, the city isn't just abnormally hot, but the entire ocean has completely dried up, leaving a sandy desert! Sheppard then finds a hologram of an aged Dr. McKay, telling him that a solar flare had sent him 48,000 years into the future. Once he learns the demise of Atlantis and everyone on it, and worse yet that the sun in the solar system is dying and he won't survive there much longer, he and the holographic McKay must find a way to send Sheppard ...

Episodes.Name: Search and Rescue
Episodes.Description: Combat engineers from Atlantis work against the clock to rescue four of their colleagues who are now trapped in the rubble of Michael's medical compound. With Michael en route, they quickly locate McKay and Major Lorne but Sheppard and Ronon are far deeper and their rescue is not assured. When Michael's ship arrives, they decide to try to rescue Teyla who is in labor and close to giving birth. When it's all over, Col. Carter is recalled to Earth for a performance review but Richard Woolsey has some bad news for her.

Episodes.Name: The Seed
Episodes.Description: Dr. Carson Beckett is removed from stasis because he's the only one who can find the antidote to a mysterious virus that has incapacitated base personnel, beginning with Dr. Jennifer Keller.

Episodes.Name: Broken Ties
Episodes.Description: Ronon is abducted by a Wraith who tries to brainwash him.

Episodes.Name: The Daedalus Variations
Episodes.Description: An empty Daedalus is found orbiting the planet. The team goes to check it out and they are transported to an alternate universe.

Episodes.Name: Ghost in the Machine
Episodes.Description: A group of beings stranded in sub-space seek help from Atlantis to return to normal space. But their outrageous claims and erratic behavior strains the trust of their benefactors and forces a painful solution.

Episodes.Name: The Shrine
Episodes.Description: Rodney is infected with a deadly illness known as "second childhood" which diminishes his mind capabilities and makes him lose his memory gradually.

Episodes.Name: Whispers
Episodes.Description: Sheppard and Beckett battle zombie-like, Wraith-engineered mutants with a team of the best and brightest female SG members.

Episodes.Name: The Queen
Episodes.Description: Teyla risks her life on a daring mission aboard a wraith hive ship.

Episodes.Name: Tracker
Episodes.Description: Jennifer, Ronon and Rodney find themselves in the middle of a Wraith hunt when Jennifer is kidnapped by a runner, Kiryk, to help him with a humanitarian mission.

Episodes.Name: First Contact
Episodes.Description: Dr. Daniel Jackson comes to Atlantis in search of a lost Atlantian room. The discovery reveals a new race. Daniel and McKay are kidnapped by the new race and are forced to finish a device which may kill the Wraith. Todd feels betrayed and takes the Daedalus.

Episodes.Name: The Lost Tribe
Episodes.Description: The new race that stole the device, not to mention Rodney and Daniel, turns out to be an old one meaning very old and well known to the human race. With an ancient grudge to settle, they force Rodney to activate the device against the Wraith with a side effect that could kill millions throughout the galaxy. That makes the Wraith mad so they abscond with the Daedalus to retaliate. Once again we lowly humans have to take control of a messy situation to keep the master races from wreaking havoc in the galaxy.

Episodes.Name: Outsiders
Episodes.Description: The Atlantis team endeavors to thwart Wraith plans to either find a cure for the Hoffan drug (which makes humans deadly to Wraith feeding on them) or exterminate all those infected.

Episodes.Name: Inquisition
Episodes.Description: Sheppard and his team are lured to a planet and are soon put on trial for crimes against the people of the Pegasus galaxy. In flashbacks, the three judge tribunal recounts the indictment against them including the re-awakening of the Wraith and the various missions where at least a few, if not more, innocent bystanders were killed. Sheppard does his best to argue that on balance, fewer were killed by their presence than would have been the case if they had never been there. A least one of the judges is clearly determined to find them guilty while a second seems far ...

Episodes.Name: The Prodigal
Episodes.Description: When the power is shut down and most of the inhabitants are locked out of key controls, it is apparent that Atlantis has been taken over by an off-world group, soon identified as Michael and his hybrids. He is after Teyla's newborn child who is key in his quest to gain control of the Pegasus galaxy. While Sheppard and McKay try to get their hands on a jumper to launch an attack, Ronon and others who were taken prisoner by Michael during his initial invasion launch reprisals of their own. When Teyla manages to get away and hide, Michael gives her a simple choice: ...

Episodes.Name: Remnants
Episodes.Description: Radek discovers an alien device that Rodney finds holds serious surprises. Sheppard runs into a reincarnated Acastus Kolya who plans to attack Atlantis. An IOC representative arrives to replace Woolsey who receives advice from a mysterious woman.

Episodes.Name: Brain Storm
Episodes.Description: Rodney finally invites Jennifer on a date; to attend a science conference with him. But petty jealousies arise at the conference that have to be suppressed when a proposed solution for global warming has potentially lethal side effects.

Episodes.Name: Infection
Episodes.Description: A Wraith cruiser arrives at Atlantis and is strangely uncommunicative.

Episodes.Name: Identity
Episodes.Description: An alien mind takes up residence in Jennifer's body and seems as confused as her colleagues are by her erratic behavior. Which begs the question; where is Jennifer?

Episodes.Name: Vegas
Episodes.Description: The killings of a Wraith in Las Vegas are investigated by Detective John Sheppard - who knows nothing about life-sucking aliens from another galaxy.

Episodes.Name: Enemy at the Gate
Episodes.Description: A hive ship turbo-charged with a ZPM has received the Wraith's message from a alternate universe containing the location of Earth. The ship is now heading for Earth.

Name: Stargate: Atlåntis
Summary: An international team of scientists and military personnel discover a Stargate network in the Pegasus Galaxy and come face-to-face with a new, powerful enemy: The Wraith.

Trailers.Title: STARGATE ATLANTIS: Season One (2004–2005) TRAILER
Trailers.Description: When a secret base abandoned by the ancients (the original Stargate builders) is found buried in the ice of Antarctica, the Atlantis ...

Trailers.Title: Stargate: Atlantis | Full Series  - Trailer
Trailers.Description: A fan made trailer for the TV series "Stargate: Atlantis". I am not the owner of the clips used in this fan made trailer. No copyright ...

Trailers.Title: Stargate Atlantis: Elizabeth Weir: "Fight Song"
Trailers.Description: HD makes it pretty :) -------------- Hello everyone :) I'm back with a NEW Stargate video! Woo-hoo! Earlier this week I finished ...

Episodes.Name: Children of the Gods
Episodes.Description: Colonel Jack O'Neill is brought out of retirement to lead a new expedition back to Abydos, only to find an old friend, a new enemy and a far wider use of the Stargate.

Episodes.Name: The Enemy Within
Episodes.Description: The team, now designated SG-1 are planning their next foray through the gate as they try to map out the variety of sites available to them and locate their missing friends. O'Neill asks that Teal'c be allowed to join his team but Gen. Hammond thinks that will be unlikely given that he is the host for a Goa'uld. Unknown to anyone, however, is that O'Neill's close friend, Maj. Charles Kawalsky, leader of SG-2, has been infected by a Goa'uld, an immature version that has not yet taken complete control of the host. Kawalsky is having regular blackouts during which the ...

Episodes.Name: Emancipation
Episodes.Description: While exploring a world populated by Mongol descendants, Capt. Carter is abducted as a wife of a local warlord.

Episodes.Name: The Broca Divide
Episodes.Description: The Stargate base is put in deadly peril when it is contaminated with a dangerous infection which causes its victims to become mindlessly animalistic brutes.

Episodes.Name: The First Commandment
Episodes.Description: The SG-1 team is sent after the SG-9 team that has failed to return. They find that SG-9's captain, having been treated like a god by planetary inhabitants, is drunk with power and is tyrannizing them. Can they overcome him?

Episodes.Name: Cold Lazarus
Episodes.Description: When Jack is injured unintentionally by a crystal alien, the alien duplicates Jack's form and out of fear of retribution tries to heal Jack. He returns to Earth in place of Jack, while Jack is still unconscious on the planet, to find the one thing he feels will accomplish this; the one thing that cannot be found again. Meanwhile, the 'real' Jack has returned and is trying to convince SGC that he is who he says he is.

Episodes.Name: The Nox
Episodes.Description: With the Stargate program in danger of being terminated, the team is under pressure to find technology. Visiting a planet where they believe there is a creature that possesses the secret of invisibility, they encounter Apophis and his guards. Both sides receiving mortal wounds, they are aided by the planet's inhabitants, the Nox, a gentle people with a very large secret.

Episodes.Name: Brief Candle
